  • Elemental Fury: You may cast haste, but with a Target of self. When you reach 5th circle in this track, you may cast haste normally. When you reach 7th circle in this track, you cast haste normally as a move action.
  • Dragon Aspect: You grant yourself semi-ethereal draconic armour, which gives you an item bonus to AC equal to the number of circles you possess in this track for the [Encounter]. When you reach 5th circle in this track, the armour also grants you [Resistance] to physical damage. When you reach 7th circle in this track, the armour also grants you [Resistance] to magical and energy damage.
  • Marked for Death: You deteriorate the armour of one opponent in [Close] range, inflicting a -2 penalty to AC and removing [Resistance] to one energy descriptor of your choice, if possible, for two [Rounds]. When you reach 5th circle in this track, the AC penalty increases to -3 and you may also remove resistance to magical or physical damage. When you reach 7th circle in this track, the AC penalty increases to -4 and if you cannot remove any [Resistance], you may instead inflict [Vulnerability] to physical, magical or energy damage. A successful Will save halves the duration.

4th Circle – I Just Wanna Make You ScreamSU: Your Voice can terrify or tire your enemies, or even command the very skies.

  • Dismay: You cause one opponent in [Close] range to become [Shaken] until the end of the [Encounter]. When you reach 5th circle in this track, you may also use this ability to cause an enemy in [Close] range to be [Shaken] for two [Rounds], which stacks with other instances of Dismay. When you reach 6th circle in this track, you may target up to three enemies in [Close] range. A successful Will save negates the [Shaken] condition.
  • Drain Vitality: You cause one opponent in [Close] range to become [Exhausted] until the end of the [Encounter]. When you reach 5th circle in this track, you may target up to three opponents in [Close] range. When you reach 6th circle in this track, you may target all opponents in [Close] range. A successful Fortitude save reduces the duration of [Exhausted] to one [Round].
  • Storm Call: You may use call lightning, as the spell. When you reach 5th circle in this track, the DC to Reflex saves for this ability increases by 2. When you reach 6th circle in this track, you may instead use lightning storm, as the spell, once per [Scene].

5th Circle – Shouting from the RooftopsSU: You can bend magical energy to your will, your Voice can even rip souls.

  • Soul Tear: Once per [Encounter], you cause one opponent in [Close] range to take damage equal to six times your character level. When you reach 6th circle in this Track, that opponent is also [Battered] for two rounds. When you reach 7th circle in this Track, if this ability kills your target, you gain a +2 to attack, damage, saves, skill checks and ability DCs until the end of the [Scene]. This is a [Death] effect. A successful Will save halves damage, negates [Battered] and prevents the damage from reducing the target below one hit point.
  • Clear Skies: You may end a single target effect created by a spell or spell-like ability of fifth circle or low¬er that has a duration and that originates from a creature or square within [Close] range or targeted a crea¬ture within [Close] range. When you reach 6th circle in this tack, you can target two effects of fifth circle or lower or one effect of sixth circle or lower. When you reach 7th circle in this track, you can target three effects of fifth circle or lower, two effects of sixth circle or lower, or one effect of 7th circle or lower.

6th Circle – UltravoxSU: Your new Shouts have three words already, and your Voice can create a great cyclone, or trap your foes in a cage of ice.

  • Cyclone: You create a 10 ft radius spread within [Close] range. Any creature entering the radius or starting their turn in the radius must make a Reflex save or be swept into the cyclone for one [Round]. While in the cyclone, a creature can act normally but is unable to move. At the start of your next turn the cyclone dissipates, and all swept up in it take 5d6 damage as they fall. At the start of your turn, you may immediately use your standard action to keep the cyclone going for another turn, and any already in it may make another Reflex save, which works the same as the original, but deals 10d6 damage on dissipation to any creatures swept up in it for two [Rounds], and half damage to any who made the Reflex save at the start of the turn. You may do this once more to increase the damage to 15d6, but cannot extend a cyclone for more than three turns total.
  • Ice Form: Once per [Encounter], you may freeze one creature in [Close] range into an unbreakable block of ice for two [Rounds]. The creature is incapable of acting or perceiving its surroundings, but it gains [Immunity] to dam¬age and [HP reduction], it cannot be targeted by an attack or ability, and line of effect is blocked between the creature and any attack, ability, or ef¬fect. The creature may make a Fortitude save to negate this effect.

7th Circle – Greybeard BeardfistSU: You can summon an Ancient Dragon from the mists of time, or a heroic Dragon Slayer from the halls of Ysgard.

  • Call Dragon: Once per [Scene], you may summon the Ancient Dragon Odahviing from the temporal stasis Io keeps him in. He is your ally but acts under his own initiative on his own initiative count, and returns to the mists of time at the end of the [Encounter]. He has Dragon/Thu’um/Iron Magi/Battle’s Tempering as tracks and is level 17 with these stats: Str 26, Dex 8, Con 18, Int 10, Wis 14, Cha 24.
  • Call of Valour: Once per [Scene], you may summon an Ancient Dragon Slayer from Ysgard. He is your ally but acts under his own initiative on his own initiative count, and returns to Ysgard at the end of the [Encounter]. He has Rage/Thu’um/Path of Destruction/Path of the Ancestors as tracks and is level 17 with these stats: Str 28, Dex 12, Con 22, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 22.

2.7 Shaman

2.7.1 Dragon Shaman

Special: You may take this track in place of Incantation in the Shaman class.

Dragons are the oldest and probably the most powerful beings in the world, so it makes sense that some would seek to emulate their powers. Many Dragon Shamans are worshippers of Dragonkind or their deities, seeking to gain favour by showing their devotion, but other are simply mages who understand that using the magic of the mighty is a valid path to power. Dracomancy includes the power to inspire and empower allies, as well as to channel the pure elemental power of Dragonkind.

1st Circle – You Must RecoverSU: All allies in [Close] range gain [Fast healing] equal to 1 plus the number of circles you have in Dragon Shaman.

2nd Circle – Dragon PulseSU: When you gain this circle choose [Acid], [Fire], [Electricity] or [Cold], and either a wedge out to [Close] range or a 5 ft line out to [Medium] range. Deal energy damage equal to 1d8 times your level with the chosen descriptor to all creatures in the chosen shape. A Fortitude save halves damage if your chose [Acid] or [Cold], and a Reflex save halves damage if your chose [Electricity] or [Fire] in either case the DC is 10 + 1/2 your level + your Con modifier. Afterwards, roll a d4. You can use this ability again in that many [Rounds].

3rd Circle – Bahamut’s BlessingSLA: As a swift action, choose an ally with the lowest current hit points in [Close] range. They gain +4 to attack rolls, skills checks and AC, [Immunity] to [Blinded] and [Deafened], [Blindsense] out to their [Melee] range, and +2 to ability DCs for one [Round].

4th Circle – Io’s BalanceSLA: As a swift action, choose a creature in [Close] range. If they have a condition, and are the only creature in [Long] range with that condition, remove that condition. If another creature in [Close] range has a movement mode that your target does not, grant them that movement mode for the [Encounter].

5th Circle – Tiamat’s GreedSLA: As a standard action, target an opponent in [Close] range and choose one magic item they are benefitting from. Remove the benefits of that magic item for the [Encounter], and grant them to one ally in [Close] range for the [Encounter]. A successfull Will save (DC 10 + 1/2 your level + your Con modifier) negates this effect.

6th Circle – Up Until NowEX: Using the ancient and changing nature of Dragons, between [Scenes], you may switch out your Slow track (if Dragon Shaman is your Slow track, this ability instead affects your Medium track), any spells you know and your choices for the 2nd circle of Dragon Shaman. You have a total of +9 you can grant as a bonus to your ability scores, with a maximum of +5 to one score, which you can change freely between [Scenes].

7th Circle – Final SmashEX: Once per [Encounter] deal 2d8 per your character level in damage of the energy type you chose at 2nd circle to all creatures in a 20 ft radius within [Close] range. This can affect [Soaring] and [Burrowing] creatures. Damaged creatures are moved 80 ft in any direction away from you. A successful save, of the same type as for 2nd circle, halves the damage and negates forced movement.

2.8 Tactician

2.8.1 Cantrips

Magic is a beautiful, complex discipline of study, with a huge array of possible specialisations in which mages can gain incredibly power. Tacticians, however, prefer a different approach. Drawing on aspects of every school of magic, they learn a wide variety of minor, useful tricks. With these they can augment their existing spells with helpful Cantrips, using a minimum of energy to maximise utility.

Special: Tacticians may (and should) take this Track instead of Bag of Tricks

1st Circle – The Least of My PowersSLA: You learn two Cantrips (from the list below). Once per [Round], you can use a Cantrip as a free action (these still provoke an attack of opportunity like a normal Spell-like ability).

When you gain this circle choose a skill, you gain a +3 bonus to that skill. Whenever you gain a new circle in Cantrips, choose a skill you have not previously chosen with this ability, and gain a +3 bonus to it.

2nd Circle – Trip the ScalesSLA: You learn three Cantrips.

When you gain this circle, choose an energy type ([Fire], [Cold], [Acid], [Electricity], [Negative], [Positive]). You gain [Resistance] to damage of this energy type. Whenever you gain a new circle in Cantrips, choose an energy type you have not previously chosen with this ability, and gain a [Resistance] to damage of that type.

3rd Circle – Wingardium LeviosarSLA: You learn four Cantrips.

You gain an additional Greater Item slot.

4th Circle – Leviosa, not LeviosarSLA: You learn five Cantrips.

You gain an additional Relic Item slot.

5th Circle – We Can Rebuild HimSLA: You learn six Cantrips.

You gain [Fast healing] 10.

6th Circle – Cancel That!SLA: You learn seven Cantrips.

You gain [Resistance] to magical damage and [Immunity] to [Prone], [Figment] effects, and additional damage and effects from critical hits.

7th Circle – LIMITED POWER!SLA: You learn eight Cantrips.

You may now use a Cantrip as a free action up to five times per [Round].

2.8.1.1 Cantrips

  • Lance: You deal energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to your level to all creatures in a 5 ft wide line out to your [Medium] range.
  • Strike: You deal energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to your level to all creatures in your [Melee] range.
  • Vortex: You deal energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to your level to all creatures in your [Close] range but not in your [Melee] range.
  • Blob: You deal energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor equal to your level to all creatures in a 10 ft radius spread centred within your [Close] range.
  • Wave: You deal magical damage with the [Force] descriptor equal to your level to all creatures in a 25 ft cone starting from your position.
  • Epsiki: You heal a creature in [Melee] range for an amount of hit points equal to your level.
  • Leech: You deal energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to half your level to a creature in [Melee] range, and heal an amount of hit points equal to the damage done.
  • Arm: Add one weapon property to a weapon wielded by a creature in [Close] range for two [Rounds].
  • Dearm: Remove one weapon property from a weapon wielded by a creature in [Close] range for two [Rounds].
  • Hinder: Target creature in [Close] range deals no additional damage on their next critical hit.
  • Expelliarmus: The next attack on target creature in [Close] range counts as a Disarm attempt.
  • Priori: Learn all details about the last active ability target creature in [Close] range used.
  • Impede: Create a 10 ft radius spread centred within your [Close] range, all spaces in this spread count as difficult terrain until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Leviosa: You move a small object (up to about 200 pounds) within your [Close] range to anywhere else in your [Close] range, if you move a weapon into a creature’s space they may immediately start wielding it.
  • Prestidigitation: You can do minor things within [Close] range. These include: clean or soil an object, change an object’s surface colour, create a harmless sensory effect (eg a shower of sparks, an illusion of a small nonmagical trinket in your hand), slightly warm or cool an object.
  • Bloom: You can make a plant bud within [Close] range bloom, light a torch within [Close] range, set up a tent within [Close] range, or similarly cause any nonmagical object to enter its ‘use’ state.
  • Judgement: You can specify an action you could take in this exact moment, and become aware of the likely major moral implications of taking that action.
  • Resound: Target creature in [Close] range’s voice becomes up to five times louder for five [Rounds].
  • Portal: Immediately open and/or close all windows, doors, trapdoors and other such things within [Medium] range which are unlocked or locked with a Larceny DC of 10 or less.
  • Glamour: Change your eye and skin colour to those of your choice until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Tremor: The ground rumbles harmlessly but noticeably for the next ten [Rounds], out to [Medium] range.
  • Mending: Repair a single break in an object.
  • Message: Whisper a message of up to 25 words to any creature in [Medium] range, they may send a whispered reply of up to 25 words.
  • Aquamenti: You produce one pint of clean water in [Melee] range.
  • Avensegium: You learn the owner (or most recent owner) of an object in [Melee] range.
  • Compass: You learn which direction is north.
  • Mark: Put a mark of up to six letters or runes on an object in [Close] range, this may be either visible to everyone or just you.
  • Adhere: Choose two adjacent mundane objects in [Close] range, they stick to each other for up to a month.
  • Posteriori: Learn what a ruined object, ash, or other such thing in [Close] range was before it was destroyed.
  • Identity: Learn the name of a place or object within [Close] range.
  • Ignite: Target creature in [Close] range starts [Burning].
  • Lumos: You create bright light out to 60 ft, and all creatures in 10 ft are [Dazzled] for one [Round].
  • Exhaust: Target [Fatigued] character in [Close] range becomes [Exhausted] instead.
  • Stomp: Target [Prone] creature in [Close] range takes damage equal to twice your level.
  • Respite: Remove the [Dazzled], [Burning], [Deafened] or [Fatigued] conditions from a creature in [Close] range.

2.8.2 Wizard

In this iteration of the Material Plane, the oldest magical arts of the Circle of Eight are mostly lost. However, the most studious arcane mages, those who have learned to harness the power of magic without any internal spark or divine gift, still learn the ancient arts. These allow a degree of arcane variety unavailable to any other mage, but also require a level of preparation unpalatable to anyone else.

Special: Tacticians may freely multiclass the Tactical Insight track for this track. In that case your class name becomes Wizard, but is otherwise identical

1st Circle – Vance’s SpellbookEX: You know all spells from every circle you have access to of every spell list you have access to. You gain an additional spell per circle per [Scene] of the highest circle you can cast, an additional two spells per [Scene] of the next highest circle, and an additional three spells per [Scene] of other circles.

However, at the start of each [Scene], you must choose a spell of the appropriate circle (and spell list if applicable) for each spell slot you have for the [Scene]. When you cast that spell slot, you must cast the chosen spell. You can choose the same spell for multiple slots.

2nd Circle – Familiar and StaffEX: You gain the Summon Mote feat. While your Mote still has hit points, you gain a +4 bonus to Arcana and Awareness.

As long as you are wielding an [Arcane] weapon, once per [Encounter] you may cast a spell without using up its spell slot, and it gains +2 to the save DC against its effects.

3rd Circle – Robe and Wizard HatEX: You gain the Rune Magic, Elemental Specialisation, and Glyphweave Adept, and Arcane Recitation feats, even if you don’t qualify for them.

4th Circle – Wizard TowerSU: With a one hour ritual, you can claim a 200 ft radius (which is not currently anyone’s Sanctum) as your Sanctum. When you cast a spell with a Duration in your Sanctum, you may make the duration Permanent as long as the spell’s effect (or creature it is affecting) is within the Sanctum. While in your Sanctum, you may change your prepared spells for the [Scene] with two full-round actions in a row.

Your Sanctum lasts indefinitely, but if you create a new Sanctum your previous Sanctum ceases to be.

5th Circle – Storm FrontEX: For all calculations in your spell effects which count your level or the number of circles you have in the Spellcasting tack, you count as two levels and one circle higher.

6th Circle – The Wizarding WorldEX: Choose one spell of every circle you know up to 5th. Your choice is permanent. You may cast those spells at will as a spell-like ability (using the same action as casting the spell normally would require). When you cast a spell whose Effect is a spread or other physical area, you may name any number of specific creatures, the named creatures are not affected by the spell’s Effect at all.

7th Circle – GenesisSU: With one day of effort casting a ritual, you may create a Demiplane. This Demiplane has the physical characteristics of your choice, and counts as a Sanctum for you (in addition to your normal Sanctum). As a standard action, you may create or close any number of portals to this Demiplane (they exist in a 5 ft space), or from your Demiplane to the Material Plane, within your [Extreme] range.

3 Classes

3.1 Bard

Table 3.1: Bard Class
HP 8
Skills 7
BAB Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Cha
KDM Wis

Bards are masters of the art of music, using their abilities as storytellers and performers to enhance their allies – and even weave sorcerous enchantment magic into their words and notes. They can also draw on more esoteric artful magic, such as accessing the Dreamsong and drawing emotions out of it, or tapping into the wind magic of the Dirae.

The Bard’s Tracks are:

  • Medium: Song: Choose from Troubador or Lore
    • Lore: Passive abilities with general utility, generally related to Skills, and learn to use immediate actions to replicate key abilities of other classes
    • Troubador: A selection of passive bonuses granted to nearby allies which start with standard actions and are sustained with swift actions.
  • Fast: Rhyme: Choose from Chirurgic Poet or Minstrel
    • Chirurgic Poet: Sacrifice your own maximum HP to heal allies and grant them a variety of useful benefits, all with free actions
    • Minstrel: Provide bonuses to allies and other useful benefits with swift actions, and use standard actions to impair or damage your enemies
  • Slow: Rhythm: Choose from Orator, Swashbuckler, or Skald
    • Orator: Use Diplomacy to give your allies benefits instead of attacking yourself, and gain some useful out-of-combat diplomatic tricks
    • Skald: Build up chains of ranged attacks which you can finish as swift actions for explosive negative effects for nearby opponents
    • Swashbuckler: Deal bonus damage and gain extra attacks with additional effects when you move around during combat

3.1.1 Lore

Bards tell and sing of tall tales and ancient legends, and that requires someone, at some point, to have studied them. Bards of Lore are those few who do the legwork so everyone else has verses and sagas to work with. It does come with benefits, though, as studying ancient lore gives a variety of helpful tricks, and means there’ll never be something you haven’t at least some idea of how to do.

1st Circle – Jack of all TradesEX: Add half your level (minimum 1) to untrained skill checks. Additionally you may use consumables that require a skill you do not have trained.

2nd Circle – Master of NoneEX: Once per [Scene], plus an additional time per circle you possess in this track, you may take 10 on any skill check, regardless of circumstances.

3rd Circle – The Highest Form of FlatteryEX: Once per [Encounter] for each Circle you possess in this track, as an immediate action, you may gain any one of the following abilities. If the ability grants a passive bonus, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You may only gain each ability once per [Encounter].

  • Barbarian’s RageEX: You gain a fury bonus to attack and damage rolls equal to the number of circles you have in this track.
  • Paladin’s LightSU: You generate a spread centred on you which provides illumination out to your [Close] range that moves with you, and all allies in the spread gain a +3 bonus to saving throws.
  • Monk’s TechniquesEX: The next melee attack you make becomes a Disarm or Trip manoeuvre, of your choice, with a save DC of 13 + ½ your character level + your KOM. Even if it misses the target must still make the save against the Disarm or Trip effect.
  • Ranger’s ToolsEX: You may immediately create a 20 ft radius spread centred within your [Close] range. Creatures starting turn in or entering the spread must make a Will save (DC = 10 + ½ your character level + your KOM) or become [Confused] for two [Rounds]. The spread lasts for four [Rounds] but each creature must only make the saving throw once.
  • Tactician’s InsightEX: Choose a Knowledge check, all allies who can hear you gain a +3 bonus to AC against enemies in the encounter which can be identified with that check.
  • Sage’s DreadSU: All opponents in your [Close] range are [Shaken] for two [Rounds]. A successful Will save (DC = 10 + ½ your character level + your KOM) negates the [Shaken] condition.
  • Shaman’s GraceSLA: As an immediate action, or as part of an immediate action where the other part was to use The Highest Form of Flattery, you may cast cure light wounds, as the spell, with your KOM as the SAM.
  • Rogue TacticsEX: Your attacks against [Flat-footed] opponents deal 1d6 additional [Precision] damage for each circle you have in this track.
  • Druid’s ShapeSU: You gain a +2 bonus to an ability score of your choice and either the Fly, Swim or Burrow movement mode.
  • Warlock’s BlastSLA: Immediately make a ranged attack roll against a target in your [Medium] range. If it hits you deal damage equal to twice your level plus your KOM.
  • Fighter’s ArmourEX: You gain an item bonus to AC equal to 3 + the number of circles you have in this track.
  • Samurai’s SpiritEX: You gain [Damage reduction] equal to your KDM, and until the end of the [Encounter] you do not become [Disabled] or [Dying] from being at 0 HP or below.
  • Mage’s BurstSU: Create a 20 ft radius spread centred within your [Medium] range and choose an energy type. Creatures starting their turn in or entering the spread take energy damage with the descriptor of your choice equal to your level. The spread lasts for four [Rounds].
  • Scout’s SpeedEX: You gain a bonus to movement speed equal to 5 ft per circle you have in this track, and on activating this ability you may immediately move up to half your speed.
  • Psion’s FocusEX: Until the start of your next turn, as a move action you may focus your mind, increasing the DCs of saves against your abilities by 3 for one [Round].
  • Warrior’s SurgeEX: Roll 1d6 per circle you have in this track and gain hit points equal to twice the result.

4th Circle – There‘s Always Time to PoseEX: You may take an additional swift or immediate action each [Round].

5th Circle – DilettanteEX: Once per [Scene] you may spend five minutes to gain a Feat of your choice that you meet the prerequisites for. This feat lasts until the end of the [Scene].

6th Circle – Whose Line is it Anyway?EX: At the beginning of each [Scene] you gain a number of improvisation points equal to your level. You may spend a point (without using an action) to add +2 to the result of any dice roll you make after the result is determined. If this would increase the roll of a d20 to a result of 20 or above it counts as a natural 20 in any instance where that would matter.

7th Circle – All the World‘s a StageEX: Whenever you roll a skill check or saving throw you roll twice and use the higher result.

3.1.2 Troubador

Bards who follow the path of the Minstrel use specific magically-infused music to aid their allies in combat. Those who follow the Troubador tradition take a more archetypical role, singing songs of valour and strength to inspire their allies to great feats in the field of adventure.

1st Circle – Need Something to Sing AboutEX: As a standard action, you may start a Song. A Song gives its effect to all allies in your [Medium] range until the end of your next turn. If you currently have an active song, you can extend it until the end of your next turn with a swift action. You can only have one Song active at a time, starting a new Song causes your active Song’s effect to immediately end. You can use the following Songs:

  • Song of Valour: Grant a bonus to damage equal to half your Cha modifier. This increases to your Cha modifier when you gain your 3rd circle in Troubador
  • Song of Courage: Grant [Fast Healing] equal to half your Cha modifier. This increases to your Cha modifier when you gain your 3rd circle in Troubador
  • Song of Greatness: Grant a +2 bonus to all skill checks, this increases to +4 when you gain your 3rd circle in Troubador

2nd Circle – This is My Fight SongEX: You can use the following Songs:

  • Song of Safety: Grant a +2 bonus to all saving throws.
  • Whisper of Will: Grant a +3 bonus to defences against interaction checks.
  • Chord of Fearlessness: All [Fear] effects affecting creatures affected by the Song end, and grant [Immunity] to [Fear] effects.

3rd Circle – Can’t Stop This FeelingEX: You may now have two Songs active at once, if you would start a third Song, choose which of your active songs to end. Also, when you start a new Song, you may remove one of the following conditions from each affected ally: [Bleeding], [Burning], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Detained], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], [Stunned].

4th Circle – Evacuate the Dance FloorEX: Once per [Round], you may take an additional swift or immediate action. You can use the following Songs:

  • Song of the Great Bow: Creatures affected by this Song count as 5 levels higher when calculating their [Melee], [Close] and [Medium] ranges.
  • Song of the Exquisite Kill: Creatures affected by this Song have their critical threat range increased to 18-20. If they already threaten a critical on an 18, they now threaten a critical on the next lowest number that they do not already threaten on.
  • Song of the Great Feats: Choose a skill when you gain this circle. When making a check with that skill, affected creatures can take 10 on that skill regardless of circumstances.

5th Circle – Everybody SingEX: You can use the Song of Sanctuary, which unlike a normal song affects opponents within 15 ft and takes effect when it is started or extended with a swift action:

  • Song of Sanctuary: All opponents in 15 ft may not target you or your allies with an offensive action until the start of your next turn, unless they are targeted for an offensive action by you or one of your allies. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) negates this effect.

6th Circle – Like It’s The Last SongEX: You may now have three Songs active at once, if you would start a fourth Song, choose which of your active songs to end

7th Circle – You Will Ever SingEX: You can use the following Songs:

  • Song of Adamantium: Grants [Resistance] to physical damage.
  • Song of Mithril: Grants [Resistance] to energy and magic damage.
  • Song of Freedom: All [Binding] effects affecting creatures affected by the Song end, and grant [Immunity] to [Binding] effects.
  • Song of Liberty: All [Mind-affecting] effects affecting creatures affected by the Song end, and grant [Immunity] to [Mind-affecting] effects.

3.1.3 Minstrel

Where there are adventures, there are stories. Where there are stories, there are storytellers. Some storytellers can use their inspiring words and music to inspire other adventurers, thus leading to more stories, and hence to more Minstrels. The Union of Minstrels deny this conspiracy theory, and claim they only adventure to practice their craft and get a good tale. Minstrels use a mixture of mundane inspiring music and supernatural songcraft to aid their allies in battle.

You TAM for this track is your highest mental statistic (Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma)

1st Circle – Inspiration Unknown: You gain the following abilities, you can use them a number of times per [Encounter] equal to one plus the number of circles you have in this track

  • I’m Spartacus!EX: As a swift action, you may grant all allies in [Close] range a bonus to AC equal to the number of circles you have in this track for one [Round].
  • Rebel YellEX: As a swift action, you may grant all allies in [Close] range a bonus to attack rolls equal to the number of circles you have in this track for one [Round].

2nd Circle – Let Me Sing You…: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Come TogetherSU: You create a spread with a radius of your [Close] range originating from you, which moves with you and lasts until the end of the [Scene]. Allies within the spread gain [Fast healing] equal to your TAM as long as they remain within the spread. At 7th circle, the spread increases to [Medium] range.
  • Shake it OffEX: Once per [Encounter] per circle you possess in this track, as a free action, you may heal one ally in [Close] range for an amount equal to your level + your TAM.

3rd Circle – The Song of My People: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Catch a Grenade For YouEX: Once per [Encounter] per odd numbered circle you possess in this track, as an immediate action, when you or an ally in [Close] range makes a saving throw, you may both make the applicable save and then whoever rolled the saving throw chooses which result to used.
  • DischordSU: Once per [Encounter] per odd-numbered circle you possess in this track, as either a standard action, or in place of a single attack in an attack action, you may create a wedge with length 10 ft + 5 ft per circle you possess in this track. Enemies in this wedge take magic damage equal to your level + TAM and are inflicted with [Vulnerability] to all damage for one [Round]. A successful Will save of DC 10 + ½ your level + your TAM halves the damage and negates the [Vulnerability]. When you activate Dischord by sacrificing an attack in an attack action, you may sacrifice one additional attack per 5 levels you possess to deal additional damage equal to your TAM.

4th Circle – EncoreSLA: As either a standard action, or once per [Round] in place of a single attack in an attack action, you may allow up to three allies in a 15 ft radius spread centred in your [Close] range to make a single attack. A creature can only benefit from A Stitch in Time, For the Horde!, Inspiring Stike, or Encore once per [Round].

5th Circle – Don’t Stop Believin’: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Hero of Our TimeEX: Once per [Scene] as a free action grant an ally [Lesser resistance] to all damage until the end of the [Scene]
  • Still StandingSU: Each opponent takes a penalty to all d20 rolls based on how close it is to you: a -3 penalty within your [Melee] range, a -2 penalty within your [Close] range, and a -1 penalty within your [Medium] range. These penalties do not stack and expire as soon as the opponent leaves the area of effect.

6th Circle – Master Exploder: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Take On MeSU: Once per [Round], as a free action, you may create a spread with a radius of your [Close] range originating from you, which renders all opponents within the area charmed for 1d4 [Rounds]. A charmed creature must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + TAM) to use an offensive action against you or your allies, if it fails, it cannot use offensive actions against you or your allies for one [Round]. Each opponent may only be affected once per [Encounter].
  • Rick RollSU: Once per [Encounter] as a standard action you may inflict damage equal to six times your level to one target enemy in [Medium] range. You then inflict [HP Reduction] equal to the damage dealt. A successful Will save of DC 10 + ½ your character level + your TAM halves the damage and prevents the damage from reducing the target below 1 HP. This is a [Death] effect.

7th Circle – We Are the Champions: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Rise of the FenixSU: Once per [Scene], as a free action, you may revive a [Dead] ally in [Medium] range who died within the last [Round]. That ally returns to life with full HP.
  • Together we’re InvincibleEX: Once per [Encounter], as a free action, you grant target ally in [Medium] range [Immunity] to all damage for one [Round].

3.1.4 Orator

Some Bards forgo to path of the Skald to focus entirely on weaving words instead of weapons. These orators inspire their allies with their speech and manipulate their enemies (and any potentially helpful passers-by) by the same token.

1st Circle – Universal SpeechEX: You can speak and understand all languages. You may target an ally with a Diplomacy check as a move action. When you do, they gain a bonus they can choose to apply (before rolling) to any future d20 roll until the end of the [Encounter] based on the Diplomacy check result:

  • 10+: +1
  • 15+: +2
  • 20+: +3
  • 30+: +5
  • 40+: +7
  • 50+: +10

Outside of combat you can Take 10 on this roll but you may not Take 20.

2nd Circle – Soothing WordsEX: As a standard action, make a Diplomacy check with a -3 penalty for every [Round] of combat which has already been completed in this [Encounter]. If the result is 20 or more, all creatures in combat cannot take an offensive action until the end of your next turn. If the result is 35 or more, all creatures in combat can’t take an offensive action until the end of your turn after the next.

3rd Circle – Suggestive WordplayEX: When you make a Diplomacy check outside of combat, if you beat the target’s Diplomacy defence by 5 or more, you may give them a suggestion of up to 25 words. As long as it seems reasonable and the target has no reason to assume it will put them in danger, the target is compelled to follow the suggestion.

4th Circle – Undeniable LogicEX: When you target an opponent with an in-combat Diplomacy check, instead of the normal effect you may deal damage equal to the result which bypasses [Resistance] and [Damage reduction]. The target takes a penalty to their next saving throw equal to the bonus an ally would get from 1st circle from a Diplomacy check of the same result.

5th Circle – Infectious InspirationEX: Once per [Round], as a free action, when an ally uses the bonus from your 1st circle ability, you may make a Diplomacy check targeting an ally (for the 1st circle ability).

6th Circle – Fight Them on the BeachesEX: If an ally uses their bonus from your 1st circle ability and their roll still fails to meet the target (AC, DC, etc.), then the bonus is not expended.

7th Circle – We Happy FewEX: Once per [Quest], you may spend ten minutes giving a speech to a number of allies equal to your Charisma modifier. In the next [Encounter], those creatures can make an additional standard action on each of their turns.

3.1.5 Skald

Bards are trained in arts of combat passed down by an apostate group of Iron Magi, who believed in the powers of chaos and freedom. Skalds battle from a distance, chaining together their attacks in an arcane tempo, which allows them to release bursts of magic to change the battlefield.

Your Chain has a length of zero at the beginning of each [Encounter]. A chain is measured by the number of Links in it. Whenever you make a successful ranged attack, you may add one Link to your Chain. Skald abilities called Chain components add one Link to your Chain whenever they are activated, even if they include attacks within them. Each Chain component is activated during an attack action to replace one or more attacks in that attack action, and each can be activated once per [Round]. Attacks made as part of a Chain component cannot be replaced as part of another Chain component.

Each Chain finisher can be activated as a swift action once per [Round], and can only be activated if the Chain has a certain number of Links or more, specified in the text of each ability. As part of each Chain Finisher, you may [Teleport] up to 5 ft per Link in the Chain, which lets you close gaps and bring home the attack, or retreat to a safe range afterwards. You can choose to [Teleport] before or after the effect of the Chain finisher, and this [Teleport] does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Activating a Chain finisher ends the current Chain, reducing the number of Links in it to zero.

1st Circle – A Tempo in SteelSU: As a Chain component, replace a single attack to instead increase your speed by 10 ft for the [Encounter] and reduce the speed of target creature in [Close] range by 10 ft. These bonuses stack twice times at 3rd circle, three times at 5th circle, and four times at 7th circle.

This can also be activated as a Chain Finisher with 1 Link or more.

2nd Circle – Howl of the North WindSU: As a Chain Finisher with 1 Link or more, create a spread with radius equal to your [Close] range centred within 15 ft. All creatures in the spread are [Shaken] for one [Round]. All creatures in the spread and your [Melee] range also take damage equal to twice your level. A successful Reflex save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Shaken] condition.

3rd Circle – Apostate of the DiraeSU: As a Chain Component that replaces two attacks in an attack action, create a 35 ft radius spread of whirling winds within your [Medium] range. Each time a creature starts its turn in the spread or enters a space in the spread they are [Slowed] for one [Round], and creatures ending their turn in the spread take damage equal to your level. The spread disperses at the end of your next turn, dealing damage equal to your level to all creatures in the spread. A successful Fortitude save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Slowed] condition.

4th Circle – Scream of the Clear SkySU: As a Chain Finisher with 2 Links or more, create a spread of radius 40 ft centred on you which lasts until the start of your next turn. When it is created, you may remove up to four conditions in total from the following list from creatures in the spread: [Battered], [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Dazed], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Energy drained], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Nauseated], [Paralyzed], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], [Stunned].

The first time an opponent uses a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability within the spread, they must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or the ability is negated and the action spend to use it is lost.

5th Circle – Legato ShockwaveSU: As a Chain Component that replaces two attacks in an attack action, make a single attack using a ranged weapon to a target in your [Melee] range, this does not provoke an attack of opportunity. This attack does additional damage equal to twice your level. If the attack hits, the target is moved in a direction of your choice until it is no longer in your [Melee] range.

6th Circle – Bellow of the Far SeaSU: As a Chain Finisher with 3 Links or more, create a spread of radius 50 ft centred within your [Melee] range. All other creatures in the spread are [Exhausted] until the end of the [Encounter] and [Energy drained] twice. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) reduces this to [Energy drained] once. This ability can be used three times per [Encounter].

7th Circle – Roar of the Wind MasterSU: Once per [Encounter], as a Chain Finisher with 7 Links or more, create a spread of radius 70 ft centred within your [Close] range. All creatures in the spread take damage equal to three times your level, are [Battered] for two [Rounds], and cannot make melee attacks against you for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the additional effects.

3.2 Dancer

Table 3.2: Dancer Class
HP 8
Skills 6
BAB Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Dex
KDM Str

Using a power at once more and less primal than a Bard’s, Dancers use their bodies movements as a complex somatic component to awaken their allies’ latent abilities through pure hormonal stimulation or by the application of ancient magics. Their Dances become more powerful over time, and they weave this aid to their allies between their own attacks, letting their powers reach a crescendo of supportive potential.

The Dancer’s Tracks are:

  • Medium and Slow: Choose any two of:
    • Bladedancer: Build up momentum passively as you dance between foes, personally attacking them and moving out of the way of their attacks.
    • Invigorator: Use a combination of standard and swift actions to dance for your allies, granting them a mixture of major and lesser boons, which are more powerful if you leave time for the dance to build up.
    • Ritualist: Use your move actions and joint attacks to weave together an ever-more complex dance with a single partner, granting you both power.
  • Fast: Superstar: Choose between Idol and Celebrity
    • Celebrity: Take advantage of your fame for wealth, easier social interacion, and drawing attention in combat.
    • Cheerleader: Become a hard-working inspiration to your allies, granting them energy when you roll well.

3.2.1 Bladedancer

Special: Elves may switch one of their tracks for Bladedancer without using their multiclass.

1st Circle – Swords DanceEX: Whenever you hit with an attack roll or an opponent misses you with an attack roll, you gain a Step. Whenever you miss with an attack roll or an opponent hits you with an attack roll, you lose a Step. You lose all accumulated Steps at the end of an [Encounter] and cannot have negative Steps.

At any point in your turn, including during your attack action, you may expend one Step to make an immediate 5 ft step.

2nd Circle – Dance of DeathEX: Whenever you begin an attack action while having at least two accumulated Steps, you gain a [Bonus Attack].

3rd Circle – This Is the Way We LoveEX: As an immediate action, you may expend two Steps to replace your AC against the next attack made against you, or your next saving throw, with the result of an attack roll. You may spend any number of additional Steps as part of the immediate action to replace AC for an additional attack, or for an additional saving throw for each Step expended.

4th Circle – Dance Dance RevolutionEX: While you have at least three accumulated Steps, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity.

5th Circle – Blade RunnerEX: As an immediate action, you may expend any number of Steps to take a number of immediate 5 ft steps equal to the number of Steps expended.

When you move on your turn with Swords Dance, you may take two 5 ft steps per Step expended.

6th Circle – Ballroom BlitzEX: You have [Miss chance] equal to 10% per Step you have accumulated.

7th Circle – One Last DanceEX: As long as you have 5 Steps accumulated, you cannot die. If you ever fall below 5 Steps, you die instantly if this ability was currently sustaining you.

3.2.2 Invigorator

The Invigorator track gives you the ability to use Invigorating Dances. These consist of an Opener and a Closer. The Opener is a standard action that targets a non-you ally in your [Close] range, and must be used before you use a Closer, which is a swift action which targets the same ally, regardless of range as long as you have line of sight and line of effect. You can use additional Openers before you use a Closer for a given Dance, but you cannot have that Dance target an ally who is the recipient of an ongoing Dance.

Whenever you start a turn with an ongoing Invigorating Dance, it gains a Step. When you use a Closer, in addition to its normal effects it grants a +2 bonus to attack rolls to that ally per Step it had for the duration of its effect, plus an additional +1 for every even numbered circle you have in Invigorator.

1st Circle – Take the StageEX: You can use the Stimulate Opener and the Lion Whirl Closer.

  • Stimulate (Opener): Your target is moved in the initiative order to be directly below you. They take damage equal to half their level (minimum 1) for every place they moved in the initiative order this way.
  • Lion Whirl (Closer): For one [Round], whenever your target rolls a die to deal physical damage and rolls the maximum result, they roll an additional die of the same size (if they are rolling a d2 or a d3, only round a 4 or a 6 on the d4/d6 which is used).

2nd Circle – Let the Show BeginEX: You can use the Sword Pirouette Opener and the Peacock Strut Closer.

  • Sword Pirouette (Opener): Make a single melee attack and your targeted ally may make a single melee attack against the same target. You and the targeted ally may make an additional melee attack if you have your 5th circle in Invigorator.
  • Peacock Strut (Closer): For one [Round], whenever your target adds a mental ability modifier (Int, Wis or Cha) as a bonus to the healing or damage done by a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability, they instead add all three of their mental ability modifiers.

3rd Circle – The Main EventEX: You can use the Wolf Step Opener and the Eagle Caper Closer.

  • Wolf Step (Opener): Your targeted ally gains +1 to AC, +10 to speed and may make a [Bonus attack] when they make an attack action until one [Round] after the Dance ends.
  • Eagle Caper (Closer): For one [Round], your target gains a +20 bonus to speed and may attack [Flying] creatures as though they were also [Flying].

4th Circle – The Show Goes OnEX: The effects of your Closers last for one additional [Round] for each Step they had.

5th Circle – Unmissable PerformanceEX: You can use the Exciting Fugue Opener and the Knight’s Ball Closer. Both of these are special in that they target all of your non-you allies in [Close] range rather than only one - if they are paired with any other Opener or Closer that Opener or Closer but target only one of the allies affected,

  • Exciting Fugue (Opener): All allies in your [Close] range may make an additional swift or immediate action on their next turn.
  • Knight’s Ball (Closer): Whenever an ally in [Close] range takes damage in the next [Round], before applying [Damage reduction] or [Resistance], you take the damage in their place. You may not apply [Damage reduction] or [Resistance] to this damage.

6th Circle – Time to ShineEX: You can use the Carbuncle Trot Opener and the Exquisite Arabesque Closer.

  • Carbuncle Trot (Opener): Your target heals 1d8 hit points per your character level at the start of their next turn, and when this Dance ends.
  • Exquisite Arabesque (Closer): For one [Round], your target may replace each of their attacks in any attack action with a combat manoeuvre. They may replace the DC of saves against this manoeuvre with 12 + 1/2 your character level + your Dex modifier.

7th Circle – To Be a StarEX: Once per [Encounter], you can use either the Dragon Dance Opener or the Sealticge’s Seduction Closer.

  • Dragon Dance (Opener): Your target cannot die until the end of their next turn. If they would be reduced below 1 hit point, they remain at 1 hit point.
  • Sealticge’s Seduction (Closer): For one [Round], which cannot be extended by The Show Goes On, or any other abilities, your target may target up to three creatures whenever they use an ability which would normally target a single creature.

3.2.3 Ritualist

The Ritualist track gives you the ability to use Ritual Dances. You may start a Ritual Dance as part of a move action, where the other part is to make a Diplomacy check, make an Acrobatics check, or to move. A Ritual Dance always affects you and one ally who is in your [Close] range when you start the dance, and lasts until either that ally leaves your line of effect, or you end two turns without adding a Dance or a Step to your Ritual.

When you start a Ritual Dance, you choose a Dance you have learned from this track and add it to the Ritual. A Dance counts as having one Step by default.

As part of a move action, where the other part is to make a Diplomacy check, make an Acrobatics check, or to move you may add a Step or a Dance to your current Ritual. A Dance adds its effect to the Ritual, and a Step adds an additional Step to all Dances in the Ritual.

You may also add a Step to your Ritual the first time each [Round] you hit with a melee attack against a creature that the ally benefitting from your Ritual has hit with a melee attack since the end of your last turn.

A Ritual can have a total number of Dances and Steps in it equal to the number of circles you have in Ritualist plus 1.

1st Circle – Feel the Heat With SomebodySU: You can use the Punishing Polka and Rejuvenating Rumba Dances.

  • Punishing Polka: Affected creatures deal an additional 1d4 fury damage on their melee attacks equal to the number of Steps the Dance has.
  • Rejuvenating Rumba: When you start this Dance, and whenever you add a Step or a Dance to this Ritual, affected creatures heal 1d6 hit points per circle you have in Ritualist per Step the Dance has.

2nd Circle – Shut Up and DanceSU: You can use the Quickening Quickstep, Toughening Tango, and Willful Waltz Dances.

  • Quickening Quickstep: Affected creatures gain a +5 bonus to Speed and a +1 bonus to Reflex saves for each Step the Dance has.
  • Toughening Tango: Affected creatures gain [Damage reduction] and a bonus to Fortitude saves equal to the number of Steps the Dance has.
  • Willful Waltz: Affected creatures gain a bonus to one skill both creatures have trained and to Will saves equal to the number of Steps the Dance has.

3rd Circle – I’m Your Boogie ManSU: When you add a Step to your Ritual as part of a move action, you may add two Steps. You may have a total number of Dances and Steps in a Ritual equal to the number of circles you have in Ritualist plus 2.

You can use the Seeking Samba Dance.

  • Seeking Samba: The affected creatures’ attacks ignore 20% [Miss chance] and 3 points of [Damage reduction] or [Resistance] for each Step the Dance has.

4th Circle – Murder on the Dance FloorSU: When one of your Ritual Dances ends, you may inflict magical damage equal to the highest of your Diplomacy and Acrobatics modifiers to an opponent within [Close] range.

You can use the Mighty Mambo Dance.

  • Mighty Mambo: The first time an affected creature hits with a melee attack each [Round], before rolling damage they first inflict 3 points of [HP reduction] against their target for each Step the Dance has.

5th Circle – Safety DanceSU: When you add a Dance to your Ritual as part of a move action, you may also add a Step. When you add any number of Steps to your Ritual as part of a move action, you may forgo one of those Steps to instead remove one of the following conditions from either of the affected creatures: [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Nauseated], [Paralyzed], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], or [Stunned].

6th Circle – Moves Like JaggerSU: When you add a Dance or Step to your Ritual as part of a move action and use the remainder of the action to move, you may move up to your full speed.

You can use the Jubilant Jive Dance.

  • Jubilant Jive: When this Dance starts, and each time a Step is added to the Dance, affected creatures gain a +5 bonus to their next d20 roll.

7th Circle – Disco InfernoSLA: As a standard action, you may end your current Ritual. All opponents who are in [Close] range of either affected creature take 2d6 energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor per Step or Dance the Ritual had and are [Blown away]. A Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) halves the damage and negates the [Blown away] effect.

3.2.4 Celebrity

1st Circle – I’m Gonna Be a StarEX: For the duration of a [Scene], you may prepare and execute a public performance. To do so, make a Diplomacy and an Acrobatics check and take the average of the two results (rounding up if necessary).

If your result is 20 or above, you gain a +2 bonus per circle you have in Celebrity to any interaction skill checks you make against creatures that were in the audience until the end of the [Quest].

You make a profit on any result above a 20. You get money equivalent to one quarter of the cost of a Lesser Consumable on a 20. For every 2 points above 20 your result is, you get that amount of money again.

2nd Circle – Name In LightsEX: You gain a bonus to Attractiveness equal to 10 times the number of circles you have in Celebrity, and all creatures gain a bonus on Knowledge checks against you equal to twice the number of circles you have in Celebrity.

Whenever you enter a new settlement or community, you gain 1 free social encounter token you may use in that settlement or community.

At the start of an [Encounter], you may choose to have each opponent in the [Encounter] with line of sight to you become [Starstruck] for one [Round], or until they are targeted for an offensive action. A [Starstruck] creature must target you and only you with offensive actions if able.

3rd Circle – Fan MailEX: Every [Quest], you receive two lesser Consumables, one greater Consumable, a Lesser Item and a Greater Item of your choice. You can an additional Lesser Item slot, and an additional Greater Item slot when you reach 10th level.

4th Circle – I’m Kind of a Big DealEX: When a [Starstruck] creature misses you with an attack, they are [Starstruck] for an additional [Round], or until they are targeted for an offensive action, and take a -2 penalty to attack rolls while they are [Starstruck], which does stack with itself.

When a [Starstruck] creature hits you with an attack, they must make a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your Cha modifier) or be Charmed (when it would use an offensive action targeting you or an ally, it must make a Will save. A successful Will allows it to use that offensive action as normal and renders the creature no longer charmed; a failed save means it cannot use an offensive action against you or your allies for one [Round]. The creature remains charmed until you or an ally use an offensive action against it).

5th Circle – Red Carpet PrivilegeEX: Whenever you make a Performance with the 1st Circle ability, you may have one attendee per 2 above 20 you scored on the skill check make a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your Cha modifier). For each creature that fails, you gain access to any telepathic communication that creature is engaged in, and you count as having made a knowledge check against that target with a roll equal to your performance check.

You never trigger attacks of opportunity from creatures who have been affected by this ability, or creatures that have been [Starstruck] within the [Encounter].

6th Circle – International IconEX: Whenever you are targeted by or included in the area of effect of an offensive ability that affects multiple creatures (as the ability is being used, this does not apply to ongoing spreads), you may choose to either be unaffected by the ability, or for all other affected creatures to be unaffected by the ability.

7th Circle – Face of the GenerationEX: You no longer choose to make opponents [Starstruck] at the start of an [Encounter]. Instead, all opponents with line of sight to you become Charmed by you (as with I’m Kind of a Big Deal). When they cease to be Charmed, you can choose if they become Starstruck for one [Round] or until they are targeted for an offensive action.

3.2.5 Cheerleader

1st Circle – Heart of the TeamEX: For the duration of a [Scene], you may prepare and execute a a private performance for your allies. To do so, make a Diplomacy and an Acrobatics check and take the average of the two results (rounding up if necessary).

If your result is above 20, for the next [Scene] your allies gain a number of Inspiration Points equal to 1 plus an additional 1 for each 4 points above 20 you rolled. Whenever they roll a d20, an ally may spend an Inspiration Point to instead roll a d20 twice and take the highest.

2nd Circle – Roll ModelEX: Whenever you roll the maximum result on a die, choose an ally with line of sight and line of effect to you. The next time they roll a die of that size, they may instead treat the result as the maximum result.

3rd Circle – Pull It TogetherEX: Your allies gain a +15 ft bonus to speed and do not provoke attacks of opportunity while moving as long as they end their movement closer to you than they start their movement, and they have line of sight to you throughout the movement.

4th Circle – Life of the PartyEX: Whenever you succeed on a skill check in combat, all of your allies in line of sight heal hit points and gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

5th Circle – Make a ComebackEX: When you roll the maximum result on a die and it is the second type of die you have rolled the maximum result on in the [Round], you may restart the duration of any effect on one of your allies in line of sight (i.e. an effect that lasts two [Rounds] now lasts until the end of your turn after your next turn, etc.)

6th Circle – Never Stop Never StoppingEX: You gain [Immunity] to any effect that reduces the number of actions you can take in a turn or specifies what actions you are able to take.

7th Circle – Encore!EX: Once per [Scene], when you die you may return to life at full hit points two [Rounds] later. When you do, all of your allies in line of sight gain temporary hit points equal to three times your level and gain an Inspiration Point.

3.3 Druid

Table 3.3: Druid Class
HP 12
Skills 6
BAB Poor
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Str
KDM Con

Druids specialize in the magic of the earth. They can channel these latent Ley Lines to bolster their allies, or to even change the environment. Their closeness with nature also leads to Druids acquiring companions from the natural world which fight with them.

The Druid’s Tracks are:

  • Medium: Terraforming: A move and standard action focused track which focuses on manipulating the battlefield with plant-based effects
  • Slow: Nature’s Ally: Allows the summoning of an ally which gradually gets more powerful and can use party’s actions to do more things
  • Fast: Gaea: Choose between Plant, Shapeshifter or Warden (which are elsewhere in the document)
    • Plant: Attack with entangling vines and gain healing and defence when you stay rooted to the spot
    • Shapeshifter: Change into a variety of forms for different situations
    • Warden: Channel the primal aspects of nature to heal allies, receive lore and sense your foes

3.3.1 Terraforming

Terraformers use earth magic to manipulate plant life to inhibit the movement of their enemies and create areas of the battlefield which are unsafe for foes, or advantageous to allies.

1st Circle – EvergreenSLA: You gain [Tremorsense] out to 10 ft per circle of this track you possess. In addition, as a move action, you may create a spread of grasping roots and vines centred within your [Close] range with a radius of 10 ft per circle in this track you possess. This spread lasts until the end of the [Encounter], and any creature starting its turn in or entering the spread must make a DC (10 + ½ your level + your KOM) Reflex save or be [Entangled] for one [Round].

2nd Circle – Professor OakSLA: Once per [Encounter], as part of a move action, you may create an Instant Tree, as the consumable, on a space within your [Close] range. Also, the [Fast Healing] from the tree is equal to the higher of your KOM and level.

3rd Circle – OvergrowSLA: As a move action, create a 50 ft radius spread of overgrown plants within your [Medium] range. All allies in that spread are [Concealed]. When you gain your 5th circle in this track, they are instead [Fully concealed]. When you gain your 7th circle in this track, the plants become poisonous and all enemies starting their turn in the spread are [Energy drained] once.

4th Circle – RosebudSLA: You may cast wall of thorns as a standard action at will.

5th Circle – Biomial ExpansionSLA: As a standard action, you may warp the terrain within [Long] range, allowing you to do any of these things.

  • Remove any mundane obstacles and add as many as you wish in unoccupied spaces
  • Cause that area to become Bright, Foul Air, On Fire or Tricksy, as the environmental effects, for the duration of the [Scene], with save DC equal to (10 + ½ your level + your KOM)
  • Create a severity 4 Onrush as a [Ground] effect on any number of spaces within the range going in any direction you wish, either until the end of the [Encounter] or [Scene], the Fortitude save DC is (10 + ½ your level + your KOM)

6th Circle – YasovaSLA: You may cast find the path and hallow at will, with their normal casting times.

7th Circle – Mother Nature’s ArmySLA: Whenever you place an Instant Tree, including with the Mother Oak ability, you may now place three trees within [Close] range. In addition to their healing effect, at the start of your turn they deal damage equal to twice your level to all enemies within their [Close] range, and may move up to 50 ft after dealing their damage.

3.3.2 Gaea

You emulate the stoic power of flora, learn to take on the wild shapes of the fauna of the world, or learn to manipulate the raw power of nature. Choose the Plant, Shapeshifter or Warden track, and this replaces the Gaea track for you.

3.3.3 Nature’s Ally

The Nature’s Ally Track grants you a Companion, the Companion can take any form you wish, be it an loyal animal sidekick, a guardian angel, a summoned creature, a helpful jinn or a mechanical servant. In any case, while it is designed by the player, it must have GM approval.

1st Circle – Find a PetEX: Once per [Scene] you may summon, create, or otherwise secure the aid of a Companion. You may only have one Companion at a time. The companion takes the form of a Scout, Grunt, Turret or Striker with level equal to yours with a size and creature type of your choice. Your Companion uses the higher of your and its attack bonus, AC and saves. It does not have its own pool of hit points — all damage, [HP Reduction], healing and temporary hit points that would affect your Companion affect you instead. If a single source of the aforementioned would normally affect both of you (such as with an Area of Effect), it affects only you. If you are [Unconscious] or [Dead], so is your Companion. When you are no longer [Unconscious] or [Dead], neither is your Companion.

Your Companion is [Bound] to you, the [Bound] condition cannot be removed by any means, and you are its sole controller. However, when you use a swift action to have the Companion make an attack, you may instead have it use a Standard action for any other purpose a Standard action can be used for.

2nd Circle – Jolly Co-OperationEX: Your Companion gains [Lesser resistance] to all damage, and once per [Round] when an opponent targets you or your square with an offensive action, it provokes an attack of opportunity from your companion. If your companion uses the Scout or Turret Archetype, it can make this attack of opportunity with its ranged attack against opponents at [Close], [Medium] or [Long] range who target you or your square (provided its attack can be used on targets at the relevant distance), but not against opponents within its [Melee] range.

3rd Circle – Hey, Listen!EX: Choose one Track, your Companion gains a single ability from that Track which requires a standard action, or is passive, of 3rd circle or lower. When you reach 6th circle in this Track, your Companion gains another ability from that track of 6th circle or lower.

Also, you can take actions to direct your companion even if you would otherwise be prevented from doing so by a condition or effect

4th Circle – You Teach Me, I’ll Teach YouEX: When you order your Companion to attack, it can make additional attacks as normal for a Mook of its level making an attack action, though it makes attacks after the first at a -5 penalty. This counts as your [Bonus attack] for that [Round].

5th Circle – The Magic of FriendshipEX: If your Companion hits an opponent with at least two attacks in the same [Round], that opponent suffers from your choice of [Vulnerability] to your offensive actions for 1 [Round], or a -2 to saves against your offensive actions for 1 [Round]. In addition, your Companion’s [Lesser resistance] to all damage improves to [Resistance] to all damage.

6th Circle – Our Courage Will Pull Us ThroughEX: Once per [Round] when you deal damage to an opponent, that opponent provokes an attack of opportunity from your companion. Your companion can now make one attack of opportunity each [Round] without expending your attacks of opportunity.

7th Circle – Legendary PetEX: Your Companion gains two Feats and a Lesser, Greater and Relic magic item of your choice. It must qualify for the Feats.

3.4 Fighter

Table 3.4: Fighter Class
HP 10
Skills 5
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Ref
KOM Str or Dex
KDM Dex or Con

Barbarians smash things, Monks use mystical martial arts, Rangers use a variety of traps and tricks, Samurai use their ancient techniques, and Scouts are really fast. But what about the guys who just have swords and fight like normal people? These are Fighters, and they come in all shapes and sizes, some are just trained fighters, some of them use extra tricks like Alchemy or powered armour, some are battlefield commanders, and some just learned to fight dirty on the streets.

The Fighter can choose three tracks, and which is Fast, Medium or Slow, from the following:

  • Combat Alchemist: A Move action focused track of preparing helpful potions and concoctions
  • Knight: A largely passive track that makes you better at single attacks like Charges and a dominating presence on the battlefield.
  • Blacksmith: A passive track giving bonuses to your equipment, defences and the ability to disarm and damage opponents’ weapons.
  • Blossom Dance: An offensive track focused on getting in lucky hits by predicting exactly where you will strike.
  • Dragoon: You gain special combat techniques to fight like a Dragon, including jumping out of reach and striking multiple opponents at once.
  • Executioner: A track focused on doing high single-target damage but needs you to kill your target to keep using it.
  • Iron Heart: A track which gives you a selection of generic but useful combat tricks
  • Item Master: You just have a lot of magical items.
  • Legionnaire: A track focused on using a combination of melee and ranged attacks and teaming up on opponents.
  • Medical Officer: You can use swift actions to create healing consumables and get better at moving around the battlefield to hand them out.
  • Power Armour: You gain a powerful set of armour with a variety of helpful modules for offense and utility
  • Rokushiki: You learn six specific superhuman martial arts techniques for utility and survivability in combat.
  • Seeker: A track which makes you better at fighting magical foes, by giving you heightened defences against magic and ways to dispel it.
  • Seidrmander: A track which gives you access to a small arsenal of close-range magical attacks which use attack rolls like normal attacks.
  • Show Fighter: You learn to fight with extra dirty hits, powerful manoeuvres and a bit of trash talking.
  • Skiltgravr: You can inscribe runes on your weapons and armour to grant you useful passive effects and active attacks, and can emulate the powers of a Giant.
  • White Raven: A track focused on commanding the battlefield, with buffs to your allies and gives Charge based bonuses.

3.4.1 Blacksmith

1st Circle – Heart of IronEX: At the start of each [Scene], you may choose up to two items you possess. The item bonus to AC of any armour increases by 1, the item bonus to attack of any weapon increases by 1 (or becomes +1 if it had none) and the deflection bonus to AC of any shield increases by 1. You may also change the properties of any weapon you possess between [Scenes].

2nd Circle – Forged in FireEX: You gain [Lesser resistance] to physical damage, and to energy damage with the [Fire] or [Acid] descriptors.

3rd Circle – Break the BladeEX: The DC for saves against your Disarm combat manoeuvre becomes 11 + ½ your level + your KDM. Twice per [Encounter], when you are hit by a melee attack, you may force the attacker to make a Reflex save or be immediately disarmed.

4th Circle – Spirit of SteelEX: The bonus granted by Heart of Iron increases to 2. You may also have it affect an additional item, which may belong to an ally instead of yourself. Finally, you can change the enchantments of any point-buy item between [Scenes].

5th Circle – Shatter the SpearEX: You may now use Break the Blade once per [Round], and any Lesser item or mundane weapon you disarm permanently loses two weapon properties.

6th Circle – Through Fire and FlamesEX: Your [Lesser resistance] to physical damage increases to [Resistance], your [Lesser resistance] to [Acid] and [Fire] becomes [Immunity], and you gain [Fast healing] equal to your level.

7th Circle – Soul of MithrilEX: The bonus granted by Heart of Iron increases to +3, and you gain 4 points worth of enchantments to distribute between the items affected by it.

3.4.2 Blossom Dance

An esoteric style used by Elven Bladedancers from the Vedic states, and human bravos in central Cruxis, the Blossom Dance focuses on flamboyant but highly precise strikes. A Blossom Dancer must know exactly how their opponent will move, so that they attack at just the right spot to continue their complex ‘routine’. And yet, as they get more experienced, Blossom Dancers reliably can predict this.

1st Circle – Born In a World of StrifeEX: Before making an attack roll, choose a number between 1 and 20. When the roll results in that number, you may make an additional iterative attack in the attack action (or an additional attack at your iterative bonus even if the attack wasn’t part of an attack action), and gain an additional effect.

If the attack would otherwise miss, it now hits. If the attack would hit anyway, you deal additional damage equal to your level plus your Dex modifier.

This ability does not work if you use any ability to set the roll to a predetermined result.

2nd Circle – Against the OddsEX: Every time you miss with an attack roll, gain 1d4 Blossom Points. After seeing the result of a d20 roll, you may spend any number of Blossom Points to increase or decrease the result by the amount of points spent. A roll modified this way can trigger the effects of this track.

3rd Circle – We Choose To FightEX: When you use an attack action, make a [Bonus attack]. The first time each [Round] you roll a d6 for damage, choose a number between 1 and 6. If the d6 results in that number, the damaged creature is [Dazed] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your Dex modifier) reduces this to being [Slowed] for one [Round].

This ability does not work if you use any ability to set the roll to a predetermined result.

4th Circle – The Flower We SawEX: Note the number you choose with your 1st circle ability for the latest attack roll you made. If an ally rolls that number on a d20, you may heal them for an amount of hit points equal to three times your current Blossom Points.

5th Circle – Binding BlossomEX: The first time each [Round] that you predict an attack roll correctly and trigger the 1st circle ability, your attack also inflicts [Entangled] and [Battered] for one [Round].

6th Circle – Petal DanceEX: When you predict and attack roll correctly and trigger the 1st circle ability twice in a row, you may enter a frenzy. When you do, make an additional full attack action, but after that attack is completed you are [Confused] for two [Rounds]. You can only use this ability once per [Round] and you may not use it while [Confused].

7th Circle – Final FlickerEX: In addition to spending any Blossom Points, you may take 5 points of [HP reduction] to increase or reduce the result of an attack roll by 1. You may do this any number of times, up to the cap on [HP reduction].

3.4.3 Dragoon

Dragons are self-evidently some of the mightiest beings that exist, especially among mortals. So it makes perfect sense that mortal warriors try to emulate them. The most acrobatic become Dragon Knights, or Dragoons as they are often known, trained to jump to great heights to emulate a Dragon’s wings, and wield their spears in special techniques that recall draconic ferocity and steadfast mystical might.

This track can also be used by Githyanki, with Jump representing their free passage to and from the Astral Plane, and the other techniques being those they learned from Tiamat during their liberation.

1st Circle – JumpEX: As a standard action, you may leap high into the air, or otherwise become unreachable by most means, becoming [Soaring] until the start of your next turn and ending your turn. At the start of your next turn, you must immediately use your standard action to move a distance up to your [Melee] range and make a single melee attack. This attack has a bonus equal to the total of your Str and Dex modifiers to the attack roll against grounded targets, and can also hit [Flying] targets, though it only gets a bonus of the lower of your Str and Dex modifiers in that case. On a hit, make an Athletics and an Acrobatics check, you deal bonus [Precision] damage equal to the lower of the two results.

2nd Circle – AngonEX: As a standard action when you are not benefitting from any fury bonuses, make a melee attack roll against a creature in [Melee] range. This attack roll ignores all item and deflection bonuses the target has to AC, and on hit it ignores all [Damage reduction] and [Resistance].

3rd Circle – Lances DownEX: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Thunder ThrustEX: As a swift action, make a melee attack roll against an opponent in [Melee] range. On a hit, instead of any normal damage or on-hit effects, it deals damage equal to the total of your Str and Dex modifiers. If the attack was a critical, it deals additional damage equal to the higher of the two modifiers, but has no other effects of a critical hit.
  • Sonic ThrustEX: As a standard action, roll for a melee attack and note down the result. Compare that result to the AC of all opponents in your [Melee] range. All opponents whose AC is lower than the result take damage as if you had hit them with a melee attack, plus your Str and Dex modifiers, with no other on-hit effects. Opponents whose AC is higher than the result take damage equal to the total of your Str and Dex modifiers.

4th Circle – Dragon’s DogmaEX: At the start of your turn, you may choose to decrease the duration of all conditions affecting you by one [Round]. If they last for the [Encounter], reducing by one [Round] decreases the duration to the eight [Rounds], and if the duration is [Scene] or longer, this has no effect.

If you do this, you take damage and [HP reduction] for each effect with the duration reduced:

  • [Bleeding], [Burning], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Fatigued], [Shaken], [Sickened]: 10
  • [Battered], [Blinded], [Checked], [Energy Drained], [Entangled], [Exhausted], [Frightened]: 20
  • [Confused], [Cowering], [Dazed], [Nauseated], [Panicked], [Paralyzed], [Petrified], [Slowed], [Stunned]: 40

5th Circle – Dragon ForceEX: Once per [Round], when you hit with an attack you may regain hit points equal to half the attack roll result.

6th Circle – Jumping and PoppingEX: You gain the following abilities, each of which you may use once per [Scene]:

  • Super JumpEX: As a standard action, you may leap high into the air, or otherwise become unreachable by most means, becoming [Soaring] until the start of your next turn and ending your turn. At the start of your next turn, you must immediately use your standard action to move a distance up to your [Close] range and make a single melee attack. This attack has a bonus equal to the total of your Str and Dex modifiers to the attack roll against grounded targets, and can also hit [Flying] targets, and threatens a critical hit on the next five numbers below when you would usually do so. On a hit, make an Athletics and an Acrobatics check, you deal bonus [Precision] damage equal to the total of the two results.
  • Soul JumpEX: As a standard action, you and all allies in [Medium] range may leap high into the air, or otherwise become unreachable by most means, becoming [Soaring] until the start of your next turn and ending your turn. At the start of your next turn, you must immediately use your standard action to move a distance up to your [Melee] range and make a single melee attack. This attack has a bonus equal to the total of your Str and Dex modifiers to the attack roll against grounded targets, and can also hit [Flying] targets, though it only gets a bonus of the lower of your Str and Dex modifiers in that case. On a hit, make an Athletics and an Acrobatics check, you deal bonus [Precision] damage equal to the lower of the two results.

7th Circle – Sonic ThunderEX: As a swift action, roll for a melee attack and note down the result. Compare that result to the AC of all opponents in your [Melee] range. All opponents whose AC is lower than the result take damage as if you had hit them with a melee attack, plus your Str and Dex modifiers, with no other on-hit effects. Opponents whose AC is higher than the result take damage equal to the total of your Str and Dex modifiers.

3.4.4 Executioner

1st Circle – GuillotineEX: Once per [Encounter], when you make a melee attack roll you may choose to make it an Execution. If an Execution attack hits, it deals additional damage equal to the total of your level and Str modifier multiplied by the number of circles you have in Executioner and make a note of the creature that was hit by the attack.

If a creature which has been hit by an Execution attack dies, you regain your use of this ability for the [Encounter]. If an Execution attack you make misses, roll a d4. After a number of [Rounds] equal to the result, you regain your use of this abiliy for the [Encounter].
