2nd Circle – ApprehendEX: As a standard action, or once per [Round] in place of an attack in an attack action, make a melee attack. During this attack, your [Melee] range is tripled. If the attack hits, its target must make a Reflex save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your Str modifier) or move directly towards you until it is in your usual [Melee] range.

3rd Circle – HemorrhageEX: Creatures you hit with your melee attacks which are not [Bleeding] start [Bleeding]. Note any creature you inflict with the [Bleeding] condition. Whenever a [Bleeding] condition that you have inflicted ends due to its duration running out, you gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to your Str modifier, and creatures you inflict with [Bleeding] roll twice the number of d4s they normally would for the condition for the duration of the [Encounter].

4th Circle – DecimateEX: As a standard action, make a melee attack with the [Volley] descriptor against all opponents in your [Melee] range. This attack deals bonus damage against every target equal to one tenth (rounded down) of their maximum hit points.

5th Circle – Crippling BlowEX: As a standard action, or once per [Round] in place of an attack in an attack action, you may make a [Melee] attack which inflicts [Slowed] on a hit for two [Rounds]. A successful Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your Str modifier) negates this effect.

6th Circle – Trinity ForceEX: Note when you use Apprehend, Decimate and Crippling Blow. Once you have used all three, if your next melee attack hits triple the damage dealt after rolling and applying all modifiers. Whether the attack hits or misses, remove the noted ability uses - this ability can trigger again if all three have been noted.

7th Circle – Sterak’s GageEX: When you kill a creature, gain [Fast healing] 10 until the end of the [Encounter]. This stacks with itself.

3.4.5 Iron Heart

Though only known as a specific fighting style in the dojos of Azujin, warriors across the world technically follow the teachings of Iron Heart. They’re simple teachings, though, emphasising simple mastery of mundane weapons and solid melee techniques over any magic or specialised fighting style. It’s just the track for people who like hitting stuff, in no specific way.

1st Circle – Steel WindEX: Once per [Round], as a swift action, when you hit an opponent with a melee attack and deal damage to that opponent with that attack, you may compare your attack roll from that attack to the AC of another target opponent within [Melee] range. If the attack roll equals or exceeds that opponent’s AC, you deal that much damage to that opponent.

2nd Circle – Dancing Blade FormEX: Your [Melee] range increases by 5 ft. When you gain your 5th circle in Iron Heart, it increases by a further 10 ft.

3rd Circle – Wall of BladesEX: Once per [Round], as an immediate action, make an attack roll. You may use the result of that attack roll in place of your AC for all attacks made against you by one opponent until the end of the [Round].

4th Circle – Lightning RecoveryEX: You may take an additional swift or immediate action per [Round]. As an immediate action, you may reroll an attack roll at a -2 penalty. You must keep the result of the reroll.

5th Circle – Finishing MoveEX: You gain access to the following abilities, you can use each twice per [Encounter] as a standard action, but each [Encounter] you can only use one of the three:

  • Dazing Strike: Make an attack action, and if three attacks in the action hit, the target is [Dazed] for one [Round].
  • Mortal Strike: Make an attack action. If the target is below half of their maximum HP each hit deals an additional 5d8 points of damage. If the target is below one quarter of their maximum HP, each hit deals an additional 5d12 points of damage.
  • Iron Heart Surge: End all [Fear] and [Binding] effects currently affecting you, as well as any [Stunned], [Dazed], [Nauseated] and [Confused] conditions affecting you. You can use this ability even when you would be otherwise unable to take an action.

6th Circle – Supreme ParryEX: You gain [Damage reduction] equal to the total of your KOM and KDM. When you use Wall of Blades and an attack misses, you may compare the attack roll result to the AC of a different opponent (one who wasn’t the missing attacker) in your [Melee] range. If the attack roll equals or exceeds that target’s AC, the attack does its normal damage to the other opponent.

7th Circle – Strike of Perfect ClarityEX: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action make an attack roll. If it hits it does normal damage, plus a bonus 160 points of damage.

3.4.6 Item Master

Special: Do not use this track with a Full Buy-In character. It would be silly.

1st Circle – Utility BeltEX: You can equip an additional Lesser Item.

2nd Circle – Q BranchEX: You can equip an additional Lesser Item.

3rd Circle – Go Go GadgetEX: You can equip an additional Greater Item.

4th Circle – Boss ChestEX: You can equip an additional Greater and Lesser Item.

5th Circle – Welcome to the Secret ShopEX: You can equip an additional Relic Item.

6th Circle – Always PreparedEX: You can equip an additional Greater and Lesser Item.

7th Circle – Great Fairy’s BlessingEX: You can equip an additional Artifact Item.

3.4.7 Legionnaire

1st Circle – Pilum and GladiusEX: As a standard and move action, make a single ranged attack against a creature within 5 ft plus 10 ft per circle you have in Legionnaire. Then you may switch your wielded weapon without an action and move towards the target until you are in your [Melee] range of that creature. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from your target. If you did not provoke any other attacks of opportunity with that movement, you may then make a melee attack action (this may be a manoeuvre or include iterative attacks) against that target.

2nd Circle – Raise the AnvilEX: Once per [Round], when you hit an opponent with a melee attack, you may make them unable to make attacks of opportunity until they leave your [Melee] range.

3rd Circle – Strike the HammerEX: When one of your allies hits a creature currently affected by Raise the Anvil with a melee attack, as long as they are the first ally to benefit from this ability in the [Round], they deal additional damage with the [Precision] descriptor equal to five times the number of circles you have in Legionnaire. The damaged creature must then make a Reflex save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) or lose their move action on their next turn. A given creature only makes this save once per [Round].

4th Circle – Legion’s ReservesEX: Once per [Encounter], when you start a move action within [Melee] range of an opponent, and end the move action in [Melee] range of no opponents, you may heal seven hit points per character level you have.

5th Circle – Eagle BannerEX: Once per [Encounter], as a move action, you may allow each ally in your [Close] range (including yourself) to choose one effect currently affecting them which would not currently be affecting them if they had succeeded on a saving throw. They may roll that saving throw, and if it succeeds then the effect ceases to affect them.

6th Circle – Stand and FightEX: Three times per [Scene], as a standard and a move action you may enter the Stand and Fight stance until the start of your next turn. While in the stance, if any opponent moves through a space within 30 ft of you, you may make a single ranged attack against them. Then you may switch your wielded weapon without an action and move towards the target until you are in your [Melee] range of that creature. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity and you may then make a single melee attack against them.

7th Circle – OnagerEX: When you make a ranged attack as part of Pilum and Gladius, you may choose to immediately roll damage as though you had hit your target, though forgoing any Fury or [Precision] bonuses. You then deal that much damage to all creatures within 25 ft of your target.

3.4.8 Medical Officer

1st Circle – MedikitsEX: As a swift action, you can create and start holding a Medical Pack. A Medical Pack is a consumable which can be used as a free action by anyone holding it to heal hit points equal to four times the number of circles you have in Medical Officer and end one of the following conditions: [Bleeding], [Burning], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed]. You can pass a Medical Pack to an adjacent ally with part of a move action, and when you do so you may have it immediately take effect on them. An adjacent ally can also, with your consent, take a Medical Pack from you as part of a move action.

Medical Packs expire at the end of an [Encounter] and become useless.

2nd Circle – Full HealEX: Instead of healing hit points from a Medical Pack, a creature can instead end one of the following conditions: [Battered], [Blinded], [Confused], [Dazed], [Exhausted], [Nauseated], [Paralyzed].

3rd Circle – Field DoctorEX: You gain the following abilities:

  • Improved Medikits: Your Medical Packs now heal hit points equal to six times the number of circles you have in Medical Officer.
  • Through the Trenches: When you move, you may cause an adjacent ally to move alongside you in the same direction. If they provoke any attacks of opportunity with this movement, you may take the attack in their place.
  • Transfusion: When you create a Medical Pack, you may lose any amount of hit points, or cause a consenting adjacent ally to lose any amount of hit points. That Medical Pack heals additional hit points equal to the amount lost.

4th Circle – VaccineEX: When a creature ends a condition with a Medical Pack, they gain [Immunity] to that condition for the duration of the [Encounter].

5th Circle – Doctors Without BordersEX: Once per [Round] as a free action while you are holding a Medical Pack, you may move up to half of your speed as long as you end the movement closer to an ally than you started the movement. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity (any allies carried with you by Through the Trenches can still provoke attacks of opportunity with this movement).

6th Circle – Combat StimsEX: Instead of healing hit points from a Medical Pack, a creature can instead use it as a Stim Pack. They gain a bonus to their next damage roll equal to the base hit points granted by the Medical Pack, plus a quarter of any bonus granted by Transfusion.

7th Circle – Full RestoreEX: If an ally is brought exactly to their maximum hit points by a Medical Pack, they may make and additional standard action on their next turn.

3.4.9 Power Armour

You have developed, through magic or technology, a particularly advanced suit of armour. Choose one suit of armour you possess. This is your modified Power Armour, and the abilities of this track only work while you are wearing that armour. If you want to change which suit of armour the Power Armour track is keyed to, you may do so between [Scenes]. (Perhaps you spend the intervening time building it in a cave, with a box of scraps.)

1st Circle – Combat ExoskeletonEX: This suit is capable of generating a hermetically sealed environment to protect you from exposure to hard vacuum, radiation, airborne diseases, chemical weapons, aquatic environments, and the like. You gain [Immunity] to Suffocation and Hard vacuum. At will, as an immediate action you may enable this ability and become dependent on the suit’s life support system or disable this ability. This life support system is capable of functioning until the end of the [Quest]. While this effect is active, you do not have to eat or drink anything. The suit also gains an environmental control system which continually protects you from extreme temperatures as per the endure elements spell.

While you are wearing this suit you may increase your item bonus to AC by 1 point and when you reach your 3rd circle in Power armour also increase your deflection bonus to AC by 1 point. You also gain one of the following benefits, you can switch benefits between [Scenes].

  • Assault Carapace: You gain an item bonus to your maximum HP equal to twice your level
  • Technician Gear: You gain a +2 item bonus to two skills of your choice
  • Hazard Gear: You gain a +1 item bonus to all saves

2nd Circle – Integrated Targeting SystemEX: You gain [Ghostwise sight] out to [Close] range and [Darkvision]. In addition, choose one of the following weapon modules to add to your suit. The Arc Blade and Pulse Rifle modules provide a +1 item bonus to attack rolls when you reach your 3rd circle in Power Armour, +2 at 5th circle and +3 at 7th circle. You may only possess one weapon module from each circle of this track that grants one.

  • Arc Blade: An Arc Blade is a melee weapon with [Reach] and three other properties of your choice other than [Barbed], [Quick draw] or [Hold-out]. When you reach your 5th circle in Power Armour, the first time you hit with an attack with your Arc Blade each [Round], you inflict [Battered] on the target for one [Round].
  • Pulse Rifle: A Pulse Rifle is a ranged weapon with [Distant 2], [Traumatizing] and one other weapon property of your choice. Attacks with the Pulse Rifle ignore all [Damage reduction] and [Resistance] on the first hit each [Round]. When you reach your 5th circle in Power Armour, it ignores [Damage reduction] and [Resistance] for the first two hits instead.

3rd Circle – Modular Offensive ArrayEX: Your suit now possesses two weapon modules. Choose one of the following weapon modules to add to your suit. In addition, you may now swap out weapon modules between [Scenes]. You may only possess one weapon module from each circle of this track that grants one.

  • Flamethrower: As a move action once per [Round] you may create a 10 ft wide line out to [Close] range which deals energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to 1d4 per level to all creatures in the area, and they start [Burning]. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) halves damage and negates the [Burning].
  • Focusing Prism: As a move action, once per [Round], you can channel magical energy through a special crystal lens. Any spell or spell-like-ability you use is treated as if your character level were 2 levels higher when calculating all level-dependent effects, and has its range extended by one category. These benefits last for one [Round].

4th Circle – Mobility EnhancerEX: Choose one of the modifications below to add to your armour. You may change the modification between [Scenes]. When you reach your 6th circle in Power Armour, instead gain two of these modifications.

  • Jetpack: You gain the Fly movement mode
  • All-Terrain Armour: You gain the Burrow and Swim movement modes
  • Personal Teleport: You may [Warp] up to your speed as a move action

5th Circle – Shield EmitterEX: The protective field generated by the suit can fulfil one of two functions, which you may switch between as a swift action. Switching between effects ends any ongoing effects granted by this circle.

  • Defensive Matrix: You gain a 20% [Miss chance] and [Immunity] to [Prone], [Blown Away] and [Checked]
  • Distortion Field: You are [Invisible]

6th Circle – Hazardous Environment ModuleEX: Medical systems grant you [Fast healing] equal to your level. Also, you gain a third weapon module. Choose one of the following weapon modules to add to your suit. You may swap out choices between [Scenes].

  • Tesla Coil: As a standard action, you may fire a bolt of energy out to [Close] range which deals energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to 1d6 times your level, and inflicts [Dazed] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates Dazed. This requires a successful ranged attack roll and provokes an attack of opportunity. If this hits, you may make a second attack against another creature within 30 ft of the first target which you have line of sight and line of effect to. This attack deals the same damage, but does not inflict [Dazed].
  • Missile Battery: As a move action, once per [Round], you can release a swarm of missiles that explode in four 5 ft. radius bursts within [Long] range and deal 1d6 damage per 2 levels you possess to any affected creature. A creature a creature hit by two bursts instead takes 1d4 damage per level; three bursts deal 1d6 damage per level, and all four together deal 1d6 damage per level + your Key Offensive Modifier. Any affected creature must make a Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ character level + KOM) for half damage. Creatures who fail the Reflex save become [Checked] in your direction for one [Round].

7th Circle – Reactor Core OverloadEX: Once per [Encounter], as a swift action, you may overload your suit’s systems. At the end of your turn you deal damage equal to 5 times your level to all creatures in [Melee] range and all damaged creatures are [Blown Away] and [Stunned] for one [Round]. A successful Reflex save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) halves the damage and negates the [Stunned] condition.

3.4.10 Rokushiki

1st Circle – Shigan, Kami-eEX: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Finger Pistol: As a swift action which provokes an attack of opportunity you may make a single melee attack against an adjacent creature.
  • Paper Body: Whenever an attack misses you or you make a saving throw, you gain +1 to AC and saves until the start of your next turn.

2nd Circle – Rankyaku, TekkaiEXYou gain the following two abilities:

  • Tempest Kick: You may make melee attacks out to [Medium] range, but all attacks at range in the same attack action must be against the same target.
  • Iron Body: When you use Defensive Fighting, you gain [Damage reduction] equal to your KDM.

3rd Circle – Soru, GeppoEX: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Shave: As an immediate action, move up to your speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.
  • Moonwalk: You gain the Fly movement mode, do not provoke attacks of opportunity for gaining or losing the [Flying] condition, but lose the [Flying] condition at the end of any turn where you do not move.

4th Circle – Master of the Six PowersEX: You gain a +2 bonus to saving throws. Choose one of the following abilities:

  • Oren: When you make an attack with Finger Pistol, for every 5 points your attack roll beats the target’s AC by, you hit with an additional melee attack.
  • Bushin: At the start of your turn, gain a +10 bonus to speed and +1 bonus to attack rolls for every 2 points of increase to AC and saves you had from Paper Body until the start of that turn.
  • Hakurai: The first melee attack you make every [Round] can be made as a [Volley] in a wedge out to your [Close] range. If you do this, subsequent Tempest Kick attacks in this [Round] must be made against a creature that was targeted by that [Volley].
  • Utsugi Go: As a standard and a move action, you may start Defensive Fighting and gain an additional [Damage reduction] equal to twice your KDM, and for the next [Round] your [Damage reduction] also applies to energy damage. Creatures which miss you with an attack or have the damage they do with an attack reduced to 0 take physical damage equal to your [Damage reduction].
  • Kokoken: When you use Shave, you may make an immediate melee attack against a creature you end the movement adjacent to.
  • Kamisori: When you move using your move action, make an attack roll. You deal damage to every creature which is in or adjacent to any space you moved through whose AC is less than the result of your attack roll equal to four times your KOM divided by the number of creatures that were damaged by this ability.

5th Circle – Cipher PolEX: Choose two of the abilities you did not choose at 4th circle and gain them. You gain a +15 bonus to movement speed, +5 bonus to Melee range, +15 bonus to [Close] range, +50 bonus to [Medium] range and a +2 bonus to attack rolls.

6th Circle – RokuoganEX: As a standard action, make a single melee attack against an adjacent creature. On a hit, this deals bonus damage equal to six times your KOM to the target and all opponents within 60 ft of the target. Then, roll a d6. You can use this ability again after a number of [Rounds] have passed equal to the result of that roll.

7th Circle – SWORDEX: You gain the three remaining abilities you did not choose at 4th circle. You gain a further +25 bonus to movement speed, +10 bonus to Melee range, +20 bonus to [Close] range, +65 bonus to [Medium] range and a +3 bonus to attack rolls.

3.4.11 Seeker

1st Circle – Hallowed BladeEX: When you are the target of a spell or spell-like ability or dispel an effect created by a spell or spell-like ability, you gain a +1 bonus to your attack and damage rolls which lasts until the end of the [Encounter], this stacks a number of times equal to 1 + the amount of circles you possess in this track.

2nd Circle – Arcane Aggressor: You gain access to the following abilities:

  • Radiant WardEX: A number of times per [Encounter] equal to the number of circles you have in this track, as a free action, you gain [Resistance] to energy and magic damage for 1 [Round]. At 4th Circle this becomes [Greater Resistance].
  • Arcane AscertainEX: Once per [Round] per circle you have in this track, as a free action, which you can take outside of your turn, you can attempt to identify a single spell or spell-like ability cast within [Medium] range this [Round]. (This is in addition to the normal attempts to identify magic)

3rd Circle – Righteous ProtectorEX: As a standard action, create a spread centred on you with a radius of your [Close] range which lasts for one [Round]. Within this area, any damage or healing caused by spells or spell-like abilities cast by opponents is reduced by an amount equal to your level.

As an immediate action, if you have successfully identified a spell or spell-like ability cast within this spread, you may attempt to disrupt the spell while it is being cast. Make an attack of opportunity on the caster; if the attack is successful, the effects of the spell or spell-like ability are negated. Disrupting this spell counts as dispelling a spell or spell-like ability.

4th Circle – Spell PurgeEX: Once per [Round], on a successful attack roll you may force the target to make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your TAM). If it fails, you may choose up to three spells, spell-like or supernatural abilities that creature has that you have identified. They may not use or benefit from those abilities for two [Rounds]. Once per [Encounter], you can extend this duration to until the end of the [Scene], and once per [Scene], until the end of the [Quest].

5th Circle – FortressEX: You attempt to temporarily block offensive magics against yourself, or an ally. Twice per [Encounter], as an immediate action, create a 50 ft long, 5 ft wide line in your [Medium] range. Spells and spell-like abilities cannot establish line of effect through this line, and any creature using a spell or spell-like ability on the line takes damage equal to twice your level. The line lasts for one [Round]

6th Circle – Holy SilenceEX: Each time you are targeted by a spell or spell-like ability or dispel a spell or spell-like ability, you store the energy and gain a charge (these last until the end of the [Encounter]). Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may release any number of these charges, dealing 2d6 per charge to all opponents in [Close] range. You may attempt stun a number of opponents equal to the amount of charges that you have used, those targets are [Stunned] for one [Round] unless they make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your TAM).

7th Circle – Eternal SacrificeEX: If you die, you may choose to heal all allies within [Medium] range of you to their maximum HP. However, your body, and all worldly possessions currently on your person all ascend to the Maker’s Side, and disappear from the plane you died in.

3.4.12 Seidrmander

The Archduchy of Roun has recently developed a secret weapon to use against the prehistoric monsters at their southern border. In addition to the magic of its Diabolic cultists, they have developed a form of runic magic which can be easily taught to non-magically talented soldiers. These Seidr runes come in three colours - blue for shock troops, red for frontline infantry, and green for wardens on the shield wall, and take the form of animal-shaped magical constructs which leap from the user’s spellbook and attack the enemy. The three colours can also be mixed by adept users.

All Seidrmander spell-like abilities provoke attacks of opportunity as normal (if they use a standard action they provoke, if an immediate action they do not provoke), and you generally pick one of three to learn at each circle. They differ from most spell-like abilities in that they have you make a ranged attack action, with range equal to your [Melee] range plus 10 ft. As with all attack actions, you may make iterative attacks with Seidrmander abilities.

When you make an attack with a Seidrmander ability, the spell is treated as your weapon. You gain a +1 to attack rolls with these spells at 1st circle, +2 at 3rd circle, +3 at 4th circle, and +4 at 6th circle. The damage done on a hit is 1d6 + your highest mental ability modifier + twice the number of circles you have in Seidrmander, all of which is magical damage. Critical hits do bonus damage as normal.

1st Circle – Triangle AdeptSLA: Choose one of the following:

  • Blárblade: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. Any attacks that hit deal bonus fury damage equal to the total number of circles of spells active on you and abilities with a duration that other allies have used which targeted you and are currently affecting you.
  • Raudrblooms: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. You gain a +2 bonus to these attacks for each ally you have in [Melee] range, up to a maximum bonus of twice the number of circles you have in Seidrmander.
  • Gronnraven: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. You gain a +3 [Precision] bonus to attack and damage rolls for these attacks against creatures which are currently wielding a ranged weapon.

2nd Circle – Taking SeidsSLA: Choose one of the following:

  • Blárvulture: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. You gain a fury bonus to damage rolls on these attacks equal to four times the number of circles you have in Seidrmander if you have no ally within range of the attack.
  • Raudrowl: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. Until the start of your next turn (including against any attacks of opportunity made against you when you use Raudrowl), you gain a +3 bonus to AC if you have an ally in [Melee] range.
  • Gronnserpent: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a +3 bonus to AC against ranged attacks and +3 to saving throws against any magical effect.

3rd Circle – Path of RadianceSLA: Choose one of the following:

  • Blártiger: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. You may make a [Bonus attack] during this attack action.
  • Raudrlion: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. For each attack which hits, allies who are not you within your [Melee] range deal +2d6 bonus magical damage on their attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
  • Gronnrabbit: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. For each attack which hits, you heal an amount of hit points equal to your level.

4th Circle – Practical CountermagicEX: Once per [Round], as an immediate action which also uses an attack of opportunity use, when you are hit with an attack roll by a creature within your [Melee] range plus 10 ft, you may immediately cast one of your spell-like abilities from Seidrmander at that creature.

5th Circle – Radiant DawnSLA: Choose one of the following:

  • Blárrat: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. Any critical hits in this attack action have an additional fury bonus to damage equal to twice your level, and you gain [Immunity] to critical hits until the start of your next turn (including during any attacks of opportunity made against you when you use Blárrat).
  • Raudrfox: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. For each two attacks that hit, the target takes a -1 penalty to all d20 rolls and AC until the end of your next turn.
  • Gronnhorse: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. If two of these attacks hit, you gain [Lesser resistance] to damage until the start of your next turn (including against any attacks of opportunity made against you when you use Gronnhorse), if three hit you gain [Resistance], and if four hit you gain [Greater resistance].

6th Circle – GrárdragonSLA: As a standard action, make an attack action out to your melee range + 10 ft. You gain a +3 bonus to attacks made as part of this action and can make a [Bonus attack]. The damage done on a hit with these attacks is 3d8 + twice your highest mental ability modifier + three times the number of circles you have in Seidrmander. You are then [Dazed] until the end of your next turn.

7th Circle – Triangle MasteryEX: You may use all abilities that you did not choose at 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 5th circles.

3.4.13 Show Fighter

1st Circle – Armed EntertainerEX: Your combat manoeuvres, and opponents’ attempts to escape or act in a [Grappled] or [Pinned] condition you inflict, have a DC of (10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM). You also gain the following abilities:

  • A Bit of Flair: As a swift action immediately after you hit an opponent, you may cause that attack to deal additional damage equal to your level or KOM, whichever is higher.
  • Sharp Tongue: After you succeed in the combat use of an interaction skill check, you may deal damage equal to your level or KOM, whichever is lower, to the affected opponent(s). This damage ignores [Damage reduction] and [Resistance].

2nd Circle – Manoeuvre MasteryEX: The DCs for your combat manoeuvres, and opponents’ attempts to escape or act in a [Grappled] or [Pinned] condition you inflict increase by 3. Likewise, you gain a +3 bonus on saves against any combat manoeuvre.

3rd Circle – King of the HillEX: Once per [Round], when you use A Bit of Flair following a hit with a melee attack, you may either attempt the Bull Rush combat manoeuvre against the opponent you hit, or treat your attack as a hit with either the Disarm, Grapple or Trip combat manoeuvre, forcing your opponent to make a save against the effect of the chosen combat manoeuvre as normal.

4th Circle – Can’t Touch ThisEX: If your opponent fails its save against your Disarm manoeuvre, your opponent is [Checked] in the direction of your choice for one [Round] in addition to the normal effect of the Disarm manoeuvre. If your opponent fails its save against your Trip manoeuvre, your opponent is [Battered] for two [Rounds] in addition to the normal effect of the Trip manoeuvre. If your opponent fails its save against your Bull Rush, you may inflict the [Blown away] condition instead of starting or continuing the movement the manoeuvre induces. If your opponent fails its save against your Grapple, you may choose to inflict [HP reduction] equal to the damage dealt by your Grapple.

5th Circle – Bloody SpectacleEX: The damage inflicted by your A Bit of Flair and Sharp Tongue abilities is increased by half your level. Also, you may take 10 on interaction skills regardless of circumstances.

6th Circle – Trash TalkEX: Once per [Round], an opponent (or opponents) affected by one use of your A Bit of Flair or Sharp Tongue ability gains a -4 penalty to AC and a -3 penalty to saves until the end of the [Encounter].

7th Circle – Fan FavouriteEX: You gain the following abilities:

  • Fearsome Fortitude: Every time you successfully perform a Disarm, Trip, Bull Rush or Grapple, you gain 4 points of [Damage reduction] for the rest of the [Encounter]. The [Damage reduction] gained from this ability stacks, to a maximum of your character level.
  • Fatal Flourish: When you activate A Bit of Flair, you may remove all of the current [Damage reduction] gained from using the Fearsome Fortitude ability. If you do so, you deal 5 points of additional damage per point of [Damage reduction] removed in this way. If you removed at least 8 points of [Damage reduction] with this ability, you also inflict [Battered] on the affected creature for the rest of the [Encounter]. If you removed at least 16 points of [Damage reduction] with this ability, you also inflict [Stunned] for one [Round] on the affected creature. This is a [Death] effect.

3.4.14 Skiltgravr

1st Circle – RunecarverEX: You gain access to two of the Runes below of your choice. As a standard action, you may inscribe a Rune you know on a weapon, armour or shield you or an adjacent ally is wielding. Runes last indefinitely, but can be discharged as an immediate action by the wielder of the item they are on for an instant effect. A single creature can only discharge a Skiltgravr rune once per [Encounter]. You may have one Rune active on a weapon, one on an armour and one on a shield at any given time.

  • Haug: Grants a +4 bonus to Fortitude saves. When discharged, the wielder gains [Lesser resistance] to physical damage until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Ild: Grants a +2 bonus to skill checks. When discharged, chains of fire sprout from the ground around a creature in [Close] range of the wielder. These cause the target to be [Entangled] and take 2d6 energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor at the start of each of their turns. A Reflex save (DC = 10 + ½ the wielder’s level + the wielder’s KDM) negates the effect, and the creature affected can make one as part of a move or as a swift action during each of its turns to end the effect.
  • Ise: Grants a +3 bonus to Awareness and [Immunity] to [Fear] effects. When discharged, the wielder’s strength increases by +2, or up to 22, whichever is higher, until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Skye: The wielder does not take a penalty to Stealth checks from moving their full speed. When discharged, a creature targeting you with an attack cannot target you during the attack action unless they have no other opponent in range.
  • Stein: Grants Darkvision and [Ghostwise sight] out to 45 ft. When discharged, target creature in the wielder’s [Close] range takes a -3 penalty to saves and social defences against the wielder until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Uvar: While active, the wielder can always act in a Surprise Round and can make Knowledge checks without using an action, and get the answer to one additional question for each creature. When discharged, grants one reroll which the wielder can spend as an immediate action to reroll any d20 roll by a creature in [Medium] range.

Whenever you gain a new circle in Skiltgravr, you gain access to another Rune you do not already have access to.

2nd Circle – Giant ExpectationsSU: As a free action, you may become [Large], if you are not already. When you do this, your weapon attacks deal an additional 1d6 damage. This effect lasts until you end it as a free action.

3rd Circle – Runic DefenceSU: As an immediate action, summon defensive runes around an ally in [Close] range for one [Round]. These grant a Deflection bonus to AC equal to the number of circles you have in Skiltgravr, and reduce damage from all attacks by your KDM.

4th Circle – Greater RunecarverEX: The effects of your Runes upgrade as follows:

  • Haug: Fortitude save bonus increases to +6. [Lesser resistance] increases to [Resistance].
  • Ild: Skill bonus increases to +3. The chains deal 5d6 damage, and prevent movement by the [Entangled] creature.
  • Ise: Awareness bonus increases to +5. Strength bonus increases to +4 or up to 26.
  • Skye: The wielder does not take a penalty to Stealth checks from attacking. When discharged, as well as becoming untargetable, you may cause a single attack that targeted you to target another creature of your choice within range.
  • Stein: Grants Tremorsense out to 40 ft. When discharged, may Charm the target. The creature cannot use an offensive action against the wielder or an ally, after the first [Round] of being charmed, when it would use an offensive action, it must make a Will save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + the wielder’s KDM), this does not take the -3 penalty from the Rune. A successful Will allows it to use that offensive action as normal and renders the creature no longer charmed; a failed save means it cannot use an offensive action against the wielder or their allies for one [Round]. The creature remains charmed until the wielder or an ally use an offensive action against it.
  • Uvar: The wielder gains a +3 bonus to AC. When discharged, grants an additional reroll.

5th Circle – Blessing of the AllfatherSU: Your bonus damage from 2nd circle increases to 3d6. When you use that ability, you may also have any number of allies within your [Close] range benefit from it.

6th Circle – Voice of the OrdningSU: As a standard action, choose a creature within 60 ft. It becomes [Oathsworn] to you. While the creature is [Oathsworn], if it would take an offensive action that targets you, that action is not taken. A successful Will save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your KDM) allows the creature to take the action; an unsuccessful Will save renders the creature no longer [Oathsworn].

7th Circle – Master of the RunesEX: The effects of your Runes upgrade as follows:

  • Haug: Fortitude save bonus increases to +12, [Resistance] increases to [Greater resistance].
  • Ild: Skill bonus increases to +5. The chains damage increases to 10d6, and inflict [Paralyzed] (except the creature can take an action to remove the effect as before).
  • Ise: Grants [Immunity] to [Mind-affecting] effects. Strength bonus increases to +6 or up to 30.
  • Skye: The wielder does not take penalties to Stealth for any offensive action or spell, and can use Stealth as an immediate action. When discharged, can change the target of any ability, not just an attack, to another creature in range.
  • Stein: Grants Tremorsense and [Ghostwise sight] out to 300 ft. When discharged, instead of Charming may put the target to Sleep, rendering them [Helpless] until they are targeted for an offensive action. They may make a Will save at the end of each of their turns to end the effect.
  • Uvar: AC bonus increases to +5 and grants a +5 bonus to Reflex saves. When discharged, grants four rerolls.

3.4.15 White Raven

1st Circle – Leading the ChargeEX: Whenever you or an ally within [Medium] range make an attack with the Charge manoeuvre, it deals bonus damage equal to your level. On the first [Round] of combat, this bonus is increased by your level again. When using the Charge manoeuvre, you do not take the -2 penalty to AC.

2nd Circle – Warleader’s StrikeEX: As a standard action, make a single melee attack against an opponent in your [Melee] range. If it hits, choose one:

  • Any allies in their own [Melee] range of that target may make an immediate single melee attack against that opponent.
  • All allies gain +3 to melee attack rolls against that opponent until the start of your next turn

When you gain your 4th circle in White Raven, once per [Round], you may replace one attack in an attack action with this ability. A creature can only be affected by abilities which give them an immediate attack such as this, A Stitch in Time and For the Horde! once per [Round].

3rd Circle – Douse the FlamesEX: Once per [Round], if you hit an opponent with an attack, you may cause that opponent to be unable to make attacks of opportunity for one [Round]. This does not require an action. You may activate this ability an additional time per [Round] for every circle of White Raven you possess above 3rd.

4th Circle – Order from ChaosEX: As a standard action, you shout orders which allow all allies in [Close] range to immediately move up to their speed in any direction. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

5th Circle – White Raven TacticsEX: Twice per [Encounter] as an immediate action you may give orders to one ally who is not you in your [Close] range. Move that ally’s place in the initiative order to straight after yours.

6th Circle – War Master’s ChargeEX: Twice per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may use the Charge combat manoeuvre. The attack made using the manoeuvre deals additional damage equal to four times your level (which stacks with your bonus from Leading the Charge), and counts as a Warleader’s Strike attack.

7th Circle – Lion’s RoarEX: Once per [Encounter] when an opponent within [Medium] range dies, as an immediate action, you may unleash a mighty battle cry. This creates a spread with radius out to your [Medium] range. Any allies in the spread gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls, saving throws and skill checks and a +6 to damage rolls until the end of the [Encounter] and may immediately remove one of the following conditions from themselves: [Battered], [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Confused], [Cowering], [Dazed], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Entangled], [Exhausted ], [Fatigued], [Frightened ], [Nauseated ], [Panicked ], [Paralyzed], [Petrified], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Stunned].

3.5 Mage

Table 3.5: Mage Class
HP 8
Skills 6 or 8
BAB Poor or Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Any mental ability
KDM Any mental ability

Special: You may choose to have either good BAB and 6 skills or bad BAB and 8 skills. Your KOM and KDM can be any of Int, Wis and Cha, but they cannot both be the same.

Mages are the magic users beyond Tacticians, Sages, Shamans, Warlocks and Geomancers. Unlike these other classes of wizard, Mages are in more specialized schools of magic, and instead complement that one school with other general magic abilities. Due to their diversity, Mages are even more likely to multiclass than most, switching out one or two of their sets of supplementary abilities for a different ability set which better fits them.

The Mage’s Tracks are:

  • Medium: Spellcraft: You gain a set of basic magical techniques to enhance your spellcasting
  • Fast: Magical School: The Mage’s specialized school of magic, a choice from many different magical tracks.
  • Slow: Source of Power: Choose between Arcane Force and Practitioner:
    • Arcane Force: Your magic and even some of your physical abilities are enhanced by your arcane power.
    • Practitioner: You use magical tricks to cover your weaknesses and disrupt your attackers.
    • Timestream: Use pre-rolled dice to overwrite your rolls, but take lasting damage if you don’t use them.

3.5.1 Spellcraft

Your TAM for this track is your highest mental ability modifier.

1st Circle – I Wanna Cast Magic Missile!SLA: When you gain this circle, and at every other circle of Spellcraft, select one spell of that circle from any spell list. You may cast that spell as a spell-like ability using the same action(s) as the spell three times per [Scene]. Your SAM for these spells is your TAM for this track.

In addition, you may cast magic missile as a spell-like ability at will as a standard action.

2nd Circle – My Magic Will Tear You ApartSU: Choose one track you possess. Calculate all level-dependent variables, such as range, damage, and DCs for spell, spell-like or supernatural abilities you possess in that track as if you were two levels higher.

3rd Circle – Trace, OnSLA: As a standard action, you may prepare a Counterspell. Prepared Counterspells are stored until the end of the [Encounter]. As an immediate action, when an opponent in [Close] range uses a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability, you may expend a Counterspell to counter that ability, causing it to have no effect and expending the action used and any spell slots, points or per [Encounter] or [Scene] uses that were spent to use it. A successful Will save of DC 10 + ½ your level + your TAM means that the slot, use or points used to use the ability are not expended, but the ability is still negated and the action used.

4th Circle – A Wizard is Never LateSU: You gain [Fast healing] equal to your level on any turn where you use a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability.

5th Circle – I Solemnly Swear That I Am Up to No Good: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Magical ReservesSU: Choose one track you possess, you gain an additional use per [Encounter] of every spell-like or supernatural ability you have with limited uses per [Encounter] from that track, or an additional spell slot of each circle if it is a Spellcasting track.
  • Enhanced MagicSLA: Choose one track you possess. Calculate all level-dependent variables, such as range, damage, and DCs for spell, spell-like or supernatural abilities you possess in that track as if you were two levels higher. This stacks with My Magic Will Tear You Apart.

6th Circle – The Night is Dark and Full of TerrorsSU: Once per [Encounter], when you use a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability you may simultaneously use another ability of the same type that requires the same action as part of the action used to use the first ability. One ability must be at least 3 circles lower than the other. This is a [Surge] effect.

7th Circle – I’m the Frigging Archmage of the Entire Universe!SU: Choose one track you possess, you gain an additional use per [Scene] of every spell-like or supernatural ability you have with limited uses per [Scene] from that track, or an additional two spell slots of each circle if it is a Spellcasting track.

3.5.2 Magical School

Pick a track from the following: Abjuration, Archaeomancy, Arithmancy, Binder, Biomancy, Cerebromancy, Chaos Mage, Chirurgeon, Chirurgic Poet, Chronomancy, Cyberspace Mastermind, Divination, Elementalist, Ghoulcaller, Illusion, Lawmage, Macroevocation, Meteomancy, Mystic, Necromancer, Pictomancy, Runesong Scholar, Sanguimancy, Sorcerer Spellcasting, Siege Mage, Spatiomancy, Summoning, True Mage, Witch. This track replaces Magical School for you.

3.5.3 Arcane Force

1st Circle – Call of the WildEX: You add your KOM to all damage rolls for, and damage done by your spells, spell-like and supernatural abilities.

2nd Circle – In the BloodEX: Choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Shield of Force: You gain an item bonus to AC equal to the number of circles you possess in this track, and a +3 item bonus to a save of your choice.
  • Wild Resilience: You gain a +3 item bonus to two saves of your choice.

3rd Circle – WildfireEX: Choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Primal Force: You gain a bonus equal to 5 ft per circle you possess from this track to the lengths of wedges and lines you create and to the radii of spreads you create.
  • Primal Power: You gain a +2 bonus to the DC of all spell, spell-like, and supernatural abilities you activate.
  • Primal Dodge: Casting spells and activating spell-like abilities no longer provoke attacks of opportunity.

4th Circle – (Un)natural SelectionEX: Choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Breakthrough: Your spells, spell-like, and supernatural abilities ignore up to half your level in [Resistance].
  • Slip Through: You gain a +15 ft bonus to your movement speed and your movement no longer provokes attacks of opportunity.

5th Circle – InsidiousEX: Choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Sticky Spells: Each [Encounter], the first [Dispelling] effect made against a spell you cast or a spell-like ability you activate fails. At 7th circle, the second [Dispelling] effect made against a spell you cast or a spell-like ability you activate fails.
  • Spell Shielding: You gain [Lesser resistance] against all damage.

6th Circle – Surge-ant PepperEX: Once per [Encounter], as a swift action, you can activate a spell, spell-like, or supernatural ability of no higher than 5th circle that would normally be activated as a standard action. At 7th circle, you can activate an ability of no higher than 6th circle in this way. This ability is a [Surge] effect and counts both as a use of this ability and as a use of the ability you activate.

7th Circle – Where the Wild Things AreEX: Once per [Scene], if your hit point total would be reduced to 0 or below, your hit points are instead reset to half your normal maximum and you can immediately activate any spell or spell-like ability of 6th circle or lower that is an offensive action. This activation requires no action expenditure and does not count against limits on activating that ability.

3.5.4 Practitioner

1st Circle – Boffo’s VisageEX: Each time an opponent misses you with an attack, or fails a save against one of your abilities, they take a -1 penalty to attack rolls against you for the [Encounter]. This stacks up to a maximum penalty of 2 + the number of circles you have in Practitioner.

2nd Circle – Second ThoughtsEX: Once per [Encounter], when an attack roll you make misses, or a creature succeeds on a saving throw against a spell or spell-like ability you have used which has a single target (or only affected a single creature), you may immediately reroll that attack or re-cast that spell against a different target. After you use this ability, note every time you succeed on a saving throw. After three successes, you may use this ability again.

3rd Circle – BorrowingSU: As a move action (where part of the move action can be to use a skill), you may take [HP reduction] and choose an ally in [Medium] range. You can then choose one of that ally’s skill modifiers and take 4 [HP reduction] per circle you have in Practitioner to use that modifier instead of your own for that skill this [Round]. Or you may choose that ally’s attack modifier and take 7 [HP reduction] for circle you have in Practitioner to use that modifier instead of your own for attack rolls this [Round].

4th Circle – Carry ConfidenceEX: If you have to make a saving throw against the ability of a creature whose penalty to attack rolls against you from Boffo’s Visage is -4 or more, you may reduce that penalty to 0 to treat yourself as having succeeded on the save without rolling.

5th Circle – I Aten’t DeadSU: If you are reduced to below 0 hit points but are still alive, you may become [Ethereal] until the end of the [Encounter].

6th Circle – Bones of ChalkSU: At the start of the [Encounter] create an Origin spread centered on yourself with a radius equal to your [Close] range, which does not move. For each [Round] after the first where you start your turn inside the Origin spread, your level is treated as 1 higher for all level-dependent variables (including attack bonus and AC) until the end of the [Encounter].

7th Circle – Dance of the Sun and MoonSU: When an opponent rolls a natural 1 on a saving throw against one of your abilities, or when a creature hits a penalty of -9 to attack rolls against you from Boffo’s Visage, you may regain one spell slot of each circle and one use each of each ability you have with limited uses per [Scene].

3.5.5 Timestream

Either through inherited Chronomancy, some sort of horrific dimensional accident, or a wondrous piece of artifice, you have the limited ability to jump around your own current of the timestream. This means you can choose when to use attacks you know you are going to, or try to throw future wasted efforts into sudden bursts of temporal shenanigans.

1st Circle – Ride the WavesSLA: At the start of each [Encounter] roll 4 d20s, plus an additional one for each circle you have in Timestream. These become your Stream Dice. If you have any Stream Dice remaining at the end of an [Encounter], this causes a paradox and you take [HP reduction] equal to thrice the number of circles you have in Timestream for each remaining die. This [HP reduction] lasts until the end of the [Scene].

When you finish moving with a move or standard (Run) action, for every 20 ft of movement you didn’t use, you may reroll one of your Stream Dice; or for every 35 ft of movement you didn’t use you may roll a d20 and add it to your Stream Dice.

When you are reduced to -5 hit points or lower, you lose all your Stream Dice and gain hit points equal to half the total results of your remaining Stream Dice. This happens before you die or fall [Unconscious].

As a swift action, roll a d4. This turn, you must replace any d20s that you roll with one of your Stream Dice results (spending the die in the process), until you have replaced a number of rolls equal to your d4 result. If you do not replace enough rolls, you take paradox damage as if you had a number of dice remaining at the end of an [Encounter] equal to the unused replacements you had.

2nd Circle – Timejump DodgeSLA: As an immediate action, spend one of your Stream Dice to gain [Miss chance] for the duration of an attack action or other offensive standard action equal to five times the result of the die.

3rd Circle – Borrowed TimeSLA: As a move action, grant an ally up to four of your Stream Dice. They gain a bonus to speed equal to 10 ft per Dice you grant them, and on their turn must replace their d20 rolls as if they were you and used the 1st circle ability of this track. Any unused dice deal paradox [HP reduction] to you, though, instead of the ally.

4th Circle – UnfoldSLA: As a free action spend two Stream Dice. If the lowest of the two had a result from 1 to 8, then you gain an additional swift or immediate action this turn. If 9 to 16, you gain an additional move action. If 17 to 20, you gain an additional standard action.

5th Circle – Leap Through Four DimensionsSLA: At the end of your turn, if you haven’t used this ability on your last turn, you may spend three Stream Dice to disappear into the timestream, causing all creatures to lose line of sight and effect to you, and pausing the duration of all conditions affecting you, for one [Round]. At the start of your next turn, you reappear and may move through space as a [Warp] out to a maximum distance equal to the total of the Stream Dice spent (rounded down to the next multiple of 5).

6th Circle – Paradoxical PairingSLA: When you [Warp] using the 5th circle ability, you may create a copy of yourself in the space you started in. This copy acts in the [Round] at the same time as you, but when it makes any d20 rolls it must use results of your Stream Dice instead of rolling, and it disappears if you run out of Stream Dice. It is otherwise identical to you. Any damage it takes its also dealt to you, and any conditions it is inflicted with are also inflicted on you. It disappears at the start of your next turn, dealing 30 points of [HP reduction] as the paradox resolves (like other paradox damage, this expires at the end of the [Scene]).

7th Circle – Complex Future TimeSLA: When you use the 3rd circle ability to grant an ally your Stream Dice, they also gain the ability to use them to return from death that you gained at 1st circle. Each ally can only gain hit points this way once per [Scene].

3.6 Psion

Table 3.6: Psion Class
HP 10
Skills 7
BAB Poor
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Int
KDM Con

Psions are the rare users of Psionics. Instead of casting spells, Psions use the innate powers of their mind to affect the world around them. As well as their pool of power points and general Powers, Psions can draw from a wide range of specialisms. Some choose to hone their own minds and increase their focus so they can improve their Powers. Some instead choose to embrace the inherent chaos of their powers and become Wilders, instead using sudden surges of mental energy in battle. Other eschew these in favour of, or combine them with, specialised training in one of the five schools of Psionic powers, giving them more instinctual Psi-Like Abilities to complement their Powers.

The Psion always has Psion Powers as their Fast track. For their other two tracks they can choose any two of:

  • Psionic Focus: A track which focuses on becoming [Focused] with a move or partial move action to gain small bonuses, and then expending [Focused] for sudden benefits.
  • Wilder: A track which uses a swift action to enter a Rage-like state of increased Psionic power, and changes your KOM and MAM to Cha.
  • Kineticist: An offensive track based on creating and firing Bolts of energy with multiple swift or move actions, * with some defensive bonuses
  • Nomad: A swift and standard action-based track focused on manipulating character movement and action economy
  • Shaper: A swift and standard action-based track focused on the use of a Psionic blade which can channel powers and some additional utility abilities
  • Telepath: A move action based support track which can do a variety of unique tricks
  • Psychic Warrior: A largely passive track which augments your combat with Psionics, with a few move action tricks

3.6.1 Psion Powers

You manifest powers drawn from the power list, detailed in the Psionics section. Your Intelligence modifier is your Manifesting Ability Modifier (MAM) for this track. The DC for your powers is equal to 10 + ½ your character level + your MAM. You can only manifest a certain number of Powers in a [Scene]. That number is noted on the “Power Points by [Scene] by level” section of the table below. You also receive bonus power points per [Scene] for having a high MAM.

You can only manifest powers that you know. You gain an additional three powers known every time you gain a circle in this track. Any time that you level up, you can unlearn a single power and learn a new power of the same level. You cannot learn powers of a level you cannot cast. To manifest a power, spend a number of power points equal to its circle, plus any additional spent to augment it.

Table 3.7: Psion Power
Level PP
1 2
2 4
3 7
4 10
5 14
6 18
7 23
8 28
9 34
10 40
11 47
12 54
13 62
14 70
15 79
16 88
17 98
18 108
19 119
20 130

3.6.2 Psionic Focus

One aspect of Psionic power even those otherwise ungifted in manifestation of psychic might can use is the ability to meditate and focus. This track depends on gaining the [Focused] condition, which has effects defined by your circles in the track, and expending it to gain sudden bonuses.

1st Circle – Psionic FocusEX: As a move action, you can become [Focused] until either the end of the [Scene] or until you end the condition with another ability.

While [Focused], you gain a +2 bonus to Awareness, Perception and Vigour checks and to the DC of saves against your Powers and Psi-Like Abilities.

2nd Circle – Sharpen the MindEX: While making a trained skill check, you may end your [Focused] condition to Take 10 on the check regardless of circumstances. You also gain one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • While [Focused], you gain a [Precision] bonus to damage on all powers, psi-like abilities, spells and spell-like abilities which deal damage equal to your KOM.
  • While [Focused], you gain a bonus to your move speed equal to 5 ft per circle you possess in this track.

3rd Circle – Situation Under ControlEX: As an immediate action, you may end your [Focused] condition to gain a +2 bonus to AC and all saves for one [Round].

4th Circle – Third EyeEX: While you are [Focused], when you are rolling to overcome [Concealment], [Total Concealment], or [Miss chance], you reduce your miss chance by 20% to a minimum of 0%. You may end your [Focused] condition during the attack to instead reduce miss chance on a single attack by 50%.

5th Circle – Psychic MeditationEX: You can now become [Focused] as part of a move action, or as a swift action.

6th Circle – Ignore All DistractionsEX: While [Focused] you gain [Immunity] to [Mind-Affecting] and [Fear] effects, as well as the in-combat use of the Intimidate skill, in addition twice per [Encounter] you may end your [Focused] condition as a free action to add +2 bonus to the DC of any ability originating from you.

7th Circle – Eidetic MemoryEX: Once per [Quest], you may end your [Focused] condition as a standard action to regain one use of every ability you have with limited uses (for example, if you have used a once per [Scene] ability, you can use it again, and you can use an ability you can use twice per [Encounter] but have used once already twice more).

3.6.3 Wilder

Some Psions choose to eschew discipline and focus, and instead channel their powers in wild surges, overpowering their enemies with pure psychic energy which also leaves themselves quickly drained.

All bonuses from this track are fury bonuses, so do not stack with other fury bonuses and negate any [Precision] bonuses you have.

Special: When you choose this track, your KOM and MAM (if you have one) become Cha.

1st Circle – Chaotic SurgeEX: As a swift action, if you are not [Energy drained] or already in a Chaotic Surge, you may enter a Chaotic Surge for a number of [Rounds] equal to 3 + your Cha modifier.

While in a Chaotic Surge you gain a bonus to attack rolls and to damage rolls with Powers, Spells, Psi-Like Abilities and Spell-Like Abilities equal to the number of circles you have in this track. You also gain a +1 bonus to Will saves and [Fast healing] 5.

Once a Chaotic Surge ends, you are [Energy drained] for a number of [Rounds] equal to the time you were in the Chaotic Surge. You may end your Surge at any time as a free action.

2nd Circle – Moving Like CrazyEX: You gain a bonus to initiative equal to 1 per 2 levels you possess.

3rd Circle – Where Am I Going With It?EX: Whenever you deal damage to an opponent while in a Chaotic Surge, they become [Dazzled] for 1 round, the duration of this condition increases by one [Round] for every time you hit the opponent again. Additionally, once per [Round], if you deal damage to a [Dazzled] opponent while in a Chaotic Surge, that opponent becomes [Confused] for one [Round] and you become its Jerk. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Confused] condition. This is a [Mind Affecting] ability.

4th Circle – Greater Chaotic SurgeEX: Your bonus to Will saves during a Chaotic Surge increases to +2, and your [Fast healing] increases to 10. You are now only [Energy drained] for one [Round] after a Chaotic Surge.

5th Circle – UnravelEX: While in a Chaotic Surge, you no longer provoke attacks of opportunity.

6th Circle – Perfect ChaosEX: Your bonus to Will saves while in a Chaotic Surge increases to +4 and your [Fast healing] increases to 20. You may now enter a Chaotic Surge as a free action.

7th Circle – Reality MaelstromEX: Once per [Scene], as an immediate action while in a Chaotic Surge, you may pull yourself one or two [Rounds] into the future. For the next one or two [Rounds], you effectively do not exist (no durations pass for you, you do not fast heal, you cannot be hit or targeted by any ability).

3.6.4 Kineticist

Kineticists are Psions who focus on the Psychokinesis discipline, practicing their powers of shaping formless matter into the air into destructive force, and preventing blows from reaching their body with full power.

1st Circle – BoltPLA: As a swift action that does not provoke an attack of opportunity, you may create a Bolt of any energy type ([Fire], [Cold], [Electricity], [Acid], [Positive] or [Negative]). This stays stored until the end of the [Encounter], floating around you as an orb of potential energy. As a move action, you may fire every Bolt you have stored at an enemy within [Medium] range. A Bolt does energy damage with its descriptor equal to your KOM.

You may spend a Power Point to augment this ability to fire the Bolts out to your [Long] range.

When you reach your third circle in this track, you instead create two Bolts with every swift action. When you reach your sixth circle, this increases to three.

2nd Circle – MissilePLA: As a standard action, you may fire each Bolt you have stored as a five ft wide line out to your [Medium] range, as long as none of the lines overlap. Each creature in the line takes energy damage with that Bolt’s descriptor equal to your KOM.

In addition, you gain the Telekinetic Adept feat.

3rd Circle – Telekinetic ManoeuvrePLA: As a standard action, you may make a ranged attack roll against an enemy in [Medium] range. If it hits, the target takes damage equal to your Intelligence score, and must make a Reflex save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or either fall [Prone] or drop their currently wielded weapon.

As a swift action, you may augment this ability by spending 2 Power Points to also cause the target to be [Battered] for one [Round], or immediately draw the dropped weapon to you (you may then choose to wield the weapon).

In addition, you gain the Telekinetic Scion feat.

4th Circle – Inertial BarrierSU: You gain [Damage reduction] equal to your level, and the Telekinetic Strength feat.

5th Circle – Become Living EnergyPLA: As a standard action once per [Encounter], you may discorporate your body into pure energy for one [Round]. Choose an energy type, whenever you are hit by a melee attack, the attacking creature takes energy damage with that descriptor equal to your KOM. You also gain a 50% [Miss Chance] against ranged attacks for that [Round].

You may augment this ability by spending 2 Power Points. If you do, when you activate the ability you also fire a bolt of energy at a creature in [Medium] range. They take energy damage with your chosen descriptor equal to 1d6 per your character level. A Reflex save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) halves this damage.

In addition, you gain the Telekinetic Master feat.

6th Circle – DiscorporateSU: Once per [Scene], when you die you may instead choose to convert your body into energy. If you do, you reassemble your body and return to life at the start of the next [Quest] at full HP.

7th Circle – Tornado BlastPLA: Twice per [Scene], as a standard action, you can create a huge burst of kinetic energy in a 40 ft radius centred within your [Medium] range. All creatures in the radius take damage equal to ten times your KOM, and you can move each to any space within the radius of your choice. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) halves the damage and prevents the movement.

You may augment this ability by spending any number of Power Points. For each one spent, make a ranged attack roll against a different enemy in the radius, if it hits they take additional damage equal to five times your KOM.

3.6.5 Nomad

Masters of the Psychoportation discipline, these Psions use their mental energy to warp space and time, enhancing the movements of their allies and impeding those of their enemies, while also causing strange effects to happen to individuals’ time perception.

1st Circle – BurstPLA: As a swift action, grant an ally in [Close] range a bonus to move speed equal to 5 ft + 5 ft more per circle you have in this track for one [Round]. As a move action, give an opponent in [Close] range a penalty to move speed equal to 5 ft + 5 ft more per circle you have in this track for one [Round]. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) reduces this penalty to 10 ft.

You can spend any number of Power Points to augment this ability, increasing the duration for one [Round] per point spent in augmentation.

2nd Circle – Spatial ExchangePLA: As a standard action, choose number of allies within [Medium] range equal to the number of circles you have in this track. [Teleport] each of those allies into the space of another ally, so each space is still occupied by one character each, and every target has moved.

You may spend 2 Power Points to augment this ability to instead use a swift action.

3rd Circle – Psionic Haste/SlowPLA: As a standard action, all allies in [Close] range gain an extra move action until the end of their next (or current) turn.

Also, as a standard action you may cause all creatures in a 30 ft radius centred within your [Close] range to be unable to use swift actions until the end of their next (or current) turn. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

4th Circle – Psionic TeleportPLA: With a standard action followed by one minute of concentration (any attack you sustain during this time forces a Will save to maintain the ability, as with an attack of opportunity while using a Power or PLA), you instantly transport yourself and one ally within [Medium] range of your choice per circle of this track you possess to a destination of your choice within 100 miles per level you possess. The destination must be a place where you have been very often and feel at home, a place you can currently see, or a place you have studied for at least one hour through other means, such as scrying.

You can augment this ability by spending any number of Power Points, for each spent you may target an opponent in [Close] range to also be affected by this power. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

5th Circle – RewindPLA: As a standard action twice per [Scene], target an opponent within [Close] range. If they fail a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM), on their next turn they must take the exact same actions they did on the last turn (though they may choose different targets and move in different directions). All rolls they make for any action they use are the same as those they made the last turn.

You may augment this ability by spending any number of Power Points, for each spent you may choose one roll made by the target, they roll it normally instead of using the last turn’s result.

6th Circle – Temporal AccelerationPLA: Once per [Encounter], as a swift action, you may take an additional turn immediately after this one ends. However, you miss your next turn, and for the remainder of the [Encounter] you are [Sickened], [Shaken] and [Fatigued].

7th Circle – RetrievePLA: As a standard action, choose up to six items equipped by target creature in [Close] range. If they fail a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM), you may cause them to unequip those items.

Also, you may now attune to or unattune to any magic item as part of a standard action (where the other part is to attune or to unattune to a magic item).

You may augment this ability by spending any number of Power Points, for each you spent you may equip up to one item unequipped by your target. Instead of equipping one item with this augmentation, you may instead immediately attune to an item you equipped with this ability.

3.6.6 Shaper

Shapers are adepts of the Metacreation discipline, enforcing their will onto the world to create matter out of nothing but thought. They can create a blade of psionic energy which they can channel other powers through, as well as a variety of other useful constructs.

1st Circle – Mind BladePLA: As a swift action, or part of another swift action, you may form a melee weapon of your choice out of pure psychic energy. This weapon has three weapon properties of your choice, and is a Lesser item of your design with enchantments as normal for a magic weapon of its type. These choices are permanent. This weapon, called your Mind Blade, does not count against your normal limit of attuned magic items. When you gain your 4th circle in Shaper, redesign this weapon as a Greater item, and when you gain your 6th circle, redesign it as a Relic. In addition, like with an [Arcane] weapon, this weapon grants its bonuses from its weapon properties to any powers or psi-like abilities you use. While wielding your Mind Blade, you count as having a Good Base Attack Bonus (equal to your level). You may only have a single Mind Blade in existence at a time, and may cause it to disappear as a free action.

2nd Circle – Minor CreationPLA: As a standard action, you may create any mundane object of Small size or smaller. In addition, twice per [Quest], you may use this ability to create any Lesser or Greater Consumable.

3rd Circle – Dancing BladePLA: When you make an attack with your Mind Blade, you gain a [Bonus attack], and can make the attack as if you were in any space in your [Close] range to determine who is in range of the attack.

In addition, once per [Round], as a swift action, if your Mind Blade is not already charged, you may choose a psi-like ability or Power that you possess. If you do so, your Mind Blade becomes charged. When you hit an opponent with an attack made using your Mind Blade, if the Mind Blade is charged, you may render it uncharged; note the result of your attack roll for that attack, and activate the chosen ability (if able, and spending any Power Points as normal) without provoking attacks of opportunity as a [Surge] effect. If the ability targets one or more creatures, you must choose that opponent as a target of the spell-like ability if able. If the ability targets one or more squares, you must choose one square that opponent occupies as a target of the ability if able. If you would make an attack roll for an attack against a creature as part of activating the ability, compare the noted result to that creature’s AC instead. If it equals or exceeds that creature’s AC, that attack hits that creature. Abilities and effects other than the ability’s effects that take place as the result of a hit or critical hit don’t activate as a result of this hit.

4th Circle – Concealing AmorphaSU: You cover yourself in a membrane of translucent and permeable liquid, which nevertheless conceals you slightly. You gain a 20% [Miss Chance].

5th Circle – Intellect FortressPLA: As a standard action, create a spread of any number of contiguous spaces you choose within your [Medium] range. All allies within the spread gain [Resistance] to all damage from sources originating outside the spread. This forcefield lasts until the end of the [Encounter].

You may augment this ability with 1 Power Point to extend the duration to [Scene]. You may also augment it with 3 Power Points to force opponents moving into the spread to make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or be unable to move into the spread for one [Round].

6th Circle – Hail of CrystalsPLA: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, make a ranged attack roll against up to four creatures within [Medium] range. Each of those creatures that are hit are struck by a generated crystal, taking physical damage equal to 1d10 per level you possess, which bypasses all [Resistance] and [Damage reduction].

You may augment this ability with any number of Power Points as a move action. For each Power Point spent, you may target an additional creature with this ability.

7th Circle – Astral ConstructPLA: As a standard action, you may create a being of pure ectoplasm in an empty space within your [Medium] range. The construct can move up to your speed at the start of each of your turns, cannot be attacked or affected by abilities, and can move through other creatures and solid obstacles as long as it ends its movement in an empty space. You may use all Powers and Psi-like Abilities as if you were in the construct’s space, and establish all senses and vision modes from the construct’s space.

3.6.7 Telepath

Many see Telepathy as the purest school of Psionics, using mental power to interact with the senses, and with thought itself. Specialised Telepaths can use this power for a variety of interesting abilities to disrupt their opponents. All abilities from this track are [Mind affecting].

1st Circle – Psionic CharmPLA: As a move action, target one opponent in your [Medium] range for each odd numbered circle of this track you possess. You gain a bonus to interaction checks against those creatures equal to 2 or the number of circles you possess in this track (whichever is higher). In addition, you never lose line of effect to those creatures with Powers and Psi-like Abilities. This effect lasts for one [Round], plus an additional one for every Power Point used to augment the ability.

2nd Circle – Read ThoughtsPLA: As a move action, you may read the surface level thoughts of a creature in [Medium] range until the end of the [Encounter]. Reading their thoughts means you can anticipate attacks, giving yourself and all allies you are in telepathic communication with a +1 bonus to AC and saves against that opponent, and reducing damage dealt by that opponent by the targeted ally’s KDM. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

You can augment this power by spending 1 Power Point to have the thought reading last until the end of the [Quest], as long as the target remains in your [Extreme] range.

Also, you may manifest the Correspond power at will without spending any Power Points.

3rd Circle – False Sensory InputPLA: As a move action, you may feed false information to a creature within [Medium] range. You may send any information you wish to their hearing or any of their vision modes, working as a Major Image spell (with save DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM), but with a +5 bonus to the believability check if you are targeting an alternative vision mode (e.g. [Ghostwise Sight] or [Tremorsense]. This false input lasts for three [Rounds].

You may augment this power by spending 2 Power Points to have it target two additional creatures.

4th Circle – Remote ViewingPLA: This ability works as the Scrying spell (with save DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM), except in addition you may move the space your ‘vision’ occupies at your move speed, up to a maximum of your [Close] range away from the target creature. If you spend 1 Power Point to augment this ability, you can instead move up to your [Medium] range away, and up to your [Long] range if you spend 3.

5th Circle – Mental ParasitePLA: Once per [Encounter], as a move action, implant a mental parasite in a creature in [Medium] range until the end of the [Encounter]. While the mental parasite is implanted, that creature gets an additional standard action at the end of its turn that you control. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

6th Circle – Crisis of LifePLA: Once per [Encounter], as a move action, you may convince a creature in [Medium] range that they are dead for one [Round], leaving them [Stunned], and then they are [Shaken] for the rest of the [Encounter]. A successful Will save (DC 10 +1/2 your level + your KOM) negates the [Stunned] and [Shaken] effects.

You may augment this ability by spending 2 Power Points to increase the [Shaken] condition to [Frightened] for one [Round], and then [Shaken] for the rest of the [Encounter].

7th Circle – Psionic DominatePLA: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, target creature within [Medium] range becomes [Bound] under your control until the end of the [Scene]. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect. The [Bound] creature cannot act normally, you may command it to use its move action as a free action, and to use its standard action as a swift action. If a creature provokes an attack of opportunity from your controlled creature, you may use an immediate action to force it to make the attack of opportunity, which uses your attack of opportunity for the [Round]. In combat, on its initiative count, the creature may make a Will save. If it succeeds, it is no longer [Bound].

3.6.8 Psychic Warrior

A final subgroup of Psions are those who choose to, instead of focusing on a specific discipline, focus on the use of every discipline for specific applications as a melee fighter.
