These psychic warriors use telepathy to ensure their attacks hit whenever they can, psychoportation to move around the battlefield, psychokinesis to protect themselves and drain power from their foes, and metacreation to empower their weapons with psychic venom.

1st Circle – PrecognitionPLA: When you take an attack action, you deal additional [Precision] damage on a hit equal to 2 times the number of circles you possess in this track. This ability does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

When you attack you can augment this power, you may spend 1 Power Point to increase the bonus damage to 3 times the number of circles you possess in this track, or spend 2 to increase it to 4 times the number of circles.

2nd Circle – RetributionPLA: When you are targeted for an attack, you may make an immediate attack of opportunity against the source of the attack. This ability does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

When you make an attack of opportunity, you may spend 2 Power Points as an immediate action to augment this power. If you do, you may make an additional two attacks of opportunity this [Round], but with this ability.

3rd Circle – Dimensional SlidePLA: As a standard action, you may [Warp] to any unoccupied space within [Medium] range.

4th Circle – TruevenomPLA: As a standard action, take an attack action. If you hit with any attack, you may extend the duration of up to two conditions the target of the hit is under by one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

You may augment this ability by spending one Power Point to make it so if the save is failed, the conditions affected cannot be removed for one [Round].

5th Circle – ReversalPLA: As a move action twice per [Encounter], deal damage equal to twice your KOM to an opponent in [Close] range and choose up to two conditions you are currently affected by. The target creature must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or you cease to be affected by each of those conditions, and the target is affected by all of them for one [Round].

You may augment this ability by spending one Power Point to increase the number of conditions targeted to three.

6th Circle – ImmovabilitySU: You gain [Damage reduction] equal to twice your highest mental ability modifier and [Immunity] to [Checked] and any effect which would cause you to move, [Teleport] or [Warp] against your will.

7th Circle – IncarnatePLA: Whenever you are affected by an ability, you may choose to have its duration increase by one [Round].

Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, choose a creature within [Close] range and up to two effects currently affecting it. You gain the benefits of those effects, and the creature must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or lose the benefits of those effects.

You may augment this ability by spending any number of Power Points, for every two you spend you may choose another effect to try to steal.

3.7 Samurai

Table 3.8: Samurai Class
HP 10
Skills 5
BAB Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Str or Dex
KDM Dex or Con

Special: KOM and KDM can’t both be Dex

The Samurai are honourable warriors wielding the weapons of their ancestors or their liege. Using a variety of weapons, the Samurai use a fluid and versatile fighting style, switching between their various armaments and changing the style of their offence from one attack to another. The only technique the Samurai specialise in is Iaido, the art of the drawn blade, where a blade is drawn and sheathed in a single lethal strike. Some Samurai have even applied the principles of the single precise strike of Iaido to other weapons, creating the catch-all quick-draw art of Iaijutsu.

The Samurai’s Tracks are:

  • Medium – Loyalty: A passive track giving the Samurai their multiple weapons and indomitable spirit.
  • Fast – Bushido: A Precision track using part of a move action to take penalties on attacks to gain additional effects, including replicating weapon properties and feats
  • Slow – IaijutSU: A Precision track giving Precision damage on the first attack each round with a given weapon

3.7.1 Loyalty

The Samurai’s powerful honour makes you resistant to various forms of attack. From your bond to your house, your ancestors, your master, or your cause, you also are gifted with or generate a growing set of powerful weapons, your Daisho.

1st Circle – BukeEX: Once per [Encounter], if you make a successful Fortitude or Will save against an effect that would normally have a lesser effect on a successful save (such as a spell with a save of “Fortitude half”), you instead ignore the effect entirely.

2nd Circle – DaishoEX: You gain two Lesser enchanted weapons of your choice which do not count against your normal limit of attuned magic items.

3rd Circle – GiriEX: You gain [Immunity] to [Fear] effects and the in-combat use of the Intimidate skill and [Damage reduction] equal to your Strength modifier.

4th Circle – ShotoEX: You may either redesign one of your Daisho weapons as a Greater weapon and gain a Lesser enchanted weapon of your choice which does not count against your limit of attuned magic items, or gain a Greater enchanted weapon of your choice that does not count against your limit of attuned magic items.

5th Circle – DaitoEX: You may either redesign one of your Daisho weapons as a Relic weapon and gain a Lesser enchanted weapon of your choice which does not count against your limit of attuned magic items, or gain a Relic enchanted weapon of your choice that does not count against your limit of attuned magic items. You also gain [Immunity] to [Prone].

6th Circle – SudokuEX: Once per [Scene], as a standard action that provokes attacks of opportunity you may commit Seppuku, causing yourself to instantly die and restoring your honour in a losing battle. At the end of the [Encounter], if any of your allies remain alive, you return to life with full HP, either due to the magic of your ancestors, or just pure resilience combined with the restoration of your honour.

7th Circle – ZanshinEX: You gain immunity to [Dazed], [Stunned], [Binding] effects and effects with the [Mind-affecting] descriptor.

3.7.2 Bushido

You fight in a fluid style, using different techniques every round of combat. As part of a move action, you may use any number of abilities from Bushido, up to a total penalty of your KOM, applying the total of the penalties given to all attack rolls you make that [Round], and gaining the effects of those abilities for one [Round]. Bonuses to attack rolls from this track do not stack with fury bonuses to attack rolls, though they are not fury bonuses themselves.

1st Circle – GiEX: You gain a bonus to attack rolls equal to +1 per circle you possess in this track. You may take a -1 to attack rolls to choose a weapon property, and add it to all weapons you wield for the rest of the [Round]. You can stack the same weapon property a number of times equal to the number of circles you possess in this track.

Weapon properties stack with themselves numerically. Every additional [Barbed] increases the penalty by -1 and the damage on removal by 2. Every instance of [Brutal] above [Brutal 3] adds 2 points of damage. Every additional [Devastating] adds 5 ft to the distance of a Bull Rush. Every two additional instances of [Parrying] reduces damage on use by your KDM again. Every two additional instances of [Reacting] allows another five ft step. Every additional instance of [Scything] reduces the penalty to both attacks by 1. [Traumatising], [Thrown] and [Unbalancing] cannot stack.

2nd Circle – YuEX: You may take a -4 to attack rolls to gain a [Bonus Attack] when you make an attack action that [Round].

3rd Circle – JinEX: You may take a -1 to attack rolls to gain the effect of one [Combat] or [Style] feat you meet the prerequisites for until the end of the [Round]. When you gain your 4th circle in this track, you may take a -3 to copy two feats (though you can use only one [Style] feat). When you gain your 6th circle in this track, you may take a -6 to copy three feats (though you may still use only one [Style] feat).

4th Circle – ReiEX: Your bonus to attack rolls from Gi increases by an amount equal to half the penalty you took on attack rolls in the previous [Round], up to a maximum of the number of circles you possess in this track. You may take a -2 to attack rolls to gain the ability to replace your AC with the result of an attack roll against a single attack before your next turn. You may take a further -1 penalty to replace your AC an additional time before your next turn.

5th Circle – MakotoEX: You no longer have a maximum penalty you can take with abilities from this track in a [Round]. You may take a -2 to attack rolls to be able to make an additional attack of opportunity this [Round].

6th Circle – MeiyoEX: You may take a -5 to attack rolls to add the [Volley] descriptor to every melee attack you make in your next attack action, which are applied to every opponent in [Melee] range.

7th Circle – ChugiEX: Reduce the total penalty from Bushido you take each round by half, to a maximum reduction of half your KOM.

3.7.3 Iaijutsu

You use Iaijutsu to deal additional Precision damage in combat, making a precise single strike whenever you draw a weapon.

1st Circle – NukitsukeEX: You add the [Quick draw] property to every weapon in your possession. The first time each [Round] you make an attack with a given weapon, you deal 1d6 bonus damage on hit with the [Precision] descriptor per circle of this track you possess.

2nd Circle – TameshigiriEX: At the start of each [Scene], you may choose one [Style] feat you have, you always have the effects of that feat, and may gain the effects of another [Style] feat you have, as usual, whenever you draw a weapon.

3rd Circle – Saya-bikiEX: Every time you deal damage with Nukitsuke, you heal half your level in HP.

4th Circle – KiritsukeEX: When you deal damage with Nukitsuke twice to one opponent in one [Round], that opponent is [Battered] for one [Round].

5th Circle – KiaiEX: Once per [Round], on drawing a weapon you may make an Intimidate check against all opponents in [Close] range. Instead of the normal effect, all opponents you succeeded the Intimidate check against are [Shaken] for two [Rounds].

6th Circle – TsukaateEX: When you deal damage with Nukitsuke four times to one opponent in one [Round], that opponent is [Dazed] for one [Round].

7th Circle – MitsumeruEX: Once per [Encounter], when using Kiai, you may instead cause all affected opponents to be [Panicked] for one [Round].

3.8 Scout

Table 3.9: Scout Class
HP 8
Skills 6
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Ref
KOM Dex or Wis
KDM Con

Scouts are swift and professional fighters, specialising in ranged combat from the fringe of the battlefield, keeping constantly in motion. Using their natural speed, perception and tirelessness, a Scout can use their repertoire of trick arrows or bullets, fancy shots and innovative thrown weapons to turn the tide of a battle.

The Scout’s Tracks are:

  • Medium – Skirmisher: A Precision damage based track which rewards movement
  • Fast – Scout’s Training: Choose one of the following tracks:
    • Explorer: A passive track which demonstrates persistence and speed.
    • Shivers: A mostly-passive track which gives defences and honed perceptive instincts.
  • Slow – Trick Shots: An offensive track which allows the application of special effects to ranged attacks

3.8.1 Skirmisher

You use your speed to your advantage in combat, hitting weak points opponents don’t have time to shift their guard to and becoming harder to hit.

1st Circle – Keep on RunningEX: When you make a ranged attack, you deal an extra 4 damage with the [Precision] descriptor per 20 ft you have already moved in a [Round]. This is up to a limit of 4 extra damage for every circle you have in Skirmisher

2nd Circle – Run for Your LifeEX: On a turn when you move at least 20 ft, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. On a turn when you move at least 40 ft, you gain a +2 bonus to AC instead.

When you gain your 3rd circle in Skirmisher, on a turn when you move at least 60 ft, you instead gain a +3 bonus to AC. When you gain your 5th circle in Skirmisher, on a turn when you move at least 80 ft, you instead gain a +4 bonus to AC.

3rd Circle – Run Like the WindEX: Twice per [Encounter], as a move action, you may move up to your speed without provoking attacks of opportunity, during this movement you may enter occupied squares, but if you end your movement in an occupied square, you are shunted to the last unoccu¬pied square you entered. When you move through a space occupied by an opponent they take damage equal to twice your level and are [Blown away] in a direction of your choice. A successful Reflex save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Dex modifier) halves the damage and negates [Blown Away].

4th Circle – Run It to the GroundEX: As a standard action, you may make an attack action at any time during a movement, and continue that movement afterwards.

5th Circle – Running Circles Around ThemEX: Twice per [Encounter], when you move at least 20 ft within line of sight of an opponent while maintaining the same distance from that opponent, you may cause that opponent to become [Confused] for one [Round].

6th Circle – Run With the IdeaEX: You gain [Immunity] to effects with the [Binding] descriptor. When you use part of a move action you may still move up to your full speed.

7th Circle – Run Out of PunsEX: Once per [Encounter], when using Run Like the Wind, you may make an attack action against each opponent at any point during the movement.

3.8.2 Explorer

Scouts are persistent, fast and sneaky. This track reflects that.

1st Circle – You Can Lead the WayEX: You gain [Immunity] to [Fatigued] and [Exhausted], the Swim movement mode, and +5 to Athletics checks when using Athletics for Climbing.

2nd Circle – MacheteEX: Every time you hit with an attack, the target’s [Damage reduction] is reduced by 1, and if that is already 0, any [Resistances] they have prevent 1 less damage. When you reach 10th level this increases to 2. You may make a [Bonus attack] when attacking a creature whose [Damage reduction] is 0 and whose [Resistances] are preventing 0 damage due to this ability. These reductions last until the end of the [Encounter].

3rd Circle – You’re Too Slow!EX: You gain a +2 bonus to Athletics, Acrobatics, Stealth and Perception skill checks

Once per [Encounter], if you make a successful Reflex saving throw against an offensive action that normally deals half dam¬age on a successful save, you may instead take no damage.

4th Circle – Map and BackpackEX: You may cast find the path at will, and gain [Fast healing] equal to your KDM.

5th Circle – Come On, Step it Up!EX: Whenever you make a successful Reflex saving throw against an offensive action that normally deals half dam¬age on a successful save, you may instead take no damage.

You may always act during a Surprise Round.

6th Circle – Don’t Stop MovingEX: You can make a Stealth check as a swift or immediate action. In addition, you no longer suffer a penalty to your Stealth check for moving at more than half your movement speed. Once per [Encounter], you may retain the result of your Stealth check after taking an offensive action.

7th Circle – The Last CrusadeEX: You gain two additional Artifact item slots.

3.8.3 Shivers

While many creatures and people defend themselves with considered technique or pure vigour, others rely on something in-between. They rely on their instincts, honed by the years but still primal in nature. From hardened city detectives to hunting beasts, they all share the same shiver down their spine which warns them of danger.

1st Circle – Feel It In My BonesEX: As a move action, cause either target creature in [Medium] range, or the closest opponent within [Medium] range to be [Revealed] for three [Rounds]. If you already had line of sight to the target, you also learn the maximum damage they can do to a single creature with their currently available attacks or abilities, not accounting for critical hits.

2nd Circle – Blood Runs ColdEX: You gain a deflection bonus to AC equal to the number of circles you have in Shivers.

3rd Circle – Sniff Them OutEX: When you use Feel It In My Bones, you also learn the target’s lowest social defence and lowest save, and gain a +2 bonus to the DCs of any saves you cause them to make while they are [Revealed].

With ten minutes of effort, with agreement from the DM that you have a clear ‘main objective’, you may learn the direction the next place or thing you require for that objective is in.

4th Circle – Wind BlowsEX: You gain [Resistance] to energy and magic damage.

5th Circle – Murky GalaxyEX: You gain a +3 bonus to all saving throws and a bonus to your maximum HP equal to three times your level.

6th Circle – Just a HunchEX: With ten minutes of effort, you can learn the exact location of any specific person, item, or place of interest, or answer any general factual question. There is a 20% chance your information is wrong.

7th Circle – Ultra InstinctEX: Whenever you succeed on a saving throw, gain an Instinct point. When you are attacked, you may spend any number of Instinct points to gain four times the number spent as a bonus to AC for one [Round].

3.8.4 Trick Shots

Be it through fancy gadgets, specialist ammunition or just pure skill, you can add a variety of special effects to your ranged attacks. Whenever you make a ranged attack, you may add any one Trick Shot effect to it. You may do this independently for each attack in an attack action.

Varying your Trick Shots knocks an opponent off guard. When you attack an opponent with a Trick Shot you have not already used in the same [Round] you gain a +1 to the attack roll the first time in a [Round] you do so, +2 to second time in a [Round], +3 the third time and +4 the fourth time.

A creature need only make a saving throw against a given Trick Shot once per [Round].

1st Circle – Tricksy Little Scouts :You gain your choice of two of the following Trick Shots. Your choice is permanent.

  • Armour-Piercing ShotEX: Attacks with this Trick Shot ignore up to 3 points of item or deflection bonuses the target has to AC.
  • Smoke ShotEX: After the attack hits or misses, create a 20 ft radius spread centred on the target of this Trick Shot. It lasts for two [Rounds] and grants [Concealment] to all creatures inside, and to all outside the spread targeted by those inside.
  • Elemental ShotEX: When you hit an opponent with this Trick Shot you deal bonus energy damage with a descriptor of your choice equal to your KOM.
  • Rocket ShotEX: When you hit an opponent with this Trick Shot, they are pushed away from you by 5 ft, plus an additional 5 ft per even-numbered circle you have in Trick Shots.

2nd Circle – Shots FiredEX: You gain [Ghostwise sight] out to 45 ft. You gain your choice of two of the following Trick Shots. Your choice is permanent.

  • Disarming ShotEX: When you hit an opponent with this Trick Shot, turn that attack into a Disarm combat manoeuvre. The save DC is equal to 10 + ½ your level + your KOM.
  • Bola ShotEX: When you hit an opponent with this Trick Shot, they cannot make attacks until the start of their next turn, and cannot make [Bonus attacks] on that turn.
  • Explosive ShotEX: When you hit an opponent with this Trick Shot, they take additional damage equal to your KOM and are [Blinded] for one [Round]. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Blinded] effect.
  • Gooey ShotEX: After the attack hits or misses, create a spread of up to eight contiguous spaces within your [Close] range of the target. It lasts for two [Rounds] and ends the movement of any creature moving into one of those spaces and leaves them [Flat-footed]. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) prevents this effect for a [Round].

3rd Circle – That’s the TrickEX: All melee weapons you wield gain the [Thrown] weapon property. You gain your choice of one of the following Trick Shots. Your choice is permanent.

  • InterceptEX: As an immediate action, you can intercept and hinder any ranged attack, spell, supernatural ability, or spell-like ability that would target or affect an ally within [Close] range. Make an attack roll with a ranged weapon you are wielding. For purposes of that offensive action, the ally can freely choose to replace its AC or any saves it makes with your attack roll. This is not applied to an attack like a normal Trick Shot.
  • Bouncing ShotEX: When you hit an opponent with this Trick Shot, you may compare your attack roll from that attack to the AC of another target opponent within 10 ft of that opponent. If the attack roll equals or exceeds that opponent’s AC, you deal damage to that opponent equal to the damage dealt by the attack. You may only use this Trick Shot once per [Round] until you reach 6th circle in Trick Shots, when you can use it an unlimited number of times per [Round].

4th Circle – Think I Heard a Shot: You gain your choice of two of the following Trick Shots. Your choice is permanent.

  • Lock-OnEX: This Trick Shot ignores all bonuses to AC that only last for one [Round] on the target, and any [Miss chance].
  • Stunning ShotEX: When you hit an opponent with this Trick Shot, they cannot use swift or immediate actions for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect.
  • Disrupting ShotEX: When you hit an opponent with this Trick Shot, you may end up to three magical effects of 4th circle or lower on that target.
  • Corrosive ShotEX: After calculating the damage of this Trick Shot, reduce it by half. At the start of each of your next two turns, the target takes the same amount of damage which the original attack was reduced by.

5th Circle – Shots Shots Shots!EX: You gain [Blindsense] out to [Close] range. You gain the Trick Shot you didn’t choose at That’s the Trick.

6th Circle – The Great and Powerful Tricks-y!: You gain your choice of one of the following Trick Shots. Your choice is permanent.

  • Concussive ShotEX: You may only apply this Trick Shot to an attack once per [Encounter]. When you hit an opponent with this Trick Shot they are [Dazed] for two [Rounds]. A successful Fortitude save of DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM reduces the [Dazed] duration by half.
  • Deadly ShotEX: You may only apply this Trick Shot to an attack once per [Encounter]. When you hit an opponent with this Trick Shot you deal additional damage equal to six times your character level. A successful Reflex save of DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM halves the damage and prevents the damage from reducing the target below 1 hit point. This is a [Death] ability.

7th Circle – Trick it to the ManEX: You gain the following Trick Shot.

  • Perfect ShotEX: You may only apply this Trick Shot to an attack three times per [Scene]. When you make an attack with this Trick Shot, treat the attack roll as a 20.

3.9 Warlock

Table 3.10: Warlock Class
HP 10
Skills 5
BAB Good
Good Saves Reflex and Will
KOM Cha
KDM Str

Mages gain access to magic from intense study. Sorcerers are born with the gift of magic. Shamans draw their magic from natural forces and from ley lines in the earth itself. Clerics are granted their powers by deities for their faith. There are some who are not born with magic, not in tune enough with the earth and unwilling to go into the depth of study or show of faith required to gain magic. These few, though, gain access to magic from another source. Be it from a Demon or Devil, a mighty Dragon, a Fey magnate, a Kraken or Leviathan, or a being of the Far Realm, Warlocks enter into pacts with powerful magic beings, gaining magic to rival any other magic-user, but at a price, be it obedience, their soul or ever more esoteric forfeits made as part of their contract.

The Warlock’s Tracks are:

  • Medium – Eldritch Might: Choose from one of the following Tracks:
    • Eldtrich Blast: A Standard action focused track giving the power to throw a bolt of pure magical energy, and to use swift actions to shape and enhance it.
    • Hellblade: A Standard action focused track giving the power to take HP Reduction to create a recurring elemental ranged attack.
    • Conqueror: A Move action focused track where you create immobile soldiers who you can use to attack and expand your reach on the battlefield.
  • Fast – Invocation: A Standard action focused track giving a choice of unlimited utility-focused powers.
  • Slow – Pact Boon: A passive track giving a selection of options for passive benefits gained as clauses in a fell contract.

3.9.1 Eldritch Blast

You gain the power to fire a blast of magical energy, the exact form of which varies depending on where you are getting your magic from. For example, a Devil or Demon pact may cause your Eldritch Blast to take the form of a beam of dark magic, whereas a pact with a Fey may give a ball of magic energy and a pact with a Far Realms being would give a twisted green bolt of incomprehensible energy. All save DCs for abilities granted by this track are (10 + ½ your character level + your KOM).

1st Circle – BlasterSLA: As a standard action, you can use an Eldritch Blast by making a single ranged attack out to [Close] range with a +1 item bonus to hit. This bonus increases to +2 when you gain your 4th circle in Eldritch Blast and to +3 when you gain your 6th circle. On a hit, Eldritch Blast deals magic damage equal to 1d6 per level you possess plus your KOM to the creature it hits.

2nd Circle – Shaping Up WellSLA: As a swift action, you may add a Blast Shape or Eldritch Essence to your Eldritch Blast. These either add an additional effect to the blast or change the shape the blast affects. This effect lasts for one [Round]. Adding a Blast Shape or Eldritch Essence does not provoke an attack of opportunity, but conjuring the blast still does. You can only have one Blast Shape and one Eldritch Essence maximum on a single Eldritch Blast.

You gain access to two of the following, your choices are permanent:

  • Hellrime Blast: Your blast deals energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor and on a hit knocks the target [Flat-footed] for one [Round], a Fortitude save negates [Flat-footed]
  • Brimstone Blast: Your blast deals energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor and on a hit makes the target start [Burning]
  • Vitriolic Blast: Your blast deals energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor and gives a -2 penalty to attack rolls for one [Round] on hit, a Fortitude save negates penalty
  • Galvanising Blast: Your blast deals energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor and on a hit inflicts the target with [Fatigued] for one [Round], a Reflex save negates [Fatigued]
  • Eldritch Glaive: You make a melee attack with your blast, treating it as a melee weapon with [Reach] which persists until the start of your next turn. You do not provoke attacks of opportunity when conjuring an Eldritch Glaive, and can make attacks of opportunity with it.
  • Eldritch Spear: Your blast has a range of [Medium].

3rd Circle – Essential ElementsSLA: You gain access to two of the following, your choices are permanent:

  • Frightful Blast: On a hit, your blast inflicts [Shaken] until the end of the [Encounter], a Will save negates the [Shaken].
  • Sickening Blast: On a hit, your blast inflicts [Sickened] until the end of the [Encounter], a Fortitude save negates the [Sickened].
  • Beshadowed Blast: On a hit, your blast inflicts [Blinded] for one [Round] a Fortitude save negates the [Blinded].
  • Deteriorating Blast: On a hit, your blast causes all other attacks on the target until the start of your next turn to ignore 2 points of DR or [Resistance] per circle you possess in Eldritch Blast. A Will save negates this effect.
  • Eldritch Chain: Your blast can hit multiple targets in a row. On a hit, you may make a second attack roll against a creature within [Close] range of your original target, if this hits it deals half damage. When you gain your 5th circle in Eldritch Blast, you can make a third attack against another creature in [Close] range of your second target, if this hits it deals half the damage of the first attack as well. Any Eldritch Essence effects have their save DCs reduced by 3 for the second target and by 6 for the third target.

4th Circle – Optimised BlasterEX: Once per [Round], you may take an additional swift or immediate action.

5th Circle – Eldritch HorrorSLA: You gain access to two of the following, your choices are permanent:

  • Repelling Blast: On a hit, your blast causes the target to be [Blown away] in a direction of your choice and be [Battered] for two [Rounds]. A Reflex save negates the [Blown away] and reduces the [Battered] duration to one [Round].
  • Bewitching Blast: On a hit, your blast causes the target to be [Confused] for one [Round], a Will save negates the [Confused].
  • Hindering Blast: On a hit, your blast causes the target to be [Slowed] for two [Rounds], a Fortitude save reduces the [Slowed] duration to one [Round]
  • Penetrating Blast: On a hit, your blast inflicts a -4 penalty to saves for one [Round], a Will save negates this penalty.
  • Eldritch Bolt: Your blast affects every creature in a 5 ft wide line out to [Medium] range. You make a single attack roll against the AC of all creatures in the line.
  • Eldritch Wave: Your blast affects every creature in a wedge of length 15 ft + 5 ft per character level you possess. You make a single attack roll against the AC of all creatures in the wedge.

6th Circle – Emergency ClauseSU: Once per [Encounter], you may reroll a d20 for an attack roll made as part of an Eldritch Blast.

7th Circle – Eldritch AbominationSLA: You gain access to one of the following, your choice is permanent:

  • Binding Blast: Your blast inflicts [Dazed] for one [Round] on hit, a Reflex save negates [Dazed]
  • Hideous Blast: Your blast inflicts [Panicked] for one [Round] on hit, a Will save negates [Panicked]
  • Utterdark Blast: Your blast inflicts [Energy drained] twice on hit, a Fort save negates [Energy drained]
  • Eldritch Doom: Your blast affects all creatures in a 20 ft radius of yourself, no attack roll is required.

3.9.2 Hellblade

Warriors who channel the power of the Nine Hells into pure elemental power, Hellblades live a dangerous life. Drawing upon infernal forces hurts them as well as their opponents, but it allows their attacks to be even more relentless and incapacitating. Power comes at a price, and the Hellblade is willing to pay.

1st Circle – Hell’s BellsSU: As a standard action, you may lose HP equal to twice your KOM to use one of the following abilities:

  • Ruby BladesSU: Make a melee attack roll against an opponent in [Close] range. On a hit they take energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to 1d6 per circle you have in Hellblade plus your KOM. At the start of your next two turns, repeat this ability against the same target.
  • Sapphire BladesSU: Make a melee attack roll against an opponent in [Close] range. On a hit they take energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to 1d6 per circle you have in Hellblade plus your KOM. At the start of your next two turns, repeat this ability against the same target.

Any one creature can only be the target of one instance of either of these abilities at a time.

2nd Circle – Dread BladeSU: As a standard action, take [HP reduction] equal to your KOM and make a melee attack roll against an opponent in [Melee]. On a hit, it deals damage as normal and also the target loses all untyped bonuses to any statistics, and cannot gain any untyped bonuses to statistics until the end of your next turn.

3rd Circle – Mouth of HellSU: As a standard action, you may lose HP equal to twice your KOM to use one of the following abilities:

  • Emerald BladesSU: Make a melee attack roll against an opponent in [Close] range. On a hit they take energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor equal to 1d6 per circle you have in Hellblade plus your KOM. At the start of your next two turns, repeat this ability against the same target.
  • Quartz BladesSU: Make a melee attack roll against an opponent in [Close] range. On a hit they take energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to 1d6 per circle you have in Hellblade plus your KOM. At the start of your next two turns, repeat this ability against the same target.

Any one creature can be the target of one instance each of Ruby, Sapphire, Emerald and Quartz Blades only.

4th Circle – Onyx BladeSU: As a standard action, take [HP reduction] equal to twice your KOM and make a melee attack roll against an opponent in [Melee]. On a hit, the target is [Battered] for the [Encounter], and all damage it deals is energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor.

5th Circle – Surpassing PowerSU: When you roll a 6 on a damage die for Ruby, Sapphire, Emerald or Quartz Blades, roll two additional d6s.

6th Circle – Terror BladeSU: As a standard action, take [HP reduction] equal to three times your KOM, take damage equal to three times your KOM and make a melee attack roll against an opponent in [Melee]. On a hit, all conditions with a duration currently affecting the target have their duration extended by one [Round].

7th Circle – DeathstormSU: As a standard action, use Ruby Blades, Sapphire Blades, Emerald Blades and Quartz Blades, and make three melee attacks, one of which is Dread Blade, one of which is Onyx Blade and the last of which is Terror Blade. After that, you are reduced to 1 HP if you are not already [Unconscious] and are [Dazed] for three [Rounds].

3.9.3 Conqueror

Warlocks who have made a pact with the Nine Hells may draw upon the might of the Iron City of Dis to become a true master of the battlefield via creating their own army of completely obedient Iron soldiers and even expanding their territory over the corpses of their fallen foes.

1st Circle – The Iron GuardSLA: As a move action, you may create an Iron Soldier within your [Close] range. Your [Close] range is expanded to include the [Melee] range of every Iron Soldier you have active. You may have up to three Iron Soldiers active at a time. If you create an Iron Soldier while you have three active, destroy one of your current Iron Soldiers.

An Iron Soldier occupies a space, but does not act by itself, does not have hit points, cannot be killed or damaged (they have AC equal to 10 + your level + your KDM if someone does want to attack them for some reason), and can be moved through freely (although a creature can’t end its turn in the space of the Iron Soldier). An Iron Soldier has a [Melee] range equal to yours plus 5 ft, can whenever you make an attack you can attack with one of your Iron Soldiers instead as long as you have line of sight and effect to that soldier. An Iron Soldier uses your attack bonus, and deals 1d8+your KOM physical damage on a hit. You may also make attacks of opportunity with one of your Iron Soldiers if a creature provokes an attack of opportunity from one, and may make one attack of opportunity per [Round] with each Iron Soldier, in addition you your own.

Your Iron Soldiers do not gain any of your bonuses to damage, but they do count as one of your allies, and can be targeted with any ability which grants a bonus to damage or attack rolls.

2nd Circle – Tower of DominationSU: Note the space in which any opponent dies. As a standard action, if there is a space where an opponent died since the start of your last turn within your [Close] range, you may raise an Iron Tower on that space.

An Iron Tower occupies a space, has hit points equal to 8 times your level (and is destroyed at 0 hit points) and AC equal to 15 + your level + your KDM, cannot be moved through by creatures that are not [Flying], [Burrowing] or [Swimming] and blocks line of sight and effect. At the end of your turn, as long as the Iron Tower is in your [Close] range, it targets either the closest energy in your [Close] range or, if you were targeted for an offensive action since the end of your last turn, the most recent creature to target you with an offensive action. It deals magic damage equal to 1d8 per two levels you have plus your KOM to that creature.

3rd Circle – Conqueror’s SpearsSU: When you make an attack action, you can make an additional attack within that action using an Iron Soldier once each for each Iron Soldier you have active. These attacks count as a [Bonus Attack].

4th Circle – Emperor’s DivideSLA: As a standard action, you may summon an ephemeral battalion of Iron Soldiers to make a decisive strike and rearrange the battlefield. Designate a 15 ft long and 10 ft wide line within your [Close] range. Deal 1d6 physical damage per level you have to all creatures within the line, and they are moved up to 20 ft in a direction of your choice perpendicular to the long side of the line. Affected creatures may make a Reflex save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) to avoid being moved, but still take the damage.

You may not use this ability again for 1d6-2 [Rounds] (if you roll a 0 you may use it again immediately).

5th Circle – Castle the KingSU: As a move action you may either move any of your Iron Soldiers up to 40 ft in any direction, or [Warp] to a space adjacent to one of your Iron Soldiers and gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

6th Circle – Imperial OrderSLA: Creatures which take damage from Emperor’s Divide and fail the Reflex save take additional damage equal to 15% of their remaining hit points after the damage is done (rounding down to the nearest 1).

7th Circle – FlashSLA: As a free action, including when it is not your turn, [Warp] to any space within your [Close] range.

You may not use this ability again for 1d6-2 [Rounds] (if you roll a 0 you may use it again immediately).

3.9.4 Invocation

Invocations are obscure magical powers which can be used without limit by Warlocks and some other magical savants. They come in four ranks: Least, Lesser, Greater and Dark in ascending order. Unless otherwise noted, all Invocations require a standard action and can be used at will. Unless otherwise noted, all ongoing effects of Invocations can be dispelled by their caster with a free action. The DC for saves against effects from Invocations is 10 + ½ your character level + your Cha modifier.

1st Circle – Least InvocationSLA: You gain two Least Invocations of your choice and a +2 bonus to one skill of your choice.

2nd Circle – Self IMProvementSLA: You gain two Least Invocations of your choice and a +2 bonus to one save of your choice.

3rd Circle – Lesser InvocationSLA: You gain one Lesser Invocation of your choice, and may permanently swap one of your known Invocations for another Lesser or Least rank Invocation.

4th Circle – Powered by a Forsaken ChildSLA: You gain one Lesser Invocation of your choice and one Greater Invocation of your choice.

5th Circle – Greater InvocationSLA: You gain one Greater Invocation of your choice and may swap one of your known Invocations for another Lesser or Least rank Invocation.

6th Circle – Master of the ArcaneSLA: You gain one Greater Invocation of your choice and may swap one of your known Invocations for another Greater or lower ranked Invocation.

7th Circle – Dark InvocationSLA: You gain one Dark Invocation of your choice and may swap one of your known Invocations for another Greater or lower ranked Invocation.

3.9.4.1 Invocations

3.9.4.1.1 Least
  • Aspect of the Moon: You do not need to sleep, and no effect can cause you to fall asleep. You also gain [Immunity] to [Fatigued] and [Exhausted] for the rest of the [Scene]
  • Aura of Flame: For the rest of the [Scene], the first creature to hit you in melee each round takes energy damage equal to your level. You choose the descriptor for the energy damage ([Fire], [Cold], [Electricity] or [Acid]) when you choose this Invocation.
  • Baneful Essence: Choose a creature type when you choose this Invocation. On touch, target ally deals an additional 2d6 [Precision] damage on attacks against creatures of that type for the rest of the [Scene].
  • Baleful Utterance: You can destroy a single a single nonmagical object or obstacle, including a weapon or piece of armour. If a creature was wearing the item when it is destroyed, they must make a Will save or be [Shaken] for one [Round].
  • Beguiling Influence: You gain a +3 bonus to interaction skills (except Perception) for the rest of the [Scene]
  • Breath of the Night: You create a cloud of mist, as the obscuring mist spell.
  • Call of the Wild: You gain the ability to speak with animals, and a +3 bonus to Nature and Vigour for the rest of the [Scene]
  • Cold Comfort: You create a 30 ft radius aura around yourself for the rest of the [Scene], bestowing an effect identical to the endure elements spell.
  • Crawling Eye: You can take 4 points of [HP reduction] and a -4 to attack rolls which do not expire until you dispel this effect as a standard action to detach one of your eyes. The eye then functions as the hand from the Ancient Reliquary item, except if it is destroyed your eye grows back five rounds later and if the effect is dispelled your eye immediately regrows.
  • Dark One’s Own Luck: As an immediate action once per [Encounter], replace the stat bonus to your Fortitude or Reflex save with your Cha bonus for one [Round]
  • Darkness: You create an area of magical darkness, as the darkness spell.
  • Earthen Grasp: You conjure a stone fist from beneath the earth which attempts to Grapple target opponent in [Medium] range. The fist appears adjacent to target opponent and immediately makes a Grapple with your attack bonus, which deals damage equal to your level and has a DC of 13 + ½ your level. The hand disappears if the opponent ceases to be [Grappled] or if the Grapple fails. It has 10 HP and an AC of 13 + your character level.
  • Entropic Warding: For the duration of the [Encounter], you gain a shield which provides 20% miss chance against ranged attacks, and also causes you to leave no tracks when moving.
  • Hex: You place a curse on an opponent in [Close] range. When an ally attacks that creature their critical threat range expands to the next number they wouldn’t normally score a critical hit on. If the Hexed creature dies you heal HP equal to twice its level. The Hex lasts until the end of the [Encounter], but you can only Hex one creature at a time.
  • Leaps and Bounds: You gain a +3 bonus to Acrobatics, Athletics, and Ride for the rest of the [Scene]
  • Least Eldritch Lore: Choose two spells of 1st Circle or lower. You can cast each of them as an Invocation once per [Encounter]. You can only have one instance of any effect from these spells active at a time.
  • Miasmic Cloud: You create a fog, as the obscuring mist spell but with a 10 ft radius. Any creature starting its turn in the fog except you must make Fortitude save or become [Fatigued] until the end of the turn they leave the fog on.
  • Otherworldly Whispers: You gain a +3 bonus to two Knowledge skills of your choice for the rest of the [Scene].
  • Scalding Gust: All creatures in a 15 ft length wedge originating from you take energy damage equal to your level and are [Blown away] unless they make a Reflex save. You choose the descriptor for the energy damage ([Fire], [Cold], [Electricity] or [Acid]) when you choose this Invocation.
  • Seeker’s Speech: Until the end of the [Scene] you may speak and understand two languages of your choice.
  • See the Unseen: Ally you touch gains 30 ft Ghostwise Sight and see invisibility, as the spell, for the duration of the [Scene].
  • Shadow Hound: You transform an opponent in [Close] range’s shadow into a hound which howls to reveal their presence and bites at them at your command. The creature is [Revealed] until the end of the [Encounter] and takes damage equal to twice your level whenever you lose line of sight to them, or they would normally become [Concealed] or [Fully concealed].
  • Soulreaving Aura: As a swift action, you can create a 10 ft radius aura of negative energy around you that lasts for an [Encounter]. At the start of your turn, any creature in the aura at 0 HP or below takes damage equal to twice your level. If a creature is killed by this effect, you gain temporary HP equal to twice its level.
  • Swimming the Styx: Ally you touch gains the Swim movement mode for the duration of the [Scene]
  • Whispers of the Grave: Once per [Scene] per circle of Invocation you possess, you may Speak with Dead
3.9.4.1.2 Lesser
  • Caustic Mire: You can create a 20 ft radius of difficult terrain within [Close] range. Any time a creature enters a space in the radius they take 2d6 energy damage. You choose the descriptor for the energy damage ([Fire], [Cold], [Electricity] or [Acid]) when you choose this Invocation.
  • Charm: Once per [Encounter], you can beguile a creature as with the Charm feat, outside of combat you may force a creature to make a Will save or view you as friendly unless it is attacked by you or your allies.
  • Curse of Despair: You can cause a creature in [Melee] range to be [Cursed] for 1d4-1 rounds. [Cursed] creatures have a 50% chance at the start or their turn to be [Dazed] for one [Round]. This does not provoke attacks of opportunity, but does require a successful melee attack roll. A successful Will save negates [Cursed], but causes the target to suffer a -1 penalty to all d20 rolls for the rest of the [Encounter] (this does not stack). Once a creature saves against [Cursed], or the [Cursed] condition runs out, they are immune to Curse of Despair for the rest of the [Scene].
  • Dark Discorporation: As a swift ac¬tion, you can turn into a swarm of bats, mist, or similar form to move between opponents and around obstacles (and even through cracks in walls) with ease. For one [Round], you do not provoke attacks of opportunity while moving and gain the Fly movement mode. You may enter occupied squares, but if you end your movement in an occupied square, you are shunted to the last unoccu¬pied square you entered.
  • The Dead Walk: You may raise a corpse in [Close] range as a Grunt Mook with the [Undead] type, with level equal to its level in life, but 0 Int, Wis and Cha and with the movement modes it had in life, under your control. It acts on its own initiative and can only take a single action on each of its turns. You may only have Mooks active with total level up to yours plus your Cha modifier.
  • Eyes of Another: As a move action, choose one ally within [Close] range. You establish line of sight from their space and cast spells and use abilities as if in their space until the end of your turn.
  • Fell Flight: Ally touched gains the Fly movement mode for the duration of the [Scene]. A number of allies (including you) can benefit from this ability equal to your Cha modifier minus 5 (minimum 1).
  • Flee the Scene: You teleport five ft per character level and instantly create a major image of yourself in the space you started in. The major image cannot be replaced, and you make the Believability check with your Cha modifier.
  • Frightful Presence: Create a 10 ft radius aura around you that lasts for an [Encounter]. All opponents ending their turn in the aura must make a Will save or be [Shaken] for two [Rounds].
  • Gaze of Khirad: For the rest of the [Scene], you can see through solid objects up to your [Medium] range. Objects and creatures that would be obscured by these objects appear as ghostly images. You still cannot establish line of effect through solid objects.
  • Green Lord’s Gift: For the rest of the [Scene], whenever you are healed by an effect that rolls dice, treat every dice of healing as if it rolled its highest value.
  • Hungry Darkness: You create an area of darkness, as the darkness spell, but any creature ending its turn in the aura takes 5d6+your character level points of damage. Once you reach level 8, this increases to 10d6+twice your character level damage.
  • Ignore the Pyre: A target creature gains [Greater resistance] to an energy type of your choice for the rest of the [Scene]. Each character can only have one instance of Ignore the Pyre active, with new castings replacing older ones.
  • Lesser Eldritch Lore: Choose two spells of 3rd Circle or lower. You can cast each of them as an Invocation once per [Encounter]. You can only have one instance of any effect from these spells active at a time.
  • Mantle of Flame: As a swift action you may create an aura out to your [Close] range until the end of the [Encounter]. Creatures starting their turn in the aura take energy damage equal to your character level. You choose the descriptor for the energy damage ([Fire], [Cold], [Electricity] or [Acid]) when you choose this Invocation.
  • Relentless Dispelling: You use dispel magic as the spell, but the effect repeats at the start of your next turn with the same target creature or space.
  • Painful Slumber of Ages: You cause one opponent in [Melee] range to fall asleep, this does not provoke attacks of opportunity but does require a successful melee attack roll. A sleeping creature is [Helpless]. A successful Fortitude save negates the sleep. At the start of each of their turns, and whenever they take damage, a sleeping creature makes a Will save, which ends the sleep if successful, and the sleep can also be ended by an ally of the creature in [Melee] range using a move action, but the sleeping creature takes damage equal to twice your Cha modifier when they awake in this way. If the opponent is still asleep at the end of the [Encounter], they fall permanently asleep unless the effect is magically dispelled.
  • Voracious Dispelling: You use dispel magic as the spell, but if a creature has an effect on it dispelled, it takes 2 damage per circle of the effect dispelled.
  • Walk Unseen: Ally touched gains invisibility, as the spell.
  • Weighty Utterance: Target [Flying] creature in [Medium] range takes damage equal to your character level, falls [Prone] and loses the Fly movement mode until the end of their next turn. A Reflex save allows them to stay [Flying] and keep the Fly movement mode.
3.9.4.1.3 Greater
  • Caiphon’s Beacon: You channel the star of deception, you get Stealth and Bluff as trained skills and a +4 bonus to attack rolls against creatures currently affected by an effect with the [Mind affecting] descriptor until the end of the [Scene].
  • Chilling Fog: You create a solid fog, as the spell, and all creatures starting their turn in the fog take energy damage equal to your character level. You choose the descriptor for the energy damage ([Fire], [Cold], [Electricity] or [Acid]) when you choose this Invocation.
  • Chilling Tentacles: You summon a tentacle of icy blackness out of the ground to grapple each enemy in a 30 ft radius within [Medium] range. Each tentacle appears adjacent to its target opponent and immediately makes a Grapple with your attack bonus, which deals energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to your level and has a DC of 16 + ½ your level. The tentacle disappears if the opponent ceases to be [Grappled] or if the Grapple fails. It has 40 HP and an AC of 15 + your character level.
  • Claw of Acamar: You lash out at a creature in [Close] range with a claw of black tentacles. Make a ranged attack roll, if it hits the target takes 2d6 damage and has their movement speed reduced to 0 for one [Round].
  • Devour Magic: You cast greater dispel magic as the spell and gain 2 temporary HP for every circle of spell effect that was dispelled.
  • Devil’s Whispers: You give a short suggestion (up to 25 words) to a creature that can hear you. If they fail a Will save, they are compelled to carry out the suggestion as long as it is not obviously self destructive. If you or your allies are currently in combat with the target creature, they get a +5 to the Will save. After carrying out the action, the creature must make another Will save, if they fail, you can choose to either make them forget they carried out the suggestion, or remember they did it but forget that you asked them to and that they were compelled to do so.
  • Draconic Toughness: At the start of each of your turns, you gain temporary hit points equal to your character level. Also, your DR is calculated using the higher of your Charisma and Constitution modifiers.
  • Dread Seizure: Target enemy in [Close] range must make a Will save or be [Slowed] for two rounds and immediately fall [Prone]
  • Duplicitous Retreat: You teleport and leave an illusion as the Flee The Scene invocation, and also gain the effects of greater invisibility for the duration of the [Encounter]
  • Enervating Shadow: You gain [Full concealment] for the rest of the [Encounter] and any creature starting its turn adjacent to you must make a Fortitude save or be [Exhausted] for five rounds
  • Kiss of Mephistopheles: For the rest of the [Encounter], your Eldritch Blasts explode in hellfire. Once per [Round] when you hit with an Eldritch Blast, it creates a 20 ft radius spread centred on the target which deals 1d6 energy damage per your Cha modifier with the [Fire] descriptor. A successful Reflex save halves this damage.
  • Greater Eldritch Lore: Choose two spells of 5th Circle or lower. You can cast each of them as an Invocation once per [Encounter]. You can only have one instance of any effect from these spells active at a time.
  • Mask of Flesh: With a successful melee attack, you deal normal damage and make your target [Invisible] for the duration of the [Scene] and change your appearance to match theirs. This change acts as a major image with the Believability check modified by your Cha modifier and unable to be changed.
  • Nightmares Made Real: You create a number of 10-ft squares equal to your character level. These squares provide concealment in the same way as obscuring mist. The first time each turn an enemy moves through a space in the area they must make a Will save or become Entangled and take 2 damage per character level.
  • Path of Shadow: You can cast wind walk as the spell
  • Path of the Seeker: You gain [Immunity] to [Binding] effects until the end of the [Scene].
  • Shroud of Ulban: You are [Invisible] for the rest of the [Scene]
  • Sudden Swarm: Until the end of the [Scene], the next time you kill a creature with either an Invocation or an Eldritch Blast, you cause a swarm of creatures to erupt from their corpse. You summon a Myriad with level equal to yours immediately, without requiring an action, with every body within 20 ft of the point where the creature died. The Myriad is under your control, and acts on the initiative of the dead creature. You may only have one Sudden Swarm active at a time.
  • Tomb of Levistus: The next time you take damage, you immediately gain temporary HP equal to ten times your level, [Vulnerability] to [Fire] and [Immunity] to [Cold], but you are also unable to take actions. All these effects end when you run out of temporary HP.
  • Touch of Insanity: You cause one creature in [Melee] range to be [Confused] for three [Rounds]. This does not provoke attacks of opportunity, but does require a successful melee attack roll. A successful Will save reduces the duration of [Confused] to one [Round].
  • Voidsense: Creatures touched gain [Blindsense] out to 30 ft for the duration of the [Scene].
  • Wall of Perilous Flame: You create a 10 ft thick wall of energy with length up to 100 ft+10 ft per character level. Any creature entering these spaces takes three times your level in magical damage, half of which has your chosen descriptor. If a creatures dies in this area and is not resurrected within one [Round], they are consumed permanently and can never by resurrected. You choose the descriptor for the energy damage ([Fire], [Cold], [Electricity] or [Acid]) when you choose this Invocation.
  • Warlock’s Call: You may send a verbal message of any length to any creature you know the name or face of, and they can reply with their own verbal message. If you send a simple command in the message, the recipient must make a Will save or be obligated to carry it out as long as it doesn’t cause them to knowingly endanger their life.
  • Wingstorm: You can only learn this Invocation if you have the Fly movement mode. As a move action, all [Flying] and [Soaring] opponents in your [Close] range take damage equal to twice your character level and are [Knocked down] and lose [Flying] and [Soaring]. A Reflex save halves damage and causes them not to lose [Flying] or [Soaring].
3.9.4.1.4 Dark
  • Dark Eldritch Lore: Choose two spells of 7th Circle or lower. You can cast each of them once per [Encounter] as an Invocation. You can only have one instance of any effect from these spells active at a time.
  • Dark Foresight: Creature touched gains foresight, as the spell. Each creature can only gain Dark Foresight once per [Scene].
  • Impenetrable Barrier: You create a wall of force, as the spell, but it forms a black wall which blocks line of sight for your opponents and lasts for a [Scene]
  • Perilous Veil: You change the appearance of a touched creature for a [Scene], working as the major image spell but with the Believability check based on your Cha modifier. You can also create Major Images that last for a [Scene]. If a creature disbelieves the illusion by having a high enough Awareness or by making the Will save, they take thrice your character level in damage.
  • Retributive Invisibility: Ally touched gains greater invisibility, as the spell with duration of [Scene]. If it is dispelled, all enemies in [Close] range of the dispelled creature take 4d6 points of damage and are [Stunned] for one [Round]. A Fortitude save halves damage and negates [Stunned].
  • Shield of the Deep: You gain [Greater resistance] to magic and energy damage for the rest of the [Scene].
  • Word of Changing: Once per [Scene], you polymorph one enemy in [Close] range to an inoffensive form. They take half their HP in [HP reduction] and cannot attack or use abilities. A successful Fortitude save ends the effect and they get a new Fortitude save at the end of each of their turns. If a creature ends an [Encounter] in their polymorphed form, they must make a Will save, if it succeeds they return to normal form, if it fails they are cannot leave their polymorphed form until dispelled.

3.9.5 Pact Boon

Your Pact grants you an assortment of powers. There are different sets of powers, based on what manner of creature you made a Pact with, the main ones being a Fey, Devil, Demon, Dragon, Deep One, archmage of a House of Waves, or Old One of the Far Realms, you choose which set of Pact Boons you gain when you gain this Track.

1st Circle – Signed and Dated: You gain an ability based on your Pact.

  • Fey – Woodland StepSU: As a move action, you can [Teleport] up to 10 ft for every circle of this track that you possess to an unoccupied space. When you gain your 5th Circle in Pact Boon, this becomes a [Warp].
  • Devil – Talk them DownSU: You can communicate telepathically with all allies in your [Close] range, as the spell world-mind. You gain a +3 bonus to the in-combat use of the Diplomacy skill, and when you succeed you also apply the same penalty to damage rolls as to attack rolls. When you reach 3rd Circle the penalty from the in-combat Diplomacy skill increases to -3, and to -4 at 5th Circle and -5 at 7th Circle.
  • Demon – Aura of EntropySU: As a free action, you can start or stop radiating an aura out to your [Melee] range, creatures starting their turn in the aura take a -1 penalty to attack rolls and ability DCs until the end of their turn. When you reach 3rd Circle in this track, the aura increases to [Close] range, at 5th Circle the penalty increases to -2, and at 7th Circle the penalty increases to -3.
  • Dragon – Drake’s SightEX: You gain [Darkvision] and [Ghostwise sight] out to 45 ft. When you gain 3rd Circle in this track, you also gain [Blindsight] out to your melee range. At 5th Circle, your [Blindsight] increases out to your [Close] range, and out to [Medium] range at 7th Circle.
  • Deep One – Unbreaking WavesEX: You gain the Swim movement mode and may make an additional 5 ft step every [Round], even if you have already moved.
  • House of Waves – Dazzling LightSU: Whenever you cast a spell or use a spell-like ability, all opponents within your [Close] range are [Revealed] and [Dazzled] for one [Round], and you generate illumination out to your [Close] range.
  • Old One – MutationEX: You gain a natural weapon with three properties which aren’t [Barbed], [Hold-out] or [Quick Draw]. At every odd numbered circle of this track, you gain an additional natural weapon.

2nd Circle – Contractual RiderSU: Choose either Reflex or Fortitude and Will saves. Once per [Encounter], if you make a successful save of that type against an effect that would normally have a less¬er effect on a successful save (such as a spell with a save of “Fortitude half”), you instead ignore the effect entirely.

3rd Circle – DD Boons: You gain an ability based on your Pact.

  • Fey – Woodland VeilSLA: As a swift or move action, you may become [Invisible] until either the end of the [Encounter] or until you make an offensive action.
  • Devil – Diabolic ResilienceEX: You gain [Fast healing] equal to your KDM
  • Demon – Demonic ResilienceEX: You gain [Fast healing] equal to your KDM
  • Dragon – Drake’s HeartEX: Your maximum HP increases by three points per character level
  • Deep One – Limbs of the MasterSU: As a move action you may conjure a tentacle occupying an unoccupied space within your [Medium] range. At the start of your turn each of your tentacles may attack a creature within 10 ft of it, dealing 1d8 + your KOM energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor and reducing their movement speed by 10 ft for one [Round]. Multiple tentacles can only deal the damage once to a creature each [Round], but the speed penalty can stack. You can have up to eight tentacles active at a time.
  • House of Waves – Light of AweSU: When a creature is affected by your Dazzling Light, it must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) or be unable to use [Bonus attacks], attacks of opportunity, or score critical hits for one [Round]. A creature that makes this save does not need to make it again until your next turn.
  • Old One – Ward from BeyondSU: The first time each [Round] each enemy hits you or damages you with an ability, they take damage equal to your character level

4th Circle – Sect Buddy: You gain an ability based on your Pact:

  • Fey – Arcana’s EndEX: You gain [Resistance] to energy and magic damage
  • Devil – Diabolic ResistanceEX: You gain [Resistance] to physical damage
  • Demon – Demonic ResistanceEX: You gain [Resistance] to physical damage
  • Dragon – Drake’s ScalesEX: You gain an item bonus to AC equal to the number of circles of Pact Boon you possess plus one.
  • Deep One – Endless OceanEX: You gain [Resistance] to energy and magic damage.
  • House of Waves – Refreshing WaveSU: When you activate Dazzling Light, all allies in your [Close] range regain hit points equal to your Cha modifier.
  • Old One – Ward of MadnessSU: You gain a 35% [Miss Chance]

5th Circle – Pact-ManEX: You gain an additional Greater Item Slot and start each [Scene] with a bonus Consumable of Relic rank or lower.

6th Circle – See What You Deed There: You gain an ability based on your Pact:

  • Fey – Mass CharmEX: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may attempt to charm all enemies in [Close] range. A charmed creature must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) to use an offensive action against you or your allies, if it fails, it cannot use offensive actions against you or your allies for one [Round]. The charm lasts until the end of the [Encounter], or until you or your allies make an offensive action against the charmed creature.
  • Devil – BlackenedSU: The first time each [Round] each opponent is affected by one of your spell, spell-like or supernatural abilities they must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or gain [Vulnerability] to all damage for 1 [Round].
  • Demon – Bond of BloodSU: As a swift ac¬tion, you can form a bond with a creature within [Medium] range that splits all damage you take equally with that creature until the end of the [Encounter]. (You can damage yourself to damage the bonded creature.) [Damage reduction] and [Resistance] do not apply to damage that creature takes from this ability. As a move action, that creature may make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Key Offensive Modifier) to sever this bond. A creature may only have one such bond at a time.
  • Dragon – Drake’s VoiceEX: Twice per [Encounter], as a swift action, you may let loose a horrible challenge. Opponents within [Close] range are [Deafened] for one [Round], and they must use their standard and move actions to either flee or approach you (using standard actions to Run and move actions to move away), or target you with offensive actions for one [Round]. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect.
  • Deep One – Abyssal MawSU: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action you may create a 30 ft radius spread within your [Medium] range. Until the start of your next turn, creatures can’t move out of the spread, and at the start of their turn they take 3d6 energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor, and you heal equal to half of the damage done. The spread then disappears.
  • House of Waves – Irresistable LightSU: All creatures that fail their save against your Light of Awe are charmed for 1d4 [Rounds]. A charmed creature must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + TAM) to use an offensive action against you or your allies, if it fails, it cannot use offensive actions against you or your allies for one [Round]. Each opponent may only be affected once per [Encounter], and the effect ends if you are one of your allies targets the creature with an offensive action.
  • Old One – Touch of MadnessSU: Whenever an opponent is damaged by your Ward From Beyond, they must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KDM) or become [Confused] at the start of their next turn until the end of the turn.

7th Circle – AfterlifeSU: Once per [Scene], whenever you die or are rendered [Unconscious], you are revived at the beginning of the next [Round] with full HP. You can delay your revival or choose not to return at all.

3.10 Warrior

Table 3.11: Warrior Class
HP 12
Skills 5, at least 3 of which must be Physical skills
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Ref
KOM Str
KDM Wis

Warriors are the undisputed masters of physical combat. Where Fighters rely on cheap tricks, armaments and magical trinkets; Rangers rely on traps and ambushes; and Barbarians rely on thoughtless rage – Warriors rely on their honed instincts and their mastery of the intricacies of countless weapons. Their instincts extend across the battlefield, as they direct allies ably. As long as the battle is based on physical prowess, a Warrior will be triumphant with their superior instinct, technique and tactics.

The Warrior’s Tracks are:

  • Medium – Battle Master: This gives a limited reserve of Superiority Dice that can be used for bursts of damage or other helpful things in combat
  • Fast – War Master: You use your knowledge of tactics to help out your allies, and especially interact with the initiative order
  • Slow – Weapon Master: You learn a variety of specialised combat manoeuvres that can only be used with appropriate weapons

3.10.1 Battle Master

The Battle Master track deals with Superiority Dice, these are a reserve of dice, whose size is determined by your circles in Battle Master. They can be spent as a free action during an attack for abilities granted by the Battle Master track.

Each [Scene], you have a number of Superiority Dice available per based on the highest circle you have in Battle Master:

  • 1st – 16
  • 2nd – 36
  • 3rd – 52
  • 4th – 64
  • 5th – 80
  • 6th – 90
  • 7th – 100

You gain an additional Superiority Die whenever you kill an enemy of level one less than, equal to or higher than yours, and you gain an additional two Superiority Dice whenever your party defeats in combat a group of opponents who are Level Appropriate (as determined by the GM).

1st Circle – But the LearnerEX: Your Superiority Dice are d6s. When you make an attack action, you may spend a number of Superiority Dice up to one more than the number of circles you have in this track. If you do, you add those dice as a [Precision] bonus to all damage rolls you make for that attack action.

At any time on your turn, you may spend any number of Superiority Dice to roll them. You heal a number of hit points equal to twice the result of the roll.

2nd Circle – Super JuniorEX: While rolling Initiative you may spend a Superiority Die to add it to your result.

At any time you may spend a Superiority Die to learn a fact about an opponent you can see as if you made a successful Knowledge check against them and could ask a question. For each of these facts you gain this way, you gain a +1 bonus to saves against abilities or combat manoeuvres used by that opponent, up to a maximum of +3.

3rd Circle – Superiority ComplexEX: When you make an attack during an attack action, you may spend a Superiority Die to instead use a Combat Manoeuvre that you can normally use with a standard action.

4th Circle – Pieces of EightEX: Your Superiority Dice are now d8s. When you make an attack roll, you may spend one of your Superiority Dice to roll it, and add the result to your attack roll. You must do this before seeing the result of the roll.

5th Circle – The Supreme BeingEX: When you make a physical or interaction skill check in combat, you may spend one of your Superiority Dice to roll it, and add the result to the skill check. You may also spend an additional Superiority Dice to use the bonus of any of your physical skills instead of the relevant skill bonus.

6th Circle – Top TenEX: Your Superiority Dice are now d10s. Whenever you spend a Die for an effect which doesn’t involve rolling it (e.g. the learning a fact from 2nd circle or changing an attack into a manoeuvre from 4th circle), roll it and add the result to your next damage roll which isn’t using the 1st circle ability.

7th Circle – Now the MasterEX: Twice per [Scene], as a free action, you may have your Superiority Dice become d20s until the end of your next turn.

3.10.2 War Master

War Masters grant their knowledge to their allies, co-ordinating them and granting them benefits in their battle from split-second tactical decisions and directions as long as they are close by.

1st Circle – War, Huh?EX: All allies that start an [Encounter] within your [Close] range gain a bonus to initiative equal to the number of circles you have in this track.

2nd Circle – Into the Danger ZoneEX: Once per [Encounter], if you make a Fortitude or Will save against an effect that would normally have a lesser effect on a successful save (such as a spell with a save of “Fortitude half”), you may choose to use this ability. If you do, and make a successful save, instead ignore the effect entirely, and grant this ability to one ally within [Close] range (they can use it once this [Encounter], and if successful grant it to another ally).

3rd Circle – Special OrdersEX: Once per [Round], as a swift action, grant an ally in [Close] range a +3 bonus to attack rolls or AC until the start of your next turn.

4th Circle – Phalanx FormationEX: Any allies within your [Close] range adjacent to an ally and adjacent to that ally on the initiative order gain [Resistance] to damage.

5th Circle – Master of TacticsEX: Twice per [Encounter] as an immediate action you may give orders to one ally who is not you in your [Close] range. Move that ally’s place in the initiative order to straight after yours.

6th Circle – Tetsudo FormationEX: Any allies within your [Close] range who are adjacent to an ally and adjacent to that ally on the initiative order cannot be targeted by ranged attack rolls.

7th Circle – It Never ChangesEX: You start the [Encounter] granting a +1 bonus to attack rolls, AC and saving throws for all allies within your [Close] range. At the start of each [Round] of combat, roll a d4. If the result is higher than the current bonus you have from this ability, add 1 to the bonus. Once the bonus is at 4, you start to roll d8s. Once the bonus is at 8, you start to roll d20s.

3.10.3 Weapon Master

Weapon Master gives you access to a variety of new combat manoeuvres. Unless otherwise stated, they are used at will as normal by making a single melee attack as a standard action, and abilities that allow you to make a Trip, Disarm or Grapple manoeuvre in place of an attack, or have any other effect related to combat manoeuvres work for these manoeuvres.

All manoeuvres gained with Weapon Master are linked to a weapon property. They can only be used while wielding a weapon with the linked property, and the attack for the manoeuvre must be made with a weapon with that property.

1st Circle – On ManoeuvresEX: You learn two Apprentice manoeuvres.

The DC of saves against the effects of your manoeuvres, or to escape the [Grappled] or [Pinned] condition when you inflict it, is 11 + ½ your level + your KOM. This increases to 12 + ½ your level + your KOM when you gain your 4th circle in this track, and to 13 when you gain your 6th circle.

2nd Circle – An Absolute WeaponEX: You learn two Apprentice manoeuvres.

You roll damage dice for all weapons as though they are [Brutal] 2. When you gain your 4th crcle in Weapon Master, you now roll damage dice for all weapons as though they are [Brutal] 3.

3rd Circle - … Interesting ManoeuvreEX: You learn one Journeyman and one Apprentice manoeuvre. When you learn a Journeyman manoeuvre, you may instead learn two Apprentice manoeuvres.

4th Circle – A Storm of SwordsEX: You learn two Journeyman manoeuvres.

The first time each [Round] you hit with an attack made as part of a combat manoeuvre, you may make an immediate additional combat manoeuvre attack. As part of the attack, you may freely switch the weapon you are wielding without provoking attacks of opportunity. This attack counts as a [Bonus attack].

5th Circle – I Can Do This All DayEX: You learn one Master and one Journeyman manoeuvre. Whenever you learn a Master manoeuvre you may instead learn two Journeyman manoeuvres.

You gain [Fast healing] equal to twice the number of unique combat manoeuvres you have used in the [Encounter].

6th Circle – TaskmasterEX: You learn one Master and two Journeyman manoeuvres. When you use A Storm of Swords, you may make a third combat manoeuvre attack as part of the same [Bonus attack] action.

7th Circle – General KenobiEX: You learn three manoeuvres of any rank.

You cannot be hit by melee or ranged attack rolls made by creatures who you have hit with at least six combat manoeuvre attacks in this [Encounter] and have missed with no combat manoeuvre attacks this [Encounter].

3.10.3.1 Weapon Master Manoeuvres

3.10.3.1.1 Apprentice
  • Shield Break [Magnum]: On a hit, the target opponent loses all deflection bonuses to AC from shield items and weapons they are currently wielding until the end of the [Encounter]. A successful Reflex save negates this effect.
  • Whirling Advance [Scything]: When you use this manoeuvre, move up to 15 ft in a single direction, this movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Make two melee attacks at a -5 penalty, the first against an opponent in your [Melee] range at the start of your movement, and the second against a different opponent in your [Melee] range at the end of the movement.
  • Hit and Run [Reacting]: After the attack made with this manoeuvre, hit or miss, you may move up to 5 ft + 5 ft per circle you have in Weapon Master in a single direction away from the attack’s target. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
  • Sudden Switch [Quick Draw]: Rather than using a standard action to use this Manoeuvre, instead, when you hit with an attack with a weapon without [Quick Draw] and have another attack remaining in the attack action, replace your next attack with this manoeuvre. You switch to wielding a weapon with [Quick Draw] and make a melee attack which treats the target as [Flat-footed].
  • Clearance Strike [Devastating]: On a hit, the target opponent is pushed away from you by 5 ft. You may choose to give up any amount of your movement for the turn. For every 10 ft you give up, the opponent is pushed away a further 5 ft (up to a maximum of 10 ft + 5 ft per circle you have in Weapon Master). A successful Reflex save negates the movement, and the movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
  • Fray [Traumatising]: On a hit, the target starts [Bleeding]. If the target is already [Bleeding], double the number of turns they count as having been [Bleeding] in a row. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.
  • Full Blast [Point-blank]: Use this manoeuvre only against an opponent in your [Melee] range when you are in the target opponent’s [Melee] range. This attack does not provoke attacks of opportunity, and on a hit the opponent is pushed away from you a number of ft equal to the damage done rounded down to the next 5 (up to a maximum of 10 ft + 5 ft per circle you have in Weapon Master). A successful Reflex save negates the movement, and the movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
  • Arcing Throw [Thrown]: Choose two opponents 20 ft or further away from you who are the same distance from you. Make a ranged attack roll and compare it to both opponents’ AC. The attack hits either opponent whose AC is less than the attack roll’s result, but on-hit effects (including critical hits) are only applied once to an opponent of your choice.
  • Yeoman’s Disarm [Distant]: Use this manoeuvre only against an opponent in your [Melee] range when you are in the target opponent’s [Melee] range. This works as a Disarm attempt, using a melee attack roll, which does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
  • Attack Its Weak Point [Flanking]: If the attack roll made with this manoeuvre benefits from the [Flanking] property’s bonus to attack rolls, the attack scores a critical hit on the next two numbers down it would not ordinarily score a critical hit with (e.g., normally it will score a critical hit on an 18-20, but if you have To Iron Married it will score on a 16-20).
  • Net Capture [Trapping]: Make a ranged attack roll against an opponent within 10 ft + 5 ft per circle you have in Weapon Master (even if this is with a melee weapon – it provokes attacks of opportunity as normal). On a hit, it deals no damage, but instead the target must make a Reflex save or be unable to move until it uses a move action to escape the trap. This action provokes an attack of opportunity.
  • Interference [Impeding]: On a hit, the target cannot take partial move actions until the start of your next turn. A Will save negates this effect.
3.10.3.1.2 Journeyman
  • Tower Shield [Guardian]: Instead of being made with a standard action and an attack roll, use this manoeuvre with a move action while wielding a [Guardian] weapon. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a +4 bonus to AC and the first on-hit effect that would affect you has no effect. You cannot change the weapon you are wielding away from the weapon you wielded while using this manoeuvre until the start of your next turn. If any effect, such as a Disarm, causes you to no longer be wielding the weapon, you cease to benefit from the effects of this manoeuvre.
