  • Surge of Blades [Swarm]: Make an attack with the [Volley] descriptor targeting all opponents in a 10 ft cone originating from you. The attack deals only your weapon’s base damage, but any opponents it misses take damage from the [Swarm] property as normal.
  • Fencer’s Foil [Parrying]: When you use this manoeuvre, use a standard action but make no attack roll. Instead, when you next use the effect of the [Parrying] property, make a damage roll as if you had just hit the attacking creature with your wielded weapon, but do not add any [Precision] damage or bonuses to damage rolls you have from non-permanent effects. Subtract the result from the damage done by the attack you are parrying, any excess damage is dealt to the attacker, and bypasses [Damage reduction] and [Resistance]. You cannot change the weapon you are wielding away from the weapon you wielded while using this manoeuvre until the start of your next turn. If any effect, such as a Disarm, causes you to no longer be wielding the weapon, you cease to benefit from the effects of this manoeuvre.
  • Wall of Blades [Reach]: When you use this manoeuvre, use a standard action but make no attack roll. Until the start of your next turn, you may make two additional attacks of opportunity. You cannot change the weapon you are wielding away from the weapon you wielded while using this manoeuvre until the start of your next turn. If any effect, such as a Disarm, causes you to no longer be wielding the weapon, you cease to benefit from the effects of this manoeuvre.
  • Drop and Slice [Hold-out]: Make an attack roll, if it misses then you may provoke an attack of opportunity and make another attack roll. If the second attack hits, a successful Reflex save causes it to instead miss.
  • Overpower [Tripping]: On a hit, this has the effect of both the Disarm and Trip manoeuvre simultaneously.
  • Tendon Slash [Disarming]: This works as the Disarm manoeuvre, but if the target fails the Reflex save they also take a penalty to damage rolls equal to your KOM until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Whack Upside the Head [Unbalancing]: On a hit, the target takes a penalty to their next attack roll equal to the damage done by this attack divided by 10 (up to a maximum of the number of circles you have in Weapon Master).
  • Rain of Arrows [Distant]: Roll two d20s and add what your ranged attack bonus would be against target opponent within range of your wielded weapon. At the start of your next turn, compare the result of those two rolls, minus 1 for every 5 ft the target creature is from where it was when you made the rolls, to that creatures AC. If they exceed the target’s AC, roll damage as if for a normal attack.
  • Expose Weakness [Rending]: On a hit, the target has [Vulnerability] to damage from your next critical hit. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.
  • A Thousand Cuts [Weakening]: Inflict [HP reduction] on the attack’s target equal to the damage done. A successful Fortitude save negates the [HP reduction].
  • Contained Storm Elemental: Instead of making an attack roll, create a 5 ft radius spread centred within your [Melee] range which lasts until the end of your next turn and roll your wielded weapon’s base damage. All other creatures ending turn in the spread take damage equal to the result (it is energy damage with the appropriate descriptor for your weapon).
3.10.3.1.3 Master
  • Overwhelming Strike [Brutal]: On a hit, the target is [Battered] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.
  • Stab and Grab [Deft]: If the attack roll hits, you can make an additional swift or partial move action this turn.
  • Impale [Barbed]: On a hit, if you cause your weapon to become embedded in your target as normal with the [Barbed] property, they start [Bleeding] and cannot remove the [Bleeding] or move while the weapon is stuck in them. If the weapon is removed while this effect is active, the action provokes and attack of opportunity and you immediately start wielding it again, and the target takes additional damage equal to the total [HP reduction] they have taken from [Bleeding] while the weapon was stuck in them.
  • Storm of Arrows [Distant]: Roll four d20s and add what your ranged attack bonus would be against target opponent within range of your wielded weapon. At the start of your turn after your next turn, compare the result of those two rolls, minus 1 for every 5 ft the target creature is from where it was when you made the rolls, to that creatures AC. If they exceed the target’s AC, roll damage as if for a normal attack.
  • Arcane Eruption [Arcane]: Instead of making an attack roll, cast magic missile, dispel magic, acid arrow or holy smite as the spells without provoking an attack of opportunity. You use your KOM in place of SAM and number of circles in Weapon Master instead of the Spellcasting track where needed.
  • Flyby Strike [Ambush]: Instead of being made with a standard action and an attack roll, use this manoeuvre as part of a move action while wielding a [Ambush] weapon when you have gained or lost [Burrowing], [Swimming], [Flying] or [Soaring] this turn. Make a single attack roll against an opponent in range of your wielded weapon at any point during the movement, on a hit this deals your weapon’s base damage and does not inflict any on-hit effects.
  • Cave In [Sundering]: On a hit, the target loses any item bonuses to AC they are currently benefitting from for the rest of the [Encounter], and you can dispel one magical effect either enchanting a set of armour or shield they are wearing, or of 2nd level or lower affecting that target. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.

4 Races

4.1 Arthropod

Table 4.1: Arthropod Race
Type [Animal] or [Aberration]
Size Any
Str +2
Dex +2
Cha -2
Skill Bonus Acrobatics
Vision [Ghostwise sight] 45 ft
Bonus Feat Option 1 Feign Death
Bonus Feat Option 2 Recon
Bonus Feat Option 3 Reaver
Table 4.1: Arthropod Class
HP 10
Skills 5
BAB Good
Good Saves Reflex and either Fort or Will
KOM Str
KDM Dex

Many creatures in the world have insectile qualities, from your bog-standard giant spiders, to magical beasts like Ankhegs and Gravinids, to arthropod aberrations like the Zerin of Pacha’ley. What these chitinous creatures all have in common is a variety of insidious abilities using their mandibles, tendrils, and poisonous fangs – a few, particularly the Zerin possess a hive mind and the ability to spread corruption across the ground.

1st Circle – Decrepit Birth: Choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • EntrapmentEX: As a move action, you may create a wedge with a length of 20 ft plus 10 ft per circle of this track you possess that inflicts the [Entangled] condition for the rest of the [Encounter] on each opponent within the area. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Entangled] condition. As a move action, a creature may lose this condition inflicted by this ability but doing so provokes an attack of opportunity. In addition, you gain the following natural weapon:
  • Sting: [Melee], [Brutal 2], [Traumatising]
  • Jaws of LifeEX: You gain 2 additional HP per level. In addition, you gain the following natural weapon:
  • Mandibles: [Melee], [Brutal 2], [Trapping]
  • Hive MindEX: You gain a fury bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls and all save DCs equal to the number of allies you have in [Long] range with the Hive Mind ability up to a maximum of 1 + the number of circles you possess in Arthropod. In addition, you gain the following natural weapon:
  • Claws: [Melee], [Brutal], [Swarm], [Flanking]

2nd Circle – Chitonic Polymer: Choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Hard ChitinEX: You gain [Lesser resistance] to physical damage.
  • Adrenal GlandsEX: You may take 10 on Acrobatics checks regardless of circumstances, and your move speed increases by 5ft per circle you have of this track.
  • Do the CreepEX: As a move action, you may create a Creep spread out to your [Close] range, or extend a Creep spread you are within from a point in the spread, out to a radius equal to your [Close] range. Opponents treat your Creep spreads as difficult terrain, and you gain a +15 ft bonus to move speed while in a Creep spread (if you move less than 15 ft and leave the spread in a movement, you lose the rest of the bonus). Creep spreads last until the end of the [Encounter].

3rd Circle – Kekeke: Choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Fever StrikeEX: The first time each [Round] that each creature is hit with your natural weapon gained from this track, that creature becomes [Sickened] and starts [Burning] for the rest of the [Encounter]. Unlike the usual occurrence of [Burning], this condition cannot be removed with a move action. Once per [Round] on its turn, without taking an action, a creature inflicted with those conditions from this ability may make a Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM). A successful Fortitude save removes the conditions. This is a [Poison] effect.
  • Get It Off Me!EX: Any time an opponent you are grappling makes a save to use an ability, cast a spell, or remove the [Grappled] condition, they take damage equal to your level.
  • Swarm SkillEX: Once per [Encounter], as a free action, you may choose a skill which one of your allies with the Hive Mind ability in [Medium] range has trained and you do not. You treat that skill as if you have it trained until the end of the [Encounter].

4th Circle – Spread the CorruptionEX: You gain [Tremorsense] out to your [Close] range and gain your choice of either the Burrow or Fly movement mode (your choice is permanent).

5th Circle – Masticate to Dominate: Choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • RavenousEX: Whenever you hit an opponent the second time in the same [Round] with the natural weapon gained from Decrepit Birth, they gain [Vulnerability] to physical damage for one [Round].
  • SnatchingEX: You gain [Damage reduction] equal to your KOM. Once per [Round], during an attack action you may use the Grapple combat manoeuvre as a [Bonus Attack].
  • Creeping DeathEX: You can only choose this option if you chose Do the Creep at 2nd circle. Opponents in your Creep spreads take a -2 penalty to AC and saving throws. You gain [Fast healing] equal to your level while in a Creep spread. You may now have your Creep spreads last until the end of the [Scene].

6th Circle – The Blood I Bleed is Black Indeed: You gain [Immunity] to [Mind-Affecting] and [Fear] effects, as well as the in-combat use of the Intimidate skill. In addition, choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Tarentella StrikeEX: The first time each [Round] that each creature is hit with your natural weapon gained from this track, that creature becomes [Confused] for two [Rounds] and starts [Bleeding]. A successful Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Bleeding] and [Confused] conditions. This is a [Poison] effect.
  • CrushcrushcrushEX: Whenever you hit an opponent with the Pin combat manoeuvre, you deal additional damage equal to twice your level to that opponent, and that opponent becomes [Slowed] until it is no longer [Grappled]. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Slowed] condition. This save is separate from the save required to resist the Pin manoeuvre. You are also no longer [Grappled] when you perform a successful Pin combat manoeuvre.
  • Queen of BladesEX: You gain a fury bonus to attack and damage rolls against opponents that have been hit by any of your allies with the Hive Mind ability equal to the number of times they have been hit by those allies, up to a maximum of half your level. You can establish line of sight from any of your allies in [Medium] range with the Hive Mind ability. You ignore the highest [Miss chance] on any enemy that is in line of sight of at least two of your allies with Hive Mind.

7th Circle – Kekekekekekekeke: Choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Poison through Your VeinsEX: Once per [Round], as a swift action, your next hit with the natural weapon granted by this track forces your target to become [Nauseated] for the duration of the [Encounter]. Once per [Round] on its turn, without taking an action, a creature inflicted with the [Nauseated] condition from this ability may make a Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM). A successful Fortitude save removes the [Nauseated] condition. This is a [Poison] effect.
  • Wave of PlagueEX: Once per [Round], as a part of a move action, you create a wedge with a length of your [Close] range originating from you that inflicts the [Burning], [Entangled], [Slowed], and [Battered] conditions for the rest of the [Encounter] to each creature within the area. Unlike the usual occurrence of [Burning], this condition cannot be removed with a move action. At the end of its turn, a creature may make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) and take your level in damage. A successful Fortitude save ends the [Burning], [Entangled] and [Slowed] conditions.
  • Nydus NetworkEX: You may only choose this option if you chose Creeping Death at 5th circle. As a move action while in one of your Creep spreads, you may [Warp] yourself and any number of allies on that Creep spread to any space of your choice on any of your Creep spreads. Any creatures warped this way gain temporary HP equal to twice their level and a +2 bonus to d20 rolls until the end of their next turn. If this starts a Surprise Round, creatures warped this way may take a whole turn instead of a single action. You may also now have your Creep spreads last indefinitely.

4.2 Azurin

Table 4.2: Azurin Race
Type [Humanoid]
Size Average
Any Stat +2
Skill bonus Choose any
Special +1 Power Point per level
Bonus Feat Option 1 Nature’s Grace
Bonus Feat Option 2 Know a Guy
Bonus Feat Option 3 Open Lesser Binding

On the continent of Kamigawa, the Psionic, reptilian Mishtai were almost completely wiped out in some unknown catastrophe over a milennium ago. In their place rose the three ‘Mishtaic’ races, of which the Azurin are by far the most populous, and the dominant race of the Azujin Dynasties. They appear just like a Kamigawan Human except for their striking blue eyes, which indicate their latent psionic power. This is used by most Azurin to wield Incarnum magic, coalescing the spirits of their ancestors into psionic constructs which they wear on their bodies.

Note: While they are different races, the Azurin should also be used to represent the Gjota, a reclusive red-haired and pale-skinned Psionic people from the Jodan mountains of the Silclavan Commonwealth.

4.3 Behemoth

Table 4.3: Behemoth Race
Type [Animal], [Magical Beast] or [Aberration]
Size [Huge]
Str +2
Base Speed 40
Skill Bonus Athletics
Special A Behemoth occupies a 10 ft by 10 ft square at 1st circle, a 15 ft by 15 ft square when they reach 4th circle, and a 20 ft by 20 ft square when they reach 7th circle.
Bonus Feat Option 1 Wake
Bonus Feat Option 2 Towering
Bonus Feat Option 3 Slow and Steady
Table 4.3: Behemoth Class
HP 12
Skills 4
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Str
KDM Con

Some monsters are just really big. This is a track for when you want a really big monster. Player discretion is advised.

1st Circle – Large and In ChargeEX: You gain two natural weapons. These may be either melee or ranged, and have three weapon properties of your choice except for [Arcane], [Barbed], [Hold-out] and [Quick-draw]. You also gain one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Big Swings: Once per [Encounter] you may make a melee attack out to [Close] range. You can use this an additional time per [Encounter] per four levels you have.
  • So Fisticated: All of your natural attacks (including your Unarmed Strike) gain the [Brutal] property. If your natural weapon already has [Brutal 3], you may choose any one weapon property to add to it, except for [Arcane], [Barbed], [Hold-out], and [Quick-draw].

2nd Circle – Exposed to RadiationEX: You gain a bonus to damage rolls on attacks with your natural weapons equal to the number of circles you possess in this track. As a swift action or as part of a move action you may stomp on a [Large] or smaller creature within your [Melee] range. This deals damage equal to your level and knocks the target [Prone]. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) negates the [Prone] condition. When you gain your 5th circle in Behemoth, any creature damaged by a stomp may not move until they use a swift action to unbury themselves from the ground.

3rd Circle – Long Arm of WrathEX: You gain a bonus to your [Melee] and [Close] ranges equal to 5 times the number of circles you possess in Behemoth, and a bonus to your [Medium], [Long] and [Extreme] ranges equal to 10 times the number of circles you possess in Behemoth.

4th Circle – 2500 Tons of AwesomeEX: You gain [Lesser resistance] to physical damage and [Fast healing] equal to your KDM.

5th Circle – Category FiveEX: Twice per [Round], when you move out of a space, all opponents within your [Melee] range when you were in that space take damage equal to your character level + your KOM and are [Knocked down]. A Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) negates the [Knocked down] condition.

6th Circle – Attack on TitanEX: You gain [Lesser resistance] to energy and magic damage and [Immunity] to [Battered]. Additionally, the [Fast healing] you gain from 2500 Tons of Awesome increases to equal your character level, and your [Lesser resistance] to physical damage increases to [Resistance] to physical damage.

7th Circle – King of the MonstersEX: Whenever you hit a creature with an attack using a natural weapon, if it’s the first time you’ve hit that creature with an attack using a natural weapon this [Round], that creature falls [Prone]. A successful Reflex save (DC 10 + ½ character level + you Con) negates the [Prone] condition. Additionally, once per [Round] and a total of twice per [Encounter] as a swift action or part of a move action, you can deal damage equal to three times your level to all opponents in your [Melee] range, damage equal to twice your level to all opponents in your [Close] range, and damage equal to your level to all opponents in your [Medium] range. This damage is not cumulative. Creatures damaged by this ability fall [Prone].

4.4 Beholder

Table 4.4: Beholder Race
Type [Aberration]
Size [Small] or [Large]
Wis +4
Int +4
Str -4
Cha -2
Vision [Darkvision]
Vision [Ghostwise sight]
Special [Immunity] to [Ground] effect
Bonus Feat Option 1 Danger Sense
Table 4.4: Beholder Class
HP 12
Skills 6
BAB Poor
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Int
KDM Wis

Beholders are enigmatic aberrations consisting of a central single-eyed face and various stalks with smaller eyes. The large eye disrupts magic each of the smaller eyes can fire a beam of energy with various magical effects, which are both chaotic and incredibly powerful. The powers of Beholders are also replicated by some chaos mages who can harness a power at random and impede more predictable magics.

All saves against effects from this track have a DC of 10 + ½ your level + your KOM.

1st Circle – Grant Us EyesSU: As a free or a standard action, you may fire a beam. To fire a beam roll a d10 and use the Quick effect of the appropriate beam if you used a free action, or the Focused effect if you used a standard action. After you have rolled, you may choose a target creature in [Medium] range to be the target. You may only fire a beam as a free action once per [Round]. This increases to twice per [Round] at 4th circle. Effects from different beams do not stack.

  • 1 – Fear
    • Quick: The target takes a -1 penalty to all d20 rolls for one [Round].
    • Focused: The target gains 2 points on the Fear Ladder (equivalent to being made [Shaken]). At 3rd circle this increases to 3 points (equivalent to being made [Frightened]). At 5th circle this increases to 4 points (this and being made [Frightened] causes [Panicked]).
  • 2 – Levitate
    • Quick: The target takes a -10 penalty to movement speed for one [Round].
    • Focused: The target must make a Reflex save or take damage equal to your KOM (this increases to twice your KOM at 3rd circle, three times at 5th circle, and four times at 7th circle) and have the weapon they are wielding disarmed. At 4th circle this also causes the target to lose any of the [Flying], [Swimming] or [Burrowing] conditions they have. A successful Reflex save halves the damage and negates the additional effects.
  • 3 – Wound
    • Quick: The target takes energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to your KOM.
    • Focused: The target takes 1d6 damage + 1d6 damage per your level + your KOM. A successful Will save halves this damage.
  • 4 – Enervate
    • Quick: The target is [Fatigued] for one [Round].
    • Focused: The target is [Exhausted] until the end of the [Encounter]. At 3rd circle they are also [Energy drained] a number of times equal to the number of circles you have above 2nd in Beholder. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.
  • 5 – Sleep
    • Quick: The target takes a -2 penalty to saves and to the DCs of saves against their own abilities for one [Round].
    • Focused: The target is [Slowed] for two [Rounds]. At 3rd circle they instead become [Helpless] until they are targeted by an offensive action (or an ally uses a standard action while adjacent to them to shake them awake). At 5th circle they can’t be woken by an ally with a standard action. A successful Will save negates this effect, and a [Helpless] creature can attempt the save again at the end of each of their turns.
  • 6 – Charm
    • Quick: The target takes a -2 penalty to saves and to the DCs of saves against their own abilities for one [Round].
    • Focused: The target is Charmed, a Will save negates this effect. The creature cannot use an offensive action against you or an ally, after the first [Round] of being charmed, when it would use an offensive action, it must make a Will save. A successful Will allows it to use that offensive action as normal and renders the creature no longer charmed; a failed save means it cannot use an offensive action against you or your allies for one [Round]. The creature remains charmed until you or an ally use an offensive action against it. At 5th circle you can also use a swift action to direct the Charmed creature to use a swift or move action of your choice, or a standard action to direct the Charmed creature to use a standard action of your choice.
  • 7 – Slow
    • Quick: The target takes a -10 penalty to movement speed for one [Round]
    • Focused: The target is [Slowed] for two [Rounds]. At 3rd circle this increases to three [Rounds] and their movement speed is halved. At 5th circle they also cannot take swift or immediate actions while [Slowed]. A successful Will save negates this effect.
  • 8 – Disintegrate
    • Quick: The target takes magical damage which ignores any [Resistance] equal to your KOM.
    • Focused: The target takes 1d10 magical damage per your level plus your KOM which ignores any [Resistance]. Any creature killed by this damage cannot be revived by a Medicine check. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage and prevents it from reducing the target below 1 HP.
  • 9 – Petrify
    • Quick: The target takes a -10 penalty to speed and a -1 penalty to all d20 rolls for one [Round].
    • Focused: The target is [Entangled] until the end of the [Encounter]. At 4th circle if this targets an already [Entangled] creature they are [Petrified] until the end of the [Encounter] instead. At 6th circle the target is always [Petrified] until the end of the [Encounter]. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.
  • 10 – Death
    • Quick: The target takes energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to your KOM and takes a -2 penalty to saves and to the DCs of saves against their own abilities for one [Round].
    • Focused: The target takes energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to eight times your level. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage and prevents the target from being reduced below 1 HP by this damage. This is a [Death] effect.

2nd Circle – Got My Eye On YouSU: At the end of your turn, designate a wedge originating from you going out to your [Medium] range. All creatures starting turn in or entering the wedge must make a Will save or be unable to use or benefit from spells, spell-like or supernatural abilities until they are no longer in the wedge.

3rd Circle – A Sight to BeholdSU: You gain the Fly movement mode. When you fire a beam as a standard action you may roll twice and choose the result you wish to use.

4th Circle – Look Upon My WorksSU: Once per [Encounter] when you fire a beam you may instead have it effect all creatures in a 5 ft wide line from you out to any space in [Medium] range, and a second line perpendicular to that one, crossing at the end, out to your [Medium] range.

5th Circle – Real Eyes See Real LiesSU: You permanently benefit from the true seeing spell. When you fire a beam as a standard action you may roll three times and choose the result you wish to use.

6th Circle – Eye of the BeholderSU: Your 2nd circle ability no longer allows a Will save, creatures in the cone simply can’t use magical abilities.

7th Circle – All Eyes On MeSU: Once per [Scene], as a standard action, fire a Focused beam of each of the ten types at a single target in [Medium] range.

4.5 Catfolk

Table 4.5: Catfolk Race
Type [Monstrous humanoid]
Size [Average]
Dex +2
Wis +2
Con -2
Base Speed 40
Bonus Feat Option 1 Breakneck Pace
Bonus Feat Option 2 Predator
Bonus Feat Option 3 Exit, Stage Left

Catfolk are a race of nomadic humanoids with slender frames, furry tails and sometimes (depending on the strain) whiskers and pointed ears. No matter what specific group, Catfolk are notable for being incredibly quick on their feet, perceptive, but also somewhat frail in comparison to the other races.

4.6 Centaur

Table 4.6: Centaur Race
Type [Monstrous humanoid]
Size Large
Str +2
Wis +2
Con -2
Skill bonus Ride
Speed bonus 5
Special Your Feat must always be used for Silver Harness, and you are always counted as being Mounted
Bonus Feat Option 1 Open Lesser Binding

Centaurs are tauric humanoids crossed with horses - i.e. they have the horso of a human attached to the torso of a horse. This gives them the strength of a horse but also its fraility. Centaurs are renowned for being wise sages of the forest, thanks to being adopted as one of the Sylvan races. However, their origin as an experiment of Baphomet’s means they are always teetering on the edge of savagery.

4.7 Daemon

Table 4.7: Daemon Race
Type [Outsider]
Size [Average]
Cha +2
Vision [Darkvision]
Lesser resistance [Acid]
Bonus Feat Option 1 Troubleshooter
Bonus Feat Option 2 Words of Power
Bonus Feat Option 3 The Earth Cracks
Table 4.7: Daemon Class
HP 8
Skills 6
BAB Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Cha
KDM Str

Demons and Devils are beings with agendas, whether to subjugate the world or throw it into chaos. Yugoloths of Hades and the natural Daemons of Gehenna and Carceri are not so fettered by these ideals. They are beings of pure self-interested malice, wielding the powers of purest evil, greed and pride, lust and envy, wrath and sloth.

1st Circle – AvaritiaEX: You gain an additional Lesser Item slot. When you gain your 4th circle in Daemon, this becomes an additional Greater Item slot. When you gain your 6th circle in Daemon, this becomes an additional Relic Item slot. You also gain the following natural weapon:

  • Hate Blade: [Melee], [Brutal 2], [Sundering]

2nd Circle – IraSU: You deal bonus energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor on all attacks equal to the number of circles you possess in Daemon. When you make an offensive action against a creature that has targeted you with an offensive action in the previous [Round], you may treat all [Resistance] and [Damage reduction] that creature has as 2 points lower per your level.

3rd Circle – SuperbiaSU: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Wings of Hate: You gain the Fly movement mode
  • Malicious Visions: Once per [Round], as a swift action, you may gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls or AC for one [Round].

4th Circle – GulaEX: Your armour’s item bonus to AC is increased by 1. Your deflection bonus to AC from a magic item or a weapon with the [Guardian] weapon property is increased by 1. Your weapon’s item bo¬nus to attack rolls is increased by 1 (it gains a +1 item bonus to attack rolls if it had no such bonus). Any bonuses you gain to skills or saving throws increase by 1 (after the total bonus is calculated). Whenever you heal HP, you heal 5 additional HP.

5th Circle – LuxuriaSU: Once per [Encounter], as a move action while you have an unused swift action you may attempt to steal a swift action from a creature in [Close] range. They must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or lose one swift action next [Round], and you gain an additional swift action this [Round]. This ability cannot be reacted to with an immediate action.

Once per [Encounter], as a standard action while you have an unused move action you may attempt to steal a move action from a creature in [Close] range. They must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or lose one move action next [Round], and you gain an additional move action this [Round].

Once per [Encounter], as a full-round action you may attempt to steal a standard action from a creature in [Close] range. They must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or lose one standard action next [Round], and you gain an additional standard action next [Round].

6th Circle – InvidiaSU: Three times per [Scene] as an immediate action, create a spread out to your [Medium] range which lasts for one [Round]. All healing in that spread instead deals damage equal to the amount it would heal that ignores [Damage reduction] and [Resistance]. You may choose not to benefit from any effects that heal you, but no other creature in the spread may.

7th Circle – AcediaSU: You gain [Immunity] to [Dazed], [Stunned], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Blown Away], [Fear] effects and [Binding] effects.

4.8 Devil

Table 4.8: Devil Race
Type [Outsider]
Size [Average] or [Large]
Int +2
Vision [Darkvision]
Lesser resistance [Cold]
Bonus Feat Option 1 Arcane Magister
Bonus Feat Option 2 Words of Power
Bonus Feat Option 3 The Earth Cracks
Table 4.8: Devil Class
HP 8
Skills 6
BAB Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Int
KDM Str

Like Demons, Devils are creatures of the lower planes, beings of pure Evil. However, where Demons thrive in chaos, madness and slaughter, Devils are subtle beings, lawful and reserved. Devils make long plans and wait years for them to come to fruition while silently pulling the strings, but can use a variety of evil magics in battle, particularly Hellrime, a diabolic ice which they use to freeze foes in battle, taking a more offensive approach to defence than the heavily armoured Demons.

1st Circle – Seek and DestroyEX: You gain a +3 bonus to Perception checks and Awareness, and may use your Intelligence instead of Wisdom to calculate your bonuses to Awareness and Perception.

2nd Circle – Second and SebringSU: Your movement speed increases by 10 ft and as part of a move action you may add the [Teleport] descriptor to all your movement for one [Round]. When you gain your 4th circle in Devil, instead add the [Teleport] descriptor to all movement you make.

3rd Circle – Psychosocial: Select one of the following abilities (the choice is permanent):

  • Fell FlightEX: You gain the Fly movement mode.
  • Visions of RevengeSU: Once per [Round] you may gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls or to AC for one [Round].

4th Circle – That One Brooding Warning: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Cold Hate, Warm BloodSU: When you hit with an attack, or deal damage to with a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability, an opponent who dealt damage to you in the last [Round], you inflict additional energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to your level.
  • Under the IceSLA: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you can encase a creature within [Medium] range in bonds of ice. The creature must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or be [Paralyzed]. On a successful save, the extreme cold disrupts the creature’s nervous system nonetheless, leaving it [Sickened] for two [Rounds].

5th Circle – Raining Blood: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Circle of the TyrantsSU: Anyone within [Close] range who damages you takes energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to your level and must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or be [Slowed] for one [Round]. A creature may only be affected by this ability once per [Round].
  • Where Cold Winds BlowSU: As part of a move action, you may lash an enemy within [Medium] range with icy chains. Your target takes energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to twice your level + your KOM and its movement speed is halved for two [Rounds].

6th Circle – Number of the Beast: Select one of the following abilities (the choice is permanent):

  • Where Death Seems to DwellSU: The first time each [Round] you hit an opponent with an attack, they are [Dazed] and [Battered] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Dazed].
  • BlackenedSU: The first time each [Round] each opponent is affected by one of your spell, spell-like or supernatural abilities they must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or gain [Vulnerability] to all damage for 1 [Round].

7th Circle – Keeper of the Seven KeysSU: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you can condemn a creature within [Medium] range to the punishment it truly deserves. The creature immediately takes damage equal to three times your level and must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or be [Petrified]. Every time the creature fails a Fortitude save against the [Petrified] condition, it takes damage equal to your level + KOM.

4.9 Divine Beast

Table 4.9: Divine Beast Race
Type [Magical beast]
Size [Average]
Cha +2
Save bonus Will
Skill bonus Medicine
Bonus Feat Option 1 Chatty Bugger
Bonus Feat Option 2 Lightbender Adept
Bonus Feat Option 3 To Iron Married
Table 4.9: Divine Beast Class
HP 8
Skills 7
BAB Good
Good Saves Will and either Fort or Ref
KOM Cha
KDM Wis

Most creatures in the world are grotesque, feral, sadistic or just in some way unpleasant. A blessed few, though, are bastions of the divine and the good. What magic these Divine Beasts have is used to cleanse evil and support their friends, and to allow them to keep purity in a world so often ravaged by darkness and terror.

1st Circle – LancerEX: You gain the Avenging Spear natural weapon, which is a [Melee] weapon with the [Reach] property and two other properties of your choice other than [Barbed], [Hold-out], and [Quick-draw]. In addition, whenever you succeed on an in-combat use of an Interaction skill, you add bonus [Precision] damage equal to 1d6 per circle of Divine Beast you have access to on attacks made against opponents affected by your skill check for one [Round].

2nd Circle – Lessons of LifeEX: You gain one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Impale: You may spend a move action to double your critical threat range for one [Round]. This effect does not stack with abilities from other tracks that increase your critical threat range.
  • Insight: You gain [Tremorsense] out to [Close] range

3rd Circle – Tread in StarlightSLA: You gain access to the following spells as spell-like abilities: searing light and cure serious wounds (standard version only). Each is usable twice per [Encounter] as a standard action.

4th Circle – In Good GraceSU: All conditions and [Binding] effects have their durations reduced by one [Round] when affecting you, to a minimum of 1 [Round]. If a condition would normally persist for an [Encounter], it instead lasts eight [Rounds]. If a condition would normally persist for a [Scene], it instead lasts for the [Encounter]. If a condition would normally persist for a [Quest], it instead lasts for the [Scene]. Permanent conditions are unaltered.

5th Circle – Purge the UncleanEX: Any opponent within your [Melee] range at the beginning of your turn takes damage equal to your KOM. You may use the Bull Rush combat manoeuvre as a free action against an adjacent opponent damaged by this ability once per [Round]. This does not provoke an attack of opportunity.

6th Circle – EmbodimentSU: You gain [Lesser resistance] to all damage. In addition, once per [Encounter] as a move action, you can cast the spell adamant skin on yourself as a spell-like ability.

7th Circle – Power of InnocenceSU: Once per [Scene], when you are killed or rendered [Unconscious], your incapacitation triggers an explosion of light in a burst, dealing 1d6 damage per level plus your KOM to all opponents within [Medium] range and inflicting [Blinded] for two [Rounds]. A Reflex save (DC 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) halves the damage and negates the [Blinded] condition. One [Round] after this explosion, you are revived at half your maximum HP.

4.10 Dragonborn

Table 4.10: Dragonborn Race
Special Transformative Race
Type Change to [Dragon]
Size Doesn’t change
Dex -2
Any non-Dex Stat +2
Bonus Feat Option 1 Dragonbreath
Bonus Feat Option 2 Wings of War
Bonus Feat Option 3 Ghost Hunter

Through a lengthy process, any humanoid may construct a cocoon of dragon scales and, in a ritual of devotion to a Dragon deity, enter to cocoon. After an incubation time ranging from a few days to a month, the humanoid emerges, now with cold blood, scales of their patron’s colour, a tail, a slitted nose, and either a Dragon’s powerful senses, their elemental breath, or a pair of leathery wings. Dragonborn retain their original characteristics, personality, and everything else except for what specifically changes, however, many use the transformation as a chance for a fresh start in life in service to the Dragons.

4.11 Elan

Table 4.11: Elan Race
Special Transformative Race
Type Change to [Aberration]
Size Doesn’t change
Str -2
Con +2
Special +1 Power Point per level
Special -1 to all saves
Special Upon becoming an Elan, you may immediately (and freely) multiclass into any track that grants Powers or Psi-Like Abilities

Through forming a symbiotic bond with an Abyrite parasite, a human can become an Elan (or by being born to two Elan with a parasite fully formed), a normal-looking humanoid whose hair is replaced by a dreadlock-like structure which is actually the body of a parasite which reinforces the body while draining some of its strength and psionic energy, providing its own reserve of Power in return. The Elan have notably largely displaced humans on Pacha’ley.

4.12 Elemental

Table 4.12: Elemental Race
Type [Primordial]
Size Any
Con +2
Vision [Ghostwise sight] 45 ft
Skill bonus Geography
Bonus Feat Option 1 By Will Sustained
Bonus Feat Option 2 Senseshift Adept
Bonus Feat Option 3 Weaponised

For Racial class, choose Fire, Water, Air or Earth. Fire Elementals can use the Fire Elemental, Plasma Elemental or Magma Elemental track. Water Elementals can use the Water Elemental, Frost Elemental or Terraforming (Mud Elemental) track. Air Elementals can use the Air Elemental, Plasma Elemental or Frost Elemental track. Earth Elementals can use the Earth Elemental, Magma Elemental or Terraforming (Mud Elemental) track.

Table 4.13: Fire Elemental Class
HP 12
Skills 6
BAB Poor
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Cha
KDM Con
Table 4.13: Water Elemental Class
HP 10
Skills 4
BAB Poor
Good Saves Fort, Ref and Will
KOM Str
KDM Con
Table 4.13: Air Elemental Class
HP 8
Skills 6
BAB Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Con
KDM Dex
Table 4.13: Earth Elemental Class
HP 14
Skills Athletics, Vigour, Geography and one other
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Str
KDM Con

4.12.1 Frost Elemental

At an intersection of the Planes of Water and Air is the Demiplane of Frost. Beings from this plane can exert their inner cold to freeze water in the air, and then control that ice to slowly drain the heat and life from other creatures. Many other creatures of ice share these same powers, and cryomancer mages can also learn the replicate them.

Frost Elementals use a stackable condition called [Frostbite]. Creatures with the [Frostbite] condition take 1d4 damage every [Round] for each stack of [Frostbite] they possess at the end of their turns. The damage is not subject to [Damage reduction] or [Resistance]. This condition lasts for 2 [Rounds] and the duration resets each time the condition is inflicted. Creatures may spend a move action to remove all [Frostbite] stacks from themselves or a creature within [Melee] range, but doing so provokes attacks of opportunity. Any magical effect that ends the [Burning] condition may also end the [Frostbite] condition.

1st Circle – Winter is ComingEX: You gain the Frozen Heart natural weapon. This is a [Melee] weapon with the [Elemental (Cold)] weapon property and 2 other weapon properties of your choice (except [Barbed] and [Hold-out]. Each time you successfully hit an opponent with your Frozen Heart natural weapon you cause that target to gain a stack of [Frostbite]. You may inflict a maximum number of stacks of [Frostbite] equal to your KOM this way to a single opponent in a [Round]. You also gain the following ability:

  • Cold Never Bothered Me AnywayEX: You gain [Immunity] to [Cold] and [Vulnerability] to [Fire].

2nd Circle – Kingdom of IsolationSU: Once per [Round], as a swift action, you may cause the cold to creep up all opponents within [Close] range, causing them to be [Dazzled] for one [Round] and gain a stack of [Frostbite].

3rd Circle – Frozen FractalsSU: Once per [Round], as a swift action you may choose a target single opponent within your [Close] range that possesses 2 or more stacks of [Frostbite]. The target immediately takes 1d6 points of energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor for every 2 stacks of [Frostbite] they possess, and become [Slowed] for 1 [Round]. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage, and negates the [Slowed] condition.

4th Circle – Let it GoEX: Once per [Round], you may add the [Volley] descriptor to one attack with your Frozen Heart natural weapon, this attack is applied against all opponents within a wedge originating from you with a length of 15 ft plus 5 ft per level you possess. All enemies hit with this attack gain a stack of [Frostbite].

5th Circle – The Wind is HowlingEX: Once per [Round] you may cause a target that has just gained a stack of [Frostbite] to become [Battered] for 1 [Round]. A successful Fortitude save negates the [Battered] condition. This ability does not require an action.

6th Circle - Absolutely Zero HopeSU: Twice per [Encounter], as a move action, you may cause all the abilities from this track that inflict one stack of [Frostbite] to instead inflict 2 [Frostbite] stacks on targets for 1 [Round].

7th Circle – Let the Storm Rage OnSU: You may now activate Frozen Fractals as a free action, though you still may only do so once per [Round]. Once per [Encounter], as a swift action you may choose a target single opponent within your [Close] range that possesses 8 or more stacks of [Frostbite]. The target immediately takes 1d6 points of energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor for every stack of [Frostbite] they possess, and they become [Petrified] for 1 [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1⁄2 your character level + you KOM) halves the damage, and negates the [Petrified] condition.

4.12.2 Magma Elemental

At the confluence of Fire and Earth is the Demiplane of Magma, one of the most treacherous realms in the Inner Planes, full of both physical force and unbearable heat. Magma elementals, and other creatures which live in similar environments on the Material Plane, harness fiery earth in combat, and defend themselves with their intensely hot nature.

1st Circle – Magma BallSU: As a standard action, or once per [Round] by replacing an attack in an attack action, you hurl a ball of molten rock at an opponent within your [Medium] range.

Throwing a Magma Ball requires a successful ranged attack roll (this is not considered an attack with a weapon), you are considered to have a base attack bonus equal to your level for this attack. The Magma Ball deals 1d6 points of physical damage, plus additional energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to your KOM.

Whether it hits or not, the Ball explodes, dealing energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to your Con modifier to all creatures within 5 ft of the Ball’s target, and they start Burning. A successful Reflex save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) negates the [Burning] condition.

You may give up any number of additional attacks in your attack action when you throw the Magma Ball, for each one you give up, the original attack and the explosion do additional damage equal to your KOM, and the radius of the explosion increases by 5 ft.

When you gain your 3rd circle in this track, the radius of the Ball’s explosion increases to 10 ft. When you gain your 5th circle it increases to 15 ft, and to 20 ft at 7th circle.

2nd Circle – Molten ShieldEX: You gain [Immunity] to [Burning] and [Fire]. The first opponent to hit you with a melee attack each [Round] takes energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to your Con modifier. At the start of your turn, any creature you are [Grappled] by or who is [Grappled] by you takes energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to your Con modifier. Your Choke manoeuvre does additional energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to your Con modifier.

3rd Circle – Viscous SlagEX: Each time you use Magma Ball, choose one opponent in the range of the explosion. If they fail the saving throw against [Burning], they are [Slowed] for one [Round].

4th Circle – Lava TubesEX: You gain the Burrow movement mode. All damage from your Molten Shield is doubled.

5th Circle - PyroclasmSLA: Once per [Encounter] as a standard action you may cast acid fog, as the spell, except that it takes the form of a cloud of burning ash, gains the [Fire] descriptor, and deals [Fire] damage.

6th Circle – Geothermal PowerSU: Any creatures [Burning] within your [Close] range lose any [Resistances] and [Damage reduction] they have.

7th Circle – Volcanic EruptionSLA: Three times per [Scene] you may cast firestorm as the spell.

4.12.3 Plasma Elemental

At the conflux of Air and Fire is the Demiplane of Plasma, where beings of pure electrical energy roam (well actually, more zap about between clusters of charge). Their power is also replicated by electromancers and some gravity mages amongst mortals. They can charge items with electricity and shock their targets to disrupt them.

1st Circle – ShockingSU: As a free action, you can electrify a weapon you are wielding, adding the Elemental property with [Electricity] descriptor, until you stop wielding it. If it already has the Elemental property, you may instead change the descriptor to [Electricity] as a free action.

Attacks you make with weapons with the Elemental property and [Electricity] descriptor ignore item bonuses to AC.

2nd Circle – St. Elmo‘s FireSU: You gain the Jolt ability below. Also, if you would take energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor, you are instead healed for half the damage you would have taken (this counts as a form of [Immunity] for effects that ignore [Immunity]).

  • JoltSU: As a move action, you deal energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to your level to all opponents in your [Melee] range. All opponents damaged this way are [Revealed] for three [Rounds].

3rd Circle – It’s Treason, ThenSU: Any opponents damaged by Jolt are [Entangled] for 1 [Round]. A successful Reflex save (DC 10+ 1⁄2 your level + your KOM) negates the [Entangled] condition.

4th Circle – Ride the LightningSU: When activating Jolt you may have it deal damage equal to twice your level + your KOM, or instead of the normal activation, you [Teleport] to an unoccupied space within your [Medium] range, and then deal energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to your level to all creatures within your [Melee] range at the destination.

Either form of Jolt still has the [Revealed] and [Entangled] effects as normal. Also, in either case, all creatures within your [Melee] range when you started the Jolt action (even if you teleported) are [Deafened] for one [Round].

5th Circle - MagnetoSU: As a standard action, you may move an unsecured object with a weight of up to 2000 pounds within your [Medium] range, to anywhere else within your [Medium] range if no squares are occupied in their destination areas. You may not use this ability to move a creature that is not [Dead], a creature‘s equipment, or a mount with at least one occupant. This weight limit stacks with the feats Telekinetic Scion and Telekinetic Master. You also gain the following ability:

  • FerromagnetismSU: Once per [Round] as an immediate action you may cause a creature within your [Close] range to attract or repel objects, granting them either a +3 bonus to attack rolls or to AC for one [Round].

6th Circle – Very, Very FrighteningSU: When you use Jolt, you now use both options, both doing twice level + KOM damage at the origination point, and then teleporting out to [Medium] range and doing damage at your destination. All creatures in a straight line between your starting point and destination take energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to your level, are [Revealed] for three [Rounds], and [Deafened] for one [Round].

7th Circle – Unlimited Power!SU: Once per [Scene] as a free action and a [Surge] effect, you can supercharge your next use of Jolt causing it to deal an additional [Electricity] damage equal to twice your level, and cause all creatures damaged by it to become [Battered] for 3 [Rounds] and [Paralyzed]. A successful Fortitude save negates the [Paralyzed] condition.

4.13 Fey

Table 4.14: Fey Race
Type Fey
Size [Small] or [Average]
Dex +2
Cha +2
Con -2
Vision [Ghostwise sight] 45 ft
Skill bonus Nature
Bonus Feat Option 1 By Will Sustained
Bonus Feat Option 2 Charm
Bonus Feat Option 3 Recon
Table 4.14: Fey Class
HP 8
Skills All interaction skills and four others
BAB Poor
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Cha
KDM Dex

The Fey are spirits of nature, like Elementals and Outsiders their bodies and souls are linked, so they do not experience an afterlife and can’t be resurrected, but also can’t be turned into Undead or have their souls manipulated. Fey are technically creatures of the Feywild, a parallel plane to the Prime Material where the world is mirrored but without the influence of civilization, where the only Sapient races are the Fey and the Dragons, all else is just nature.

True Fey come in two major types, Seelie and Unseelie. Choose one type when you gain your first circle in Fey. From 2nd circle onwards you gain the abilities of your chosen type, but at one circle you can instead gain the ability of the opposite type. Any choice is permanent.

1st Circle – Light Foot, Sharp TongueEX: All Fey are skilled in certain areas, you gain a +3 bonus to four of the following skills: Acrobatics, Larceny, Stealth, Geography, Nature, Perception, Diplomacy, Bluff, Intimidate.

2nd Circle – Mists of the FeywildSLA: You can weave the mists into illusions. Gain one of the following abilities:

  • Seelie – Into the Mists: As a standard action, twice per [Encounter], you may cast Invisibility, as the spell. When you gain your 4th circle of the Fey track, you may instead cast Greater Invisibility.
  • Unseelie – Weave the Mists: As a standard action, twice per [Encounter], you may cast Silent Image, as the spell, though it can instead create a sound, smell, or heat-based illusion. When you gain your 4th circle of the Fey track, you may instead cast Major Image.

You also gain [Lesser resistance] to energy and magic damage. This increases to [Resistance] when you gain your 4th circle in Fey, and to [Greater resistance] when you gain your 6th circle.

3rd Circle – Voice of the CourtSU: Your voice carries some authority in the Court, and with it comes power. Gain one of the following abilities:

  • Seelie – Fey Pact: A number of times per [Encounter] equal to the number of circles you possess in Fey plus 1, as a move action you may enact a bargain with any willing creature within [Close] range. One party loses HP equal to your level and you then remove up to two of the follow¬ing conditions currently affecting the creature: [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Nauseated], [Paralyzed], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], or [Stunned]. The other party then gains HP equal to twice your level.
  • Unseelie – Discordant Chant: Once per [Encounter], as a move action, you may start a chant which creates a spread out to [Close] range until the end of your next turn. Any turn after the first, you may spend a swift or move action to extend the duration until the end of the next turn. At the end of your turn, any creature in the spread takes a -1 penalty to all d20 rolls until they leave the spread. These penalties stack up to -3.

You also gain a bonus to saves against spells and spell-like abilities equal to the number of circles you have in Fey.

4th Circle – Ducal DictateSU: You gain one of the following abilities:

  • Seelie – Bountiful Geas: As a standard action, give all allies in [Close] range a target creature within [Medium] range to attack. Any ally which targets that creature with an offensive action until the start of your next turn can choose to gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and a +3 bonus to AC for one [Round].
  • Unseelie – Exacerbate Pain: As a standard action, you may worsen any conditions being suffered by creatures in a 10 ft radius spread centred within [Medium] range. Any creature which is [Dazzled] becomes [Blinded]; [Entangled] becomes [Slowed] and [Slowed] becomes [Paralyzed]; [Fatigued] becomes [Exhausted]; [Sickened] becomes [Nauseated]; any creature suffering a [Fear] effect has their fear level increased by 3; and any creature suffering [Energy drained] gains an additional stack of [Energy drained]. A successful Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

You also ignore all effects which would prevent you from using a movement mode or from using [Teleport] or [Warp] movement abilities.

5th Circle – Whim of NatureSLA: Your powers can warp the natural world like you can the Feywild. Gain one of the following abilities:

  • Seelie – Small Favour: Once per [Encounter], as an immediate action, you can [Warp] a single willing creature within [Medium] range to a place of your choosing within 1 mile for every circle you possess in this track. Upon being whisked away, the creature is healed 4 hit points per level.
  • Unseelie – Steal Time: Once per [Encounter], as a move action while you have an unused swift action you may attempt to steal a swift action from a creature in [Close] range. They must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or lose one swift action next [Round], and you gain an additional swift action this [Round]. This ability cannot be reacted to with an immediate action. Once per [Encounter], as a standard action while you have an unused move action you may attempt to steal a move action from a creature in [Close] range. They must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or lose one move action next [Round], and you gain an additional move action this [Round]. Once per [Encounter], as a full-round action you may attempt to steal a standard action from a creature in [Close] range. They must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or lose one standard action next [Round], and you gain an additional standard action next [Round].

You also gain [Immunity] to [Binding] and [Poison] effects.

6th Circle – Verdant MandateSU: Your powers can now sway physics itself, or inflict Geas on your foes. Gain one of the following abilities:

  • Seelie – Aura of Protection: All allies in your [Close] range gain [Immunity] to extra damage and effects from critical hits, [Dazed] and [Stunned]. Whenever an ally in [Close] range would normally take a critical hit, or be [Dazed] or [Stunned], they gain temporary HP equal to their level.
  • Unseelie – Baleful Geas: As a standard action, you may make a creature in [Close] range [Oathsworn] to you and your allies unless they make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM). While the creature is [Oathsworn], if it would take an offensive action that targets a creature it is [Oathsworn] to, that action is not taken. A successful Will save allows the creature to take the action; an unsuccessful Will save renders the creature no longer [Oathsworn].

7th Circle – Voice of the MonarchSU: Your voice now carries the authority of the ruler of your Court. Gain one of the following abilities:

  • Seelie – Word of Warning: Three times per [Scene], as a move action, you may give an ally a warning. Once during the [Scene], an ally with a warning may spend the warning as an immediate action to choose the result of the next d20 roll they make.
  • Unseelie – Word of Doom: Any ability you possess from the Fey track with a range of [Close] increases to [Medium] range. As a standard action, you may cause an enemy affected by one of your abilities from the Fey track to be [Stunned] for one [Round]. A successful Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

4.14 Genie

Table 4.15: Genie Race
Type [Outsider]
Size [Average]
Cha +2
Vision [Ghostwise sight] 45 ft
Lesser resistance Any chosen energy type
Bonus Feat Option 1 Safekeeper Magus
Bonus Feat Option 2 Words of Power
Bonus Feat Option 3 Open Lesser Binding
Table 4.15: Genie Class
HP 8
Skills 5
BAB Poor
Good Saves Any Two
KOM Cha
KDM Dex
Special Either gain Good BAB or all three saves are good

Genies are powerful and intelligent elementals, separated into the Djinn of Air, the Marids of Wind, the Dao of Earth and the Efreeti of Fire. With their intelligence and elemental abilities their powers are greater than normal elementals, and Genie Lords in fact have nearly limitless powers. However, their powers have a simple, but harsh limit – they can only use the main part of their power at the behest of another. Wishes allow them to perform particularly powerful ritual magic, but in combat they often rely on hasty wishes made by allies to immediately release their power.

Note that all abilities from this Track require an ally to use an action, but you still use the ability (and provoke attacks of opportunity for using it), so all distances and variables are based on your position and stats. To use one of your abilities, an ally must be within hearing distance of you and you must not be [Deafened]. You can be made to use each of your abilities only once until the start of your next turn.

1st Circle – Friend Like Me: You get +2 to saves against abilities which would cause [Deafened] on a failed save and the following two abilities:

  • Wish for HealthSLA: As a standard action, an ally can cause you to heal all allies within 10 + 5 ft per circle you have in Genie for 1d6 HP per your character level.
  • Elemental PortalSLA: As a move action, an ally can cause you to [Teleport] them up to 10 ft per your character level in any direction.

2nd Circle – Star Light, Star Bright: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Elemental BlastSLA: As a standard action, an ally can cause you to deal energy damage with a descriptor of your choice to all creatures in a 5 ft radius spread within your [Close] range. This deals 1d8 damage per your level, and a Will save of DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier halves the damage.
  • Genie’s CurseSLA: As a swift action, an ally can cause you to curse target enemy in your [Medium] range. A cursed enemy must make a Will save of DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier or take a penalty to damage rolls equal to your Cha modifier and to movement speed equal to five times your Cha modifier, to a minimum of half their original movement speed. This curse lasts for one [Round].

3rd Circle – A List Three Miles Long: Your bonus to saves against [Deafened] increases to +5 and you gain the following two abilities:

  • Genie’s BlessingSLA: As a swift action, an ally can cause you to grant up to two allies in your [Medium] range +2 to attack rolls, saving throws and skill checks for one [Round].
  • Elemental CoverSLA: As a move action, an ally can cause you to create a spread out to your [Close] range which lasts for one [Round]. All allies in the spread gain [Concealed] and a +3 bonus to AC.

4th Circle – Some Power in Your Corner Now: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Wish for HappinessSLA: As a move action, an ally can cause you to remove one condition from the following list from an ally in [Medium] range: [Battered], [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Confused], [Cowering], [Dazed], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Entangled ], [Exhausted ], [Fatigued ], [Frightened ], [Nauseated ], [Panicked ], [Paralyzed], [Petrified], [Shaken], [Sickened] or [Stunned].
  • Genie’s WordSLA: As a swift action, an ally can cause you to use dispel magic, as the spell (except for the casting time, obviously).

5th Circle – Heavy Ammunition in Your Hands: You gain [Immunity] to [Deafened] and the following two abilities:

  • Genie’s BaneSLA: As a swift action, an ally can cause you to make one opponent in [Medium] range [Battered] for one [Round]. A successful Will save of DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier negates [Battered].
  • Warp the WorldSLA: As a move action, an ally can cause you to create a 5 ft wide line out to your [Medium] range, originating from you. All creatures in the line must make a DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier Reflex save or be subject to your manipulation of gravity in the line.

You may choose one space in the line and have all creatures in the line move towards that space, they then fall [Prone], lose [Flying] and access to the Fly movement mode for two [Rounds] and take damage equal to twice your level.

6th Circle – Once Upon a DreamSLA: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, an ally can cause you to encase an enemy in ice or rock, or leave them suffocating in a vacuum of empty air or smoke. Target an enemy in [Close] range, the creature is [Petrified] for two [Rounds] unless it succeeds on a Will save of DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier.

7th Circle – Grant Me a Wish TonightSLA: Five times per [Scene], as a standard action, an ally can cause you to cast miracle, as the spell.

4.15 Goblinoid

Goblinoids are a distant cousin of Orcs who evolved in smaller caves and isolated marshy forests. Because their environment did not allow for large groups, the Goblinoid ancestor race never developed a social brain. Even now that Goblinoids are a fully sapient race who use tools and form small tribes with agriculture and other forms of subsistence, they still lack the ability to empathise with other beings. This makes them dangerous to… basically everyone - or at the very least a nuisance.

The abilities of Goblinoids are based around the fact that they do not play fair - the idea of ‘fair’ does not even register in a Goblinoid brain. There are three main strains of the Goblinoid species which express their abilities in different ways (and have different base statistics). If you gain the Goblinoid track without being a Goblinoid, you must choose one of these three when you gain this Track, and you gain abilities as if you were of that subrace:

  • Goblins are cunning, but their cunning is certainly of the lowest form. They are instinctually able to avoid the worst consequences of their actions, getting in cheap shots and mitigating the effects of attacks against them with a mixture of guile and (apparent) dumb luck
  • Hobgoblins may not fully recognise the fact that other creatures have a unique lived experience, but they do recognise that other beings - especially other Goblinoids - are useful, they specialise on ganging up on their opponents.
  • Bugbears, despite their size, are almost supernaturally sneaky. Their bodies are full of tense muscle, but are also somehow optimised for moving silently. They prefer to isolate their targets and attack them relentlessly.

The abilities of the Goblinoid track also suit well for general ‘street criminals’ - Goblin for con artists and tricky crooks; Hobgoblin for hired thugs and organised gangsters; and Bugbear for sneaky hired killers and for plain thuggish bullies.

Table 4.16: Goblin Race
Type [Monstrous humanoid]
Size Small
Int +2
Dex +2
Str -2
Save bonus Reflex
Vision Darkvision
Bonus Feat Option 1 The Bigger They Are
Bonus Feat Option 2 Liar’s Dice
Bonus Feat Option 3 Cheerful Hemoglobin
Table 4.16: Hobgoblin Race
Type [Monstrous humanoid]
Size Average
Str +2
Con +2
Wis -2
Bonus Attack
Vision Darkvision
Bonus Feat Option 1 A Song of Arrows
Bonus Feat Option 2 Deft Strike
Bonus Feat Option 3 Recon
Table 4.16: Bugbear Race
Type [Monstrous humanoid]
Size Average
Con +2
Dex +2
Int -2
Skill bonus Stealth
Vision Darkvision
Bonus Feat Option 1 You Will Falter
Bonus Feat Option 2 Deft Strike
Bonus Feat Option 3 To Iron Married
Table 4.17: Goblin Class
HP 8
Skills 6
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Ref
KOM Int
KDM Con
Table 4.17: Hobgoblin Class
HP 10
Skills 5
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Str
KDM Int
Table 4.17: Bugbear Class
HP 12
Skills Stealth and 3 others
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Ref
KOM Str
KDM Wis

1st Circle – GobshiteEX: You can make a 5-ft step even in a turn when you use your move action to move. You also gain one of the following abilities based on your subrace:

  • Goblin: You automatically hit and score a critical hit on an attack roll if your d20 roll is a 1. When you gain your 4th circle in Goblinoid this also happens on a natural 2.
  • Hobgoblin: If you hit an opponent who has been damaged by an attack by or an ability used by one of your allies since the end of your last turn with an attack, you deal additional [Precision] damage equal to 1d4 times the number of circles you have in Goblinoid. This increases to 1d6 per circle if the opponent has been damaged by more than one of your allies.
  • Bugbear: Your melee attacks against opponents who have none of their allies in their [Melee] range deal additional damage equal to your KOM. This bonuses increases to twice your KOM when you gain your 3rd circle in Goblinoid.

2nd Circle – More Than a MookEX: Once per [Round] for each skill, you may replace your attack bonus on an attack roll you make with your Larceny or Bluff skill bonus. You also gain [Immunity] to conditions based on your subrace:

  • Goblin: [Sickened] and [Nauseated]
  • Hobgoblin: [Fatigued] and [Exhausted]
  • Bugbear: [Revealed] and [Poison] effects

3rd Circle – Goblin It to Win ItEX: You gain one of the following abilities based on your subrace:

  • Goblin: Reduce the size of all damage dice rolled against you by one (e.g. d6s are reduced to d4s). d4s are reduced to counting as 1. If multiple creatures are being damaged by the same roll, the dice are reduced against them as well. You also ignore additional damage and effects from critical hits.
  • Hobgoblin: When you use Power Attack or Deadly Aim, you may have a willing ally within their [Melee] range of a target of your attack action take the penalty to attack rolls on their next turn, instead of you.
  • Bugbear: Your first hit with an attack each [Round] against an enemy with none of its allies within its [Close] range inflicts [Battered] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

4th Circle – GobbledegookEX: Opponents who take a 5 ft step out of a space in your [Melee] range, or use an EX or SU ability that requires a standard action or more to use within your [Melee] range, provoke an attack of opportunity from you.

5th Circle – A Gob Among MenEX: You gain one of the following abilities based on your subrace:

  • Goblin: When you make a successful save against an effect, you take no damage from that effect, or from attacks made as part of that effect.
  • Hobgoblin: Once per ally per [Round], when you hit with an attack against an opponent an ally is within thier [Melee] range of, you may have that attack count as a Trip, Disarm, Grapple or (if applicable) Pin attempt by that ally (using their save DC).
  • Bugbear: You have [Resistance] to all damage from creatures with none of their allies in [Close] range.

6th Circle - Gobbles the MindEX: As a move action, you may make a Bluff or Larceny check against a target opponent in [Close] range. If your skill check result is higher than the target’s Bluff defence, they cannot make iterative attacks or [Bonus attacks] against you until the end of their next turn.

7th Circle – GoblivionEX: Once per [Scene], when you are reduced to 0 hit points or below you may deal 30 damage which ignores [Resistance] and [Damage reduction] to all creatures within [Close] range, and gain hit points equal to the total damage dealt.

4.16 Goliath

Table 4.18: Goliath Race
Type [Humanoid]
Size [Large]
Str +4
Con +2
Dex -4
Skill bonus Athletics
Skill bonus Vigour
Bonus Feat Option 1 Juggernaut

Goliaths are a short-lived race of humanoids native to the valleys and deserts of Muercia and western Kamigawa, and the glaciers of northwest Rhyllia. They are notable for their huge size, growing up to 10 foot tall and with similarly wide, burly builds. This size makes them excellent climbers and fighters to match their competitive nature, but also means they require a huge amount of food, meaning they form small tribal groups more than large societies which would be impossible to feed. Kord is a patron deity of almost all Goliath tribes.

4.17 Horuan

Table 4.19: Horuan Race
Type [Humanoid]
Size Average
Wis +2
Skill bonus History
Save bonus Will
Special You may cause your class chassis to have -3 HP to gain the Fly movement mode
Bonus Feat Option 1 Pick a God and Pray!
Bonus Feat Option 2 Recon
Bonus Feat Option 3 To Iron Married

Horuans are a rare race of humanoids found in the Apothi Desert of Silclava, but also in the Skysong region of Rhyllia. They have the torso of a slender human, but the head of a bird (and they come in many varieties of bird) and the wings of a bird emerging from below their shoulder blades. Some Horuans have talons in place of feet, but some have normal feet. The former have a lighter frame and fully hollowed out bones, and so can use their wings to fly from birth, while the latter need extensive training to use their smaller wings for anything more than gliding.

4.18 Inevitable

Table 4.20: Inevitable Race
Type [Construct]
Size [Average] or [Large]
Con +2
Wis +2
Cha -2
Skill bonus Engineering
Save bonus Will
Special Class chassis gains +2 HP and -1 Skill
Bonus Feat Option 1 Ghost Hunter
Bonus Feat Option 2 You Shall Not Pass
Bonus Feat Option 3 Optimistic Viscera
Table 4.20: Inevitable Class
HP 10 (12)
Skills 5 (4)
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Wis
KDM Str

Just as Celestials are creatures of pure Good, denizens of the Upper Planes, and just as Demons are the incarnations of Evil and Chaos which dwell in the Abyss, Mechanus has its own race of beings. The Inevitables, servants of Primus, are the enforcers of the natural laws of the universe, those who hunt down oathbreakers and those who violate fundamental laws of creation such as liches who cheat death. While there are different forms of Inevitable, they all draw on the same axiomatic powers, which are demonstrated by this Track. The Inevitable track can also be used by other creatures who serve Primus, wielding the powers of Law in battle.

1st Circle – Amicus CuriaeEX: You gain a +2 item bonus to AC and may select one of the following abilities (this choice is permanent):

  • Inevitable PursuitEX: You gain +10 ft to your movement speed and moving out of a square of difficult terrain does not cost you extra movement
  • Inevitable ArmourEX: You gain [Lesser resistance] to physical damage.
  • Inevitable DisruptorEX: You gain [Lesser resistance] to energy and magic damage.

2nd Circle – Mens ReaSU: The first time in a [Round] you hit an opponent in melee, you may cause them to become [Detained] for one round, this does not require an action. [Detained] opponents must target you with their attacks and any offensive ability which specifies a target and if using an offensive ability which creates an area of effect, they must include you in the area of effect if they can place the area of effect in a place which would include you. If a [Detained] creature has to move to be able to attack or target you, they must only do so if that movement would not provoke an attack of opportunity. If a [Detained] creature cannot possibly attack or target you, they can act normally. Each time you cause an opponent to be [Detained] in a row, the duration increases by one round. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your character level + your KOM) negates [Detained] and stops the increase in duration, resetting it to one on the next application. If a creature is [Detained] by more than one creature, it can target either of two creatures it is [Detained] by. If you die, all creatures you have [Detained] are no longer [Detained].

3rd Circle – Compos Mentis: Select one of the following abilities (this choice is permanent):

  • Mechanus WingsEX: You gain wings and the Fly movement mode
  • Visions from PrimusSU: Once per [Round], as a swift action, you may gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls or to Armour Class for one [Round]

4th Circle – Intra Vires: Select one of the following abilities (this choice is permanent):

  • Zelekhut’s PursuitEX: You gain +15 ft to your movement speed (stacking with Inevitable Pursuit) and you do not provoke attacks of opportunity when moving from non-[Detained] creatures as long as at least one enemy is [Detained] by you.
  • Kolyarut’s ArmourEX: You gain [Lesser resistance] to physical damage (this stacks up to [Resistance] with Inevitable Armour).
  • Marut’s ArmourEX: You gain [Lesser resistance] to energy and magic damage (this stacks up to [Resistance] with Inevitable Disruptor).

5th Circle – Ratio DecidendiSU: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action you may use Dictum. Dictum deals 1d8 damage per level to all opponents within [Close] range and leaves them [Dazed] for one [Round]. A successful Fort save (DC 10 + ½ your character level + your KOM) halves the damage and negates the [Dazed] condition.

6th Circle – Res Ipsa Loquitor: Select two of the following abilities (this choice is permanent):

  • Unstoppable PursuitEX: As long as at least one enemy is [Detained] by you, you gain [Lesser resistance] to damage from creatures who are not [Detained] by you.
  • Unending PursuitEX: If a creature [Detained] by you in your [Melee] range makes a 5 ft step, you may immediately make a 5 ft step in the same direction, this does not require an action.
  • Power of JusticeEX: You gain a fury bonus to damage equal to your level against the last enemy you [Detained].
  • Hammer of JusticeEX: The first time each [Round] you cause a creature to be [Detained], they are also [Battered] for one [Round].

7th Circle – Res JudicataSU: Once per [Encounter], as a swift action (or as part of a swift action to use Visions from Primus), for one [Round] you can, before rolling, choose to treat any d20 roll my make as an 11.

4.19 Khenra

Table 4.21: Khenra Race
Type [Monstrous Humanoid]
Size Average
Wis +2
Str +2
Dex +2
Con -2
Int -2
Skill bonus Diplomacy
Save bonus Reflex
Special You may swap one of your tracks for Heroica without using your multiclass
Bonus Feat Option 1 Pick a God and Pray!

Found in the Apothi Desert of Silclava, and also in small packs in deserts across the world, the Khenra are a humanoid species which stands at between 4 and 5 feet tall, with the head of a jackal and their bodies covered in fur which ranges from red to sandy to deep black. Khenra are notable in that they are, without exception, born as twins. While note every Khenra pack places emphasis on these bonds, most Khenra are inseparable from their sibling.

4.20 Killoren

Table 4.22: Killoren Race
Type Fey
Size [Average]
Int +2
Wis +2
Con -2
Skill bonus Nature
Special Once per [Scene] choose Ancient, Hunter or Avenger and gain the appropriate Skill bonus and Bonus Feat for the [Scene]
Ancient Skill Bonus History
Ancient Bonus Feat Dread Secret
Hunter Skill Bonus Stealth
Hunter Bonus Feat Danger Sense
Avenger Bonus Attack rolls
Avenger Bonus Feat Arcantric Accuracy

A race of humanoid Fey created by Oberon, the distinguishing factor of the Killoren is their ability to take on the Aspects. With meditation a Killoren can absorb the energies of a certain aspect of nature, changing their abilities and appearance slightly. The Aspect of the Ancient links the Killoren to the ancient memory of nature allowing them to commune with the natural world to learn secrets of the area and access the memories of other Killoren attuned to the Aspect in the area. Killoren attuned to the Ancient have lighter skin, shorter horns and green, vine-like hair. The Aspect of the Hunter attunes a Killoren with its animal instinct, granting it enhanced senses and some natural camouflage, in addition to a supernatural ability to respond to danger. Killoren attuned to the Hunter have skin that shifts colour to match the environment, their hair recedes and their eyes and ears grow and glow with a faint green light. The Aspect of the Destroyer is rarely attuned to, and only when a Killoren or nature itself is badly threatened, granting the Killoren bestial might and unhindered anger towards those that threaten itself or nature. Killoren attuned to the Destroyer grow in height and broadness, their skin becomes light brown as their hair becomes dark brown and their antlers grow and become more dangerously pointed.

4.21 Kitsune

Table 4.23: Kitsune Race
Type [Magical beast]
Size [Average]
Cha +2
Dex +2
Int -2
Vision [Ghostwise sight] 45 ft
Save bonus Will
Bonus Feat Option 1 Safekeeper Adept
Bonus Feat Option 2 Senseshift Adept
Bonus Feat Option 3 Arcane Magister
Table 4.23: Kitsune Class
HP 8
Skills 8
BAB Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Cha
KDM Wis

Native to the forests of Kamigawa, Kitsune are a legendarily powerful race of shapeshifting foxes with nine tails. They like to take the form of beautiful humanoid women, and toy with mortals in the same way that Fey do - though usually with better intentions. As well a shapeshifting, they command power over a unique type of faerie fire, and can concentrate magical boons into misty orbs.

1st Circle – Nine Tails: Select one of the following abilities (this choice is permanent):

  • Fox FireSLA: As a standard action, deal energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to 1d4 per your character level plus your Cha modifier to all creatures in a 15 ft wedge starting at any space in your [Close] range. Creatures damaged this way are [Revealed] for three [Rounds].
  • DisguiseSLA: As a standard action, heal hit points equal to 1d8 per your character level plus your Cha modifier and change your appearance to that of a [Small], [Average] or [Large] creature with the [Humanoid] or [Monstrous humanoid] type of your choice.
