You can only appear to be a generic creature of that type by default, but you may make a Larceny check (DC is the Awareness of any creature viewing you) to impersonate a specific creature you can see or that you are familiar with the appearence of. The Diguise lasts until the end of the [Scene], until you take a new form, or until you dispel it with a swift action.

2nd Circle – Orb of PowerEX: You gain a +2 bonus to the DC of any saves against abilities you use, and all damage dice you roll are increased by one size. As a move action which provokes attacks of opportunity, you can throw your Orb to an ally in [Close] range, which gives that ally this bonus instead until the end of their turn, when the Orb returns to you. An ally with the Orb can also use a move action to throw it to a different ally within their [Close] range.

3rd Circle – Vulpine Wanderer: You gain the ability that you didn’t choose at 1st circle, and you gain the enchanced version of the one you didn’t:

  • Enhanced Fox FireSLA: Creatures that are damaged by Fox Fire take 3d4 energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor at the start of each turn that they remain [Revealed].
  • Enhanced DisguiseSLA: You gain a +1 bonus to the AC of any creature that believes your Disguise, and is an ally of the creature you are Disguised as. This bonus increases by 1 for every 4 points your Larceny check beats their Awareness by, and is reduced by 1 every time you target or damage that opponent or their allies with an offensive action.

4th Circle – Charm of the Fox QueenSLA: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you can cause target creature within [Close] range to become charmed. Whenever a charmed creature would use an offensive action against you or an an ally, the charmed creature must make a Will save. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) allows the charmed creature to use that offensive action as normal and renders the creature no longer charmed; a failed save means the charmed creature cannot use an offensive action against you or your allies for one [Round], and also causes them to move up to half their speed towards you.

A charmed creature remains charmed until the end of the [Encounter] or until you or an ally use an offensive action against it (this ability and its effects are not considered offensive actions for this purpose).

When an opponent succeeds on a Will save to remove the charm, roll a d4. You may use this ability again after that many [Rounds] have passed.

5th Circle – Contemplate the OrbEX: Any creature that is between you and the ally you throw your Orb of Power to (or between an ally and another ally they throw the Orb to) takes damage equal to your Cha modifier, takes a -2 penalty to the DC of saves against abilities it uses, and has the size of all damage dice it rolls reduced by 1 for one [Round].

6th Circle – Outfoxed: You gain the Enhanced ability that you didn’t gain at 3rd circle, and the Ultimate version of the ability that you did choose.

  • Ultimate Fox FireSLA: You have line of sight and line of effect, regardless of obstacles and other rules, to any creature currently [Revealed] by your Fox Fire.
  • Ultimate DisguiseSLA: When you use the Disguise ability, you heal all allies in your [Melee] range for the same amount of hit points.

7st Circle – Nine TalesSU: Once per [Encounter] when your Orb of Power is thrown to a new holder, you may [Warp] adjacent to the new holder and grant the new and previous holder a +9 bonus to all d20 rolls for one [Round].

4.22 Lurking Terror

Table 4.24: Lurking Terror Race
Type [Aberration] or [Magical beast]
Size Any
Dex +2
Any non-Dex +2
Any non-Dex -2
Skill bonus Stealth
Bonus Attack rolls
Bonus Feat Option 1 Shadow Blink
Bonus Feat Option 2 Ghost Hunter
Bonus Feat Option 3 Reaver
Table 4.24: Lurking Terror Class
HP 8
Skills 6
BAB Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Any
KDM Dex

For intrepid heroes, clearing out a spooky castle is a daily chore. So what if the locals say it’s haunted? It’s probably just the wind. The chilling howls in the darkness as they approach? It’s just some wolves. The candles in the hallways sputter out one by one? Someone just forgot to replace them. The rogue is missing? He probably just went off to steal some silverware. And then an ear-piercing shriek echoes through the halls, and the fun begins.

1st Circle – BlightSU: You like to stake out a kill site before you set to work. As a swift action, you may create a spread within [Close] range with a radius of 25 ft + 5 ft per circle of Lurking Terror you possess, which lasts until the end of the [Encounter]. This spread is called a Blight. You may have a maximum of one Blight per Lurking Terror circle you possess. Opponents treat squares inside the radius of your Blights as difficult terrain. Whenever an opponent begins its turn within one or more of your Blights, it gains [Vulnerability] for one [Round] to damage you deal while you are within the radius of one or more of your Blights. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Vulnerability].

2nd Circle – Murder AlleySU: You hunt awash in the scent of death. Whenever an opponent ends its turn within one or more of your Blights, it becomes [Sickened] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Sickened] condition. In addition, whenever an opponent fails a save against one of your Lurking Terror abilities, it begins [Bleeding]. All attempts to end or remove the [Bleeding] condition with a move action from opponents within the radius of one or more of your Blights simply fail.

3rd Circle – BloodletterSU: Beautiful, glistening red, it calls to you. Whenever an opponent moves out of a square within one or more of your Blights, including making a 5-ft step, that opponent provokes an attack of opportunity from you. You can make this attack of opportunity against that opponent even if that opponent is not within the normal range of your melee attacks. (You make a melee attack, not a ranged attack.)

Additionally, whenever an opponent within one or more of your Blights suffers any amount of [HP Reduction] from the [Bleeding] condition, it takes that much damage.

4th Circle – All Work and No PlaySU: You show your victims a crazy time. Each [Encounter], the first time each opponent begins its turn within one or more of your Blights, it becomes [Confused] for one [Round].

Also, while you are within one or more of your Blights, you are [Covered] and do not provoke attacks of opportunity for movement.

5th Circle – The Widow’s WebSU: You are [Invisible] within the radius of your Blight. Once per [Round], while you and an opponent are within one or more of your Blights, if you hit that opponent, you can lay a dark veil upon that opponent, isolating it from all aid. Until the beginning of your next turn, other opponents that do not have line of sight to you cannot target that opponent. A successful Reflex save by the opponent hit (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the veil effect.

6th Circle – Relentless KillerSU: You simply refuse to stop while there is killing left to do. You gain [Lesser resistance] to all damage while within the radius of your Blight, which improves to [Resistance] against damage dealt by creatures outside the radius of your Blight. In addition, conditions your Lurking Terror circles inflict now ignore [Immunity] to those conditions.

7th Circle – No-One Can Hear You ScreamSU: A massacre at your hands is only a matter of time. As a swift or immediate action, you may create up to one Blight within [Medium] range per Lurking Terror circle you possess. (You may still have a maximum of one Blight per Lurking Terror circle you possess.) Whenever an opponent begins its turn within one or more of your Blights, it becomes [Energy drained], and you gain temporary HP equal to your level. These temporary HP stack, to a maximum of half of your maximum HP

4.23 Merfolk

Table 4.25: Merfolk Race
Type [Humanoid]
Size [Average]
Cha +2
Wis +2
Con -2
Skill bonus Diplomacy
Lesser resistance [Cold]
Bonus Feat Option 1 Hollow Voice
Bonus Feat Option 2 Charm
Bonus Feat Option 3 Breakneck Pace
Table 4.25: Merfolk Class
HP 8
Skills 6
BAB Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Cha
KDM Dex

The Merfolk, half-fish, half-humanoid, are the main intelligent beings of the seas, living in great underground cities in coral reefs and natural trenches (though, due to practical concerns of being underwater, they are generally less technologically advanced than their terrestrial counterparts). Most Merfolk are content to remain in their underwater abodes, but some venture up towards land. Some do this for malicious reasons, such as using their alluring voices to draw sailors to their deaths, or to simply capture a new thrall. Some do to become adventurers on land, using their natural aquakinesis to create pools of water for them to move between, so they don’t need to flop around on their fins (though they can breathe in air as well as water).

1st Circle – Devoting Full Time to FloatingEX: You gain the Swim movement mode and do not provoke attacks of opportunity for surfacing or diving. However, your movement speed on land is reduced to one quarter (rounding down to the next multiple of 5) after all bonuses are added. You also gain the following spell-like ability:

  • AquakinesisSLA: As a move action you may create a Pool spread within [Close] range of radius of up to 10 + 5 ft per circle of Merfolk you have, as long as the only creatures in the spread are your allies. The area of the Pool spread becomes water, meaning it can only be moved through with an Athletics check (DC 10, as it is calm, still water) or the Swim movement mode, or over by flight. The water is deep enough for a [Large] or smaller creature to submerge in or drown in. The spread lasts for two [Rounds], after which is dries up and all creatures in it which are [Swimming] lose the [Swimming] condition immediately and move on to dry land.

2nd Circle – Siren SongEX: When you make a successful in-combat Diplomacy check against an opponent, instead of the normal effect you may make a second Diplomacy check, and if it succeeds you cause that opponent to move up to its speed directly towards you. This does not use up an action, and the movement provokes attacks of opportunity as normal.

3rd Circle – Out of the SeaEX: When you surface from [Swimming] you leap from the water, gaining [Flying] until the end of the [Round] (which means you do not take your land movement speed penalty). At the end of the [Round], as you lose [Flying], if there are no opponents within 5 ft of you, you may create a Pool spread centred on you with radius 5 ft as a free action.

4th Circle – It’s Better Down Where It’s WetterEX: All allies in your [Medium] range gain the Swim movement mode. They retain the Swim movement mode for one [Round] after they leave your [Medium] range.

Also, your voice now carries healing properties, and you may replace the modifier for a Vigour or Medicine check with your Diplomacy modifier.

5th Circle – Music Play, Do What the Music SayEX: When you make a successful in-combat Diplomacy check against an opponent, instead of the normal effect you may make a second Diplomacy check, and if it succeeds you may choose an active ability. If the target has that ability they must use it on their next turn (they can choose what or where to target it, and any other choices in using the ability).

6th Circle – Part of That WorldEX: You may now dive and surface as a free action, and your Pool spreads last five [Rounds]. Also, when you move through a Pool spread you may place another Pool spread which is adjacent to it or overlaps it as a free action, following the same rules about only allies being in the spread.

7th Circle – Poor Unfortunate SoulsEX: Enemies affected by your Siren Song ability cannot use Athletics to move in water, or for the passive bonus to holding their breath, until the end of the [Encounter].

4.24 Minotaur

Table 4.26: Minotaur Race
Type [Monstrous humanoid]
Size Large
Str +4
Con +2
Cha -4
Bonus Attack
Skill bonus Geography
Bonus Feat Option 1 Horny on Main

Ranging in size between an especially large Orc and an especially small Hill Giant, the bull-headed Minotaurs can be found around the world. In most places, they are savage followers of their God, the Demon Prince Baphomet, and especially enjoy building labyrinthine lairs. That said, in Silclava and Lorado there have been reports of Minotaur civilizations. No-one doubts that Minotaurs are intelligent enough to live like normal humanoids, it just seems that most would prefer to follow their maze-delving, man-eating instincts.

4.25 Myconid

Table 4.27: Myconid Race
Type Plant
Size [Small] or [Average]
Con +2
Base speed 25
Skill bonus Nature
Skill bonus Diplomacy
Vision [Darkvision]
Bonus Feat Option 1 Fast Talk
Bonus Feat Option 2 Optimistic Viscera
Bonus Feat Option 3 Livers Need Not Apply
Table 4.27: Myconid Class
HP 12
Skills Diplomacy and five others
BAB Poor
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Int
KDM Con

Myconids are a slightly alien lifeform native to the Underdark, notable for being the only known intelligent fungus-based race, rather than being an animal or (more rarely) plant. Myconids or other less intelligent fungus-based creatures communicate and defend themselves with the help of spores, and Myconids are especially notable for their pacifism, preferring to build a friendship with adversaries, and at worse make them too sickly to fight, rather than killing them outright.

1st Circle – Rapport SporesSU: As part of a move action, you scatter spores on all creatures within your [Close] range, you can communicate perfectly with any creature affected by the spores, even if they do not normally have a language, and gain a +2 bonus to Diplomacy checks against all creatures affected.

2nd Circle – Poisonous SporesEX: As a move action, create a spread centred on you out to a radius of 5 ft + 5 ft per circle you have in this track. The spread lasts until the start of your next turn and all creatures in the spread at any point are [Sickened] until the end of their next turn. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KDM) negates the effect for that instance of Poisonous Spores.

3rd Circle – Fungal GrowthEX: Once per [Encounter], as a move action, you may effect yourself with cure moderate wounds or nature’s power, as the spells.

4th Circle – Peace SporesSU: As a move action, you can cause every creature in 20 ft to gain the effect of a sanctuary spell, with the save DC being 10 + ½ your level + your KDM.

5th Circle – Reanimating SporesSU: As a move action you may raise a dead creature in your [Melee] range who has been affected by one of your Myconid abilities this [Encounter] as a Spore Servant. A Spore Servant is restored to full HP and has the same statistics and passive abilities as the original creature, but has its type changed to Plant and cannot use any active abilities it has except its basic attack action and moving, and does not speak any languages. A Spore Servant you create is always your ally, and will follow any commands it is given through Rapport Spores. A Spore Servant ceases to be animated at the end of the [Quest] and when you create a Spore Servant that causes the total levels of your Spore Servants to exceed the total of your own and your KDM, your oldest Spore Servant dies until the total no longer exceeds the limit.

6th Circle – Disease SporesEX: Once per [Round], you may cause one creature who failed their save against Poisonous Spores to become [Nauseated] instead of [Sickened]. A creature may only be affected by this ability once per [Encounter].

7th Circle – Miracle SporesSU: Once per [Encounter], you may cast heart of oak, as the spell, as a move action. Twice per [Scene] you may return a [Dead] creature within [Close] range to life at full HP.

4.26 Ooze

Table 4.28: Ooze Race
Type [Aberration]
Size [Average] or [Large]
Con +4
Dex -2
Bonus AC
Skill bonus Vigour
Bonus Feat Option 1 Slow and Steady
Bonus Feat Option 2 By Will Sustained
Bonus Feat Option 3 Senseshift Adept
Table 4.28: Ooze Class
HP 12
Skills 4
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Str
KDM Con

Deep in many dungeons and in other strange places live the enigmatic Ooze, creatures of semi-sentient slime which engulf all they come across and dissolve it in their living stomachs. The powers of these hardy creatures are also co-opted by some factions like the Cult of Jubilex, and other creatures who enjoy spewing acid.

1st Circle – Spread the LoveEX: Once per [Round], as a move action or as part of a move action you may create an ooze spread with a radius of your [Melee] range originating from you that deals energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor or physical damage, chosen each time you create the spread, equal to your level (minimum of 1) to all creatures besides yourself within the area and inflicts the [Entangled] condition for one [Round] on all creatures besides yourself within the area. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Entangled] condition. When you gain your 4th circle in Ooze, this damage increases to your level plus half your level.

Also, you gain a +1 bonus to your Grapple combat manoeuvre DC and to saves against the Grapple combat manoeuvre.

2nd Circle – Shape of Things to ComeEX: You gain [Lesser resistance] to your choice of physical or magic and energy damage. This choice is permanent. When you gain your 6th circle in Ooze, you instead gain [Lesser resistance] to all damage.

3rd Circle – Solidus MaximusEX: At the beginning of your turn, without spending an action, you may choose to reduce your movement speed by half for one [Round]. If you do so, you gain a +2 bonus to all of your saving throws and your [Lesser resistance] from Shape of Things to Come increases to [Resistance]. When you gain your 5th circle in Ooze, you instead gain a +4 bonus to all of your saving throws.

4th Circle – The Gift That Keeps On GivingEX: When you create an ooze spread, you may cause it to instead deal energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor or physical damage, chosen each time you create the spread, equal to your level (minimum of 1) to all creatures besides yourself within the area and inflict the [Entangled] and [Sickened] conditions for one [Round] on all creatures besides yourself within the area. A successful Fortitude save (10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Sickened] condition.

Also, your bonus to the Grapple combat manoeuvre DC and saves against the Grapple combat manoeuvre increases to +3.

5th Circle – Loosen UpEX: You gain [Immunity] to effects with the [Binding] descriptor. If you already have or later gain this [Immunity] through another effect or ability, you instead gain a +2 bonus to all of your saving throws for as long as you have that [Immunity] through that effect or ability.

6th Circle – Volumen HydrargyrumEX: Whenever you create an ooze spread, all creatures besides yourself in the area are [Grappled] by you.

Whenever you use the Solidus Maximus ability, you gain temporary HP equal to your level + your KDM and [Fast healing] equal to your level for one [Round].

7th Circle – Oh God it’s EverywhereEX: Once per [Round], as a swift action, you may create a spread with a radius of your [Medium] range originating from you that pulls all opponents in the spread to squares adjacent to you, or as close as possible to adjacent in the event that all adjacent squares are occupied. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the effect. Immediately after creating that spread, as a free action, you may create a spread with a radius of your [Melee] range originating from you that deals energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor or physical damage, chosen each time you create the spread, equal to your (minimum of 1) to all creatures besides yourself within the area and inflicts the [Entangled] and [Sickened] conditions for one [Round] on all creatures besides yourself within the area. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Sickened] condition.

4.27 Otherworldly

Table 4.29: Otherworldly Race
Type [Aberration]
Size Any
Int +4
Wis +2
Dex +2
Cha -4
Con -2
Save bonus Will
Vision [Ghostwise sight] 45 ft
Bonus Feat Option 1 Truly Bad People
Bonus Feat Option 2 Shadow Blink
Bonus Feat Option 3 Pierce the Veil
Table 4.29: Otherworldly Class
HP 12
Skills 3
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort, Ref and Will
KOM Int
KDM Dex

Beings of the Far Realms, creatures from the stars, and even some creatures native to Oerth but still beyond sapient comprehension like Mind Flayers all share the ability to shred the consciousness of other creatures through their very aberrant existence. Also there’s a lot of tentacles going on.

1st Circle – Alien FormEX: You gain a bonus to your defences against interaction checks equal to the number of circles you have in this track. When you gain your 3rd circle in this track you gain [Immunity] to [Fear] effects and the in-combat use of the Intimidate skill. You also gain a [Brutal], [Trapping], [Unbalancing] Tentacle natural weapon.

2nd Circle – Mental OnslaughtPLA: As a standard action, you may create a wedge out to your [Close] range which deals damage equal to the total of your level and Int modifier to all creatures within it without the Otherworldly track that are not [Blinded] and have line of sight to you. All opponents dealt damage by this ability must make a Will save (DC 10 + 1/2 your level + your Int modifier) or, at your choice, have to target you with their next targeted offensive action, or be unable to target you with their next targeted offensive action. This is a [Mind affecting] ability.

Once per [Encounter], you may spend 5 Power Points to augment this ability to also cause all creatures that fail the save to be [Dazed] for one [Round].

3rd Circle – Die For Your MasterEX: All allies in your [Medium] range that do not have the Otherworldly track gain a +2 fury bonus to attack rolls and saving throws, and all opponents in your [Medium] range that do not have the Otherworldly track take a -2 penalty to attack rolls and saving throws. You may telepathically communicate with all creatures with the Otherworldly track in [Medium] range.

4th Circle – Empathic TransferPLA: As a move action, deal damage equal to twice your level to a creature in [Close] range that failed a save against Mental Onslaught this [Round] and heal hit points equal to the damage done.

You may spend up to 3 Power Points when using this ability to increase the damage by a number per level equal to the points spent.

5th Circle – GibberingEX: Once per [Round], when you use a combat manoeuvre that requires an attack, you may use Mental Onslaught as part of that action.

6th Circle – Psychic ScreamPLA: The damage done by Mental Onslaught increases to 1d4 per your level + your Int modifier. In addition, all creatures damaged by Mental Onslaught are [Deafened] and [Revealed] for one [Round].

7th Circle – The Mountains of MadnessPLA: Once per [Encounter], choose an opponent damaged by Mental Onslaught. They take additional damage equal to six times your level and are [Shaken] and [Confused] for two [Rounds]. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Int modifier) halves the damage and negates the [Confused] effect. This is a [Death] effect.

4.28 Plant

Table 4.30: Plant Race
Type Plant
Size Any
Con +2
Skill bonus Nature
Skill bonus Geography
Bonus Feat Option 1 Slow and Steady
Bonus Feat Option 2 By Will Sustained
Bonus Feat Option 3 Danger Sense
Table 4.30: Plant Class
HP 12
Skills 4
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Con
KDM Any mental

In the forests and wild places of the world are a wide variety of sentient and monstrous plants, which use a mixture of entangling roots and poisonous spores to fight, in addition to particular specialisms of each species, such as strangling vines or disguised mouths. Some animals also use plant-based powers, such as many Fey and Druids, who harness this track to command flora in battle.

1st Circle – GrasswhistleEX: You gain the ability to speak to plants. You are able to ask questions of and receive answers from plants. A regular plant’s sense of its surroundings is limited, so it won’t be able to give (or recognize) detailed descriptions of creatures or answer questions about events outside its immediate vicinity. In addition, all terrain within [Close] range of you is treated as difficult terrain for opponents.

2nd Circle – Vine WhipEX: Once per [Round], as a move action, cause any creature you hit that [Round] to make a Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Key Offensive Modifier) or be [Entangled] for 1 [Round]. Any creature affected by this ability has to make only one save per [Round]. When you gain your 4th circle in this track, this affects every opponent within your [Melee] range of the creature you attack.

3rd Circle – IngrainEX: At the end of your turn, subtract how far you have moved during the current [Round] from your move speed. For every 5 ft. of this result, you gain 2 points of [Fast healing] and a +1 deflection bonus to your AC for one [Round]. These bonuses stack a number of times equal to the number of circles you possess from this track, up to a maximum of 14 [Fast healing] and a +7 deflection bonus to your AC at 7th circle. Movement caused by effects not created by you does not change the bonuses you get, and you start with the maximum bonuses at the start of every [Encounter].

4th Circle – Stun SporeEX: Once per [Round], as a swift action, cause any creature you attack that [Round] to make a Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Key Offensive Modifier) or gain the [Sickened] and [Slowed] conditions for two [Rounds]. Any creature affected by this ability has to make only one save per [Round]. This is a [Poison] effect.

5th Circle – SynthesisEX: You gain [Immunity] to effects with the [Mind-affecting] descriptor, [Stunned] and [Paralyzed].

6th Circle – Cotton GuardEX: You gain [Lesser resistance] to damage. If you gain at least 3 points of AC from Ingrain, you gain temporary HP equal to your character level, and if you gain 6 points of AC from Ingrain, your [Lesser resistance] to damage improves to [Resistance] to damage for one [Round].

7th Circle – Frenzy PlantEX: As a standard action, make an attack action with the [Volley] descriptor added to every melee attack in it, these attacks with the [Volley] descriptor are applied to all opponents in [Close] range. Every creature hit during this attack gains the [Energy drained] condition and loses [Flying] and access to the Fly movement mode for one [Round]. You may not use this ability if you used it last turn. This is a [Poison] effect.

4.29 Raptoran

Table 4.31: Raptoran Race
Type [Humanoid]
Size [Average]
Dex +2
Save bonus Reflex
Base speed 35
Bonus Feat Option 1 Breakneck Pace
Bonus Feat Option 2 Recon
Bonus Feat Option 3 A Song of Arrows
Table 4.31: Raptoran Class
HP 8
Skills 6
BAB Good
Good Saves Reflex and either Fort or Will
KOM Dex
KDM Con

The Raptorans are a race of humans who long ago made a pact with the Djinni Lords of the Plane of Air to gain flight. Now they have sharp features, pointed ears, long claw-like nails and most notably a pair of great wings.

This track can also be used for any creature that is defined by their ability to fly more than anything else.

1st Circle – We Have Lift-OffEX: You gain the Fly movement mode.

2nd Circle – Rainbow DashEX: You may Charge at double your movement speed and without provoking attacks of opportunity. You may make your attack at any point in the Charge.

3rd Circle – Everything’s Air-Droppable OnceEX: All allies in your [Close] range gain the Fly movement mode and can increase their movement speed to equal yours. They retain the Fly movement mode (but not the speed increase) for one [Round] after they leave your [Close] range.

4th Circle – Close Air SupportEX: Your attacks do bonus damage equal to your character level.

5th Circle – Need for SpeedEX: You gain [Fast healing] equal to your movement speed divided by 5.

6th Circle – About 20% CoolerEX: You gain a +5 ft bonus to your movement speed for each [Flying] creature in [Medium] range, up a maximum of double your base movement speed. Twice per [Encounter], on an attack action or a Charge, you deal bonus damage on your attacks equal to your remaining movement for the [Round] divided by 5, up to a maximum of three times your level.

7th Circle – SkyfallEX: As a standard action, you may move up to your speed without provoking attacks of opportunity and lose [Flying] and make a single attack with the [Volley] descriptor against all enemies in [Close] range. Enemies hit by this attack lose [Flying] and the Fly movement mode until the end of the [Encounter] and are [Stunned] for one [Round]. A Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Stunned] condition. A Creature can only be [Stunned] by Skyfall once per [Encounter].

4.30 Reptile

Table 4.32: Reptile Race
Type [Animal] or [Monstrous humanoid]
Size Any
Con +2
Save bonus Fortitude
Bonus AC
Bonus Feat Option 1 Predator
Bonus Feat Option 2 Improved Sunder
Bonus Feat Option 3 Sinister Sinews
Table 4.32: Reptile Class option 1
HP 12
Skills 5
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Ref
KOM Str
KDM Con
Table 4.32: Reptile Class option 2
HP 8
Skills 7
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Ref
KOM Dex
KDM Con

In the deserts, swamps and jungles around the Prime Material, reptilian humanoids thrive, and beyond their settlements are countless cold-blooded, scaled creatures to contend with, even some great beasts which are now bones beneath the earth. While they are all very different, they all share cold blood, and the ability to store their metabolic energy for sudden, savage release.

1st Circle – BaskEX: As part of a move action, you may heal hit points equal to your level and gain 2 focus points. When you make an attack action, you can spend any number of focus points to ignore 3 points of [Damage reduction] or [Resistance] for each point spent.

2nd Circle – Improved ScalesEX: You gain a +4 item bonus to AC. Also, you gain a natural weapon with [Brutal 2] and two other properties of your choice.

3rd Circle – Ectothermal FuryEX: As a swift action, up to twice per [Round] you may either spend 1 focus point to gain a bonus 20 ft to your move speed until the end of your turn, or spend 2 focus points to, for the rest of the turn, score a critical hit on the next two numbers down from your normal limit.

4th Circle – In Cold BloodEX: As a free action, once per [Round], you may spend 2 focus points to gain an additional swift action that [Round], 4 points to gain a move action, or 8 points to gain a standard action.

5th Circle – Poikilothermal RageEX: When you make an attack action, you may spend 2 focus points to deal additional damage on the first hit in the action equal to twice your KOM, and the opponent hit is [Battered] for one [Round].

6th Circle – Greater BaskEX: When you use Bask, you now gain 3 focus points, and can end two of the following conditions currently affecting you: [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Nauseated], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed].

7th Circle – Bradymetabolic MaliceEX: When you make an attack action, you may spend 6 focus points to deal additional damage on the first hit in the action equal to four times your KOM, and the opponent hit is [Dazed] for one [Round].

4.31 Rilkan

Table 4.33: Rilkan Race
Type [Humanoid]
Size Average
Skill bonus Choose any
Special Class chassis gets -2 HP and +1 Skill
Special +1 Power Point per level
Special Once per [Scene] per Skill, you may spend a Power Point to count as having that Skill trained for a single check
Bonus Feat Option 1 Curiosity
Bonus Feat Option 2 Mister World-Mind
Bonus Feat Option 3 Open Lesser Binding

In the Azujin client state of Azuhan, you can find the most rare and most strange of the Mishtaic races, the Rilkan. While they are broadly humanlike in appearance, the Rilkan have maintained more of the Mishtai’s physiology than their cousin races, having slitted pupils, patches of iridescent scales over parts of their skin, and even vestigial tails. Naturally Psionic, the Rilkan are able to instinctively access the memories of their ancestors (and even living Rilkan who have passed through the area in which they live), which gives them the ability to display a wide variety of skills.

4.32 Shapeshifter

Table 4.34: Shapeshifter Race
Type Fey
Size Any
Any ability score +2
Skill bonus Choose a skill
Bonus Choose attack, AC or one save
Bonus Feat Option 1 Any you meet the prerequisites for
Table 4.34: Shapeshifter Class
HP 10
Skills 5
BAB Good
Good Saves Any two
KOM Any
KDM Any (not same as KOM)

Shapeshifters are descendants of Fey who retain their ancestors’ ability to change form nearly at will. They often exist within communities who are completely unaware of their nature – which is a good thing since they are often persecuted or just mistrusted.

You have access to a limited number of Forms. Each Form has a certain number of Feature Points available to be spent on it. At the start of each [Quest] you prepare your Forms by distributing giving each Form a set of Features with total Point value equal to or lower than the Form’s Point value. You keep access to this set of Forms until your next [Quest] (or when you level up and gain a new Form, which you can immediately choose the Features of). You can choose the same Features multiple times across Forms and also within the same Form, but Features do not stack with themselves unless otherwise noted.

When you assume a Form, you can change your creature type to one of your choice, and dictate your appearance. However, you cannot look like a specific individual; you can only assume general traits such as “an unusually short Elf with blonde hair and green eyes”.

This table gives how many Forms you have of each Point value at each circle:
Table 4.35: Shapeshifter Forms by Circle
Form Points 1 2 3 4 5 6 7
1st Circle 2 0 0 0 0 0 0
2nd Circle 2 2 0 0 0 0 0
3rd Circle 2 3 2 0 0 0 0
4th Circle 0 2 3 2 0 0 0
5th Circle 0 1 2 3 2 0 0
6th Circle 0 0 1 2 3 2 0
7th Circle 0 0 0 2 3 3 2

1st Circle – MakeshiftSU: As a standard action, you can assume any of your prepared Forms.

You gain access to the Natural Attack, Small Shape, Large Shape, Average Shape, Darkvision and Ghostwise Sight Form Features.

2nd Circle – Shifty CharacterSU: Once per [Scene], as a free action you may add one Feature you have access to on to your current Form, which can exceed the total Point allowance of that Form.

You gain access to the Battle Ready, Skill Advantage, Natural Advantage and Swift Feet Form Features.

3rd Circle – Night ShiftSU: Once per [Encounter], you can assume one of your prepared Forms as a move action.

You gain access to the Hardy, Evasive, Vampiric, True Vision and Water Ready Form Features.

4th Circle – Gear ShiftSU: Once per [Encounter], you can assume one of your prepared Forms as an immediate action.

You gain access to the Flight, Disguise, Sensory Acuity and Warbeast Form Features.

5th Circle – Sticky KeysSU: The number of times per [Scene] you can use the ability from Shifty Character increases to three but you cannot use it on the same Form twice.

You gain access to the Multiple Limbs, Multistrike, Swift Body, Swift Mind and Tunnelling Form Features.

6th Circle – Graveyard ShiftSU: You can now assume one of your prepared forms as an immediate action twice per [Encounter].

You gain access to the Blindsight, Perfect Camouflage, Thick Hide, Antimagic and Regeneration Form Features.

7th Circle – Paradigm ShiftSU: You can assume any of your prepared Forms as a move action at will.

You gain access to the Unfazed, Uncatchable and Uninfluenced Form Features.

4.32.1 Form Features

4.32.1.1 1 Point

  • Natural Attack: Your Form has one natural weapon, with three properties of your choice (except [Arcane] and [Barbed]). Each additional time you take this feature, you gain two more natural weapons.
  • Small Shape: Your size category changes to [Small].
  • Average Shape: Your size category changes to [Average].
  • Large Shape: Your size category changes to [Large].
  • Darkvision: You gain the [Darkvision] vision mode.
  • Ghostwise Sight: You gain the [Ghostwise sight] vision mode out to 45 ft. Every time you take this feature, this range doubles.
  • Skill Advantage: You gain a +3 item bonus to a skill of your choice, chosen at the point of preparing the Form.
  • Natural Advantage: You gain a +2 item bonus to one statistic (Str, Dex, Con, etc.), chosen at the point of preparing the Form.
  • True Vision: You gain the effects of the see invisibility spell permanently.
  • Water Ready: You gain the Swim movement mode or gain a +10 ft bonus to movement speed if you already have it.
  • Flight: You gain the Fly movement mode or gain a +10 ft bonus to movement speed if you already have it.
  • Unfazed: You gain [Immunity] to [Stunned] and [Dazed].

4.32.1.2 2 Point

  • Battle Ready: Your Form has one natural weapon, with three properties of your choice (except [Arcane] and [Barbed]) and a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. You also gain a +3 item bonus to AC and a +2 bonus to DCs of and saves against combat manoeuvres.
  • Swift Feet: You gain a +15 ft bonus to your movement speed.
  • Hardy: Once per [Encounter], if you make a successful Fortitude or Will save against an effect that would normally have a less¬er effect on a successful save (such as a spell with a save of “Fortitude half”), you instead ignore the effect entirely.
  • Evasive: Once per [Encounter], if you make a successful Relfex save against an effect that would normally have a less¬er effect on a successful save (such as a spell with a save of “Reflex half”), you instead ignore the effect entirely.
  • Vampiric: When you deal damage with a melee attack, you heal HP equal to half the damage dealt, up to a maximum of your level.
  • Disguise: You can make your appearance match exactly that of any individual creature whose appearance you are familiar with, as long as your Form is the same size and creature type as that individual.
  • Sensory Acuity: You gain [Immunity] to [Figment] effects.
  • Tunnelling: You gain the Burrow movement mode or gain a +10 ft bonus to movement speed if you already have it.
  • Blindsight: You gain the [Blindsight] vision mode out to your [Close] range, if you take this ability a second time it increases to [Medium] and with three times out to [Long] range.
  • Uncatchable: You gain [Immunity] to [Binding] effects.
  • Uninfluenced: You gain [Immunity] to effects with the [Mind affecting] descriptor.

4.32.1.3 3 Point

  • Multiple Limbs: You can make an additional attack of opportunity each turn for each instance of this feature you have.
  • Multistrike: Whenever you take an attack action, you gain a [Bonus Attack].
  • Swift Body: You gain a +25 ft bonus to movement speed.
  • Swift Mind: Once per [Round], you may take an additional swift or immediate action.
  • Thick Hide: You have [Resistance] to physical damage.
  • Antimagic: You have [Resistance] to magical and energy damage.
  • Regeneration: You gain [Fast healing] equal to your level.

4.32.1.4 4 Point

  • Warbeast: Your Form has up to three natural weapons, with three properties of your choice (except [Arcane] and [Barbed]) and a +4 item bonus to attack rolls, you also gain a +5 item bonus to AC and a +4 bonus to DCs of and saves against combat manoeuvres. Also, your [Melee] range increases by 10 ft.
  • Perfect Camouflage: You gain the effects of the greater invisibility spell permanently.

4.33 Skarn

Table 4.36: Skarn Race
Type [Humanoid]
Size Average
Str 2
Save bonus Choose any
Special +1 Power Point per level
Special Unarmed strikes count as a Brutal 1 weapon
Bonus Feat Option 1 Trance of Battle
Bonus Feat Option 2 Thicket of Blades
Bonus Feat Option 3 Open Lesser Binding

More widespread than the other Mishtaic races, Skarn can be found not just in the stalwart Azujin nation of Nigahara, but also in the Frein and Ikoran archipelagos off the coast of Baccain, to which many clans of Skarn migrated mere decades after the death of the Mishtai. Skarn look like muscular but stout Humans, averaging just under five feet tall. Their most distinctive feature are the lizard-like retractable spines which emerge from scaly growths along their backs, and the bony, blade-like potrusions which stick out of their forearms (and provide an emergency improvised weapon).

4.34 Slaad

Table 4.37: Slaad Race
Type [Outsider]
Size [Large]
Cha +2
Con +2
Wis -2
Lesser resistance Acid
Save bonus Will
Bonus Feat Option 1 Confusion
Bonus Feat Option 2 To Iron Married
Bonus Feat Option 3 Senseshift Adept
Table 4.37: Slaad Class
HP 10
Skills 5
BAB Good
Good Saves Ref and Will
KOM Cha
KDM Con

In the chaos of Limbo, the madness of Pandaemonium and the Freedom of Ysgard, there is one constant race, the Slaads. Shapeshifting beings that have a default form of a fearsome bipedal frog, and insanely complex and ever changing systems of society and reproduction. These beings of pure chaos, and mortals which emulate them, harness powers which are noticeable strange, and hard to predict compared to orthodox magic.

1st Circle – Hi every1 im newSU: Your attacks deal additional damage equal to three times the circle of the last active ability from a track your target used.

2nd Circle – Holds up sporkSU: The first time each [Round] that you take damage, you heal HP equal to the highest common factor between your maximum HP and the maximum HP of the creature which dealt the damage to you.

3rd Circle – T4h PeNGU1N of DOOM!SU: Gain one of the following abilities, your choice is permanent:

  • Random Visions: Once per [Round], as a swift action, gain a +1d6 bonus to attack rolls or AC for one [Round].
  • Shifting Locomotion: You gain the Fly movement mode when your HP is even, and the Burrow movement mode while it is odd.

4th Circle – As u can seeSU: As a standard action, [Warp] a distance equal to 1d4 times the sum of a d20 and d10 roll (in ft). All enemies in your [Melee] range where you end the movement are moved away from you for 10 ft equal to the number of subtypes of Feat they have, and land [Prone].

5th Circle – im very random xDSU: Twice per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may cause an opponent in your [Close] range to become [Dazed] for one [Round]. This ability is negated if the target’s AC or Fortitude save bonus is a multiple of 5.

6th Circle – DOOOOOOOOOM!SU: As a standard action, create a wedge out to your [Close] range. All opponents in that wedge take damage based on a factor determined by a d4 roll.

  • Targets take damage equal to 8 times the total number of vision modes possessed by you and all creatures in the wedge
  • Targets take damage equal to 5 times the difference between the lowest and highest trained skill modifier of all creatures in the wedge and you.
  • The target whose name is first in alphabetical order takes 50 damage, then the second takes 40, the third 30, the fourth 20, the fifth 10 and all others take no damage
  • Targets take damage equal to 20 times the number of tracks they possess that aren’t from their Class

7th Circle – Love and wafflesSU: Twice per [Encounter], as a swift action you gain a protective barrier until the start of your next turn. This barrier gives you [Immunity] to all damage and effects from attacks where the attack roll result was not a multiple of 3.

4.35 Sphinx

Table 4.38: Sphinx Race
Type [Magical beast]
Size [Large]
Int +2
Wis +2
Dex -2
Vision [Ghostwise sight] 45 ft
Save bonus Will
Bonus Feat Option 1 Any [Skill] feat that requires a Knowledge skill trained
Table 4.38: Sphinx Class
HP 12
Skills All Knowledge skills and 1 more
BAB Poor
Good Saves Fort and Will
KOM Wis
KDM Int

Sphinxes are ancient and enigmatic creatures, and masters of two forms of magic. Their speciality is an esoteric form of enchantment based on telling riddles, where they can curse those who fail to solve a riddle, but are powerless against those who can decipher it. In addition to this, Sphinxes are hugely intelligent and resistant to magic.

1st Circle – The Riddle GameEX: You gain a +2 Item bonus to your Int score. Also you gain the following ability:

  • Riddle of the ExplorerSLA: As a move action, target an opponent in [Medium] range and make a Geography check, the target also makes a Geography check. If you score higher, that target takes a penalty to movement speed until the end of the [Encounter] equal to 5 ft per circle you have in Sphinx, and they lose any access to [Tremorsense] or [Blindsense]. This stacks up to two times.

2nd Circle – Riddle Me ThisEX: Once per [Encounter], when you make a save against a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability which has a lesser effect on a successful save (e.g. half damage), you instead negate the ability’s effects completely. You gain the following ability:

  • Riddle of the BuilderSLA: As a move action, target an opponent in [Medium] range and make an Engineering check, the target also makes an Engineering check. If you score higher, that target takes a penalty to damage roles equal to half your Int modifier until the end of the [Encounter], this stacks up to two times.

3rd Circle – Three GuessesEX: You gain the Fly movement mode, and the following ability:

  • Riddle of the ScholarSLA: As a move action, target an opponent in [Medium] range and make a History check, the target also makes a History check. If you score higher, that target takes a -2 penalty to all save DCs for its abilities until the end of the [Encounter], This stacks up to two times.

4th Circle – Four Legs in the MorningEX: Your Item bonus to Int increases to +4. You gain the following ability:

  • Riddle of the MageSLA: As a move action, target an opponent in [Medium] range and make an Arcana check, the target also makes an Arcana check. If you score higher, they take a -3 penalty to saving throws which decreases by 1 at the end of each of their turns, but stacks up to -4.

5th Circle – To Be or Not to Be?SU: You gain [Resistance] to magical and energy damage, and a +3 bonus to saves against effects with the [Mind affecting] descriptor. You gain the following ability:

  • Riddle of the Dark LoreSLA: As a move action, target an opponent in [Medium] range and make a knowledge check of your choice, the target also makes that check. If you score higher, the target is [Shaken]. The fear from this ability stacks, but the target loses one point on the fear ladder at the end of each of their turns.

6th Circle – The Big QuestionsEX: Your Item bonus to Int increases to +6. You gain the following ability:

  • Riddle of the Aging ManSLA: As a move action, target an opponent in [Medium] range and make a Medicine check, the target also makes a Medicine check. If you score higher, they gain [Vulnerability] to all damage done by your allies until the start of your next turn. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Int modifier) means you instead choose physical or magical and energy damage from your allies for them to gain [Vulnerability] to.

7th Circle – The Final WordSU: Your [Resistance] to magical and energy damage increases to [Greater resistance] and you gain [Immunity] to effects with the [Mind affecting] descriptor. You gain the following ability:

  • Riddle of TimeSLA: As a move action, target an opponent in [Medium] range and make a Nature check, the target also makes a Nature check. If you score higher, they are [Energy drained], if you scored more than 10 higher they are [Energy drained] twice, and if you scored more than 20 higher they are [Energy drained] four times.

4.36 Thri-Keen

Table 4.39: Thri-Keen Race
Type [Monstrous humanoid]
Size Average
Con +2
Int +4
Str -2
Cha -2
Skill bonus Perception
Special You may wield up to two additional weapons at a time, and may stack the [Guardian] bonuses of two weapons or shields
Bonus Feat Option 1 Troubleshooter
Bonus Feat Option 2 Cheerful Hemoglobin
Bonus Feat Option 3 Pick a God and Pray!

The most human-like Arhtropoid race, Thri-Keen can be found in deserts and jungles throughout the world - they need either extremely high or low moisture in their environment to be comfortable. With a mostly humanoid frame, Thri-Keen are still easily distinguised by having four arms (often bending at two different elbows), a beetle-like face with compound eyes and mandibles, and a shell-like carapace over their torso. However, their brains are fairly typical of mammalian and reptilian humanoids, and Thri-Keen societies are highly varied.

4.37 Tiefling

Table 4.40: Tiefling Race
Type [Humanoid] but also count as an [Outsider] for relevant effects
Size [Average]
Any physical +2
Int +2
Wis -2
Lesser resistance [Fire], [Acid] and magic
Bonus Attack
Skill bonus Bluff
Special -2 to Will saves
Bonus Feat Option 1 Arcane Magister
Bonus Feat Option 2 By Will Sustained
Bonus Feat Option 3 The Earth Cracks

Special: Tieflings may multiclass freely into the Devil, Demon or Daemon track.

The descendants of humanoids and Fiends, Tieflings appear like humans, but with red skin and noticeable horns and tails, which means it is very easy for society to identify and outcast them. Their dark ancestry gives them enhanced physical capabilities and cunning, but that same blood also makes them easy to tempt and unlikely to put much thought into their actions.

4.38 Wildborn

Table 4.41: Wildborn Race
Type [Animal], [Monstrous humanoid] or [Magical beast]
Size [Average]
Any Physical +2
Vision [Ghostwise sight] 45 ft
Vision [Darkvision]
Bonus Feat Option 1 Wake
Bonus Feat Option 2 Breakneck Pace
Bonus Feat Option 3 When I’m Angry
Table 4.41: Wildborn Class
HP 10
Skills 5
BAB Good
Good Saves Fort and Ref
KOM Any physical
KDM Wis

The hunting creatures of the wild, lycanthrope warriors, and even hunters with just a speck of beast blood all hunt in a similar fashion, relying on their senses to isolate targets and find their weakness, then simply letting their natural ferocity take over.

1st Circle – On the ProwlEX: You gain a +2 bonus to Awareness and Perception checks, and the following natural attack:

  • Tooth and Claw: [Melee], [Brutal 2], [Reacting]

2nd Circle – I Can Smell YouEX: Your acute senses enable you to penetrate illusions that would fool other creatures. You gain [Immunity] to effects with the [Figment] descriptor. Whenever you succeed on the combat use of Perception against an opponent, you gain a +3 fury bonus to attack rolls against that opponent until the beginning of your next turn.

3rd Circle – Hungry Like the WolfEX: You gain [Fast healing] equal to your Key Defensive modifier. Once per [Round], when you hit an opponent against which you succeeded on the combat use of Perception in the current [Round] with an attack using your Tooth & Claw natural attack, you may make that opponent [Slowed] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Slowed] condition.

4th Circle – More Than They Can ChewEX: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Bear: You gain a fury bonus to your maximum HP equal to +3 per level and a fury bonus to damage rolls on attacks with your Tooth and Claw natural weapon equal to your KOM.
  • Wolf: You gain a fury bonus to your maximum hit points equal to +2 per level. Whenever you hit an opponent with an attack using your Tooth & Claw natural attack, that opponent suffers a -1 penalty to AC until the end of the [Encounter]. This penalty stacks with itself, to a maximum of -3.
  • Tiger: You gain a fury bonus to your maximum hit points equal to +1 per level. Whenever you deal damage with a melee attack using your Tooth & Claw natural weapon, if you used the Power Attack combat manoeuvre this turn, you gain a fury bonus to that damage equal to the penalty applied to your melee attack rolls from the Power Attack combat manoeuvre.

5th Circle – First to FeedEX: You gain a bonus on initiative checks equal to your character level.

6th Circle – Never Stop HuntingEX: Whenever you succeed on the combat use of Perception against an opponent, that opponent suffers a penalty to its movement speed equal to half its movement speed until the beginning of your next turn. Additionally, select one of the following abilities (this choice is permanent):

  • Submission is for the Weak: You gain [Immunity] to [Mind-affecting] effects and the [Stunned] and [Dazed] conditions.
  • Hunter of Seasons: You gain [Immunity] to the [Fatigued], [Exhausted] and [Prone] conditions.

7th Circle – Bad Moon RisingSU: You just don’t know when to stay down. Once per [Scene], if you are killed, you return to life the following [Round] at half of your maximum hit points. You can delay your resurrection any number of [Rounds] or choose not to return at all. Upon your return, you automatically know the location of the opponent that killed you, and until the end of the [Encounter], you ignore any [Miss chance] that opponent may have and gain +5 fury bonus to attack rolls and damage against that opponent.

5 Additional Tracks

5.1 Abjuration

Abjurers are typically thought of as masters of defensive magic. Technically, Abjuration is the discipline of binding magic onto items or into spaces in the world, but the most common application of this is to create defensive wards or grant them to allies. Skilled Abjurers also know magic can be unwoven as easily as it is woven, and allow their allies to unweave these wards for immediate bursts of powerful magic.

1st Circle – Arcane RampartEX: As a standard action, create three Walls of Force per circle you have in Abjurer on contiguous unoccupied spaces within your [Close] range. Each Wall cannot be moved through except by a creature that is [Flying], [Soaring], [Burrowing], [Swimming] or one that makes an Athletics or Acrobatics check a DC 14 + your character level + your KDM. The Walls do not block line of sight or line of effect, but do grant [Covered] to any creature being targeted by a ranged attack through them.

If you create a Wall of Force in a space already occupied by a Wall of Force, it is enhanced so that it cannot be moved through except by [Burrowing] or [Soaring] creatures and blocks line of effect.

Each Wall expires after a number of [Rounds] equal to your KDM. As an immediate action, you can expend any number of Walls within an ally’s [Melee] range. They get a bonus to AC and saving throws equal to twice the number of expended Walls against the next attack of opportunity, attack action, spell, spell-like ability or supernatural ability that targets them.

2nd Circle – Ward of SafetySLA: As a standard action, you may place a ward on an ally in [Medium] range which grants them a bonus to a save of your choice equal to the number of circles you have in Abjurer. The ally with this ward can expend it as a free action to deal damage equal to twice their character level to all enemies in their [Melee] range, this is physical damage if the ward was against Fortitude saves, energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor is against Reflex saves, and magical damage if against Will saves. If not expended, the ward expires at the end of the [Encounter].

3rd Circle – Elemental WardSLA: As a standard action, you may place a ward on an ally in [Medium] range which grants them [Resistance] to an energy type ([Fire], [Acid], [Electricity], [Cold] or [Negative]) of your choice. The ally with this ward can expend it as a move action to enchant their wielded weapon with that energy type. Until the end of the [Encounter], hits with that weapon deal an additional 1d6 points of energy damage with that descriptor equal to the number of circles you have in Abjurer. If not expended, the ward expires at the end of the [Encounter].

4th Circle – Shielding WardSLA: As a standard action, you may place a ward on an ally in [Medium] range which grants them a +4 deflection bonus to AC. The ally can expend this ward as a free action to replace their AC or saving throw against a single attack or ability with either the result of an attack roll from them, or of a Reflex save from you. If not expended, the ward expires at the end of the [Encounter].

5th Circle – Ward of ImmunitySLA: As a standard action, choose either effects with the [Binding] descriptor, effects with the [Mind-affecting] descriptor or [Battered], [Dazed] and [Stunned]. You may place a ward on an ally in [Medium] range which grants them [Immunity] to those effects or conditions. The ally can expend the ward as a free action to regain hit points equal to four times their character level and end any one condition affecting them. If not expended, the ward expires at the end of the [Encounter].

Once you have chosen a type of effect or group of conditions with this ability, you cannot choose a different one until the end of the [Encounter].

6th Circle – Immovable WardSLA: As a standard action, you may place a ward on an ally in [Medium] range which forces any opponent attempting to enter their [Melee] range to stop moving, a successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Int modifier] allows them to enter the range but at the start of their next turn they must make the save again or be shunted to the nearest square outside the range (if still there) and become unable to enter the range that [Round]. The ally may expend the ward as an immediate action to have any enemy succeeding the save become [Nauseated] for one [Round]. If not expended, the ward expires at the end of the [Encounter].

7th Circle – Ward of RebirthSLA: Once per [Encounter] as a standard action, you may place a ward on an ally which returns them to life at half their maximum HP if they die. That ally can expend the ward as a swift action to cause an enemy in their [Melee] range to become [Battered] until the end of the [Encounter]. If not expended, the ward expires at the end of the [Encounter]. You may only have one instance of this ward active at a time and if it does return someone to life you cannot use it again until the next [Scene].

5.2 Archaeomancy

Magic is everywhere, even in places where there is not a hedge mage in sight, the land remembers its long history of exposure to the forces of the arcane, the divine and even the profane. Archaeomancers are mages who unearth these memories and combine them into esoteric or ancient spells.

All save DCs against effects of spells and abilities from this track are 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Int modifier.

1st Circle – UnearthSU: The first time each [Round] each creature uses a spell, spell-like, or supernatural ability within 10 ft of you, plus 5 ft for each circle of Archaeomancy you have, you gain a spell charge. When you gain a spell charge until the end of the [Encounter], roll a d8, and gain the corresponding charge:

  • 1 - Abjuration
  • 2 - Conjuration
  • 3 - Divination
  • 4 - Enchantment
  • 5 - Evocation
  • 6 - Illusion
  • 7 - Necromancy
  • 8 - Transmutation

As a standard action you may use a spell charge to cast the corresponding reconstructed spell (see below). These all count as spells, not spell-like abilities, and provoke attacks of opportunity as normal. They do not spend spell slots.

When not in combat, you may only Unearth a number of spell charges equal to your Int modifier before the latent magic runs dry. In combat there is no limit as the emotional energy of battle causes latent magic to rise to the surface.

In any case, you may only have up to six spell charges at a time. After you have six, you no longer gain spell charges from Unearth until you spend some.

All Abjuration Reconstructed Spells are [Warding] effects, all Enchantment Reconstructed Spells are [Mind-affecting] and all Illusion Reconstructed Spells are [Figment] effects.

2nd Circle – RecombineSU: As a standard action, you may use two spell charges to cast the corresponding Reconstructed Spell of two disciplines. You can cast Reconstructed Spells from the 2nd circle list.

3rd Circle – Learn from HistorySLA: As a move action, you may gain a +3 bonus until the start of your next turn to AC if you were hit by an attack in the last [Round], and a +3 bonus to any saves you failed in the last [Round].

You can cast Reconstructed Spells from the 3rd circle list.

4th Circle – Disrupt the PresentSLA: As a standard action, you may end a single magical effect within [Medium] range of 6th circle or lower.

You can cast Reconstructed Spells from the 4th circle list. These are all [Surge] effects.

5th Circle – DiscoverSU: When you trigger Unearth, instead roll a d10. On a 9 or 10 you choose which spell charge you gain.

For every five spell charges you have gained in the [Encounter], you may cast a Reconstructed Spell as part of a standard action, where the other part is to cast a Reconstructed Spell (note that you cannot activate multiple [Surge] effects in a [Round]).

6th Circle – Redefine the PresentSLA: As a standard action, you may end a single magical effect within [Medium] range of 7th circle or lower, or any number of magical effects within [Medium] range of 3rd circle or lower.

You can cast Reconstructed Spells from the 6th circle list. These are all [Surge] effects.

7th Circle – Doomed to Repeat ItSLA: Once per [Scene], as a standard action, force target opponent within [Medium] range to, on their next turn, repeat every action they took on their last turn. If possible, this should include choosing the same targets for any attacks or abilities. A Will save negates this effect.

5.2.1 Reconstructed Spells

5.2.1.1 Basic

  • Abjuration: Choose Fortitude, Reflex, or Will and an ally within [Medium] range. The next time in this [Encounter] that the chosen ally makes a successful save of that type against an effect that would normally have a lesser effect on a successful save (such as a spell with a save of “Fortitude half”), they instead ignore the effect entirely.
  • Conjuration: Create a 5 ft radius spread of dimensional rift centred within your [Medium] range. All creatures starting turn in or moving through the spread gain a +15 ft bonus to their movement speed for the [Round], and may [Teleport] for any part of their movement which is between spreads created by this spell. All attacks or effects with line of effect moving through the spread may bend the line of effect up to 45 degrees at the point they move through the spread.
  • Divination: Choose an ally within [Medium] range. On any d20 roll in the next [Round], before they roll, they may choose to roll two d20s and take the highest.
  • Enchantment: Choose an opponent within [Medium] range and another creature within [Medium] range. If possible without provoking attacks of opportunity, and the second target is your ally, the opponent must either target that ally with or include them in the area of effect of their next offensive action. If possible without provoking attacks of opportunity, and the second target is the opponent’s ally, the opponent must either target that creature with or include them in the area of effect of their next helpful action. A successful Will save negates this effect.
  • Evocation: Choose an opponent within [Medium] range. They take damage with the [Force] descriptor equal to three times your Int modifier, and you may push them back up to 5ft per circle of Archaeomancer you have. A successful Fortitude save prevents the forced movement.
  • Illusion: Choose an opponent within [Medium] range. On the next d20 roll they make in the [Round], they roll two d20s as take the lowest.
  • Necromancy: Choose an opponent within [Medium] range and an ability score. They take a penalty to that ability score equal to half your Int modifier until the end of the [Encounter]. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect and the penalties do not stack.
  • Transmutation: Choose an ally within [Medium] range. Once until the end of the [Encounter], as a free action on their turn they may heal hit points equal to three times your Int modifier.

5.2.1.2 2nd Circle

  • Abjuration + Conjuration = Elemental Ward: Choose an ally within [Medium] range and an energy type. Until the end of the [Encounter], that ally has [Immunity] to that energy type, and the first time each [Round] an opponent enters or starts turn in that ally’s [Melee] range, the opponent takes energy damage with the chosen descriptor equal to three times that ally’s KDM.
  • Abjuration + Illusion = Displacement: Choose an ally within [Medium] range. They gain 50% [Miss Chance] until the end of the [Encounter], but whenever an attack misses them due to [Miss chance] they lose it for the remainder of the [Round].
  • Abjuration + Necromancy = Necrotic Shield: Choose an ally within [Medium] range. Until the end of the [Encounter], the first time each [Round] they hit with a melee attack the target takes [HP reduction] equal to twice your Int modifier, and the first time each [Round] they are hit with a melee attack the attacker takes [HP reduction] equal to your level.
  • Conjuration + Evocation = Elemental Storm: Choose an energy type and create a 45 ft radius spread within [Medium] range. Until the end of your next turn, the first time each [Round] each creature starts turn in or moves into the spread they take energy damage with the chosen descriptor equal to your level plus your Int modifier. At the end of your next turn, all creatures in the spread take energy damage with the chosen descriptor equal to three times your level plus your Int modifier.
  • Conjuration + Illusion = Flee the Scene: Choose an ally within [Medium] range and [Teleport] them up to 50 ft in any direction (you do not need line of sight to the destination if you just specify a distance). They become [Invisible] until they make an offensive action or until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Divination + Enchantment = Heroism: Choose an ally within [Medium] range. Three times until the end of the [Encounter], before they make a d20 roll they may choose to add another die to the roll. This die is of the closest size (rounding down) to your Int modifier (e.g. an Int modifier of 7 will roll a d6, and of 5 will roll a d4).
  • Divination + Necromancy = Death Sight: Choose an ally within [Medium] range. Until the end of the [Encounter], they know the hit points of all creatures they can see, and their attacks inflict [Bleeding] and [Burning] on a hit.
  • Enchantment + Evocation = Mental Force: Choose an opponent within [Medium] range. You deal magical damage equal to five times your Int modifier to that opponent. A Will save negates the damage.
  • Illusion + Necromancy = Blindness: Choose an opponent within [Medium] range. They are [Blinded] until the end of the [Encounter]. A Fortitude save negates this effect.

5.2.1.3 3rd Circle

  • Abjuration + Divination = Forewarning: Choose an ally within [Medium] range. Once until the end of the [Encounter], when they are targeted by an attack or have to make a Reflex save, before the roll, they may cause that attack to automatically miss or the Reflex save to automatically succeed.
  • Abjuration + Enchantment = Mind Blank: Choose an ally within [Medium] range. They gain [Immunity] to [Mind-affecting] until the end of the [Encounter] and gain temporary HP equal to your Int modifer for every [Mind-affecting] effect that was on them at the time of casting.
  • Conjuration + Necromancy = Fear Storm: Create a 45 ft radius spread within [Medium] range. Until the end of your next turn, the first time each [Round] each creature starts turn in or moves into the spread they are [Shaken] for two [Rounds]. At the end of your next turn, all creatures in the spread are [Frightened] for two [Rounds].
  • Divination + Illusion = True Sight: Choose an ally within [Medium] range. They gain [Immunity] to [Figment] and all creatures within their [Long] range are [Revealed] to them until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Divination + Transmutation = Echolocation: Choose an ally within [Medium] range. Until the end of the [Encounter], they gain [Blindsense] out to their [Melee] range and deal 4d6 bonus [Precision] damage against creatures within their [Blindsense] range.
  • Enchantment + Illusion = Hypnotic Glamer: Create a 5 ft wide line with length equal to five times your Int modifier within [Medium] range. All creatures with line of sight to the line must make a Will save or be Slowed while they have line of sight to it. The line lasts until the end of the [Encounter], and blocks line of sight for all creatures who have failed the Will save.
  • Evocation + Illusion = Shadow Blast: Deal energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to five times your Int modifer to all opponents in a 15 ft wide line out to your [Medium] range. A successful Will save negates the effect, and if failed a successful Fortitude save halves the damage.
  • Illusion + Transmutation = Ectoplasm: Create a number of 5 ft spreads within [Medium] range equal to your Int modifier until the end of the [Encounter]. Creatures are [Entangled] while they are in any of the spreads, and at the end of a creature’s turn if they are in one of the spreads they must make a Will save or take energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to three times your Int modifier.

5.2.1.4 4th Circle

  • Abjuration + Evocation = Energy Wall: Create a 10 ft wide line of length equal to 20 times your Int modifier within [Medium] range and choose an energy type. The line blocks line of sight but not line of effect. When a creature starts turn in or enters a space in the spread they take energy damage with the chosen descriptor equal to three times your Int modifier. This lasts until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Conjuration + Divination = Close Augur: Choose an ally in [Medium] range and roll three d20s. Until the end of the [Encounter], when the chosen ally makes a d20 roll they must use one of the noted down results instead of the d20 results, and cannot use that result again. Once all the results are used, the effect ends.
  • Evocation + Necromancy = Skull Cloud: Create a 45 ft raidus spread within [Medium] range. Until the end of the [Encounter], the first time each [Round] that each creature starts turn in or enters the spread they take [HP reduction] equal to twice your Int modifier, and then energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to twice your Int modifier, a Fortitude save negates the [HP reduction]. At the start of each of your turns, you may move the spread to be centred on any space in [Medium] range.
  • Enchantment + Transmutation = Phantom Pain: Choose an opponent in [Medium] range. Until the end of the [Encounter], whenever they move or make an attack roll they take damage equal to your Int modifier. A Will save negates this effect, and they can attempt an additional Will save as a move action that provokes attacks of opportunity.
  • Necromancy + Transmutation = Spawn Wraiths: Create a 45 ft radius spread within [Medium] range which lasts until the end of the [Encounter]. Any creature which starts and ends turn in the spread must make a Fortitude save or be [Paralyzed] and take a -2 penalty to Strength, Dexterity and Constitution. If three [Positive] effects are used within the spread, it is dispelled.
  • Conjuration + Transmutation = Warp Drive: Choose an ally in [Medium] range, immediately on casting the spell they [Warp] up to 100 ft in any direction, and until the end of the [Encounter] all their movement can be a [Warp].

5.2.1.5 6th Circle

  • Abjuration + Transmutation = Supreme Haste: Choose an ally in [Medium] range. Until the end of the [Encounter], they may once each make an additional standard, move, swift and immediate action.
  • Conjuration + Enchantment = Storm of Control: Create a 45 ft radius spread within [Medium] range. Until the end of your next turn, the first time each [Round] each creature starts turn in or moves into the spread they must make a Will save or be unable to target with an offensive action any creature which has not targeted them with an offensive action in the last [Round]. At the end of your next turn, all creatures in the spread must make a Will save or be [Bound] to you for one [Round].
  • Divination + Evocation = Future Sight: Choose an opponent in [Medium] range. At the end of your next turn, they take damage equal to nine times your Int modifier. A Fortitude save halves the damage and prevents it from reducing them below 1 hit point. This is a [Death] effect.
  • Enchantment + Necromancy = Brain Death: Choose an opponent in [Medium] range. They are [Stunned] for one [Round]. A Will save causes them to instead be [Slowed], [Sickened] and [Exhausted].
  • Evocation + Transmutation = Petrify: Choose an opponent in [Medium] range. They are [Petrified]. A Fortitude save causes them to instead be [Slowed] and [Entangled] with the same rules for removal as [Petrified].

5.3 Arithmancy

Arithmancers follow a strange discipline – a subset of Divination which purports to understand the Numbers which underlie all things in the universe. Many disagree with their ‘reductionist’ philosophy, but one cannot argue with their ability to manipulate reality through their understanding of these numbers.

1st Circle – Base TenSU: You and all creatures within [Close] range ignore all rounding (instead keeping non-integer values wherever relevant). As a swift action, you may cause a creature within [Close] range with non-integer current HP to become [Dazzled] for three [Rounds]. As a move action, you may cause a creature within [Close] range with non-integer current HP to become [Shaken] for two [Rounds].

Also, once per [Scene] you can use the following ability. You may use it an additional time per [Scene] when you reach your 4th and 7th circles in Arithmancy:

  • Fourier TransformSLA: With a one minute ritual, change the bonus granted by one ability of an ally in [Close] range from its type to another valid one (e.g. item to feat or fury to deflection, but you cannot change an attack bonus to deflection type). This effect lasts until the end of the [Scene].

2nd Circle – Number TheorySU: As an immediate action, learn the bonus for an action which was just taken in [Medium] range (e.g. attack bonus for an attack, skill bonus for a skill check, save bonus for a saving throw). Choose one of the three options below for each of Odd and Even. When you use number theory, if the number is Odd you can apply the penalty you chose for Odd, and if Even the one for Even. The choice is permanent.

  • Reduce the creature’s next damage roll result to the next prime number (eg 16 goes down to 13).
  • The creature’s attack bonus and AC go down to the next multiple of 3 for one [Round].
  • Change one +2 bonus the creature has to -2 for two [Rounds].

3rd Circle – Central TendencySLA: As part of a move action, name a saving throw bonus, a skill bonus, attack bonus, maximum HP, AC or Awareness, and then say a number. If it is the Median of that number of all creatures in the [Encounter], you get +2 to that value for two [Rounds] (for HP you instead get +2 temporary HP per your level). If it is the Mean, you gain +5. You can use this ability once per [Encounter] for each value, and can use it as a move action where the other part is to use Central Tendency.

Also, for Number Theory you may choose one of these penalties each for Multiple of 3, Multiple of 4 and Multiple of 5 (if a number is a multiple of both, or also Odd or Even, you may choose which penalty to apply). The choice is permanent.

  • The creature’s next skill check against another creature fails if their skill bonus is less than the target’s bonus to that skill.
  • DCs of saves against the creature’s abilities are reduced to a maximum of the target’s bonus to that save +13 for one [Round].
  • The creature’s [Fast healing] and [Damage reduction] are halved for two [Rounds].

4th Circle – DifferentiationSLA: Twice per [Encounter], as an immediate action when a creature rolls damage after using an ability, you may cause all other future uses of that ability for the [Encounter] to do the same amount of damage.

5th Circle – AdditionSLA: Twice per [Scene], as a standard action, you may choose two abilities that target creature in [Close] range has. When they use next one of the two abilities, they also use the other simultaneously (if they use the same action, using only one but using both actions if they use different actions).

Also, for Number Theory, you may choose one of these penalties each for Prime, Square and Multiple of 10. The choice is permanent.

  • The creature’s next healing which is not [Fast healing] has its value reduced by the higher of its attack bonus plus 10 or AC.
  • The creature’s next save adds the highest common factor of its save bonuses instead of its normal save bonus.
  • The creature’s [Bonus attacks], attacks of opportunity, and attacks made as part of an active ability all use its iterative attack bonus instead of its normal one for two [Rounds].

6th Circle – CongruencySLA: Twice per [Encounter], as a standard action, roll 1d20+4. Total the congruency of the current HP of every creature in [Medium] range to that value (for example, the congruency of 100 to 6 is 4). All allies within [Medium] range heal HP equal to that number, and you may choose one ally in [Medium] range. If their next attack hits, it deals bonus damage equal to that number.

7th Circle – Division and MultiplicationSLA: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Division: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, target two creatures within [Medium] range. Divide one creature’s current HP by the other’s current HP. If the result is an integer, the first creature’s HP becomes the result of that calculation. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½your level + your KDM) negates this effect.
  • Multiplication: Once per [Scene], as a standard action, choose an ability with limited uses per [Scene] or [Encounter] not called Multiplication that target ally in [Melee] range has. Roll 1d4-1. The number of uses that ability has is multiplied by your result.

5.4 Armour Knight

Especially in large armies, but even in smaller adventuring parties it is helpful to have someone equipped to take punishment by wearing heavy armour and carrying huge tower shields. Slow and plodding, but powerful, Armour Knights are meant to get to the centre of a battle and stay there, resisting physical attack and landing single powerful strikes.

1st Circle – Safe and ShieldedEX: You take a -15 penalty to your base movement speed, but gain [Damage reduction] equal to your total Item and Deflection bonus to AC. This increases to twice your total Item and Deflection bonus to AC at 6th level.

2nd Circle – ProvokeEX: You gain a bonus to Intimidate checks equal to your total Item and Deflection bonus to AC. When you make a successful in-combat Intimidate check against an opponent within your [Close] range, they cannot make attack rolls or use abilities which require attack rolls on their next turn unless those attack rolls target you. This ability can only target one opponent per Intimidate check.

3rd Circle – AegisEX: Once per [Round], when you take damage from any source, you may roll a d100. If the result is less than the ability score you use for your KDM, you take no damage.

4th Circle – Iron CurtainEX: You gain [Immunity] to additional damage and effects from critical hits, and your [Melee] range is increased by 10.

5th Circle – LunaEX: As a standard action, you may make a single melee attack which ignores all [Damage reduction] and [Resistance] on a hit.
