When you make the attack roll, roll a d100 and if the result is below the ability score you use for your KDM, the attack deals double damage and you half your target’s AC against the attack.

6th Circle – PaviseEX: You may use Aegis an additional time each [Round], but only against a type of damage you have not previously used it against (e.g. you can use it against physical and magical damage, or against [Fire] and magical damage).

7th Circle – Blessed BulwarkEX: Double your item and deflection bonuses to AC.

5.5 Bake-Kurage

Like the other Mishtaic races, the Skarn are unable to access magic. The Azurin developed Feng Shui, and the ancient Rilkan in the Houses of Waves circumvented the Mishtai’s dying curse. Even diasporic Skarn turned to base elementalism. But in Nigahara, magic is shunned in favour of Samurai oaths, embracing Qi or rejecting the metaphysical for the Karakuri. But beyond the Shogunate’s walls, on the black soils of the volcanic beaches, exiled shamans make contracts with alien creatures - the Kurage, alien, ghostly jellyfish-like spirits of the water. These Bake-Kurage can summon Kurage to them, using the calming magic of primordial water to heal their allies and make their enemies dangerously vulnerable.

1st Circle – Kurage’s OathSLA: As a standard action, create a Kurage on a space within [Medium] range. The Kurage does not block line of sight or line of effect, and can be freely moved through (but creatures cannot end their turn in the Kurage’s space, as though it was occupied by a creature), and lasts for 1d4 [Rounds]. At the end of each of your turns, all opponents within 15 ft of the Kurage take energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to your level, and all allies within 15 ft of the Kurage heal hit points equal to the total of your KDM and your level.

You may only have one Kurage active at once. If you create a new one, the previous one disappears instantly.

2nd Circle – The Clouds Like Waves RipplingSU: The first time each [Round] each ally deals magical damage to a creature which was damaged by your Kurage in the last [Round], they deal 1d4 additional damage per circle you have in Bake-Kurage. Allies gain +1d4 to attack rolls against creatures which were damaged by your Kurage in the last [Round].

3rd Circle – Nereid’s AscensionSU: A number of times per [Scene] equal to the number of circles you have in Bake-Kurage, you may don the Ceremonial Garment of the Bake-Kurage as a free action. This lasts until the end of your next turn. While you are wearing the Garment, you can a ranged [Brutal], [Distant], [Cold] natural weapon, make a [Bonus attack] when you make an attack action, and whenever you hit a creature with your natural weapon, all allies within 15 ft of your Kurage heal hit points equal to your level plus your KDM.

4th Circle – All Streams Flow to the SeaSU: The range of your Kurage’s ability to damage and heal (including as a result of a hit while you wear the Ceremonial Garment) increases to 25 ft. All d4s rolled due to Bake-Kurage abilities (duration and bonus damage) increase to d6s.

5th Circle – Tamano-oya’s CasketSU: When you don the Ceremonial Garment, roll a d6 and add that to the duration of your Kurage. When you hit with your natural weapon while wearing the Garment, opponents within 25 ft of your Kurage take energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to your level.

6th Circle – The Moon Overlooks the WatersSU: The first ally each [Round] to deal magical damage to a creature which was damaged by your Kurage in the last [Round] doubles that damage instead of adding d6 per circle.

7th Circle – Sango IsshinSLA: As an immediate action once per [Encounter], when an ally dies you may spend two uses of your Ceremonial Garment to return them to life at full hit points.

5.6 Binder

Beyond the normal afterlives, reserved for those whose soul never finds an Outer Plane in which to rest, is the Void. Many in the Void fade away and disappear from existence, but those souls of greater will linger as Vestiges, a memory of what they were in life, and the powers that defined them.

Binders are users of Pact Magic, which allows a mortal to call upon a representation of a Vestige and converse with it. In return for a chance to experience reality, Vestiges will grant a fraction of their power to a Binder. With proper preparation, a Binder can always have the right Vestige for the occasion, and is a very powerful ally.

But only the best bargainers can strike a deal while keeping their own personality. A Binder who does not successfully persuade a Vestige must bear their Sign, and operates under their Influence, affecting their personality and preventing them from certain specific actions.

1st Circle – The Best Trade Deal, Maybe EverSLA: With ten [Rounds] of effort, you can create the seal of a 1st circle Vestige. Once you make a seal, as a standard action you may begin negotiations with the Vestige. You may either immediately make a Pact with the Vestige, gaining its abilities but also its Influence and Sign, or you may spend an additional move action and a standard action next turn to make a Diplomacy, Bluff or Intimidate check. If it is successful (against the Vestige’s Pact DC), you gain the Vestige’s abilities, but not its Influence, and can choose whether to display their Sign.

If you have two Vestiges active whose Influences’ instructions counteract each other, you are [Paralyzed] until they are no longer in conflict.

You can keep a Vestige bound to you indefinitely, but can only have one at once. Binding another Vestige requires ending the bond with the one you currently have.

2nd Circle – Faustian PactSLA: You may now make the seal of 2nd circle Vestiges.

3rd Circle – Buy One Get One FreeSLA: You may now make the seal of 3rd circle Vestiges.

You can now keep two Vestiges bound to you, but must relinquish one to make a Pact with a third Vestige.

4th Circle – Brace for ImpactSLA: You may now make the seal of 4th circle Vestiges.

5th Circle – Pact of ParliamentSLA: You may now make the seal of 5th circle Vestiges.

You can now keep three Vestiges bound to you, but must relinquish one to make a Pact with a fourth Vestige.

6th Circle – I Wanna Make a Deal With YouSLA: You may now make the seal of 6th circle Vestiges.

7th Circle – The New DealSLA: You may now make the seal of 7th circle Vestiges.

You can now keep four Vestiges bound to you, but must relinquish one to make a Pact with a fifth Vestige.

5.6.1 Vestiges

5.6.1.1 1st Circle

Adelaide, the Doubter
Pact DC: 20
Sign: Your breath comes out as a pale blue mist
Influence: You identify the flaws in everything, you must always target enemies on full HP with offensive actions if possible
Doubter’s Insight: You know the name and creature type of any creature you can see
Multifarious Glyphs: For every magical effect originating from you currently affecting you, the DCs of your spells, spell-like and supernatural abilities increase by 1.
Soorinek’s Doubt: A number of times per [Round] equal to the number of circles you have in Binder, you may replace your AC against a single attack with the result of a Will save.

Amon, the Void Before the Altar
Pact DC: 16
Sign: You grow a ram’s curling horns
Influence: You become surly and irritable. You will not enter areas of a [Light] effect and will not enter the [Melee] range of any creature which deals damage with the [Fire] descriptor.
Special: Amon will not answer your call if you are bound to, or have been in the current [Scene], Chupoclops, Eurynome, Karsus or Leraje
Dark Sight: You gain [Darkvision].
Amon’s Hate: You instantly know the AC, saves and any [Immunities], [Resistances] and [Vulnerabilities] of creatures with the [Outsider] type you see.
Ancient Breath: As a standard action, you may deal energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to 1d4 times your level plus your Cha modifier to all creatures in a wedge out to your [Close] range originating from you. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) halves this damage.

Arete, the First Convert
Pact DC: 17
Sign: You gain the long, threaded hair of an Elan
Influence: You are eager to try new things, and will never reject a deal if the terms appear fair.
Psychic Sustenance: You do not need to eat, drink or sleep
Alarycite Cognition: You may eavesdrop on telepathic communication within your [Close] range.
Elan’s Metabolism: Your maximum hit points increase an amount equal to twice your character level.

Aym, Queen Avarice
Pact DC: 17
Sign: You gain a star-shaped brand on your forehead and left palm
Influence: You become stingy and greedy, but must also give a coin to every Dwarf you meet within a minute of learning their name.
Sundering: Every weapon you wield gains the [Sundering] property. Your attacks deal double damage to objects, and creatures of the [Construct] type have [Vulnerability] to damage from your attacks.
Dwarven Step: You take no penalty to Reflex saves from wearing Heavy Armour
Halo of Fire: The first creature to hit you with a melee attack each round takes 1d6 energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor.
Aym’s Resistance: When you make this Pact, choose one of [Fire], [Acid], [Cold] and [Electricity] for each circle of Binder you have. You gain [Resistance] to damage with those descriptors (you can choose one twice for [Greater resistance]).

Braeun, Voice of Tiamat
Pact DC: 18
Sign: Your voice is twice as loud as normal
Influence: You are loud and proud, and must attempt to open any door within a minute of seeing it.
Subtle Sight: When you touch a door, window, trapdoor (or similar portal), or portal to another Plane, you get an image of what is on the other side.
Braeun’s Ears: You gain [Immunity] to the [Deafened] condition.
Unrelenting Shout: As a standard action, you may attack one opponent in [Close] range with pure force. This deals 1d6+KOM damage with the [Force] descriptor and causes the opponent to be pushed away from you 5 ft plus an additional 5 ft per circle of you possess of Binder. When you reach 4th circle in Binder, the target is also [Battered] for two rounds. When you reach 6th circle in Binder, you affect a wedge out to your [Close] range and the damage increases to your level + KOM. A successful Fortitude save prevents being pushed back and [Battered].

Kas, the Bloody-Handed
Pact DC: 18
Sign: You gain an eye on each palm, which weeps blood for five [Rounds] after using any of Kas’ abilities.
Influence: You are warm and kind, but must betray someone within a hour of binding Kas
Vecna’s Lies: You gain a +3 bonus to Bluff checks, which increases to +6 against creatures who consider you their ally
Bloodied Blade: You ignore any [Damage reduction] and [Resistance] of creatures with the [Undead] type.
Blinding Strike: The range of numbers you score a critical hit on increases by 1 (eg from 20 to 19-20, from 18-20 to 17-20), and you inflict [Blinded] for the [Scene], or until the target is healed of all the damage you inflicted with the attack, on a critical hit.

Momir Vig, Author of the Covenant
Pact DC: 18
Sign: You gain a mutated limb or appendage, such as a tentacle or a scorpion tail growing from your arm.
Influence: You are overwhelmed by curiosity and an obsession with the scientific method. If you have abilities you have not used yet this [Scene], you must use one on your turn.
Ridic Form: You become an [Aberration] and gain a +3 bonus to Knowledge checks against [Aberrations].
Mutated Appendage: You gain a natural weapon with three properties of your choice when you make this pact.
Biological Perfection: You lose all your racial bonuses. You gain +2 to up to two statistics, if you choose two you take -2 to one statistic. You then gain two of:

  • +5 movement speed
  • +1 to attack rolls
  • +1 to AC
  • +1 to a saving throw
  • +1 (+1/8 levels) to a skill
  • [Darkvision]
  • [Ghostwise sight] 45 ft
  • The Swim movement mode

The Lady, of the Orbs
Pact DC: 17
Sign: Whenever you have a hand free, an orb which constantly shifts in colour appears in it
Influence: You are gregarious with your wealth, and immediately lay claim to any magic item you see or find.
Lady’s Knowledge: You can perfectly predict the weather for the next 24 hours within [Extreme] range.
Terraform: You have the effect of the Shape Earth consumable.
Lady’s Wealth: When you make this Pact, gain a Lesser Consumable of your choice, plus an additional one for every circle of Binder you have. You can only benefit from this ability once per [Quest]. You lose these consumables, and any benefits from them, when you cease to be bound to The Lady.

Savnok, the Instigator
Pact DC: 19
Sign: A piece of arrow appears under your skin somewhere in your body, causing no damage but minor discomfort
Influence: You are headstrong and it is nearly impossible to change your mind. You cannot remove any item you are wearing or holding which increases your AC.
Special: Savnok will only answer the call of a Binder who has at some point in their life stolen something without making amends.
Instigator’s Fate: Any ranged attack which you are in range of that targets one of your allies has a 50% chance of redirecting to you
Savnok’s Concealment: You take no penalty to Larcney checks to conceal weapons without [Hold-out] from a hand search.
Shift Allies: As a standard action, you may [Teleport] two allies within 100 ft to each other’s positions.
Savnok’s Armour: While you have this Pact, you gain a suit of magical armour which grants you +3 to AC and 3 [Damage reduction]. When you gain your 4th circle in Binder, this increases to +4 and 7 [Damage reduction], and to +6 and 10 [Damage reduction] at 6th circle.

5.6.1.2 2nd Circle

Andromalius, the Repentant Rogue
Pact DC: 20
Sign: You gain an extra digit on each hand
Influence: You delight in minor mischief and pranks, but cannot steal, even from a dead body (as long as you are under a jurisdiction which forbids stealing)
Rogue’s Tricks: The DC of Larceny and Bluff checks against you increases by 4.
Location: You gain see invisibility, as the spell, while in this Pact. As a move action, you can learn the exact location of a specific, or the nearest of a general category of, mundane object within [Extreme] range.
Sneak Attack: When you hit with an attack against a [Flat-footed], [Helpless], [Confused], [Dazed], [Entangled], [Exhausted], [Stunned], [Shaken], [Frightened], [Cowering] or [Panicked] target, you deal 1d6 additional damage with the [Precision] descriptor per Binder circle that you possess, to a maximum of 7d6.

Astaroth, Unjustly Fallen
Pact DC: 20
Sign: Your skin yellows and you gain a sickly scent
Influence: You flee responsibility and refuse, under any circumstances to apologise or make reparations for your actions.
Astaroth’s Breath: You gain [Immunity] to [Sickened] and [Nauseated]. As a standard action you may cause all creatures in a wedge starting from you out to your [Close] range to become Sickened for the [Encounter]. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) reduces this duration to one [Round].
Angelic Lore: You gain a +3 bonus to History and Arcana checks, this increases to +5 when about anything Good aligned, and +8 when about anything Good aligned and with the [Outsider] type.
Master Craftsman: You gain the Scribe Scroll feat, and may also create a single Lesser magic item (or three Consumables) with approval from the DM with a [Scene] of effort.

Captain Harrow, First on the Sea
Pact DC: 21
Sign: A peaked captain’s hat appears on your head and cannot be removed by any means.
Influence: You are convinced that you are the leader of whatever group you are in. Nevertheless, you love the idea of freedom and may not inflict [Binding] effects.
Special: Captain Harrow will only answer the call of a Binder who has touched the ocean.
Captain’s Parley: When you make a successful Disarm manoeuvre, you may immediately start wielding the disarmed weapon.
The Liberty: As a standard action next to a large enough body of water, you may create a 40 ft x 20 ft Personal Mount which can travel over the surface of water and grants cover to those inside (from those outside the Mount).
Cannon Barrage: As a standard action, you may deal damage equal to twice your level plus your Cha modifier in a 10 ft radius spread centred in your [Medium] range. All creatures damaged by this ability lose [Flying] and cannot start [Flying] for two [Rounds]. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) halves the damage and negates this effect.

Dhalver-Nar, the Tortured One
Pact DC: 24
Sign: Teeth grow from your scalp
Influence: You shift from extreme focus to complete distraction at a whim, you may not take any action which requires more than one [Round] of concentration
Mad Soul: You gain [Immunity] to [Confusion], and any effect which would reduce your Wis modifier or Will saves.
Tortured Insight: You may immediately identify the abilities of any magic item of Relic rank or lower.
Shield Self: Once per [Encounter], as an immediate action, you may create a spiritual bond between you and target ally within [Medium] range. Until the end of the [Encounter], whenever you would take damage, if they are within 25 ft + 5 ft per level of you the damage is instead split equally with that ally. This split happens before any other ability affects the damage taken and after the split the damage taken cannot be reduced, split, or affected in any way.

Eurynome, Mother of the Material
Pact DC: 22
Sign: Your skin becomes clammy and moist
Influence: You are paranoid and ungrateful, seeing possible betrayal in every action. You may not attack an enemy unless an ally has already done so (this is not required if your allies are not present).
Poison Blood: When an effect causes a creature to be healed or gain temporary hit points when hitting you with an attack or otherwise affecting you with an ability, they take that much damage instead.
Water Dancing: You may walk on water as if it was ground.
Giant’s Hide: You gain [Damage reduction] equal to half your Cha modifier
Eurynome’s Maul: While bound to this pact, you can as a swift action start to wield a [Brutal], [Brutal], [Magnum], [Unbalancing] magical weapon which grants +1 to attack rolls and +2 energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor. When you reach your 4th circle in Binder this increases to +3 to attack rolls and +6 energy damage. At 6th circle this increases to +4 to attack rolls, and also causes [Battered] for one [Round] if it hits the same enemy twice in a row.

Haagenti, Mother of Minotaurs
Pact DC: 23
Sign: You have the same physical features as before, but they are suddenly less appealing and make you seem ugly
Influence: You are bashful and particularly deferent towards beautiful creatures. You must acknowledge the superiority of and defer to any creature whose Attractiveness is 30 or more above yours.
Special: Haagenti will only answer the call of a Binder who speaks Giant, or is [Large] or [Huge].
Shield Proficiency: All weapons you wield gain the [Guardian] property.
Weapon Proficiency: All weapons you wield gain either the [Scything], [Swarm] or [Magnum] property.
Transformation Immunity: You gain [Immunity] to any effects which would in any way change your physical form.
Confusing Touch: As a standard action you may make a melee attack roll. If it hits, the target is [Confused] for three [Rounds]. You may use this once per [Encounter], when you gain your 5th circle in Binder you may use it thrice per [Encounter].

Malphas, the Turnfeather
Pact DC: 23
Sign: Your tongue and teeth turn black
Influence: You fall in love incredibly easily. You may not target with an offensive action any creature which has made a successful Diplomacy check against you this [Scene].
Bird’s Eye Viewing: You gain the Summon Mote feat, and your Mote has the Fly movement mode.
Sudden Strike: Your attacks deal an additional 4d6 damage on hit in a Surprise Round.
Turnfeather’s Cloak: As a standard action you may become [Invisible] until the end of the [Encounter] or until you use an offensive action. When you reach your 4th circle in Binder this is instead just until the end of the [Encounter], and you also cannot be sensed by Tremorsense. At 6th circle you also cannot be sensed by Blindsight.

Naberius, the Grinning Hound
Pact DC: 21
Sign: Your voice becomes deep and gravelly
Influence: You love the sound of your own voice, you must speak whenever given a pulpit or invitation, and if a creature uses an interaction check against you, you must respond at the earliest opportunity with your own.
Special: Naberius will only answer the call of Binders trained in Bluff
Silver Blood: You instantly stabilise when [Dying]
Silver Tongue: Once per [Round] you may make a Diplomacy check as a swift action, or as a move action, where the other part is to make a Diplomacy check.
Persuasive Words: Once per [Encounter] as a standard action give a command of up to 25 words. If the target would find them a reasonable suggestion, they must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) or follow that order at the earliest possible opportunity, but not if it would put them in clear danger.

Ronove, the Iron Maiden
Pact DC: 24
Sign: Your face settles into a grin or frown, not changing with your emotions
Influence: You believe others underestimate you and constantly seek to prove your worth, you may not eat or drink.
Feather Fall: You do not take damage from falls.
Far Hand: You gain the Telekinetic Adept and Telekinetic Scion Feats.
Ronove’s Techniques: Your combat manoeuvres, and opponent’s attempts to escape the [Grappled] and [Pinned] conditions caused by you, have a DC of 11 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier. This increases by 1 at 4th and 6th circles of Binder.

5.6.1.3 3rd Circle

Decarabia, the Lost
Pact DC: 28
Sign: Your vision becomes slightly blurry, as if you are underwater.
Influence: You become vague and confused. You voluntarily fail the first Will save you make in each [Encounter].
Special: Decarabia will accept the call without exerting his Influence on a Binder who is bound to Forneus.
Lost Mists: Opponents within your [Medium] range may not make 5 ft steps.
Decarabia’s Regeneration: When you make a Vigour check, you may count the result as 5 higher for the purposes of delaying or removing conditions.
Floating in the Void: You gain the Fly movement mode.

Eligor, Dragon’s Slayer
Pact DC: 29
Sign: Your hands become thickly scaled
Influence: You take pity on all outcasts. In battle you must always target [Humanoids] and [Dragons] if possible with offensive actions.
Skill in the Saddle: If you make a Charge while mounted, you may make an additional melee attack at any point during the Charge.
Chromatic Strike: When you make an attack action, choose an energy type. If a target of that attack action has [Vulnerability] to that energy type, your attacks deal additional energy damage with that descriptor equal to your level.
Slayer’s Might: You gain a +2 bonus to Strength. This increases to +4 at your 6th circle in Binder.

Focalor, Prince of Tears
Pact DC: 26
Sign: Your eyes are constantly teary
Influence: You are dejected and morose. When you kill a creature, you must spend a [Round] saying words of sorrow for the life you cut short.
Special: Focalor’s seal must be drawn in liquid
Water Breathing: You gain the Swim movement mode.
Prince of Tears: You gain [Immunity] to [Dazzled] and [Blinded], and as a standard action you may cause all creatures in a wedge starting from you out to your [Close] range to lose access to all special vision modes they have for the duration of the [Encounter].
Prince of Storms: As a standard action, you may cast call lightning, as the spell. When you reach 6th circle in Binder, this improves to lightning storm.

Geryon, Deposed Lord
Pact DC: 28
Sign: Your eyes turn green with yellow, cat-like irises, and a second pair appear on the back of your head
Influence: You become overly trusting and loyal towards those you see as allies. You may not make Perception checks against other creatures.
Special: Geryon will only answer the call of a Binder trained in History or Geography
All-Around Vision: You may always act in a surprise round, and the [Flanking] weapon property does not work against you.
Swift Flight: As a swift action, you gain the Fly movement mode for one [Round].
Acidic Gaze: At the end of your turn, you may turn your gaze on an opponent. At the start of their turn, they must either treat you as [Invisible] for the [Round], or take energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor equal to 2d6 times the number of circles of Binder you have.

Karsus, Hubris in the Blood
Pact DC: 27
Sign: You bleed much more than normal.
Influence: You become arrogant, and cannot use Diplomacy to influence people.
Special: You cannot call Karsus in the area of an active spell, and he will not answer the call of a Binder bound to Amon, or one untrained in Arcana.
Heavy Magic: The DCs of saves against any effect originating from a magic item you are attuned to increase by 2.
Karsus’ Senses: You have [Ghostwise sight] out to 100 ft and can always detect magical auras. You instantly identify any spell or spell-like ability you see.
Karsus’ Touch: As a move action you may cast dispel magic, as the spell but with a range of [Close]. This improves to greater dispel magic when you gain your 6th circle in Binder.

Leraje, the Green Herald
Pact DC: 27
Sign: Your skin becomes sallow, as if diseased.
Influence: You become quiet and reserved, and may not target Elves or Fey creatures with offensive actions.
Special: Leraje will not answer the call of any Binder whose was bound to Amon in the last [Scene].
Precise Shot: When you use Precise Striking on a ranged attack, you gain a +1 to attack rolls and ignore 2 points of [Damage reduction] and [Resistance] for every 2 points of penalty.
Herald’s Hiding: If you do not move for five [Rounds], you may use Stealth as if you were in cover.
Ricochet: Once per [Round], you may make a ranged attack also target another creature within your [Melee] range of the first target. The second hit only does the normal damage, with no additional on-hit effects.

Primus, the One and the Prime
Pact DC: 28
Sign: Parts of your skin gain metal, geometric plates
Influence: You become ruthlessly practical and rigid, and must obey all lawful authorities.
Special: Primus will not answer the call of a Binder who has ever made a Pact with Tenebrous.
Prime’s Word: You can speak and understand the languages of all [Humanoids], [Outsiders] and [Constructs] in [Close] range.
Divine Structure: When you take an action, for each previous [Round] you have taken the same action, you gain +1 to all d20 and damage rolls associated with the action, and +1 to DCs of saves against effects caused by the action. These stack up to 2 + the number of circles you have in Binder.
Primus’ Word: As a standard action once per [Encounter], target creature in [Medium] range must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) or take one of these actions on their next turn at your choice:

  • Move towards you with their move action
  • Move away from you with their move action
  • Drop their currently wielded weapon with their swift action (or a part move action)
  • Fall [Prone] with their move action

A creature who fails their Will save also treats you as [Invisible] and cannot hear, smell or feel you for the duration of the [Encounter].

Tenebrous, the Shadow That Was
Pact DC: 29
Sign: You appear always shrouded in shadow.
Influence: You are detached, with an aching feeling of loss and abandonment. You must not act first in any combat [Round].
Special: Tenebrous’ seal must be drawn in a [Darkness] effect or at night.
Rebuke Undead: As a standard action, you may cause target [Undead] creature within [Medium] range to be unable to target you or your allies with offensive actions for one [Round].
Essence of the Void: All allies in your [Close] range gain [Resistance] to [Cold]. Your melee attacks deal 2d6 additional energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor.
Flicker of Shadow: You gain 10% [Miss Chance] for every circle of Binder you have.

Valen, Wrath of the Underdark
Pact DC: 28
Sign: Your eyes become milky, like a Drow’s
Influence: You are cruel, with an urge to torture enemies whenever possible. You may not kill a creature, only knock them unconscious for later ‘play’.
Underdark Senses: You gain a +2 bonus to Awareness and always detect Secret Doors.
Valen’s Healing: You gain [Fast healing] 10.
Wrath of the Underdark: As a standard action, create a 30 ft radius spread within [Medium] range. This deals energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to 1d6 per your level on creation, a successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) halves this damage. Afterwards, it remains as difficult terrain until the end of the [Encounter].

5.6.1.4 4th Circle

Acererak, the Devourer
Pact DC: 32
Sign: A gem replaces one of your teeth
Influence: You hunger for power and look for voids to fill in power structures. If you detect a trap, you must either set it off yourself or try to trick someone into doing so.
Lich’s Voice: As a standard action, you can grant the semblance of life and intellect to a corpse for half an hour, allowing it to answer several questions that you put to it. You may ask one question per two levels you possess. Unasked questions are wasted if the duration expires. The corpse is compelled to answer each question truthfully, although the corpse’s knowledge is limited to what the creature knew during life, including the languages it spoke (if any), and the creature is only compelled to answer the explicit question asked. A given corpse can only be targeted by this ability once.
Tomb of Horrors: When you make a saving throw against a Trap, roll twice and take the higher number.
Paralyzing Touch: As a standard action, make a melee attack roll. If it hits, the target is [Paralyzed], a successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) negates this effect.

Agares, the Truth Betrayed
Pact DC: 31
Sign: You gain a wracking cough which disperses small stones and dust
Influence: You despise falsehood and act with complete confidence. You may not use the Bluff skill.
Special: Agares’ seal must be drawn on the earth or unworked stone
Earth and Air Mastery: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls while touching the ground. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls against [Flying] opponents, and [Flying] creatures take a -2 penalty to attack and damage rolls against you.
Earthshaker: You have [Immunity] to [Fear] effects and [Prone].
Elemental Ally: If you do not already have one, with a two [Round] action you can create an Expert Mook with the Earth Elemental track of level equal to yours minus 3. This is allied to you and follows your orders. It ceases to be your ally if you cease to be Bound to Agares.

Andras, the Grey Knight
Pact DC: 32
Sign: You gain a pair of tiny, useless grey wings on your back
Influence: You become listless and remote, you tire of battle and must retreat after ten [Rounds]
Saddle Sure: You gain a +5 bonus to Ride checks and if you have a Personal Mount its speed increases by 10 ft.
Smite Good and Evil: At the start of combat, choose an opponent. You gain a +1 fury bonus to attack rolls against that opponent for every attack you have missed this [Encounter], and your attacks deal additional damage equal to twice your Cha modifier against that opponent.
Sow Discord: As a standard action, you may cause target creature in [Close] range to make an immediate attack action against another target creature in range of their currently wielded weapon. A successful Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) negates this effect.

Cabiri, the Watching Master
Pact DC: 35
Sign: A third eye opens in your forehead
Influence: You become obsessed with watching things, and all [Figment] effects automatically work against you (even if you make the save or their Believability check is low).
Cabiri’s Sight: You gain [Ghostwise sight] out to [Long] range
Eyes Everywhere: You may cast arcane sight and scrying at will and get two Floating Eye consumables whenever you make this Pact (they disappear when you cease to be bound to Cabiri). Once you have your 6th circle in Binder you may also cast greater scrying at will.
Vision of Fear: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you conjure an Illusion (making a Believability check of 1d20 + your character level + your Cha modifier) of the greatest fear of one enemy in [Medium] range which then appears to attack them. This deals damage equal to 8 times your character level if the target’s Awareness is lower than your Believability check. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your character level + your Int modifier) halves the damage and prevents it from reducing the target below 1 HP. This is a [Death] and [Fear] effect.

Dyne, Power of All Ages
Pact DC: 33
Sign: A red triangle appears on your right palm and your eyes turn red
Influence: You are obsessed with power and establishing yourself as the dominant person in the group. You must always target the highest level opponent with offensive actions in combat.
Special: Dyne will not answer the call of a Binder bound to Faros or Ayran, but will if they are bound to both.
Desert Winds: You gain [Immunity] to conditions caused by environmental effects, and are always under the effects of the endure elements spell
Power of Time: You may attack creatures as if they were in their state 1 [Round] ago, or as if you were in the state you were in 1 [Round] ago.
Dyne’s Fire: As a swift action, you may empower your attacks with powerful force. Each time you hit with a melee attack for the [Round] you deal [Force] damage to all creatures in your [Melee] range of the target equal to your Cha modifier.

Faros, Hero of Winds
Pact DC: 33
Sign: A green triangle appears on your right palm and your ears become like an elf’s
Influence: You are fearless and fight evil whenever possible. You must not choose to benefit from any ability which makes you not provoke attacks of opportunity (including using Acrobatic checks to do so).
Special: Faros will refuse the call of any Binder who was bound to Dyne in the last [Scene].
Hero of Courage: You gain [Immunity] to [Fear] effects.
Blade Beams: When you are at full HP, you may make melee attacks out to [Medium] range.
Weapons Master: Choose three weapon properties when you make this Pact. All weapons you wield gain those three properties.
Faros’ Wind: As a standard action, create a Wind Marker within [Close] range (removing any Wind Marker you have already placed), or [Warp] yourself and up to one ally per three levels you have to your Wind Marker. Wind Markers are [Invisible] and last indefinitely, including after you cease to be bound to Faros.

Forneus, Emperor and Lover
Pact DC: 32
Sign: You gain a pair of manta ray-like flaps of skin under your arms.
Influence: You become whimsical and overly attached to your friends. You must always stay within [Close] range of at least one ally if possible.
Floating Sea: You may take an additional 5-ft step each [Round].
Shared Love: When you make this Pact, choose an ally and a Lesser Item you are attuned to, and one they are attuned to. You each benefit from the effects of the other’s chosen item.
Forneus’ Love: Twice per [Encounter], as a standard action you may Charm a creature within [Close] range. A charmed creature must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) to use an offensive action against you or your allies, if it fails, it cannot use offensive actions against you or your allies for one [Round]. The charm lasts until the end of the [Encounter], or until you or your allies make an offensive action against the charmed creature.

Paimon, the Dancer
Pact DC: 32
Sign: The right side of your mouth deforms, as if being stretched or pulled
Influence: You become fun-loving and bold. Whenever you hear music, you must use your move action to dance.
Uncanny Dodge: You gain a +4 bonus to Acrobatics checks used to avoid attacks of opportunity.
Dancer’s Dexterity: You gain a +4 bonus to Dexterity. You may use Dexterity in place of your KOM for attacks and damage rolls with weapons with the [Parrying] property. You gain a +2 bonus to attacks and damage rolls with weapons with the [Parrying] property.
Dance of Death: As a standard action, move up to your speed. You may make one melee attack against each creature you move within your [Melee] range of during that movement.

Porthos, Volcano’s Knight
Pact DC: 31
Sign: Your stomach expands to a decent beer belly.
Influence: You love laugh and to drink, if you do not have to move to be in range to attack an opponent, you must use your move action to use Livers Need Not Apply
Friend of Fire: Creatures cannot target you with offensive actions that deal damage with the [Fire] descriptor.
Porthos’ Gut: You gain the Livers Need Not Apply feat, but it uses your Cha instead of Con modifier.
White Raven Tactics: As an immediate action, you may move an ally in [Close] range to below you in the initiative order. You must wait 1d4 [Rounds] before using this ability again.

Sekhemra, the Cunning Knife
Pact DC: 31
Sign: You gain a small vestigial tail and your nails extend into claws
Influence: You are scheming and distrustful. You cannot use the Intimidate skill.
Cunning Knowledge: You gain a bonus to Stealth, Larceny, Medicine and Arcana equal to the number of circles you have in Binder.
Cunning Dodge: At the start of each of your turns, choose an opponent, you gain +4 to AC against that opponent for this [Round].
Cunning Surge: Once per [Encounter], as a free action, take an additional standard action.

The Triad
Pact DC: 34
Sign: Your facial features shift every hour between a young man, a middle aged woman, and an old man
Influence: You shift every hour between being inquisitive and locquacious, to motherly and caring, to brash and combative. In any case, you despise shadow and will not stand within 5 ft of another [Average] creature or 10 ft of a [Large] creature to avoid their shadow.
Special: The Triad will not answer the call of a Binder who has the Illusion, I Am Ten Ninjas, or Spellthief track.
Triad’s Powers: You gain 20 Power Points for the duration of the Pact and the ability to manifest prowess, time hop and cloud mind, as the Powers. When you reach your 6th circle in Binder you can also manifest mindwipe and tower of iron will.
Triad’s Knowledge: Once per Knowledge skill per [Scene] (including if you remake the Pact with The Triad), you may reroll a failed Knowledge skill check with a +4 bonus (you must take the new result).

Zanian, Steward of the Void
Pact DC: 40
Sign: Your voice becomes a whisper
Influence: You become obsessed with research. You must use your swift actions to make Knowledge checks against opponents until you have identified each one (even if your allies already have).
Expert Binding: You gain a +4 bonus to skill checks made to negotiate a Pact.
Teeth of Dhalver-Nar: Once per [Scene] (including when you remake the Pact with Zanian), using the action (and, if relevant, the ability use) of the ability, you may store an active ability you gain from a Vestige in a consumable. This consumable can be used as a swift action, but also causes the user to succumb to the Vestige’s Sign and Influence for the duration of the [Scene].
Steward’s Tactics: At the start of battle, after Initiative is rolled, you may swap the position of two allies in the initiative order up to three times.
Zanian’s Call: Once per [Scene], as a standard action, you may send a verbal message of any length to any creature you know the name or face of, and they can reply with their own verbal message. If you send a simple command in the message, the recipient must make a Will save or be obligated to carry it out as long as it doesn’t cause them to knowingly endanger their life.

5.6.1.5 5th Circle

Ahazu, the Seizer
Pact DC: 40
Sign: Your skin becomes cold and your mouth becomes filled with pure darkness, which sometimes escapes as a cloud from your open lips
Influence: You become avaricious, often stealing small valuables when you get the chance. You must imprison your enemies rather than killing them, at all costs.
Special: If you die while Bound to Ahazu, you go to the Void and cannot be returned to life by any means
Void Soul: You may move freely through obstacles and ignore difficult terrain.
Void Mind: You gain [Immunity] to [Mind-affecting] effects.
Void Body: The first time each creature hits you with a melee attack each [Round] they take 5d8 energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor and are [Sickened] for one [Round].
Ahazu’s Abduction: As a standard action, target creature becomes [Ethereal] for one [Round], becoming unable to take any action, but no line of sight or effect can be established to them. A successful Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) negates this effect.

Balam, Bitter Angel
Pact DC: 37
Sign: Your voice becomes strange – both hollow and guttural
Influence: You hate holy places and devotees of deities, blaspheming whenever possible. You avoid entering an area of effect created by a follower of a deity at any cost.
Finesse: You may use any of your stat modifiers instead of your KOM for attack rolls and damage rolls.
Prescience: You gain a +5 bonus to Initiative rolls.
Balam’s Cunning: Twice per [Encounter] you may reroll any d20 roll, you must keep the new result. You may use this an additional time per [Encounter] when you gain your 6th and 7th circles in Binder.

Buer, Grandmother Huntress
Pact DC: 37
Sign: Your feet turn into Satyr’s hooves.
Influence: You are plagued by momentary memory losses. You must deal nonlethal damage to [Humanoids], [Animals], [Giants] and [Monstrous humanoids].
Special: Buer’s seal must be drawn outdoors
Huntress’ Purity: You gain [Immunity] to [Poison] effects, and any conditions which affect you take 1 [Round] before they start to affect you (then the duration starts to be used up).
Tracker’s Skills: You gain a +4 bonus to Geography checks used to track creatures.
Buer’s Gift: You gain [Fast healing] equal to your level, and twice per [Encounter], as a standard action you may cast heal, as the spell.

Dantalion, the Star Emperor
Pact DC: 38
Sign: One of Dantalion’s faces appears on your torso. While it seems lifeless, if you use an ability granted by Dantalion, its eyes and mouth open revealing a starry void within.
Influence: You are aloof and incredibly interested in learning about the rulers of the day. You must use Read Thoughts on anyone in range who is, or claims to be, a ruler.
Thought Travel: All movement you make is a [Teleport].
Read Thoughts: As a move action, you may read the thoughts of any number of creatures in [Close] range. You gain +1 to AC and saving throws against attacks and abilities of those creatures for one [Round], and any damage their attacks do is reduced by your KDM. Creatures you are in telepathic communication with share this bonus.
Awe of Dantalion: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, all creatures in [Medium] range are [Oathsworn] to you. Whenever a creature attempts to use an offensive action on you it must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier), if successful the action happens as normal, if unsuccessful the action does not work and they cease to be [Oathsworn].

Flauros, Steam Seer
Pact DC: 37
Sign: Smoke comes out of your nostrils when you breathe.
Influence: You become withdrawn and hateful towards civilization. You must target any creatures of the [Construct] type with offensive actions, above all other possible actions, if able.
Minotaur’s Charge: After you make an attack as part of a Charge, you may make a Bull Rush as a free action on the same target as the attack.
Shift the Steam: As a free action, you may cause any spreads within [Medium] range which deal energy damage to gain or change to a descriptor of your choice. As an immediate action you can change the energy descriptor of an ability being used.
Steam Augury: As a standard action you may cast augury as the spell. Four times per [Scene] (uses carry between pacts with Flauros), you may cast holy divination, as the spell, as a standard action.

Haures, the Dreaming Duke
Pact DC: 37
Sign: Your palms are where the backs of your hands should be.
Influence: You are distracted and dreamy, often talking to yourself. You must not enter any spread created by a magical effect.
Incorporeal Movement: You may move through other creatures and obstacles, and you have 50% [Miss Chance] while moving.
Shapeshift: As a swift action, you may change your appearance to match any humanoid form, except with the backwards hands of Haures’ Sign.
Duke’s Illusions: As a standard action, you can cast major image, as the spell. You may create an additional [Figment] for every circle above 4th in Binder you have.

Malefor, Sword of Bahamut
Pact DC: 36
Sign: Your breath becomes cold and icy.
Influence: You become a true devotee to the words of Bahamut. You may not use any ability to give a creature an unconditional bonus.
Shadow Garrotte: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may make a ranged attack against a creature within [Close] range. On a hit, it deals damage equal to three times your level, and the target is [Flat-footed] until the start of your next turn.
Ice Storm: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may deal 1d6 energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor per your level to all opponents within [Medium] range. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) halves this damage.
Sword’s Meditation: Once per [Encounter], as a full round action, you may regain the use of all once per [Encounter] abilities you have already used.

Otiax, the Key to the Gate
Pact DC: 39
Sign: You are surrounded by wisps of light blue mist.
Influence: You are agitated around any closed doors, and obsess over opening them. If you come into possession of a key, you must find and open its corresponding door as soon as possible.
Unlock: With a full [Round] of effort, unlock any lock you are touching.
Lore of the Gate: You gain a +10 bonus to Knowledge checks relating to the Far Realm. Every [Scene] you are bound to Otiax, you receive a random piece of knowledge pertaining to the Far Realm.
Concealing Mist: As a free action once per [Round], you may create or suppress a 20 ft radius spread centred on you which functions as the obscuring mist spell.
Otiax’s Tendrils: You gain a [Brutal], [Swarm], [Reach] melee natural weapon. All attacks made with this weapon also attack all other creatures in your [Melee] range, though these additional attacks only do the base damage with no on-hit effects.

Shax, Sea Sister
Pact DC: 37
Sign: A scar appears around the circumference of your neck
Influence: You become cruel and stingy, and must demand compensation for any service you render to another.
Special: Shax’s seal must be drawn within sight of a body of water
Sister’s Sea: You gain the Swim movement mode.
Storm Strike: As a free action, you may cause all damage you deal with attacks for one [Round] become energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor, and add 2d8 damage to those attacks.
Freedom of the Sea: You gain [Immunity] to [Binding] effects. Weather the Storm: You gain [Resistance] to magic damage.

Vanus, Reviled One
Pact DC: 38
Sign: A boil appears on your skin in which a maggot swims
Influence: You become fun-loving but also jumpy. After victory in combat, you must spend one [Round] in celebration. Special: Vanus will not answer the call while his seal is in sight of a door or window
Noble Disdain: You gain a +3 bonus to d20 rolls as part of attacks and abilities used against creatures more than 2 levels below you, and to the DCs of saves against those abilities.
Vanus’ Ears: You gain a +4 bonus to Perception when listening for things, and obstacles such as walls do not impede your ability to hear things on the other side.
Free Ally: As a standard action, choose an ally within [Medium] range. All effects currently affecting that ally which prevent them from moving or reduce their speed end, and they may immediately move up to their speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

Zagan, Duke of Disappointment
Pact DC: 37
Sign: Your voice gains a lisp and you speak with sibilance.
Influence: You become self-aggrandizing and aggressive in the extreme, you cannot use the Diplomacy skill and leave any social encounter where someone uses Intimidate against you.
Constrict: You gain a +3 bonus to the DC of your Grapple combat manoeuvre and attempts to escape the [Grappled] and [Pinned] conditions you inflict. When you use Choke, you deal additional damage equal to twice your Cha modifier.
Snake Bane: You gain a +2 to attack and damage rolls against reptilian creatures, and can identity them without a knowledge check.
Aversion: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action choose a target creature in [Close] range, and an item or creature in [Medium] range. On the target’s turn, if able they must use as many actions as they need to move at least 20 ft away from the chosen creature or object. While the chosen creature or object is within 20 ft of them, they lose their KDM bonus to AC and are [Flat-footed]. The target creature may make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) at the start of each of their turns to end this effect.

5.6.1.6 6th Circle

Ansitif, the Defiler
Pact DC: 43
Sign: Your hair sets on (harmless) fire.
Influence: You become hateful, especially to any worshippers of deities. If a creature deals damage to you of a type you have [Resistance] to, you must target them with any offensive actions you have.
Hatred of Paladins: You gain [Resistance] to all damage done by attacks which benefit from Fury bonuses.
Countermagic: As a standard action, you may prepare a Counterspell. This may be used as an immediate action, before the start of your next turn, to cancel a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability used by a creature in [Close] range. They may make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) to negate this effect.
Blasphemy: Once per [Encounter], as a free action, all creatures in [Close] range are [Dazed] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect, and all creatures that were affected by this ability deal bonus damage to you equal to their level with all abilities that deal damage.

Ashardalon, Pyre of the Unborn
Pact DC: 45
Sign: A patch of skin over your heart is marked by a deep-hued crimson sigil of a curled red dragon.
Influence: You constantly hunger for vengeance against those you feel have wronged you. You must attack an enemy that has damaged or insulted you in battle above any other targets.
Ashardalon’s Hoard: You gain access to an extradimensional space which you can move any non-living item you hold to. This space is 5000 cubic feet, and you can access any item in it as a free action. The space, and the items within, persists between Pacts with Ashardalon.
Pyre’s Armour: You gain [Immunity] to critical hits.
Ashardalon’s Wrath: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, all opponents in [Medium] range must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) or become [Panicked]. Affected creatures lose 3 points on the Fear Ladder at the end of each of their turns.

Chupoclops, Harbinger of Forever
Pact DC: 42
Sign: Your lower jaw extends and you grow two tusks from it.
Influence: You are defeatist and morose. You voluntarily fail the first saving throw you make each [Encounter].
Special: The dead body of a sentient creature must be placed in Chupoclops’ seal before he answers the call
Huge Form: As a free action, you may become or cease to be [Huge], but without taking any of the penalties [Huge] creatures usually take.
Aura of Despair: Creatures within your [Close] range take a -2 penalty to all d20 rolls. You know the maximum and current HP of all creatures in [Close] range.
Ethereal Watcher: Once per [Encounter], as a move action, you may become [Ethereal] until you take another action. While [Ethereal] no line of sight of effect can be made to or by you.

Desharis, the Sprawling Soul
Pact DC: 42
Sign: Your eyes become glass, behind which is the image of a street filled with shadowy figures.
Influence: You love being around people, and will refuse any course of action which involves you being alone (with no other creatures within your [Medium] range).
Special: Unless you made a Pact with Desharis in the last [Scene], Desharis will not answer your call unless you are in a settlement (of village size or larger)
Tongues: You can speak, understand, and read all languages.
Infinite Doors: When you enter a door, you may emerge from any other door you can visualise within 1 mile per your level. This is a [Warp] effect.
Spirits of the City: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action you may create a Myriad of level equal to yours with all bodies within [Close] range, as long as there are that many inanimate, man-made objects around. The Myriad follows your commands and lasts for five [Rounds].

Ipos, Prince of Fools
Pact DC: 43
Sign: You grow long, black iron nails
Influence: You are contemptuous and sure of your intelligence. If someone asks you about an area you have knowledge about, you must use your next swift action to make a Knowledge check to edify that person.
Special: Ipos will only answer the call of a Binder who is trained in at least two Knowledge skills.
Planar Attenuation: You have [Immunity] to the negative effects of environmental effects on Planes which are not the Prime Material.
Flash of Insight: Whenever you make a successful Knowledge check, you gain the effects of the true seeing spell for one [Round].
Ipos’ Influence: You gain a +2 bonus to the DCs of saves against the abilities of other Vestiges you use. You gain a +4 bonus to Intelligence.

Murvoth, Dread King Eternal
Pact DC: 42
Sign: Your eyes become black voids with single glowing yellow dots inside, like those of a Lich.
Influence: You become ruthless in your pursuit of what you perceive to be ‘The Greater Good’. You must take an offensive action every [Round] in battle when able, never retreating.
Brutal Strike: When you move at least half your speed in a [Round], your melee attacks that [Round] can hit [Flying] creatures, regardless of whether you are [Flying]. Your attacks against [Flying] creatures deal bonus damage equal to your level.
Dread Aura: You gain [Immunity] to [Death] effects, and opponents within your [Close] range have a -2 penalty to saves against [Death] effects.
Seven Phylactery Lich: Once per [Quest] (carrying over between Pacts with Murvoth), when you die, you return to life at full HP and may make an immediate move action and standard action.

Orthos, Sovereign of the Howling Dark
Pact DC: 50
Sign: You always look as if you are being buffeted by a light breeze.
Influence: You become cautious of dark and cold places. You must carry a light source into any non-illuminated area.
Whispering Wind: As a free action you may send a message of up to 25 words, whispered on the wind, to any creature you are familiar with on the same Plane as you.
Sense in Darkness: You gain [Blindsense] out to your [Close] range.
Void Sovereign: If you succeeded in your interaction check to make this Pact, you automatically succeed in interaction checks to make other Pacts.
Howling Dark: As a standard action, you may deal 5d6 damage to all creatures in 60 ft. You may then freely reposition any opponents damaged by this ability anywhere within 60 ft. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) negates the damage and hence also the repositioning.

The Drifter
Pact DC: 44
Sign: You gain an arcane sigil (of the Soul Trap spell, as it happens) on your forehead.
Influence: You become scatterbrained and obsessed with the natural world over the artificial. You may not make Knowledge checks apart from Nature and Geography.
Swarm’s Influence: All damage dealt and HP healed by spells, spell-like and supernatural abilities within [Close] range is reduced by an amount equal to your level.
Crystal Cantrips: When a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability of 3rd circle or lower is used within your [Close] range you gain a Consumable which can be used with the same action as that ability to replicate the ability. This Consumable lasts until the end of the [Scene].
Negative Drift: Once per [Encounter], as an immediate action, cancel all healing within [Medium] range for one [Round].

Zceryll, the Star Spawn
Pact DC: 44
Sign: Your eyes become like glass orbs, and creatures in your peripheral vision appear to have tentacles and other strange appendages.
Influence: You will never admit any weakness, or that you need help at all. You must refuse all abilities used on you which would heal damage.
True Strike: Your attacks ignore [Damage reduction] and [Resistance], and treat [Greater resistance] as [Lesser resistance].
Bolt of Madness: As a standard action make a ranged attack roll, on a hit the target must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) or be [Dazed] for one [Round] and [Confused] for one [Round] after.
Summon Alien: As a full round action you may summon an Expert Mook with the Otherworldly track and the True Strike ability of level equal to yours minus 3. The Alien obeys your commands as long as you are bound to Zceryll. You can only have one summoned at a time.

5.6.1.7 7th Circle

Abysm, the Schismed
Pact DC: 46
Sign: Your nails become crystal and you sweat a gemlike dust.
Influence: Your speech pattern becomes fragmented, and your mannerisms change from moment to moment. You may not stay attuned to any Lesser Items while bound to Abysm.
Psionic Strike: As a standard action you may cast magic missile, as the spell, but a psi-like ability, and using your circles in Binder and Cha modifier to determine the effect.
Schismed Sight: As a standard action you may cast clairvoyance/clairaudience as the spell, but a psi-like ability.
Schism from Earth: As a move action you may cause any number of creatures within [Medium] range to begin [Flying]. You may dispel this effect as a free action, dealing falling damage as appropriate.
Overpower: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action you may attempt to Dominate a creature in [Close] range. If the creature succeeds on a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) they take 30 damage, if they fail they are [Bound] by you until the end fo the [Scene]. The [Bound] creature cannot act normally, you may command it to use its move action as a free action, and to use its standard action as a swift action. If a creature provokes an attack of opportunity from your controlled creature, you may use an immediate action to force it to make the attack of opportunity, which uses your attack of opportunity for the [Round]. In combat, on its initiative count, the creature may make a Will save. If it succeeds, it is no longer [Bound].

Andramalech, Multifarious Minister
Pact DC: 46
Sign: You gain a crest behind your head like a peacock’s tail.
Influence: You become duplicitous and vain. If you start a turn without having taken damage or failed a save since last turn, you must spend a move action showing off.
Multifarious Aspects: For each bonus type, you may stack two bonuses of the same type (e.g. two item bonuses to AC, and two feat bonuses to attack).
Minister’s Voice: When you make an in-combat interaction check, you may target all opponents in [Close] range.
Andramalech’s Duplicity: Once per [Encounter] as a standard action, you may target up to three creatures within [Medium] range. You cause all bonuses they have to attack, AC and saving throws to become penalties of the same amount for one [Round]. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) negates this effect.

Ayran, Queen in Diamond
Pact DC: 45
Sign: A blue triangle appears on your right wrist, and your features become pale and fair.
Influence: You become obsessed with protecting your allies and safeguarding them against enemies. You may only take an offensive action if you have no other option which would protect allies from harm somehow.
Special: Ayran will not accept the call of a Binder who has been bound to Dyne in the last [Scene].
Wise Queen: The DCs of interaction skills used against you increase by 4.
Light of Wisdom: As a free action you may create bright illumination out to your [Medium] range. All opponents in the range are [Revealed] for two [Rounds].
Ayran’s Diamond: Once per [Encounter], as an immediate action, you may gain [Immunity] to all damage for one [Round]. All spells cast targeting you for the [Round] are instead reflected back on their caster.

Doyum, Harbinger of Soorinek
Pact DC: 46
Sign: You become completely bald.
Influence: You always have a cheeky grin, and seek to embarrass people whenever possible. You must spend part of a move action every [Round] making a Bluff or Intimidate check to criticise someone.
Doyum’s Tripwires: As a free action on your turn, you may create or remove Tripwires within [Medium] range so that you have up to five active. Tripwires are [Invisible] and are non-overlapping 30 ft, 5 ft wide lines. A creature attempting you leave a space covered by a Tripwire falls [Prone] and destroys the Tripwire. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) negates the [Prone] effect.
Redirect: As an immediate action, when a creature in [Medium] range uses a [Teleport] or [Warp] effect, you may redirect it so they end the effect in another space of your choice within your [Medium] range and their movement’s range.
Undo: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, undo all effects of target creature in [Close] range’s last turn. All ability uses are restored, all conditions caused by them end, all damage caused by them is undone (rather than healed), and they return to the exact state they were in at the start of their last turn.

Halphax, the Angel in the Angle
Pact DC: 45
Sign: Your skin appears to be cracked stone.
Influence: You lose all sense of shame or embarrassment, but you must accede to the demands of anyone who takes a hostage you care about, be it person or item.
Special: Halphax’s seal must be drawn in a building, in a corner of the structure.
Halphax’s Knowledge: You gain a +8 bonus to Engineering checks.
Adamantine Skin: You gain [Damage reduction] equal to your level.
Safe Sanctuary: While you are sleeping for the night (rather than magically put to sleep), you and up to ten chosen allies within [Close] range enter an extradimensional space where you are completely free from harm until you wake, well-rested.
Imprison: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action you may attempt to imprison a creature in [Melee] range in extradimensional space until the end of the [Quest]. That creature cannot take actions and loses line of sight and effect to and from all other creatures. At the end of its turn during this [Encounter], the creature may attempt a Fortitude save to end the effect. After the [Encounter] ends, they may attempt the save every hour.

Marchosias, King of Killers
Pact DC: 47
Sign: Your eyes turn into hot coals.
Influence: You are debonair and sly, as if you always have a trick up your sleeve you are entirely confident in. You must use your Death Attack against any creature you catch unawares.
Special: Marchosias will only answer the call of a Binder who has previously committed an evil act that they have not atoned for.
Smoke Form: As a swift action, you gain the Fly movement mode for one [Round] and ignore attacks of opportunity while moving and move through the spaces of other creatures for the [Round].
Killer of Killers: You gain a +4 bonus to attack and damage rolls against creatures with abilities which allow them to benefit from [Precision] bonuses.
Death Attack: As a move action, you may study a creature in [Medium] range. Your first attack that hits a creature you have studied at least three times deals bonus damage equal to seven times your level, then removes all studying you have done of the creature. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) halves this damage and prevents the damage from reducing the creature below 1 HP. This is a [Death] effect.

Ose, Champion of Hell
Pact DC: 45
Sign: All weapons you wield gain malicious properties, such as becoming serrated or multi-pronged.
Influence: You are proud and hateful, you must accept all challenges of single combat.
Champion’s Challenge: Any creature in your [Melee] range must target you if able with melee attacks.
Ose’s Tenacity: When any effect prevents you from attacking or taking standard actions, you may still make a single melee attack each turn.
Nine Hells Strike: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action make two melee attacks. The first deals 66 damage on hit which ignores all [Damage reduction] and [Resistances]. The second deals 99 damage on a hit which ignores all [Damage reduction] and [Resistances].

5.7 Biomancy

Biomancers are a subset of Transmuters who focus entirely on the warping of humanoid and animal matter rather than on the use of magic to manipulate the wider variety of available materials. This means they can affect even the basic racial characteristics of creatures, and eventually grant their allies a variety of esoteric biological abilities – even those of their enemies.

Your TAM for this track is your SAM or the highest of your mental ability modifiers. All bonuses given by abilities from this track are racial unless otherwise noted.

1st Circle – The Selfish GeneSLA: As a move action, you may alter the racial abilities of an ally in [Melee] range. To do this, remove any of the following racial features from that creature, gaining 1 Gene Point for each:

  • +2 to an ability score
  • +1 (+1/8 levels) to a skill
  • +1 to AC, attack rolls, Fortitude saves, Reflex saves or Will saves
  • 5 ft of base movement speed (if it is above 30)
  • A vision mode or movement mode
  • [Lesser resistance] to an energy type You may also gain 1 Gene Point for giving a -2 penalty to an ability score, up to a maximum of -4 total racial penalty to ability scores.

You can then spend a number of Gene Points up to the number you gained for removing abilities plus an additional 1 per circle you have in Biomancy to grant any of the following bonuses, which stack with the creature’s existing racial bonuses:

  • +2 to an ability score (up to a maximum of +4 racial to a single ability score and a total bonus to ability scores equal to your TAM)
  • +1 (+1/6 levels) to a skill
  • +1 to AC, attack rolls, Fortitude saves, Reflex saves or Will saves
  • +10 base movement speed (up to a maximum 45 base movement speed)
  • Darkvision, [Ghostwise sight] out to 80 ft, Tremorsense out to 10 ft, or the Swim movement mode.
  • [Resistance] to energy damage with either the [Fire], [Cold], [Acid] or [Electricity] descriptor.
    This lasts until the end of the [Encounter], but 3 Gene Points can be spent to make the changes last until the end of the [Scene].

If you use this ability on an ally while they are still benefitting from it, you start from scratch rather than adding to their already modified racial features.

2nd Circle – Genetic DriftSLA: At the start of each [Scene], choose five of the following abilities. When adding racial abilities to an ally, you may add any of the chosen characteristics for 1 Gene Point:

  • Antibodies: [Immunity] to [Poison] effects.
  • Adrenaline: [Immunity] to [Fatigued] and [Exhausted].
  • Antibiotics: [Immunity] to [Sickened] and [Nauseated].
  • Gliding: You gain the Fly movement mode, but can only move horizontally (you cannot fly upwards), and lose 10 ft of altitude for every 30 ft of lateral movement. You don’t take fall damage when you hit the ground while gliding.
  • Acid Spit: As a standard action, you may deal 1d4 per level energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor to a creature within 20 ft and the target starts [Burning]. A Reflex save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) halves this damage and negates the [Burning] condition.
  • Electric Skin: The first time each creature hits you with a melee attack each [Round], they take energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to your level.
  • Bioluminescence: As a free action, you may create a spread centred on you with radius equal to your [Close] range which provides illumination and lasts for five [Rounds]. As a swift action while this spread is active you may inflict [Dazzled] on all opponents inside the spread for five [Rounds]. A Fortitude save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) reduces this duration to one [Round].
  • Thick Skin: Your maximum HP increases by three times your level. When you gain this trait heal hit points up to your level.
  • Web Shot: As a move action, you may create a wedge with a length of 20 ft plus 10 ft per circle of this track you possess that inflicts the [Entangled] condition for the rest of the [Encounter] on each opponent within the area. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) negates the [Entangled] condition. As a move action, a creature may lose this condition inflicted by this ability but doing so provokes an attack of opportunity.
  • Prehensile Tail: You gain a +4 bonus to Athletics checks used to climb. You can wield an additional weapon simultaneously.
  • Hard Shell: Your bonus to AC from the Defensive Fighting manoeuvre increases by 2, you are immune to critical hits while benefitting from the bonus to AC from Defensive Fighting.
  • Horns: You gain a natural weapon with the weapon properties [Brutal 3, Magnum, Devastating] which you can only use for an attack with the Charge manoeuvre. If an attack with your Horns hits, you may immediately make a Bull Rush manoeuvre without spending an action.
  • Ink Gland: Up to four times per [Encounter], as a swift action, you may create a spread with effect identical to the obscuring mist spell centred on you.
  • Roar Cords: As a swift action, you may cause all creatures in [Close] range to become [Deafened] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) negates this.
  • Scythe Hands: Once per [Round], as a swift action, when you hit an opponent with a melee attack and deal damage to that opponent with that attack, you may compare your attack roll from that attack to the AC of another target opponent within [Melee] range. If the attack roll equals or exceeds that opponent’s AC, you deal damage to that opponent equal to the damage dealt by the attack.

You may also target an opponent with the 1st circle ability. If you do so, it uses a standard action, and you may only get a maximum of 3 Gene Points from the first part of the ability, and they may make a Fortitude save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your TAM) to negate the changes.

3rd Circle – MutationSLA: At the start of each [Scene], choose four of the following abilities. When adding racial abilities to an ally, you may add any of the chosen characteristics for a number of Gene Points equal to the number in brackets next to its name:

  • Wings (3): You gain the Fly movement mode
  • Additional Limbs (1): You gain a +4 bonus to saves against and to your manoeuvre DCs for Grapple, Pin, Trip and Disarm. All your wielded weapons gain an additional weapon property of your choice.
  • Sticky Pads (1): You can climb up any surface without making an Athletics check.
  • Barbs (1): Whenever you hit with an attack, you may put a barb inside the creature which works like a weapon with the [Barbed] property being embedded in the creature.
  • Corrosive Spit (1): As a standard action, you may destroy one mundane weapon wielded by a creature in [Close] range, or inflict a penalty to attack rolls with one magical weapon equal to half your Con modifier. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) negates this effect/
  • Plated Skin (2): You gain a +4 item bonus to AC.
  • Poisonous Spores (2): As a move action, create a spread centred on you out to a radius of 15 ft you have in this track. The spread lasts until the start of your next turn and all creatures in the spread at any point are [Sickened] until the end of their next turn. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) negates the effect.
  • Telescopic Vision (2): Your range category for all ranged weapons you wield increases by one.
  • Piercing Vision (2): You may establish line of sight through obstacles of up to 5 ft of thickness. You ignore 20% [Miss chance] on creatures you attack.
  • Echolocation (1): You gain Tremorsense out to 30 ft.
  • Pressurised Claw (2): As a standard action, you may fire a pressurised blast which deals [Force] damage to a creature within 20 ft equal to 1d6 per your character level + your Con modifier. A creature hit by this attack is pushed away from you 5 ft per 10 damage they take. A Fortitude save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) halves the damage and negates the push. Movement from this push does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
  • Sonorous (2): Once per [Round], you may intone deeply and deal [Force] damage equal to your level to all creatures within 10 ft of you as a free action.
  • Camouflage (3): You may use the Stealth skill as a swift action.
  • Virulent Venom (3): If you hit a creature with three attacks in a [Round], they gain [Vulnerability] to damage from your attacks until the end of your next turn.

4th Circle – The Origin of SpeciesSLA: With a magical ritual that requires five minutes of effort, you can enhance a mundane animal, turning it into a Mook with 6 Gene Points worth of additional abilities (chosen from the same list you use to enhance allies). The ritual requires the animal’s co-operation (or an unconscious animal). The animal does not become any more or less obedient to you due to this ritual than it would otherwise be.

You may have a number of animals enhanced with this ability at a time equal to the number of even-numbered circles of Biomancer you have. You may not use this ability if it would cause you to surpass this limit.

5th Circle – The Descent of ManSLA: When you remove racial abilities from an opponent, you may remove any of their passive EX abilities to gain 2 gene points. Until the end of the [Encounter], when granting racial abilities to your allies you may grant them any EX abilities you have removed from an opponent by spending a number of Gene Points equal to the circle of the ability.

6th Circle – EpigeneticsSLA: At the start of each [Scene], choose four of the following abilities. When adding racial abilities to an ally, you may add any of the chosen characteristics for a number of Gene Points equal to the number in brackets next to its name:

  • Adaptive Camouflage (2): You are [Invisible].
  • Burrowing Claws (2): You gain the Burrow movement mode.
  • Regeneration (3): You gain [Fast healing] equal to your Con modifier. When you are affected by a status condition with duration of more than one [Round], its duration is reduced by one [Round]. Conditions with duration [Encounter] are reduced to eight [Rounds].
  • Magnetism (3): As a move action, you may cause a magnetic disturbance which affects a spread centred on you with radius 20 ft. Creatures in the radius take physical damage equal to your level + your Con modifier and one weapon they are wielding is Disarmed.
  • Colossal (3): You grow to [Huge] size, can attack creatures which are [Flying], and gain [Lesser resistance] to damage from creatures which are smaller than [Huge].
  • Hypnotic Patterns (4): As a standard action, you may Charm a creature which can see you in [Close] range. The creature cannot use an offensive action against you or an ally, after the first [Round] of being charmed, when it would use an offensive action, it must make a Will save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier). A successful Will allows it to use that offensive action as normal and renders the creature no longer charmed; a failed save means it cannot use an offensive action against you or your allies for one [Round]. The creature remains charmed until you or an ally use an offensive action against it.
  • Ethereal Metabolism (4): At the start of your turn, you may become [Ethereal] until the end of your next turn. While [Ethereal] all creatures lose line of effect and line of sight to you, and you lose line of effect and line of sight to all creatures.
  • Neurotoxin (2): If you hit a creature with four attacks in a [Round], they are [Confused] until the end of their next turn.
  • Aurotoxin (2): If you hit a creature with three attacks in a [Round], they lose [Flying] and access to the Fly movement mode until the end of your next turn.
  • Displacing Metabolism (3): You gain 30% [Miss Chance].
  • Huge Limbs (2): If you hit a creature with four attacks in a [Round], they are [Battered] until the end of your next turn.
  • Wind Wings (4): You gain the Fly movement mode. Whenever you make an attack action you may deal damage equal to your level + your Con modifier to a creature in [Close] range, and reduce their speed by 10 ft for one [Round]. You may sacrifice any number of attacks in the attack action to increase the damage by your level and the speed penalty by 10 for each attack sacrificed. As a standard action once per [Encounter] you may create a spread centred in your [Close] range with radius 20 ft which deals damage equal to 1d8 per your character level and moves all creatures in the spread to any space within 30 ft of its centre of your choice and knocks them [Prone]. A successful Fortitude save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) halves the damage and negates the movement (they are still knocked [Prone]).
  • Beholder Eye (4): Creatures which you have line of sight to, after they use a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability, must make a Will save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) or the ability is cancelled.
  • Volcanic Growth (3): As a standard action, you may deal energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor to all creatures within your [Close] range equal to 1d8 per your character level + your Con modifier. Damaged creatures start [Burning] and are [Blinded] for one [Round]. A successful Reflex save (DC = 10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) halves the damage and negates the [Burning] and [Blinded].

7th Circle – Climbing Mount ImprobableSLA: With a magical ritual that requires ten minutes of effort you can resurrect a [Dead] creature at full HP. You can use this as a standard action to instead resurrect a creature at 0 HP.

5.8 Black Knight

Black Knights are warriors which use Hieromancy, the magic of honour, a subset of Axiomancy which makes you a target for your foes, and allows you to draw power from pain. While their magic is dark and sinister, Black Knights are not necessarily evil, though their masochism does tend to push them towards antiheroism.

1st Circle – Knight’s WatchSU: Once per [Round], as a swift action, you may [Detain] one creature in [Close] range for one [Round]. [Detained] opponents must target you with their attacks and any offensive ability which specifies a target and if using an offensive ability which creates an area of effect, they must include you in the area of effect if they can place the area of effect in a place which would include you. If a [Detained] creature has to move to be able to attack or target you, they must only do so if that movement would not provoke an attack of opportunity.
