3rd Circle – I See ItSU: You can always act in a surprise round and cannot become [Flat-footed]. Also, once per [Round], as a swift action, you may gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls or to AC for one [Round].

4th Circle – Eye ScrySLA: You gain [Blindsight] with a radius equal to 10 ft per circle you possess in Divination. Also, you may cast scrying and detect scrying at will, when you reach your 6th circle in Divination you may also cast greater scrying at will. When you use One Vision, you now roll two d20s.

5th Circle – Visions of Future PastSU: A number of times per [Scene] equal to the number of circles you possess in this track, as a free action you may do all your actions for the turn and see the results of all die rolls, but none of the effects actually happen. After seeing this, you return to your original position and you may take your turn again, if you take any of the actions you took the first time, all rolls (including those made by enemies) are treated as having the same result as the first time.

6th Circle – According to KeikakuSLA: You now gain a +6 bonus to attack or AC or a +3 to both when you use your ability from I See It. When you use One Vision, you now roll three d20s.

7th Circle – Anything Can ChangeSU: You gain a permanent +5 bonus to AC and saves.

5.21 Domination

Psions versed in the power of Domination, known as Mesmers, use a warped reflection of standard mind-control magic. Rather than directly taking hold of an opponent’s thoughts - a difficult and risky type of magic - they instead place psychic parasites into their targets minds, striking whenever they act against the Memer’s wishes. Through this, they exercise just as much control as a traditional Telepath or Enchanter.

All abilities from the Domination track are Psi-Like abilities. Unless otherwise stated, they require a standard action and target an opponent in [Medium] range. A targeted creature can make a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) to negate the effect at that point, but otherwise the Domination effect will last until the end of the [Encounter], and deal damage whenever it is triggered by the targeted creature taking certain actions. All ongoing Domination effects end after they trigger three times.

Like other Psi-Like Abilities, you can augment your Domination powers (and gain 2 PP per circle you have in the track, as normal). You may spend 1 power point on manifesting a power to increase the damage dice by one size. When a Domination power ends, you may spend 2 power points as an immediate action to immediately re-apply the effect. The target makes a save against this as usual, but at a -4 penalty.

1st Circle – EmpathyPLA: Whenever target creature hits with an attack roll, they take 1d8 magic damage per two character levels you have (minimum 1d8).

2nd Circle – MindfirePLA: Whenever target creature casts a spell or uses a spell-like or supernatural ability which requires a standard action, they take 1d8 magic damage per character level you have.

3rd Circle – FragilityPLA: Whenever target creature receives a [Condition], they take 1d4 magic damage per two character levels you have (minimum 1d4).

You also gain the following ability:

  • StumblefirePLA: Whenever target creature moves more than half their movement speed in one action, they take 1d4 magic damage per two character levels you have (minimum 1d4) and must make a Reflex save (DC 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) or fall [Prone].

4th Circle – FumblefirePLA: Whenever target creature misses with an attack roll, they take 1d6 magic damage per character level you have and must make a Reflex save (DC 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) or drop their wielded weapon (as though disarmed).

This effect can only trigger once per [Round] per creature, and subsequent triggers won’t count towards the limit of three times before the effect ends.

5th Circle – ShamePLA: Whenever one of your allies succeeds on a saving throw caused by the target creature, they are [Dazed] for one [Round].

You can only use this ability once per [Encounter], and it ends if it triggers once instead of after three times.

6th Circle – Cry of FrustrationPLA: Once per [Encounter], as an immediate action when a creature in [Medium] range uses a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability, you may force them to make a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM). If they fail the save, the ability has no effect and you deal 1d6 magic damage per your character level to all other creatures in [Medium] range.

7th Circle – Supreme ShatteringPLA: Once per [Encounter], an a standard action target a creature in [Medium] range and dispel all magical and psionic effects currently affecting the creature (including any Domination abilities you used on them) and originating from the creature and persisting in a space or on a creature within [Medium] range. That creature then takes 1d6 magic damage per circle of effect dispelled. A successful Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) negates this damage, but not the dispelling.

5.22 Fluxmage

Most spellcasters focus on a specific area of magic, or even psionics in very rare cases. However, rare multidisciplinary casters, and even a few specialists, can transfer the mana they use into a flux state, enabling them to use it for any of their spells. Also, they can manipulate this flux to affect the magic abilities of others, and even empower their allies.

1st Circle – TapEX: All spell slots and power points you possess from other tracks are replaced with a pool of points called Mana equal to the circle of each spell slot or the number of power points you possess. Mana is renewed at the end of each [Scene] like spells or powers, and can be used to cast spells or powers by spending 1 Mana per circle of the spell or power, instead of expending a spell slot or power points. In addition, you gain a +2 bonus to two knowledge skills of your choice. These choices are permanent.

2nd Circle – Laying LinesEX: When an ally within [Close] range uses a spell or spell like ability, you gain Mana equal to ½ the circle of the ability. In addition, you may transfer a number of Mana equal to up to the number of circles you possess in this track to any ally within [Close] range as a free action. This Mana may be used to cast any spell or power they know. If the creature receiving Mana is unable to cast spells or powers, they gain the ability to cast up to three spells or powers you know until they run out of Mana. Spells or powers gained in this way may not be of a higher circle than the highest circle in any track that the ally possesses.

3rd Circle – Aether’s VanguardSU: As an immediate action you may spend 1 Mana to gain [Resistance] to either magic damage or one energy descriptor of your choice ([Acid], [Cold], [Electricity] or [Fire]) for one [Round]. When you gain your 6th circle in Fluxmage you may spend 2 Mana as an immediate action, to gain [Greater resistance] to either magic damage or one energy descriptor of your choice for one [Round].

4th Circle – UnplugSU: Once per [Round] as part of a move action, you may learn all tracks a creature within [Medium] range possesses. In addition, once per [Round] as a move action costing 3 Mana, you may prevent a creature within [Medium] range from using activated abilities from up to two circles of your choice for two [Rounds]. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

5th Circle – RefreshSLA: With a ritual lasting for 5 minutes, you may spend 10 Mana to gain an additional use of any spell, spell like ability, or supernatural ability that has a limited number of uses per [Scene] or 15 Mana to gain an additional use of an ability that has a limited number of uses per [Quest]. Any one ability may benefit from Refresh once per [Scene] or per [Quest], whatever the recharge time of the ability chosen is.

6th Circle – Personal ShieldSU: When you use Aether’s Vanguard, you gain the appropriate level of [Resistance] to all energy damage and magic damage.

7th Circle – BlackoutSU: As a standard action, you may use Unplug and instead of it targeting one creature it changes to a 50 ft. radius burst with centre anywhere within [Medium] range. In addition, when you use Unplug in this way, you may increase the number of times you may use an ability that has a limited number of uses per [Encounter] by 1. Any one ability may benefit from Blackout once per [Encounter].

5.23 Ghoulcaller

Special: Any creature with the Necromancer track may switch one of their tracks for Ghoulcaller without using their multiclass.

Necromancers use negative energy to force death on others and temporarily animate corpses. Ghoulcallers are the Necromancers who ignore the ‘temporary’ part and focus all their efforts on the animation of Undead and commanding them in battle.

Undead created by Ghoulcaller’s abilities do persist between [Encounters], but at the end of each [Encounter] you can only have Undead under your control whose level sums to a maximum of twice your level, and must lose control of, or destroy, Undead until they are under that limit. Your Undead also cannot be healed by any means, except by spending Onyx Charges. You have a number of Onyx charges equal to your Int modifier each [Scene], and can spend one Charge as a full round action to heal an adjacent Undead (one of yours, not any creature with the [Undead] type) to full hit points.

1st Circle – Call of the HauntedSLA: Whenever a creature which would leave a corpse dies, note its location as a Grave and which [Round] it died on. As a standard action while within 5 ft + 5 ft per circle of Ghoulcaller you have of a Grave, you may raise an Undead in that location. You may raise an additional Undead for each even numbered circle you have in Ghoulcaller, but any additional Undead must be risen from a different Grave. Then, remove any Graves you rose an Undead from. The Undead has level equal to the living creature’s, minus 1 for every full [Round] that has passed since it died, to a minimum of 1 or the living creature’s level minus 3.

Undead act on Initiative count 0, and will only move adjacent to the closest opponent and attack them. As a move action, you may command any number of your Undead in [Close] range to move up to their speed in the same direction. Your Undead count as your allies.

You can create the following types of Undead:

  • Zombie: A Grunt Mook. Its Special action (when you unlock it) is to make a single Melee attack which on a hit deals normal damage and inflicts [Sickened] for two [Rounds]. A Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 its level + your Int modifier) negates the [Sickened] condition and halves the damage.
  • Skeleton: A Striker Mook that does not gain additional movement modes at higher level, but does have [Damage reduction] equal to half its level. Its Special action (when you unlock it) is to make an attack action, with a single additional attack in the action.

2nd Circle – Dead ProspectsSLA: As a standard action, you may search for long-dead creatures and thereby create up to three Graves within [Close] rage, but all at least 15 ft from all other Graves. Each Grave counts as having a creature of level equal to yours minus 1d6 (minimum 1) and no relevant statistics (any Undead ability based on their statistics instead does their baseline Mook statistics), whose level does not decay any more.

As a standard action, you may command any of your Undead in [Medium] range to immediately use their Special action. As a move action after this Standard action, you may command a different Undead in [Medium] range to immediately use their Special action.

3rd Circle – The Dead Ride BehindSLA: A number of times per [Scene] equal to the number of even circles you have in Ghoulcaller, you can create an Advanced Undead, of the same level as a normal Skeleton or Zombie would be, from a grave. The types of Advanced Undead are:

  • Dullahan: A Grunt Mook with the highest attack bonus between it and the dead creature it is based on. Its Special action is to make an attack action with a single additional attack in the action, and using the damage bonus the dead creature it is based on had with the weapon it was wielding when it died.
  • Ghast: A Grunt Mook which gains bonus hit points equal to half the difference between its own and the dead creature it is based on - if the dead creature’s is higher. Its Special action is to make a single Melee attack which on a hit deals normal damage and inflicts [Slowed] for one [Round]. A Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 its level + your Int modifier) negates the [Slowed] condition and halves the damage.
  • Wight: A Striker Mook with the highest saving throw bonuses between it and the dead creature it is based on that does not gain additional movement modes at higher level. Its Special action is to make a single melee attack which on a hit deals no damage but instead inflicts [Energy drained] a number of times equal to the number of even circles you have in Ghoulcaller.
  • Vampire: A Striker Mook with the highest Speed between it and the dead creature it is based on that gains the Fly movement mode at higher level. Its Special action is move up to its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity and with [Flying].
  • Mummy: A Grunt Mook which gains bonus AC equal to half the difference between its own and the dead creature it is based on - if the dead creature’s is higher. Its Special action is to inflict [Shaken] on all opponents in its [Melee] range for two [Rounds], a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 its level + your Int modifier) negates this effect.

4th Circle – King of GhostsSLA: As a standard action, without a Grave but using one of your uses of Advanced Undead creation, you may create a Shadow or Wraith of level equal to yours minus 2 or minus 1 within [Close] range:

  • Wraith: A Striker Mook with the Fly and Swim movement modes. Its Special action is to gain 50% [Miss chance] for one [Round].
  • Shadow: A Striker Mook with the Fly and Swim movement modes. Its Special action is to make a single melee attack which on a hit deals no damage but instead inflicts a -4 penalty to the target’s KOM for two [Rounds].

5th Circle – Corpse ExplosionSLA: As a standard action, you may destroy any of your Undead in [Medium] range and deal energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to 1d6 per its level to all creatures within a 20 ft radius of it. A Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 its level + your Int modifier) halves this damage. If any other of your Undead are hit by this explosion, instead of being damaged they also explode in the same way.

6th Circle – Valley of the DamnedSLA: When you create an Advanced Undead, you can also create Death Knights and Banshees:

  • Banshee: A Striker Mook which gains bonus HP equal to half the difference between its own and the dead creature it is based on - if the dead creature’s is higher and with the highest saving throw bonuses between it and the dead creature it is based on. Its Special action is to make a single attack against all opponents within its [Close] range, which on hit deals additional damage equal to its level.
  • Death Knight: A Grunt Mook which gains bonus AC equal to half the difference between its own and the dead creature it is based on - if the dead creature’s is higher and has the highest attack bonus betwee it and the dead creature it is based on. Its Special action is to make an attack action with a single additional attack in the action, and using the damage bonus the dead creature it is based on had with the weapon it was wielding when it died.

7th Circle – PhylacterySU: When you die, you become an Artifact magical item that any ally in [Close] range may immediately attune to. As long as another creature is attuned to this item (which has no other effect), it cannot be destroyed. If the item still exists at the end of the [Scene] then you return to life adjacent to the attuned creature and the item ceases to exist.

5.24 Henchman

Every good villain needs a few henchmen to do the dirty work. A lot of the time, you’re off on missions trying to track down rare creatures for the Boss, or other things which will impress him. But when push comes to shove, you use your loyalty in battle to produce a wide array of fantastic, but somehow not-actually-magical effects.

1st Circle – Prepare for Trouble!EX: As a move action, grant an ally within [Medium] range a deflection bonus to AC until the start of your next turn equal to the higher of 3, or the number of circles you have in this track + 1. When you use this ability, you may name any ability; your target gets an additional +3 to AC against attack rolls made as part of abilities with that name, and a +4 bonus to saves against it.

2nd Circle – Make it Double!EX: Once per [Encounter] per circle you have in this track, you may choose an ability an ally within [Medium] range has used since the end of your last turn. Using the same action, you may use that ability. Any attack roll you make as part of the ability has a -4 penalty, and any save DCs against the effects of that ability have a -4 penalty. For any variables based on your level, you count as three levels lower, and for any variables based on circle you use the number of circles you have in this track -1. For any variables based on an ability score, you use your KDM minus 2.

3rd Circle – Protect the World from DevastationEX: As a standard action, remove up to four total of the following conditions from allies in [Medium] range: [Battered], [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Cowering], [Dazed], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Entangled], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Nauseated], [Panicked], [Paralyzed], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], or [Stunned].

4th Circle – Unite All Peoples Within Our NationEX: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action choose an ally within [Medium] range. All positive effects affecting that ally now affect all allies within [Medium] range, with the same duration as on the chosen ally. If the effect on the chosen ally is dispelled, or removed in any other way, it ends on each of the other affected allies too.

5th Circle – Denounce the Evils of Truth and LoveEX: As a move action, target opponent in [Medium] range cannot treat other creatures as their allies for two [Rounds]. A successful Will save (DC = 10 + ½ your character level + your KDM) negates this effect.

6th Circle – Extend Our Reach to the Stars AboveEX: All allies (including you – note this only applies once) within [Medium] range extend their [Melee] range by 10 ft, their [Close] range by 25 ft, their [Medium] range by 100 ft, and their [Long] range by 500 ft. You also gain the following ability:

  • Blast Off at the Speed of LightEX: You gain the Soar movement mode. As long as they are in your [Medium] range and for one [Round] after they leave your [Medium] range, your allies gain the Soar movement mode.

7th Circle – Surrender Now, or Prepare to Fight!EX: Your allies always have a Surprise Round at the start of an [Encounter], no matter the circumstances. However, you must use your Surprise Round reciting a motto, creed, or other such thing, and may take no actions.

5.25 Icefall Blade

The Lawrence clan of the Silclavan nobility have pioneered a unique form of swordplay which involves harnessing the powers of ice and light while swinging a greatsword in a dance-like rhythm. Thanks to exiles from the family, the art has been taught to initiates across the continent and across the world, and now the “Dance of Obligation” flourishes as an obscure martial art across much of the world. This has found particular traction among the churches of Deities of ice.

1st Circle – Icetide VortexEX: As a standard action, or in place of an attack in an attack action, make an attack roll (if replacing an attack, using the same attack bonus) as a [Volley] against all creatures in a wedge originating from you of length 15 ft + 5 ft per even numbered circle you have in Icefall Blade. The attack deals 1d10 + your KOM energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor on a hit.

If you hit any creatures with an Icetide Vortex attack, you gain [Immunity] to [Binding] effects and a bonus to AC equal to the amount of odd numbered circles you have in Icefall Blade for one [Round] (this does not stack).

2nd Circle – Glacial IlluminationEX: As a standard action, or in place of an attack in an attack action while you have no Lightfall Sword active, make an attack roll (if replacing an attack, using the same attack bonus) as a [Volley] against all creatures in a 15 ft long, 5 ft line with at least one space adjacent to you. The attack deals 1d10 + your KOM energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor on a hit.

After using this ability, you create a Lightfall Sword. The Lightfall Sword starts with a number of charges equal to the amount of creatures hit by the Glacial Illumination attack, and gains one charge for each attack you hit or for each creature you hit with a [Volley] attack. At the end of your turn on the [Round] after it was created, the Lightfall Sword detonates, dealing 1d10 physical damage to all other creatures in 25 ft of you for each charge it had.

3rd Circle – Roiling RimeEX: Every time you hit all creatures in the area of an Icetide Vortex attack, make an additional attack roll against a creature in your [Close] range that was not in the area of effect of the Icetide Vortex. This deals 1d10 + your KOM energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor on a hit.

4th Circle – Tidal IllusionEX: After you hit all creatures in the area of an Icetide Vortex for the second Icetide Vortex in a row (they do not need to be consecutive attacks), all other creatures in 25 ft of you gain [Vulnerability] to [Cold] and physical damage until the start of your next turn.

5th Circle – Noble OlbigationEX: Whenever you hit with an attack, or hit all creatures in the area of an Icetide Vortex attack, while you have a Lightfall Sword active, roll a d6. On a 4 or 5, add an additional charge to the Lightfall Sword. On a 6, add two charges to the Lightfall Sword.

6th Circle – The Obstinancy of One’s InferiorsEX: Creatures who are below half of their maximum hit points take an additional 3d10 damage from your Lightfall Sword detonations.

7th Circle – Wellspring of War-LustEX: Your Lightfall Swords now start with an additional 1d10 charges.

5.26 Illusion

Many mages practice a few Illusion spells, such as Silent Image, but some reject all other forms of magic and focus on the weaving of illusions, focusing on the use of cunning and creativity to survive both in an out of battle.

1st Circle – Phantasmal ForceSLA: As a standard action, you may create an Illusion within [Long] range, taking up space up to or equal to 12 spaces plus 4 per level. The Illusion only affects one sense (for example, it can be a silent, intangible image; an invisible sound or smell; or a feeling of intense heat or cold). When you create the Illusion, make a Believability check (1d20 + your level + your Int modifier), the illusion seems real except to creatures whose Awareness is higher than your Believability check result. If a creature interacts with the Illusion with a sense it does not cover (e.g. touching an image or listening for a heartbeat, or looking for the source a sound would have come from), they may make a Will save (DC 10 + half your character level + your Int modifier) to disbelieve the Illusion. To a creature who disbelieves the Illusion, it appears as a shadowy outline, a faint noise, or some other minor shadow of what it should be which does not in any way obstruct the senses of the creature.

As a move action, you may change one of your active Illusions, but it must remain in the same sense. When you do so, you make another Believability check, though those who observe the Illusion change get an immediate Will save to disbelieve the Illusion. You may have a number of active Illusions equal to your Intelligence modifier (if you create a new Illusion which would surpass this limit, one of your existing ones immediately ends). Your Illusions last until the end of the [Encounter], though once per [Scene], you may create one which lasts until the end of the [Scene]. This is a [Figment] effect.

All bonuses that increase the DC of saves against abilities from this track grant a bonus of the same size to your Believability check.

2nd Circle – Trick of the MindSU: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Blur: You gain a 10% [Miss chance] per circle of this track you possess. Every time an opponent misses you due to [Miss chance], you lose 5% [Miss chance] until the end of the [Encounter], down to a minimum of the amount of [Miss chance] you get from other sources. This is a [Figment] effect.
  • Disguise Self: When you use Phantasmal Force to change your own appearance with an Illusion, you gain a +3 to the Believability check and the Will save DC.

3rd Circle – Magician ImpossibleSLA: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Major Image: Your Illusions created with Phantasmal Force can now affect up to three senses, and once per [Scene] you can make an Illusion permanent.
  • Colour Spray: As a standard action, you may cause all opponents in a wedge with a length of 10 ft per circle you possess of this track to become [Blinded] for two [Rounds]. A Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Int modifier) negates the [Blinded] condition.

4th Circle – Obfuscating ArcanaSLA: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Greater Invisibility: You may cast greater invisibility, as the spell, at will.
  • Drimwaj’s Magic Mouth: You may conjure an illusory messenger or mouth adjacent to any creature you have at least firsthand knowledge of. This can either convey a verbal message of up to 25 words, or convey a message through moving pictures, which can give a show of up to thirty seconds. You can use this ability a number of times per [Scene] equal to your Intelligence modifier.

5th Circle – Trick or TreatSLA: Select one of the following abilities, your choice is permanent:

  • Phantasmal Killer: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you conjure an Illusion of the greatest fear of one enemy in [Medium] range which then appears to attack them. This deals damage equal to 8 times your character level if the target’s Awareness is lower than your Believability check. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your character level + your Int modifier) halves the damage and prevents it from reducing the target below 1 HP. This is a [Death] effect.
  • Veil: You may use Phantasmal Force to instead alter the appearance of every ally in [Close] range for the rest of the [Scene]. You gain a +3 to the Believability check and the illusion affects every sense of those interacting with a Veiled ally. You cannot cause a creature to appear as if they were a different size category.
  • Shadow Spell: At the start of each [Scene], choose three spells from any spell list of 5th circle or lower. A number of times that [Scene] equal to your Intelligence modifier, you may use Phantasmal Force to mimic the effect of one of these spells, casting it as the spell, though it only has an effect on a creature if your Believability check made on casting the spell exceeds that creature’s Awareness. Any mimicked spells with lasting effects count towards your limit of active Illusions.

6th Circle – Magical MysterySLA: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Supreme Image: Your Illusions created by Phantasmal Force now affect every sense, so creatures only get a Will save to disbelieve them when they observe an Illusion change.
  • Mass Invisibility: When you cast greater invisibility, you may now affect every ally in [Close] range.

7th Circle – Master of IllusionSLA: Select one of the following abilities, your choice is permanent:

  • Astral Projection: Once per [Scene], with an hour of effort, you may create an Illusory copy of yourself with all of your abilities and statistics and move into the Astral Plane, becoming [Ethereal] for as long as the Projection exists. While you are [Ethereal] as a result of this ability, line of sight is blocked between you and other creatures, and line of effect is blocked between you and any other creature’s attack, abili¬ty, or effect. You can control your Projection completely from any distance. When your Projection is reduced below 0 HP, it is immediately destroyed, you cease to be [Ethereal], and are [Dazed] for one [Round].
  • Greater Shadow Conjuration: At the start of each [Scene], choose three spells from any spell list of 7th circle or lower. A number of times that [Scene] equal to your Intelligence modifier, you may use Phantasmal Force to mimic the effect of one of these spells, casting it as the spell, though it only has an effect on a creature if your Believability check made on casting the spell exceeds that creature’s Awareness. Any mimicked spells with lasting effects count towards your limit of active Illusions.

5.27 Incorporeal

Many creatures can phase in and out of physical reality, fading into intangible forms to dodge attacks and even possess the bodies of other creatures.

1st Circle – Out of BodySU: You gain [Lesser resistance] to physical damage. Once per [Round], as a move action, you can become [Faded] or stop being [Faded]. While [Faded], your [Lesser resistance] to physical damage becomes [Resistance] and you are [Concealed], but are [Vulnerable] to [Force] effects. When you stop being [Faded], all opponents within [Close] range take [Cold] damage equal to your KOM.

2nd Circle – Phase Shift: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Fade OutSU: Once per [Round] per circle you possess from this track, when an opponent who is not [Concealed] or [Fully concealed] makes an attack against you, if you are [Faded] you may make a Will save and use the result in place of your AC against that attack if the result is higher than your AC.
  • From the ShadowsEX: When you are not [Faded] you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls. While you are [Faded] all weapons you wield gain the [Magnum] property. Your attacks deal bonus energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to your KOM.

3rd Circle – Out of Sight, Out of Mind: Select one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Fade Away: When you become [Faded], you may become [Invisible] until you make an offensive action or cast a spell. When you gain your 5th circle in Incorporeal, you may instead become [Invisible] until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Shadowcat: When you are [Faded] you may add the [Warp] descriptor to all movement you make.

4th Circle – Willing PosessionSU: Once per [Scene], while [Faded], as a standard action, you may occupy the body of a willing creature within [Close] range. Your host may act normally, and you may activate any ability that does not require an attack roll. You cannot be targeted, but Willing Possession may be dispelled. Your host takes all physical damage done to them, all magical and energy damage your host takes is split equally between the two of you after the host’s [Damage reduction] or [Resistance] has been applied, and you take all [Force] damage done to your host. You do not gain [Damage reduction] or [Resistance] against damage while possessing a creature. You may stop possessing a creature as a move action.

5th Circle – Flash of DarknessSU: When you move into or out of a space adjacent to an opponent, or through an opponent’s space, while [Faded], they take energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to twice your level and are [Slowed] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates [Slowed]. Each opponent may only be affected by this ability once per [Round].

6th Circle – Horror, ManifestEX: When you stop being [Faded], creatures within [Close] range of you must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or become [Frightened] for two [Rounds].

7th Circle – Hostile PossessionSU: Once per [Scene], while [Faded], as a standard action, you may occupy the body of one creature in [Close] range. That creature may make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) to resist the possession, but if it fails it is [Bound] under your control. You may activate any ability that does not require an attack roll, but your host cannot act normally. Instead, you may command your host to move up to its speed once per [Round] as a free action, and to make a single attack as a swift action. If a creature provokes an attack of opportunity from your host, you may use an immediate action to force your host to make the attack of opportunity, which uses your attack of opportunity for the [Round]. You cannot be targeted, but Hostile Possession may be dispelled. Your host takes all physical damage done to them, all magical and energy damage your host takes is split equally between the two of you after the host’s [Damage reduction] or [Resistance] has been applied, and you take all [Force] damage done to your host. You do not gain [Damage reduction] or [Resistance] against damage while possessing a creature. You may stop possessing a creature as a move action, and you stop possessing your host at the end of the [Encounter]. On its initiative count, your host may make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM). If the save succeeds, your host is no longer [Bound] and you reappear in the nearest unoccupied space. This is a [Mind-affecting] effect.

5.28 Invoker

Invokers recognise that there is power in the divine, but they reject that worship is necessary to access that power. With focus and discipline, or sheer magnetic force of will, the divine can be harnessed in just the same away as the arcane can.

When you choose the Invoker track, choose Int or Cha. That is your TAM, and is used in place of any ability modifier in any abilities or feats you gain from this track. Also, pick three deities whose domains you specialise in replicating the effects of.

1st Circle – Le on HandsSLA: Whenever you succeed on an interaction check, or the first time each [Round] an ally in your [Melee] range takes damage, you gain a focus point.

As a standard action, you may spend a focus point to cast cure light wounds, as the spell. When you gain your 2nd circle in Invoker, you may instead cast cure moderate wounds. When you gain your 3rd circle in Invoker, you may spend two focus points to cast cure serious wounds, and when you gain your 4th circle you may spend two focus points to cast cure critical wounds. In every case, you cannot reverse the spell.

2nd Circle – Do it for DivineSLA: As a free action while using your 1st circle ability, you may spend any number of focus points to grant the target of your spell a bonus to an ability score of your choice equal to the number of focus points spent (up to a maximum of +2 plus the number of circles you have in Invoker).

3rd Circle – Divine VisitationSLA: As a swift action, you may spend a focus point to gain a ‘Blessed by’ feat for one of three deities you chose for this track, or spend two focus points to gain any other ‘Blessed by’ feat. You benefit from the feat until the end of the [Encounter].

4th Circle – I Want to See Everyone’s HandsSLA: When you use your 1st circle ability, you may spend an additional 2 focus points to have it target all allies in your [Close] range.

5th Circle – Invoke the FifthSLA: When you use your 3rd circle ability you may also gain a ‘Disciple of’ instead of a ‘Blessed by’ feat if you meet the prerequisites (including if you meet the prerequisites from a feat you have gained through the 3rd circle ability).

6th Circle – Through Heaven’s EyesSLA: When you use your 3rd circle ability you may also gain a ‘Prophet of’ instead of a ‘Blessed by’ feat if you meet the prerequisites (including if you meet the prerequisites from a feat you have gained through the 3rd circle ability). You ignore the [Iconic] tag on ‘Prophet of’ feats.

7th Circle – Not the MessiahSLA: As long as you have three or more focus points, the area within your [Long] range is treated as though it is under a hallow spell. Three times per [Scene], you may spend five focus points to cast miracle, as the spell.

5.29 Khan

Either a mounted battlefield commander or a screaming leader of a great nomadic horde, Khans are mobile mounted warriors who use their leadership skills in battle to co-ordinate large numbers of allies.

1st Circle – Khan-Do AttitudeEX: Choose one of the following abilities (your choice is permanent):

  • Charging Khan: Whenever you are mounted and at least two allies (other than you) have your target in their [Melee] range, your melee attacks that round gain a fury bonus to damage equal to 5 points per circle of this track you possess. This increases to 8 points when at least four allies (other than you) have your target in their [Melee] range.
  • Archer Khan: Whenever you are mounted and at least two allies (other than you) are within your [Close] range, your ranged attacks that round deal additional damage with the [Precision] descriptor equal to 1d6 per circle of this track you possess. If at least four allies are within your [Close] range this increases to 1d8.

2nd Circle – For the Horde!EX: As a standard or move action which provokes an attack of opportunity, you may create a spread originating from you with a radius of 5 ft + 5 ft per circle of this track you possess, which affects a single ally plus an additional ally for each circle of this track you possess. If you used a standard action, those affected may immediately make a single melee or ranged attack. A creature may only be affected by this ability, Inspiring Strike, Encore or A Stitch in Time once per [Round]. If you used a move action, those affected may immediately move up to 5 ft + 5 ft per circle of this track you possess. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

3rd Circle – Lok’tar Ogar!EX: Whenever an ally within [Close] range attacks a creature which a different ally in [Close] range has hit with an attack in the last [Round], they may ignore the highest applicable [Miss chance].

4th Circle – Khanye WestEX: As a standard action, you may make an attack action at any time during a movement, and continue that movement afterwards.

5th Circle – Khan You Handle It?EX: As a standard action while mounted, you may make a normal move action and can move through any number of spaces occupied by opponents. The first time in the round you do, you may make an attack action against that opponent, that opponent may make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your character level + your Dex modifier) to negate the attack action, but you may still make a single attack. Every other time in the movement you move through a space occupied by an opponent you haven’t moved through in that movement, you may make a single immediate attack against that opponent.

6th Circle – Khan’t Let You Do ThatEX: When mounted, you never provoke attacks of opportunity.

7th Circle – KHAAAAAAAN!EX: The first time each [Round] you hit an attack against an opponent which at least three allies have hit with an attack in the last [Round], that opponent is [Dazed] for one [Round]. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your character level + your Dex modifier) negates the [Dazed] condition.

5.30 Lawmage

Be they law enforcement officers, servants of Mechanus or just wizards who really like order, Lawmages are those who wield pure axiomatic magic (though not pure Axiomancy – though Law magic is essentially making a contract with specific terms which cannot be denied). Lawmages impose their will upon the world, and their magic drains those who deny the contract they make with the world. Powerful Lawmages can use various powers to control those who go against their will.

Your TAM for this track is either your SAM or your highest mental ability modifier if you don’t have an SAM. DCs for saves against abilities in this track are 10 +1/2 your level + your TAM.

1st Circle – Judge, Jury and ExecutionerSU: As a move action, you may create a Jurisdiction. A Jurisdiction is a spread with radius equal to your [Close] range with centre in your [Medium] range. You may dispel your own Jurisdiction as a free action and all Jurisdictions are dispelled at the end of the [Encounter] and may only have a number of Jurisdictions active at one time equal to the number of circles you have in this track.

When you create a Jurisdiction, name one (specific) creature, one active ability, and one condition. Creatures who target the named creature with an offensive action, use the named active ability, or take any action which would inflict the named condition while in the Jurisdiction gain a [Lawbreaker] stack. Creatures with [Lawbreaker] stacks take -1 to all d20 rolls for each [Lawbreaker] stack they have. You attacks against creatures with [Lawbreaker] stacks deal additional damage equal to four times the number of [Lawbreaker] stacks they have. A creature may have a number of [Lawbreaker] stacks from your abilities up to your TAM.

Whenever you gain an odd numbered circle in Lawmage you may name an extra ability when creating a Jurisdiction. Whenever you gain an even numbered circle in Lawmage, you may name an extra condition when creating a Jurisdiction.

Also, when dice are rolled for damage in a Jurisdiction, instead the average roll for those dice is taken, rounding down (so 2d6 will instead do 7, 3d6 will do 10).

2nd Circle – Police Line, Do Not CrossSU: As a move action, you may create a Quarantine. A Quarantine consists of a number of contiguous spaces equal to four times the number of circles you have in this track. You may dismiss a Quarantine as a free action and all Quarantines are dispelled at the end of the [Encounter] and may have up to three active Quarantines. Whenever a creature enters a space within a Quarantine from outside the Quarantine or ends their turn in a space in a Quarantine, they gain a stack of [Lawbreaker].

Once per [Encounter] per circle (and once per [Encounter] per specific ability), when a creature with at least one stack of [Lawbreaker] uses an active ability in your Jurisdiction, you may remand it. When you remand an ability, the creature may not use that ability for the rest of the [Round], but may choose a different ability to use with the same action. The creature who was remanded loses one stack of [Lawbreaker].

3rd Circle – Stop, In The Name of the Law!SU: As an immediate action, when an opponent in [Medium] range with at least three stacks of [Lawbreaker] attacks one of your allies or uses an ability which targets at least one of your allies, you may negate that attack or ability (the action is still used) and they lose three stacks of [Lawbreaker]. A successful Will save negates this ability. This ability can only cancel abilities of circle equal to or lower than your highest circle in Lawmage.

As a standard action, you may prepare to use this ability. If you do, it only requires one [Lawbreaker] stack on the target, only removes one stack on use, and the Will save DC is increased by 3 for one [Round].

4th Circle – Witness ProtectionSU: Whenever an ally starts their turn within your Jurisdiction, they gain temporary hit points equal to your TAM.

As a standard action, you may target any creature in any of your Jurisdictions. That creature loses all bonuses and penalties to any rolls they have from any effects, lose all [Damage reduction] and all [Fast healing] for one [Round].

5th Circle – You’re Under Arrest!SU: As a standard action once per [Encounter], you may place an opponent in [Melee] range with at least two stacks of [Lawbreaker] in a Detention Sphere for two [Rounds]. The creature is incapable of acting or perceiving its surroundings, but it gains [Immunity] to dam¬age and [HP reduction], it cannot be targeted by an attack or ability, line of effect is blocked between the creature and any attack, ability, or ef¬fect and they lose two stacks of [Lawbreaker]. The creature may make a Fortitude save to negate this effect.

6th Circle – Taken as EvidenceSU: When you counter an ability with the 3rd circle of this track, the creature cannot use that ability again until the end of the [Encounter]. When you place a creature in a Detention Sphere, you may choose one active ability you know they have, they cannot use that ability again until the end of the [Encounter].

7th Circle – Diplomatic ImmunitySU: While you are in one of your Jurisdictions you gain [Immunity] to all effects originating from, and damage done by, all creatures with at least six stacks of [Lawbreaker].

5.31 Macroevocation

Many mages use Evocation magic - it is by far the most common way to harness the arcane to deal damage to opponents, which is of course one of the most effective methods to solve problems. But few use as much Evocation magic as the Macroevokers, who forgo any sense of subtlety or self-control to harness pure elemental and arcane force for massive effect. And massive collateral damage.

All spell-like abilities from the Macroevocation track deal damage of two types to all creatures within [Long] range. This includes the caster, but does not include creatures the caster does not have line of effect to. These abilities do not count as areas of effect for any ability which allows you to exclude a creature or space from an area of effect. Use this table to work out what resistance any creature damaged by these abilities have to the damage done (based on how much resistance they have to each damage type):

Table 5.1: Macroevocation Damage Resistances
None Lesser Resistance Greater Immunity
1 None None Lesser Lesser Resistance
2 None Lesser Lesser Resistance Resistance
3 Lesser Lesser Resistance Resistance Resistance
4 Lesser Resistance Resistance Greater Greater
5 Resistance Resistance Resistance Greater Immunity

The DC of all saves against Macroevocation abilities is 10 + 1/2 your character level + your SAM, or if you do not have an SAM, your highest mental ability modifier.

1st Circle – DecadestructionSLA: You gain the following abilities you can use as a standard action:

  • Plasma: Deal 1d6 energy damage with the [Fire] and [Acid] descriptors per your character level to all creatures within [Long] range. A successful Reflex save halves the damage.
  • Tempest: Deal 1d6 energy damage with the [Cold] and [Electricity] descriptors per your character level to all creatures within [Long] range. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage.

2nd Circle – HectoexterminationSLA: You gain the following abilities you can use as a standard action:

  • Neutron: Deal 1d6 magical and energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor per your character level to all creatures within [Long] range. A successful Reflex save halves the damage.
  • Meltdown: Deal 1d6 physical which ignores [Damage reduction] (but not [Resistances]) and energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor per your character level to all creatures within [Long] range. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage.

3rd Circle – KiloeradicationnSLA: You gain the following abilities you can use as a standard action:

  • Yinyang: Deal 1d6 physical which ignores [Damage reduction] (but not [Resistances]) and magical damage per your character level to all creatures within [Long] range. A successful Will save halves the damage.
  • Ardor: Deal 1d6 energy damage with the [Cold] and [Fire] descriptors per your character level to all creatures within [Long] range. A successful Will save halves the damage.

4th Circle – MegaregenerationSU: You gain [Fast healing] equal to your character level.

5th Circle – GigaobliterationSLA:You gain the following abilities you can use as a standard action:

  • Death: Deal 1d6 energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor only per your character level to all creatures within [Long] range. A successful Will save halves the damage.
  • Apocalypse: Deal 1d6 damage per your character level to all creatures within [Long] range, this damage has no descriptor and ignores [Resistances]. Damaged creatures must make a Fortitude and a Reflex save. If both saves succeed, they take no damage. If either save fails, they take full damage. If they have an ability such as Hard to Break which allows them to take no damage when they save to partially reduce an effect, they can use this to take no damage if they only make one save (of the appropriate type).

6th Circle – TeraamplificationSU: Once per [Encounter] increase the damage done by any Macroevocation ability to 1d12 per your character level. If it deals below the average damage, you can use this ability again this [Encounter].

7th Circle – PetaruinationSLA: Deal 100 damage to all creatures in [Long] range which ignores all [Resistances] and has no descriptor.

5.32 Merchant

The humble merchant is seen all over the world, ferrying their wares from place to place to make profits based on different resource needs and supplies. Really, a merchant is already an adventurer, in a way, and needs to have some wits about them to survive the journey on the road, but some even decide to make the career switch from commerce to the more direct forms of acquisition. An adventuring merchant brings with them their skill at bartering, their ability to appraise items, their quick reflexes to get out of danger, and their contacts in towns across the world.

1st Circle – Down to BusinessEX: You gain a +3 bonus to Diplomacy and Bluff checks, and to all Knowledge checks made to identify creatures or items.

When in a settlement you always know the identity and location of the most reliable vendor for any specific kind of service.

2nd Circle – Liquid AssetsEX: Once per [Encounter], if you make a successful Reflex saving throw against an offensive action that normally deals half damage on a successful save, you may instead take no damage.

When you are travelling outside a settlement in familiar territory, you always know the sorts of creatures or other threats that may be encountered randomly on your path.

3rd Circle – Seal the DealEX: You are always aware of the location of the most valuable item that you or your allies do not own within [Close] range, by pure mercantile instinct.

You can attune to and unattune from magic items as a swift action.You count as 2 levels higher and with an ability score 2 points higher for the purpose of calculating the effect of any magic item you are attune to. Also, your familiarity with treasure gives you a +4 bonus to saving throws against any effect of a magic item.

4th Circle – Cash in HandEX: Your web of contacts means that, unless it is truly impossible, at the start of each [Quest] you are able to acquire some Hirelings. Your Hirelings take the form of Expert Mooks (with a Track of your choice) of total level equal to your level plus your Cha modifier, though you may have a number of Hirelings no more than your Cha modifier, and no Hireling can be higher level than your own level minus 2. They will follow your orders within reason, though they do require fair payment (a base price before adjustment for circumstance for all a [Quest]’s hirelings should be of two castings of a 4th circle spell effect).

You also can always find someone willing to sell you the best available form of transport for the situation you find yourself in at the start of the [Quest], at a fair price (which may be higher than the market rate depending on circumstance).

5th Circle – More Than You Bargained For!EX: Your expertise with magical items allows you to draw out extra value from them. All Greater and Relic magic items you attune to gain an additional effect, equivalent to that of a Lesser item. This should be thematically appropriate and determined by the DM. Your Artifacts gain and additional effect equivalent to that of a Greater item.

6th Circle – Close Up ShopEX: When you ignore an effect due to Liquid Assets, you may treat all future saving throws against effects originating from the same creature as though you rolled a 20.

7th Circle – Art of the DealEX: Once per [Scene], while in combat, with a Diplomacy check you may attempt to hire one of your opponents. If your check is successful, the target does not see you or any of your allies as a mortal enemy, and you offer a reasonable price, that opponent will become your ally and follow your orders (within reason) for the duration of the [Encounter], and will not see you as an opponent after the [Encounter] has ended (until/unless you do something novel to provoke their ire).

5.33 Meteomancy

Meteomancers use the magic of the air to influence the weather and infuse it with magic, causing effects across the entire battlefield as well as localised meteomantic events.

If you have an SAM, that is your TAM for this track, otherwise, choose your Int, Wis or Cha modifier to be your TAM. All saves against the effects of abilities from this track have DC 10 + ½ your level + your TAM.

1st Circle – ForecastSLA: You can use the following abilities as a move action:

  • Sunbeam: One ally in [Medium] range heals 1d6 HP per circle of Meteomancy you have. The Weather becomes Sun.
  • Breeze: One enemy in [Medium] range is [Blown Away] in a direction away from you on a failed Reflex save. The Weather becomes Cloud.
  • Mistral: One ally [Medium] range gains a +10 ft bonus to movement speed for one [Round], and all enemies in [Melee] range of that ally take a -10 penalty to movement speed for one [Round]. The Weather becomes Snow.
  • Shower: One enemy in [Medium] range takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls and -4 to damage rolls for one [Round], this increases to -3 to attack and -6 to damage when you reach your 3rd circle in Meteomancy, and to -4 to attack and -8 to damage when you reach your 6th circle. A successful Fortitude save halves the penalty. The Weather becomes Rain.

The Weather is an ongoing effect which lasts until the end of [Encounter], or until changed by you or one of your allies. If an enemy is also has Meteomancy, each side has their own Weather (and the sky or inside microclimate created gets very messy). All allies in the [Encounter] gain the benefits of the Weather.

  • Sun: Your allies gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls. This increases to +2 when you reach your 4th circle in Meteomancy, and to +3 at 6th circle.
  • Cloud: Your allies gain a +1 bonus to saves. This increases to +2 when you reach your 4th circle in Meteomancy, and to +3 at 6th circle.
  • Snow: Your allies gain a +1 bonus to AC. This increases to +2 when you reach your 4th circle in Meteomancy, and to +3 at 6th circle.
  • Rain: At the start of your turn, all allies heal equal to your TAM. This increases to equal to your level (or your TAM if still higher) when you reach your 4th circle in Meteomancy, and to the total of your level and TAM when you reach your 6th circle.

2nd Circle – Cloud NineSLA: As a standard action, you may fire an orb of pure meteomantic energy at an enemy in [Close] range. This orb deals 1d4 energy damage per level with a different descriptor and additional effect depending on the current Weather. A successful Reflex save halves the damage and negates the additional effect.

  • Sun: [Fire], [Dazzled] for two [Rounds], this increases to [Blinded] when you reach your 5th circle in Meteomancy.
  • Cloud: [Electric], -2 to DCs of saves against any of their abilities for one [Round]. This increases to -4 when you reach your 5th circle in Meteomancy.
  • Snow: [Cold], -15 to movement speed for one [Round], this increases to [Slowed] when you reach your 5th circle in Meteomancy.
  • Rain: [Acid], [Fatigued] for two [Rounds]. This instead becomes [Vulnerability] to all energy and magic damage for one [Round] when you reach your 5th circle in Meteomancy.

3rd Circle – When it Rains, it PoursSLA: You can use the following abilities as a move action:

  • Sunspot: One ally in [Medium] range deals an additional 1d4 energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor per circle you have in Meteomancy on all attacks for one [Round]. The Weather becomes Sun.
  • Shroud: One ally in [Medium] range becomes [Invisible] until the end of the [Encounter] or until they make an offensive action. The Weather becomes Cloud.
  • Ice: A 20 ft radius in [Medium] range becomes covered in ice. This works as the Grease spell, and any creature which falls [Prone] also takes energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to your TAM. The Weather becomes Snow.
  • Torrent: One enemy in [Medium] range is [Revealed] for two [Rounds] and cannot make [Bonus attacks], attacks of opportunity or Bull Rush combat manoeuvres for two [Rounds]. A successful Fortitude save negates the effect except for being [Revealed]. The Weather becomes Rain.

4th Circle – Round About Half past TenSLA: You can use the following abilities as a move action:

  • Mirage: One ally in [Medium] range gains 25% [Miss chance] for two [Rounds]. The Weather becomes Sun.
  • Suffuse: End one ongoing magic effect of circle equal to or less than the number of circles you have in Meteomancy on target creature in [Medium] range. The Weather becomes Cloud.
  • Flurry: Target creature in [Medium] range is [Checked] in four directions of your choice (out of six on the hex grid) and [Exhausted] for one [Round]. A successful Reflex save reduces this to two directions (still of your choice) and [Fatigued]. The Weather becomes Snow.
  • Deluge: The next time target creature in [Medium] range uses an action to use an extraordinary, spell-like or supernatural ability, or a spell, they must make a Fortitude save, on failure they must use that action for a different purpose, and can’t use the ability that failed for two [Rounds]. The Weather becomes Rain.

5th Circle – DududududuSLA: Twice per [Encounter], you may call up a storm out to your [Close] range, which deals damage equal to five times your TAM to all creatures in the range, with an additional effect on every enemy in the range depending on the current Weather.

  • Sun – Sandstorm: All enemies in the storm are [Blinded] and [Battered] for two [Rounds]. A Fortitude save halves the duration and damage.
  • Cloud – Tornado: You may move every enemy in the area to any other space in the area. Each space can still only be occupied by one creature. A successful Reflex save halves the damage and negates the forced movement. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
  • Snow – Snowstorm: All enemies in the storm are [Slowed] and [Exhausted] for one [Round]. A Fortitude save halves the damage and negates [Slowed] (but not [Exhausted]).
  • Rain – Lightning Storm: Instead of all creatures in the area, only enemies in the area are damaged. A Reflex save halves the damage.

6th Circle – Meteor MancySLA: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may call down a Meteor on a 30 ft radius within [Medium] range. This deals damage equal to 5 times your level to all creatures in the area. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage and prevents the damage from reducing the target below 1 HP. This is a [Death] effect. The Weather becomes Ash.

  • Ash: All healing effects, including [Fast healing] used by any creature in the [Encounter] are halved. Cloud Nine deals physical damage and causes [Battered] for one [Round] on a failed save, and any storm used acts as a Tornado.

7th Circle – Extinction EventsSLA: Once per [Encounter], you may use one of the following abilities as a move action:

  • Heat Wave: All enemies in [Medium] range are [Energy drained]. As long as the Weather remains Sun, at the start of your turn all enemies in [Medium] range must make a Fortitude save or be [Energy drained] again. The Weather becomes Sun.
  • Cyclone: All enemies in [Medium] range are [Flying] and [Checked] in all directions for one [Round], and you may move them 30 ft in any direction if they fail a Reflex save. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. As long as the Weather remains Cloud, at the start of your turn all enemies in [Medium] range must make a Reflex save or be [Flying] and [Checked] in all directions for one [Round] and you can move them 20 ft in any direction (it still doesn’t provoke). The Weather becomes Cloud.
  • Glaciation: All enemies in [Medium] range are [Petrified] unless they make a successful Fortitude save for as long as the Weather remains Snow (they can still make a save at end of turn against [Petrified] as normal). The Weather becomes Snow.
  • Tempest: All enemies in [Medium] range are [Deafened] and [Nauseated] for one [Round], a successful Reflex save negates [Nauseated]. As long as the Weather remains Rain, at the start of your turn all enemies in [Medium] range are [Deafened] for one [Round]. The Weather becomes Rain.

5.34 More Dakka

Some ranged attackers use complex formulae to determine the optimal angle of shot. Some use fancy trick ammunition to confuse the battlefield. Some resort to underhanded tricks. But you? You simply put your faith in a simple equation: As the number of projectiles approaches infinity, the number of problems remaining unsolved by the projectiles approaches zero.

1st Circle – Bullet StormEX: Your iterative ranged attacks deal only 1d6 + your KOM damage, regardless of weapon properties. Any bonus damage to these attacks from abilities or from critical hits is halved. In return, you may make one additional iterative attack in any attack action where all your attacks are ranged.

This increases to two additional attacks at 6th level, and three at 16th.

2nd Circle – Run to GroundEX: When you hit with two iterative ranged attacks in a row, the target takes damage equal to your KOM and falls [Prone].

3rd Circle – Spray and PrayEX: As a standard action, make a ranged attack roll with your equipped weapon and designate a wedge out to your [Close] range. Note the result of the attack roll and compare it to the highest AC of opponents in the wedge. If your attack roll was higher, deal physical damage to all creatures in the wedge equal to your KOM multiplied by half of the difference between your noted attack roll and the AC value.

4th Circle – DefiladeEX: Any opponent damaged by Run to Ground or Spray and Pray is [Vulnerable] to physical damage for one [Round].

5th Circle – Death GattlingEX: When you make an attack action, if all attacks in the action are ranged you may choose to make every attack in the action with your iterative attack bonus. If you do, you may make two additional iterative attacks in the action.

6th Circle – The CullingEX: Twice per [Scene], at the start of your turn, you may initiate The Culling, which lasts for two [Rounds]. During The Culling, you move at half speed, and can only make attacks against creatures in the same straight line from you as any other target you attacked in that turn. During the Culling, all your attacks are iterative, you do not benefit from any [Bonus attacks], and you make a number of attacks equal to twice the number of circles you have in More Dakka.

7th Circle – Flush TargetEX: Any opponent which is hit by three of your ranged attacks in the same [Round] is [Revealed], loses all cover, and loses any temporary effect which increases AC, saves, [Damage reduction] or [Resistance].

5.35 Mystic

You use magical arts from long before the circle of Eight began to codify spells, but removed from the instinctive magic of the common Evoker or Illusionist. You have access to all schools of magic, but rather than being bound by spells you bring out the ancient runes in complex Mystic Arcana, for almighty effects which require time and effort to even cast.

Mystic Spell-Like Abilities form part of a Mystic Arcana. You use actions to add components including Effects, Areas, Limitations and Boons to a Mystic Arcana, which will then have the effects of all of its components, and will fail to cast (losing all components that were built up) if its Limitation cannot be satisfied. An Arcana is immediately cast once it has an Effect, and Area and a Limitation, but until casting you can add components to any number of Arcana, to cast all at once in one burst. While the effects are set in stone by earlier components, the specific place where an Arcana is targeted is chosen when it is cast rather than when choosing the Area.

The DC of saves against any Mystic Arcana is 10 + 1/2 your level + your highest mental ability modifier.

1st Circle – The Old MagicSLA: As a standard action, you may add an Effect or a Limitation to a Mystic Arcana. As a move action you may add an Area or a Limitation to a Mystic Arcana.

You can use the following components:

  • Effect - Shadow Winds: All creatures in the area take magical damage equal to 1d10 per your level + your highest mental ability modifier. A successful Reflex save halves the damage.

  • Effect - Enervating Shadows: All creatures in the area are [Slowed] for three [Rounds]. A successful Will save negates this effect.

  • Effect - Chains of Darkness: All creatures in the area are [Entangled] and [Sickened] for the [Encounter]. A successful Fortitude save reduces this duration to one [Round].

  • Area - Beam: A 5 ft wide line out to the end of your [Medium] range.

  • Area - Explosion: A 10 ft radius spread centred within your [Close] range.

  • Area - Wave: A wedge out to 10 ft + 10 ft per circle you have of Mystic.

  • Limitation - Willing Sacrifice: The area of effect must include one ally other than yourself.

  • Limitation - Near Miss: The area of effect must have one opponent adjacent to a space in the area, but not in the area.

  • Limitation - Blood for Blood: You also take the effect of the Mystic Arcana, and may not make a save against the effect.

2st Circle – The WeaveSLA: As a swift action, you may add a Minor Boon to a Mystic Arcana.

  • Minor Boon - Blackfire: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the Effect also starts [Burning] and takes [HP reduction] equal to the damage dealt by that [Burning] condition this [Encounter].
  • Minor Boon - Drained Might: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the Effect also takes a penalty to damage rolls equal to half your highest mental ability modifier for the [Encounter].
  • Minor Boon - Enduring Shadow: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the Effect also has any healing they receive from a source other than themselves reduced by your level for the [Encounter], to a minimum of half.

3rd Circle – Dark Magic AttackSLA: You can add the following components to a Mystic Arcana.

  • Effect - Screaming Sigils: All creatures in the area are [Frightened] by their nearest opponent for two [Rounds], and [Shaken] for the remainder of the [Encounter]. A successful Will save instead causes them to be [Shaken] for two [Rounds].

  • Effect - Ebon Shackles: All creatures in the area have their effective level reduced by 3 for all level-dependent damage, DC and range calculations for three [Rounds]. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.

  • Area - Scything Ray: A 5 ft wide line starting and ending on an edge of your [Medium] range.

  • Area - Cage of Magic: Your [Close] range, which includes you in the area of effect.

  • Limitation - No Survivors: The area of effect must include every opponent in the [Encounter].

  • Limitation - Blunted Consequences: All creatures are treated as having made their save against the Effect of the Arcana.

4th Circle – When it Was WrittenSLA: As a standard action you may add a Major Boon to a Mystic Arcana. You can add the following boons to a Mystic Arcana.

  • Minor Boon - Unweave the Veil: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the Effect also has one magical effect of 5th circle or lower on them dispelled.

  • Minor Boon - Spectral Shield: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the Effect also cannot make attacks of opportunity while under the Effect, or until two [Rounds] have passed.

  • Minor Boon - Bane of Precision: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the Effect also cannot make critical hits while under the effect, or until they have had three critical hits denied.

  • Major Boon - Drain Life: For each creature which does not succeed on a save against the Effect, gain temporary hit points equal to your highest mental ability modifier.

  • Major Boon - Deepened Darkness: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the Effect also takes magical damage equal to 1d8 per two character levels you have, plus your highest mental ability modifier.

5th Circle – Twice Said and DoneSLA: If you cast a second Mystic Arcana in a [Round], DCs of saves against its Effect are increased by 4. You can add the following components to Mystic Arcana.

  • Effect - Traitor’s Whisper: All creatures in the area must make a Will save or immediately make an attack action with any weapons they are currently wielding against their closest ally in their attack range.

  • Area - Reaving Blast: A 20 ft wide line out to 10 ft per your character level.

  • Minor Boon - Fettered Wings: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the effect also loses the Fly movement mode if they have it while under the effect, or until two [Rounds] have passed.

  • Major Boon - Endless Pain: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the effect is also [Battered] for two [Rounds].

6th Circle – Master of the Mystic ArtsSLA: You can add the following components to Mystic Arcana.

  • Effect - Powers Sequestered: All creatures in the area lose access to all abilities and benefits from their Fast and Slow tracks for three [Rounds]. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.

  • Area - Cataclysmic Storm: A 50 ft radius spread centred within your Long range.

  • Minor Boon - Necrotic Reminiscence: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the effect and dies within two [Rounds] of being affected explodes, dealing energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to four times their level to all creatures within 20 ft of them.

  • Major Boon - Armaments Lost: Any creature which does not succeed on a save against the effect loses all benefits from its attuned magic items for one [Round].

7th Circle – The Most Ancient CurseSLA:You may add the following component to Mystic Arcana.

  • Effect - Trapped in Onyx: All creatures in the area must make a Will save. If they fail and then die within the next [Round], they are revived with 66 hit points as an ally of their highest level (on a tie, it is either you, or the opponent with the highest Will save) opponent, and will act on that now-ally’s command. At the end of the [Encounter], they will die again unless some method of prolonging necromancy is used on them.

5.36 Paragon

You are just an exemplary biological specimen. You are stronger, faster, tougher than most members of your species. You can do more than anyone else. You are a shining beacon, an example to follow, a true hero.

1st Circle – You’re Gonna Go Far, KidEX: Double all of your racial bonuses (vision modes, if applicable, get doubled range). If you have any racial penalties, triple them, if you don’t, take a -2 penalty to an ability score of your choice.

2nd Circle – Super PowerEX: Choose one of your other Tracks. For all EX abilities of that track, treat your level as two higher and any relevant physical ability score (including your KOM or KDM if they are Str, Dex or Con) as 1 higher.

3rd Circle – The QuicknessEX: Each turn you may make an additional attack of opportunity and 5 ft step. When you use a move action to move after a partial move action, you can move up to your full speed.

4th Circle – Hero of the RealmEX: You gain [Immunity] to [Burning], [Bleeding], [Blinded] and [Battered].

5th Circle – Diamond in the RoughEX: You may make an additional swift or immediate action each [Round], and may make an additional iterative attack in your attack actions.

6th Circle – God’s MenuEX: You gain [Immunity] to [Binding] effects, [Blown away] and [Bonus attacks].

7th Circle – The GOATEX: You gain a +4 bonus to all ability scores.

5.37 Pictomancy

Most spells have components, though they’re not especially important. Wizards and Tacticians keep them in a specialised pouch; Shamans and Clerics draw their power from the Outer Planes or the natural world. Pictomancers are an esoteric subset of arcane spellcaster who distil their components into pigments which which they can apply pure magic to their targets at close range.

All Pictomancy abilities use Pigment. You have a number units of Pigment per [Scene] equal to your highest mental ability modifier plus the number of circles you have in Pictomancy. All creatures affected by Pictomancy abilities are [Revealed] for the duration.

1st Circle – Art AttackSLA: As a standard action or in place of an attack in an attack action, you may spend any amount of Pigment (minimum 1 unit) to apply either of the below effects to an opponent in [Close] range. This ability does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

The effects last until the target uses a standard action to remove the paint, or until the end of the [Encounter]. If an opponent removes paint in your [Melee] range, you gain the Pigment you spent on the ability back.

  • Disarming Scarlet: Your target takes a penalty to any physical damage rolls equal to the number units of Pigment you spent multiplied by the number of circles you have in Pictomancy. An opponent affected by Disarming Scarlet cannot deal any physical damage which does not require an attack roll or allow a saving throw.
  • Disenchanting Mauve: Your target takes a penalty to any magical and energy damage rolls equal to the number units of Pigment you spent multiplied by the number of circles you have in Pictomancy. An opponent affected by Disarming Scarlet cannot deal any magical or energy damage which does not require an attack roll or allow a saving throw.

2nd Circle – I’ll Paint You a PictureSLA: As a standard action or in place of an attack in an attack action, you may spend any amount of Pigment (minimum 1 unit) to apply either of the below effects to an opponent in [Close] range. This ability does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

The effects last until the target uses a standard action to remove the paint, or for one [Round] plus an additional [Round] for each unit of Pigment you spent. If an opponent removes paint in your [Melee] range, you gain the Pigment you spent on the ability back.

  • Indefensible Teal: When the target takes physical damage, they take additional damage equal to their own KDM.
  • Zappable Chartreuse: When the target takes magical or energy damage, they take additional damage equal to their own KDM.

3rd Circle – ThinnerSLA: As a standard action, or in place of an attack in an attack action, you may remove a single effect from a creature in [Melee] range which is not a named Condition. This is a [Dispelling] effect of circle equal to the number of circles you have in Pictomancy.

4th Circle – Coat of Many ColoursSLA: As a standard action or in place of an attack in an attack action, you may spend any amount of Pigment (minimum 1 unit) to apply either of the below effects to an opponent in [Melee] range. This ability does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

The effects last until the target uses a standard action to remove the paint, or until the duration specified in the effect. If an opponent removes paint in your [Close] range, you gain the Pigment you spent on the ability back.

  • Incurable Coral: When the target is healed by any effect other than [Fast healing], the amount they heal is reduced by your level multiplied by the number of units of Pigment you spent. If not removed, this effects lasts until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Inconvenient Cyan: The target takes a -5 penalty to attack rolls for [Bonus attacks] and a penalty to attack rolls for iterative attacks equal to half the number of circles you have in Pictomancy. If not removed, this ability lasts for one [Round], plus an additional [Round] for each unit of Pigment you spent.

5th Circle – Mass ProductionSLA: When you use any Pictomancy ability (except for Thinner) you may spent any number of additional points of Pigment. For each point spent, apply the effect to another creature within your [Melee] range.

6th Circle – Self-InspiredSLA: You may target yourself with your Pictomancy abilities. When targeting yourself, Indefensible Teal and Zappable Chartreuse reduce incoming damage; Disarming Scarlet and Disenchanting Mauve grant a bonus to damage and you ignore their second effect; Incurable Coral increases incoming healing; and Inconvenient Cyan gives bonuses instead of penalties.

Creatures in your [Melee] range can use a standard action to remove these effects, refunding you Pigment as normal.

7th Circle – The Full SpectrumSLA: As a standard action or in place of an attack in an attack action, you may spend any amount of Pigment (minimum 1 unit) to roll that number of d8s and apply the effects you roll on the table below to an opponent in [Melee] range. This ability does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

DCs of any saves against these effects are 10 + 1/2 your level + your highest mental ability modifier.

  • 1 - Red: Energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to three times your highest mental ability modifier.
  • 2 - Orange: [Burning], [Bleeding], [Blinded] and [Exhausted] for three [Rounds]. A Fortitude save negates this effect.
  • 3 - Yellow: [Checked] in all directions for two [Rounds]. A Reflex save negates this effect.
  • 4 - Green: Energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor equal to three times your highest mental ability modifier.
  • 5 - Blue: [Entangled], [Dazzled], [Deafened] and [Sickened] for three [Rounds]. A Reflex save negates this effect.
  • 6 - Indigo: [Energy drained] 1d6 times. A Fortitude save halves this effect.
  • 7 - Violet: [Petrified] for one [Round]. A Will save negates this effect.
  • 8 - Rainbow: Roll again twice.

5.38 Plutomancy

It is, to some, an unfortunate fact that all settled societies on the Material Plane use some form of currency. Barely a century ago, a master Transmuter named Adham Keywald from the Baccain city of Azulona developed a way to, through a combination of Transmutation, Enchantment and pure Divine magic, use this shared belief in the value of currency to fuel pure and esoteric magic. His disciples and their disciples, the Plutomancers, can use currency to cast currency-related spells, and otherwise warp the concepts of economics into ways to affect other creatures directly.

All Plutomancy abilities are Spells. You have a number of slots for Pictomancy spells per circle per [Scene] equal to two plus the number of circles you have in Pictomancy above that circle (e.g. at 4th circle you will have 5 slots for 1st circle spells, 4 for 2nd circle spells, 3 for 3rd circle spells, and 2 for 4th circle spells per [Scene]).

Your spellcasting ability modifier for Plutomancy spells is Int. The DC of all saves against Plutomancy spells is 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Int.

1st Circle: You gain the following spells:

  • Appraise: As a standard action, target an item you can see in [Medium] range. You learn what its exact current market value is.
  • Invest: As a standard action, grant an ally within [Medium] range a +3 bonus to attack rolls until the end of the [Encounter]. Note every time they hit or miss with an attack roll this [Encounter]. For every three times they have hit, you gain a +1 bonus to all d20 rolls, up to a maximum of the number of circles you have in Plutomancy. If their number of misses is ever equal to or higher than double their number of hits, and both numbers are greater than 2, this effect ends.
  • Taxation: As a move action, target an ally in [Medium] range. Whenever they roll damage this [Encounter], reduce the size of all dice they roll by one.
