At the end of each of their turns, roll all the dice they would ordinarily have rolled for damage that turn (do not add any of their bonuses). You may heal any allies within that ally’s [Close] range for a total number of hit points equal to the total of those rolls, splitting the amount between allies as you wish.

2nd Circle: You gain the following spells:

  • Consolidate: With a 30 second ritual, transform any number of items you are holding and have not been held by any other creature for more than five minutes in the last week into their equivalent value in the local currency (in any denominations you wish that are reasonable to carry). For every Lesser magic item transformed, increase the total amount of currency you get by 3%; for every Greater magic item transformed, increase it by 6%; 9% for each Relic; and 12% for each Artefact (these percentage increases are additive).
  • Quantitative Easing: As a standard action, heal an ally within [Medium] range for 2d8 hit points per your level plus your Int modifier multiplied by the number of even circles you have in Plutomancy. That ally gains [Vulnerability] to all damage for one [Round]. If you use this ability a subsequent time in an [Encounter], the healing dice size is reduced by 1 (from d8 to d6 to d4 to twice your level) and the number of [Rounds] the ally has [Vulnerability] for is increased by 1.
  • Value Added: As a standard action, target an ally within [Medium] range. For the rest of the [Encounter], each [Round] track how much damage that ally takes and how much damage they deal. At the end of each [Round], if that ally took more damage than they dealt, heal them for 15 hit points per even numbered circle you have in Plutomancy. If they dealt more damage than they took, inflict 15 points of magical damage per even numbered circle you have in Plutomancy to an opponent in that ally’s [Close] range.

3rd Circle: You gain the following spells:

  • Lobbying: During a social encounter, you may spend an amount of currency equal to your level multiplied by your target’s level multiplied by 10 in local gold piece-equivalents (the DM may adjust this amount if the target has particular resistance to magic or money is especially important in their culture). Gain a social encounter token against that target. You can only spend one token gained with Lobbying at a time to make or resist demands.
  • Supply and Demand: As a standard action, learn the AC of all creatures in [Medium] range. Then, target an opponent in [Medium] range whose AC is higher than 15 + the number of circles they have in their fast track + their level. That creature must make a Will save or have their AC reduced by 2d4 for the [Encounter], to a minimum of 11 + the number of circles they have in their fast track + their level. Grant an ally in [Medium] range whose AC is lower than 11 + the number of circles they have in their fast track + their level a bonus to AC for the [Encounter] equal to the amount of AC that target lost.
  • Depreciate: As a move action, target an opponent in [Medium] range. They must make a Will save. If the save fails, the DC of all saves against active abilities they use or passive abilities they trigger is reduced by 2 per time that ability has been used in the [Encounter] or 1 per time it has been triggered in the [Encounter]. This lasts until the end of the [Encounter], or until the creature uses a full-round action to remove the effect (it cannot be affected by Depreciate again if it does).

4th Circle: You gain the following spells:

  • Write-Offs Account: You can only cast this spell as a 30 second ritual before you have had any combat [Encounters] in the [Scene]. Take any amount of [HP reduction] (up to half your maximum hit points) and note three times that number. For the rest of the [Scene], as an immediate action you may reduce that noted number by an amount up to the number of circles you have in Plutomancy multiplied by your Int modifier, and heal an ally in [Close] range for that amount.
  • Savings Account: As a standard action, you may create a Savings Account for the [Encounter]. Whenever an ally in [Close] range succeeds on a saving throw, you learn the amount they succeeded on it by and add that number to the Savings Account. Whenever an ally in [Close] range makes a saving throw, as an immediate action they may add a bonus to that save of up to +3, reducing the Savings Account by that amount. You may also grant this bonus to an ally proactively as an immediate action.
  • Planned Overdraft: As a standard action, target an ally in [Medium] range. For the rest of the [Encounter], they do not become [Unconscious] or [Dying] when below 0 hit points. At the end of that ally’s turn, if they are still below 0 hit points they will take [HP reduction] equal to 15 times the number of turns they have been below 0 hit points. That ally will still die if they are reduced to a negative amount of hit points equal to their Con modifier, but they will only do so if they are on that number of hit points at the end of their turn.

5th Circle: You gain the following spells:

  • Rational Actor: As a free action when not in combat, you may force another creature to make a Will save. If they fail, they must act completely unemotionally with respect to any monetary decision and simply maximise the material benefit to themselves (as they perceive it) for the next three minutes.
  • Complex Futures: As a standard action, choose two allies in [Medium] range. Add together their current hit points and note the result. For the next 1d4+1 [Rounds], both those allies use that total hit points rather than their own, and all damage they take is deducted from that, and healing is added to that total. Those allies share their [Resistances], and take the highest of their respective [Damage reduction], [Fast healing] and any sustained [HP reduction]. At the end of the duration, both allies’ hit point total becomes half the amount the combined total was at. You may only cast this spell once per [Encounter].
  • Short Squeeze: As an immediate action when an attack misses an ally in [Medium] who is under 20 hit points, or when such an ally succeeds on a saving throw to reduce or negate damage they would take, deal 22 points of magical damage per odd numbered circle you have in Plutomancy to the attacker or the creature whose ability was being saved against.

6th Circle: You gain the following spells:

  • War Bonds: With a ten minute ritual, choose an ally and spend any amount of currency. For the duration of the [Quest], whenever that ally kills a creature whose level is greater than 3 less than theirs (e.g. if the ally is level 16, any creature of level 14 or higher), roll 1d10. You immediately gain an amount of currency equal to that % of the initially spent amount. You may roll 2d10 if the creature killed is more than 2 levels higher than the ally. You may only have one ally affected by this spell at a time and a creature can only be affected by one instance of this spell at a time.
  • Put on the Chain: As a standard action, target creature in [Medium] range must make a Will save or become [Ethereal] for two [Rounds]. Any creature within that creature’s [Medium] range can use any active ability that creature has while it is [Ethereal]. If they do, they take [HP reduction] equal to that creature’s level, and you and that creature both gain temporary hit points equal to that amount (which stacks up to a number of times equal to your Int modifier).
  • Prime the Pump: As an immediate action at the end of an ally’s turn, note the amount of damage they dealt that turn, roll 2d10, and calculate that percentage of the total. Until the start of their next turn, all allies in their [Medium] range gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to your calculated number.

7th Circle: You gain the following spells:

  • Capitalise Assets: With a one minute ritual, target any items, objects, etc. that you definitively own within [Close] range. You can also target any non-physical concepts, favours, contracts etc. that you definitively own. You learn what its exact current market value is. You gain their equivalent value in the local currency (in any denominations you wish that are reasonable to carry), destroy all physical items and lose all rights to or metaphysical ownership of the non-physical assets. For every Lesser magic item transformed, increase the total amount of currency you get by 3%; for every Greater magic item transformed, increase it by 6%; 9% for each Relic; and 12% for each Artefact (these percentage increases are additive).
  • Micromorts: As a full round action, target an opponent in [Medium] range. For the duration of the [Scene], as long as you have line of sight to that opponent, note their hit points at the start of each [Round] and the amount of damage that they take each [Round]. At the end of each [Round], roll a percentile. If your result is lower than the damage they took that [Round] expressed as a percentage of their maximum hit points, they must make a Will save. If that fails, roll a second percentile, if that result is also lower than the damage they took expressed as a percentage of their hit points at the start of the [Round], they must make a Fortitude save. If that fails, they instantly die.
  • Fungible Token: As a full round action, target an opponent in [Medium] range. They must make a Will save. If it fails, for the duration of the [Encounter] their [Damage reduction] and [Fast healing] are reduced to the lowest of any of their allies within their [Long] range, they lose all [Resistances] that are not shared by all of their allies within their [Long] range, and gain any [Vulnerabilities] that any of their allies within their [Long] range have. Whenever any damage is dealt to that creature, you may apply it instead to any of that creature’s allies within your [Medium] range. That creature may make a Will save to take the damage itself.

5.39 Projection

Projection is a highly specialised branch of Spectramancy – Mirror Magic. It is the art of projecting a copy of the weapons used by others, and with more advanced Spectramancy even using those copied weapons as conduits to copy their wielder’s abilities, using them as a perfect counter to their attacks, and even reinforcing them.

When you gain the Projection track, you gain access to the Forge skill. This represents your inner Forge – the mental construct which stores your Projections and creates new ones. The Key Ability Modifier for Forge is your choice of Dex or Wis – you either create your copies via a fighter’s instincts or by perceptual analysis. This still counts towards your limit of trained skills, but if you gain this track after character creation, such as through Guild Initiation, you can switch one of your trained skills for Forge (and you should). Forge has no other uses apart from the Projection track.

1st Circle – The Bone of My SwordSU: You can use your magic to copy the weapons of other creatures. As part of a move action, make a Forge check targeting a creature’s weapon in [Medium] range which you can see clearly of DC 10 + target creature’s KOM + target creature’s level. This DC is increased by 2 if the weapon is a Lesser item, 3 if a Greater item, 6 if a Relic and 8 if an Artefact. It is also increased by 3 if the weapon being copied is a natural weapon. On a success, you create a copy of the weapon and instantly switch your equipped weapon to it. If you’ve copied a natural weapon, you create an analogous held weapon, such as a kukri for a bird’s talons, or a serrated axe for a dragon’s claws. If the check fails, you cannot attempt to copy the weapon again until the next [Scene].

This copy lasts for one [Round], which increases to two [Rounds] when you gain your 2nd circle in Projection, three [Rounds] at 4th circle, and four [Rounds] at 6th circle, at which point it disappears into the ether. While you have the copy, you may wield it normally and as if you were attuned to it – though it doesn’t use any item slots.

As the copy disappears, you may store it in your Forge. You can have a number of weapons in your Forge equal to your KAM for Forge, and adding a new weapon to a full Forge requires removing one. You may use Forge as part of a move action to create a copy of any weapon in your Forge with a DC equal to the original DC minus 4. If this check fails, you also can try again as soon as the next [Encounter].

2nd Circle – Steel is My BodySU: Now you can not only copy a weapon, but also the owner’s fighting style. As part of a move action, or to complete a move action where the other part was using Forge, while wielding a weapon made with this Track, you may make a Forge check of DC 10 + the original wielder’s character level + the original wielder’s KOM + the difference between your BABs. On a success, until the end of the [Round] all attacks made with the weapon can be made as if with the modifiers to attack and damage of the original wielder.

Your access to fighting styles also allows you to emulate the abilities and techniques of the creature you copied from. As part of a move action, or to complete a move action where the other part was using Forge, while wielding a weapon made with this Track, you may make a Forge check of DC 10 + the original wielder’s character level + the original wielder’s KOM + the circle of target ability to copy any non-spell active ability you have seen used by, or know of through Knowledge checks, the original wielder of the weapon. This DC is increased by 2 for EX abilities, 4 for Spell-Like Abilities and 6 for Supernatural abilities. It is decreased by 2 if the ability requires an attack roll appropriate for the wielded weapon (so not if the weapon is Melee without the [Thrown] property and the ability requires a ranged attack roll). On a success, you may use that ability once before the end of your next turn. You still use your own statistics for any modifiers in the ability. If the check fails, you cannot attempt to copy the ability again until the next [Scene]. You may store abilities related to weapons in your Forge as well, with the same -4 to the DC, but the weapon they are tied to must also be in the Forge, and they use up the same slot as a Weapon.

Many abilities have limited uses per [Round], [Encounter] or [Scene]. You may not use a single ability more times in a time period than it could be by the original wielder. Otherwise, you can use abilities with limits as follows:

  • Twice/[Encounter]: Four times per [Encounter]
  • Once/[Encounter]: Twice per [Encounter]
  • >3 times/[Scene]: Four times per [Scene]
  • Twice/[Scene]: Three times per [Scene]
  • Once/[Scene]: Twice per [Scene]

3rd Circle – Fire is My BloodSU: You may immediately create a copy of an incoming weapon in an attempt to create the perfect parry. As an immediate action you may replace your AC against a weapon attack with the result of a Forge check, and if the attack misses you can continue to do so for every subsequent attack with that weapon until either one of the attacks hits (breaking your copy) or the end of the [Round]. If you are wielding a copy of that weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the Forge check as it is easier to simply reinforce the weapon for a parry than the create one, but the copy is destroyed if an attack you use this ability against hits.

4th Circle – Over a Thousand BladesSU: You now have enough mastery of the Forge to even improve weapons with spare mana. When you use Forge to copy a weapon, for every 2 points you exceed the DC by you can add a weapon property to the weapon or increase your attack bonus with the weapon by 1.

When you use Forge to copy an ability, for every 2 points you exceed the DC by you can increase your effective character level for calculating variables for the ability (such as damage dice per level or DC) by 1.

5th Circle – Unaware of LossSU: Once per [Encounter], you can summon a barrage of weapons from your Forge. For each weapon in your Forge, make an attack roll with it, using either your or the original wielder’s modifiers at your choice, against a creature in [Medium] range. These are still melee attacks if with Melee weapons and ranged attacks if with Ranged weapons, and the original range of the weapons doesn’t matter. The attacks deal damage as normal, but effects that trigger on a hit, such as from a critical hit, can only happen once.

6th Circle – Waiting for One’s ArrivalSU: When you copy an ability with Forge, if you exceeded the Forge check DC by 3 or more, you can use the original wielder of the weapon’s modifiers in place of your own.

7th Circle – This is the Only PathSU: You may now use Forge to replace your AC against an attack as a free action, and your bonus for wielding a copy of the weapon increases to +5.

5.40 Sanguimancy

The ancient discipline of Sanguimancy is often conflated with Blood Magic. This is only partly the case, while Blood Magic is a form of Sanguimancy, it is the most primitive and basic form – only involving manipulation of one’s own blood. In reality, Sanguimancy is magic which involves the manipulation of any blood, particularly that in the bodies of others. Sanguimancers can use their powers to draw blood from their victims, alter blood flow to debilitate them or heal allies, or even use the blood flowing through an enemy’s veins to move them against their will. Particularly advanced Sanguimancers can even use their power to implant false blood in creatures with none, such as Constructs and Elementals. The art of Sanguimancy is usually used by evil mages, particularly Vampires, but many Aquamancers are also adept in the discipline, using the water in blood as a vector for manipulation and often as a healing art.

When you choose this track pick a mental ability score (Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma) to be your SAM for this track. Save DCs for abilities in this track are 10 + ½ your level + your SAM. Abilities granted by this track are at-will standard actions unless stated otherwise. At the start of each [Scene], you select one ability from each circle you possess in this track to be the Sanguimancy spells you can use for that [Scene].

1st Circle – Thicker than Water: Select one of the following abilities. You can change your choice at the start of each [Scene]:

  • HaemophiliaSLA: When a creature in [Medium] range takes physical damage, as an immediate action you deal damage to that creature equal to half the damage taken, up to a maximum of your SAM or level, whichever is higher. For every odd numbered circle in this track beyond the first, you may use this spell an additional time as a free action, after casting it the first time, until the start of your next turn.
  • HaemophobiaSLA: When an ally in [Medium] range takes physical damage, as an immediate action you heal that creature for an amount equal to half the damage taken, up to a maximum of your SAM or level, whichever is higher. For every odd numbered circle in this track beyond the first, you may use this spell an additional time as a free action, after casting it the first time, until the start of your next turn.
  • HaemolocotSLA: When a creature in [Close] range takes physical damage, as an immediate action you may [Teleport] to an unoccupied space adjacent to that creature. When you gain your 4th circle in this track, this range increases to [Medium].

2nd Circle – Blood on the Dance Floor: Select one of the following abilities. You can change your choice at the start of each [Scene]:

  • ResanguinateSLA: Heal target ally in [Medium] range that has taken physical damage in the last [Round]. You heal HP equal to 1d6 per character level + your SAM.
  • Sanguine PuppetrySLA: Target creature in [Medium] range makes a single attack, melee or ranged, with their equipped weapon or one of their natural weapons of your choice against target creature within their [Melee] range (or their appropriate range for a ranged attack). An unwilling creature may make a Fortitude save to resist this effect.
  • ExsanguinateSLA: Deal damage to target creature in [Medium] range that has taken physical damage in the last [Round] equal to 1d6 per character level + your SAM and that creature starts [Bleeding]. A successful fortitude save halves the damage and prevents [Bleeding].

3rd Circle – Blood Begets Blood: Select one of the following abilities. You can change your choice at the start of each [Scene]:

  • Bleed ’em DrySU: Whenever an ally in [Close] range deals physical damage to a creature, they may cause that creature to start [Bleeding]. [Bleeding] creatures in [Close] range cannot remove the condition. This is a passive ability
  • Numbness of BeingSLA: Target creature in [Medium] range takes -4 to all d20 rolls until the end of your next turn. A successful Fortitude save reduces this penalty to -2.
  • Blood BoilSLA: All allies in [Close] range gain +10 to speed, +1 AC and a [Bonus attack] whenever they make an attack action until the end of the [Encounter]
  • Blood ClotSLA: All enemies in [Close] range are [Slowed] until the end of the [Encounter]. A Fortitude save negates this effect.

4th Circle – Skip a Heartbeat: Select one of the following abilities. You can change your choice at the start of each [Scene]:

  • BradycardiaSLA: Target creature in [Close] range is [Paralyzed] until the end of the [Encounter]. A Fortitude save negates this effect.
  • Greater ResanguinateSU: Whenever an ally in [Close] range takes physical damage they heal HP equal to half your level.
  • TachycardiaSLA: Target creature in [Close] range is [Confused] for three [Rounds]. A Fortitude save negates this effect.

5th Circle – Bloody Good Show: Select one of the following abilities. You can change your choice at the start of each [Scene]:

  • Greater Sanguine PuppetrySLA: You force target creature in [Medium] range to move up to its speed using any of its movement modes and you control which way it moves. This movement still provokes attacks of opportunity. An unwilling creature may make a Fortitude save to resist this effect.
  • Greater ExsanguinateSLA: Once per [Encounter] you may deal damage equal to seven times your level to target creature in [Medium] range which took physical damage in the last [Round]. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage and prevents the damage from reducing the target below 1 HP. This is a [Death] effect.
  • Myocardial InfarctionSLA: As an immediate action after seeing the result of the attack roll you may cause an attack made by a creature in [Close] range to miss. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.

6th Circle – Blood Moon Rising: Select one of the following abilities. You can change your choice at the start of each [Scene]:

  • Rush Of Blood to the HeadSLA: Target creature in [Medium] range is [Nauseated] for one [Round], a successful Fortitude save negates this effect.
  • Dance, Puppets, Dance!SLA: Target creature in [Medium] range makes an attack action using any of its natural weapons or equipped weapons and using melee and ranged attacks of your choice against target creature in its [Melee] range (or their appropriate range for a ranged attack). An unwilling creature may make a Fortitude save to resist this effect.

7th Circle – Total Eclipse of the HeartSLA: You select a creature in [Close] range, target creature is [Dazed] for one [Round].

5.41 Shocktrooper

Special: Orcs may switch one of their tracks for Shocktrooper without using their multiclass.

An Orc in battle is not a subtle creature. Shocktroopers in an Orc warband or army leverage their elevated strength in devastating charges and reckless attacks, leaving lacerating wounds that bleed freely. Orcs are most suited to this combat style, but members of other races who have witnessed a shocktrooper in combat are often convinced to adopt this brutal combat method.

1st Circle – Shock and AweEX: You gain the Reckless Strike feat, even if you do not meet the prerequisites. Also, when using the Charge manoeuvre, you do not take the -2 penalty to AC and ignore difficult terrain.

2nd Circle – Sturm und DrangEX: The first time each [Round] you hit an opponent with a melee attack while using the Power Attack manoeuvre, they start [Bleeding]. A Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Str modifier) negates this effect.

You deal additional damage against [Bleeding] creatures equal to the number of circles you have in this track multiplied by the number of [Rounds] they have been [Bleeding] continuously for.

3rd Circle – ChevaucheeEX: Each [Round] you use the Power Attack manoeuvre, choose one of the following two abilities:

  • Face Hunter: You gain a fury bonus to damage rolls on melee attacks this turn equal to your Str modifier.
  • Raging Bull: Once this [Round], when you hit an opponent with a melee attack, you may imme¬diately perform a Bull Rush against that opponent.

4th Circle – The Bugle SoundsEX: The first time each [Round] you hit an opponent with a melee attack while using the Power Attack manoeuvre with a penalty of at least 5, they are [Battered] for two [Rounds]. A Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Str modifier) halves this duration.

5th Circle – And the Charge BeginsEX: When you use the Charge combat manoeuvre on a turn you have used the Power Attack manoeuvre with a penalty of at least 3, you may make a full attack action at the end of the Charge. Only the first attack benefits from the +2 bonus to hit.

6th Circle – BlitzkriegEX: Sturm und Drang no longer allows a save to resist [Bleeding].

When you use Raging Bull, if that opponent is adjacent to an obstacle or occupied square and you are able to push them 5 ft or further, you may forgo the ability to push that opponent further to deal damage equal to your level against that opponent and any creatures in that square.

As part of the standard action to use the Charge combat manoeuvre, you may use Reckless Strike (instead of using a move action).

7th Circle – VernichtungsschlachtEX: The first time each [Round] you hit an opponent with a melee attack while using the Power Attack manoeuvre with a penalty of at least 10, they are [Dazed] for one [Round]. A Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Str modifier) negates this effect.

5.42 Sorcerer Spellcasting

You cast spells drawn from the sorcerer spell list, detailed in the Spells section. Your Charisma modifi¬er is your Spellcasting Ability Modifier (SAM) for this track. The DC for your spells is equal to 10 + ½ your character level + your Spellcasting Ability Modifier. You can only cast a certain number of spells of each spell level in a [Scene]. That num¬ber is noted on the “Spells per [Scene] by Circle” section of the table below. You also receive bonus spells per [Scene] for having a high Spellcasting Ability Modifier.

You can only cast spells that you know. You gain an additional three spells known every time you gain a circle in this track. Any time that you level up, you can unlearn a single spell and learn a new spell of the same level. You cannot learn spells of a level you cannot cast. You may use an available spell slot of a circle to cast any spell you know of that circle or lower.

Table 5.2: Sorcerer Spells
Level 1st Circle 2nd Circle 3rd Circle 4th Circle 5th Circle 6th Circle 7th Circle
1 2 – – – – – –
2 3 – – – – – –
3 3 2 – – – – –
4 4 3 – – – – –
5 4 3 – – – – –
6 5 4 2 – – – –
7 5 4 3 – – – –
8 5 5 3 – – – –
9 5 5 4 2 – – –
10 5 5 4 3 – – –
11 5 5 5 3 – – –
12 5 5 5 4 2 – –
13 5 5 5 4 3 – –
14 5 5 5 5 3 – –
15 5 5 5 5 4 2 –
16 5 5 5 5 4 3 –
17 5 5 5 5 5 3 –
18 5 5 5 5 5 4 2
19 5 5 5 5 5 4 3
20 5 5 5 5 5 5 3

5.43 Spatiomancy

The 44th Order are known to adventurers far and wide after the recent resurgence of Chronomancy across the Prime Material Plane. But lesser known is that this reappearence has also led to their rival discipline once again emerging. The Spatiomancers manipulate the three dimensions of movement, warping space to allow attacks from strange angles and making it harder to approach them.

1st Circle – Acceleration GateSLA: As a move action, remove any Acceleration Gate spreads you have created and create an Accleration Gate spread originating in [Close] range which is a 5 ft wide, 10 ft long line. Any creature which enters the spread or starts their turn in it gains a 10 ft bonus to their speed for each circle you have in Spatiomancy for one Round. Any ranged attack where line of effect is established through the spread gains +30 ft of range and +1d6 damage for each circle you have in Spatiomancy.

2nd Circle – Disruption FieldSLA: As a move action, create a 10 ft radius spread centred on you which moves with you which lasts until the end of the [Encounter]. At the end of your turn, all creatures in the spread take 1d6 physical damage per circle you have in Spatiomancy.

3rd Circle – Spatial FoldingSLA: As a move action, choose two spaces in [Medium] range. They count as adjacent for all purposes until the end of the [Encounter]. Any attack or ability establishing line of effect through both spaces has a 50% chance of failing due to the destablising nature of spatial folding.

4th Circle – Space!: You gain the following two abilities:

  • Atomic DecouplingSU: You can freely move through other creatures, and any obstacles or objects for up to 15 ft (but you cannot end your movement in either).
  • Defraction GateSU: When a creature establishes line of sight or line of effect through an Acceleration Gate spread you have created, they may have the line bend 45 degrees at any point (as long as it still goes through the spread)

5th Circle – Gravity WellSLA: As a move action, choose a space in [Medium] range. All creatures within your [Close] range of that space move towards it until they are adjacent to it or they hit an obstacle. A Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

6th Circle – The Final FrontierSU: Creatures who enter or start turn in your Acceleration Field spread gain an additional swift action and a [Bonus attack] in that [Round]. Creatures dealt damage by your Disruption Field are [Slowed] for one [Round]. When you use Spatial Fold, you may choose three spaces. Creatures affected by Gravity Well take 1d4 damage for every 10 ft they are moved.

7th Circle – Spatial RendSLA: As a move action, target an unoccupied line which is up to 30 ft long and 10 ft wide. Destroy all mundane objects in that space, and the space itself (the remaining area joins together as best it can to fill in the gap). Any creature within 15 ft of the destroyed area takes 25 damage.

5.44 [Stand] Power

Found throughout the world are a set of artefacts known as the [Stand] Arrows. Anyone pierced by one of these arrows, or related by blood to one of those pierced, gains the ability to manifest their fighting spirit as a separate entity - usually with some esoteric name. These [Stands] fight in hand to hand combat, but display a huge variety of specific magical abilities depending on their host. What they all have in common is that the strength of their manifestation is based on their user’s willpower and physical fortitude.

1st Circle – Battle TendencySLA: As a standard action, you may make a Will save, with an additional bonus equal to the highest of your Str and Con modifiers, to manifest your [Stand] (shouting its name is optional but encouraged). Your [Stand] appears in a space adjacent to you, with properties determined by your Will save result (on a result below 15 you fail to manifest your [Stand]):

  • Range: This is the maximum range away from you that your [Stand] may move. If it is forced to move outside of that range, it dematerialises.
  • Duration: This is how long the [Stand] remains manifested. 1 [Round] means it will last until the end of your next turn, 2 [Rounds] means it will last until the end of the turn after, etc.
  • Item Bonus: The [Stand] gains that amount as an Item bonus to attack rolls and AC
  • Additional Abilities: The [Stand] gains all additional abilities listed.
Table 5.3: Stand Properties
Will Save Result Range Duration Item Bonus Additional Ability 1 Additional Ability 2 Additional Ability 3 Additional Ability 4
15 Melee End of [Round] 0 – – – –
18 Melee End of [Round] 1 – – – –
20 Close End of [Round] 1 – – – –
23 Close End of [Round] 1 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] – – –
25 Close End of [Round] 2 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] – – –
28 Close 1 [Round] 2 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] – –
30 Medium 1 [Round] 2 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] – –
33 Medium 1 [Round] 3 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] – –
35 Medium 1 [Round] 3 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] [Immunity] to [Dazed], [Stunned], [Bleeding], [Burning], [Exhausted] and [Fatigued] –
38 Long 1 [Round] 3 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] [Immunity] to [Dazed], [Stunned], [Bleeding], [Burning], [Exhausted] and [Fatigued] –
40 Long 2 [Rounds] 4 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] [Immunity] to [Dazed], [Stunned], [Bleeding], [Burning], [Exhausted] and [Fatigued] –
43 Long 2 [Rounds] 4 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] [Immunity] to [Dazed], [Stunned], [Bleeding], [Burning], [Exhausted] and [Fatigued] [Invisible] to all creatures without the [Stand] Power track
45 Long 2 [Rounds] 5 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] [Immunity] to [Dazed], [Stunned], [Bleeding], [Burning], [Exhausted] and [Fatigued] [Invisible] to all creatures without the [Stand] Power track
48 Extreme 2 [Rounds] 5 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] [Immunity] to [Dazed], [Stunned], [Bleeding], [Burning], [Exhausted] and [Fatigued] [Invisible] to all creatures without the [Stand] Power track
50 Extreme 2 [Rounds] 5 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] [Immunity] to [Dazed], [Stunned], [Bleeding], [Burning], [Exhausted] and [Fatigued] [Invisible] to all creatures without the [Stand] Power track
53 Extreme 3 [Rounds] 6 [Resistance] to Energy and [Immunity] to [Fear] 20% [Miss Chance] [Immunity] to [Dazed], [Stunned], [Bleeding], [Burning], [Exhausted] and [Fatigued] [Invisible] to all creatures without the [Stand] Power track

While your [Stand] is manifested, you lose all abilities from your other Tracks and your Feats, cannot make attacks of opportunity, and are [Vulnerable] to all damage.

Your [Stand] has statistics equal to yours and has all abilities from your Tracks and Feats. But it cannot use Skills and is neither equipped with nor attuned to any of your items. Its only weapon is an unarmed strike which counts as having [Brutal] three times as its weapon properties. Your [Stand] shares your hit points, and when either of you take damage or are healed, that affects the same hit point total (if you are both simultaneously damaged or healed by the same effect, you only take the damage or healing once). However, your [Stand] otherwise counts as a separate creature for the purpose of being affected by spells, conditions and the like (if you are both simultaneously affected by an effect which grants a beneficial effect or negative condition, you are both affected and make saving throws separately).

When you move while your [Stand] is adjacent to you, your [Stand] moves with you (any attacks of opportunity you provoke while moving may target either of you). At the end of your turn, your [Stand] takes a full turn under your control.

2nd Circle – Star PlatinumEX: As a standard action while your [Stand] is manifested, you may command it to use a Stand Rush on its turn. On its turn, it will use its standard action (it may move and use a swift action beforehand) to make an attack action as a Stand Rush. For each hit in that attack action, it makes an additional attack at an attack bonus 5 less than the attack which hit (i.e. after the first hit it makes an additional attack at its iterative attack bonus, then an attack with -5 compared to the iterative bonus if that hits, etc.).

3rd Circle – Crazy DiamondSLA: The first time each [Round] that your [Stand] hits with an attack it may dispel one effect on its target that the target gained since the start of its last turn.

4th Circle – Golden ExperienceSLA: As a standard action, your [Stand] may heal an ally in its [Melee] range for an amount equal to the result of your will save to manifest it minus 10.

5th Circle – Stone FreeEX: Any creature hit by one of your [Stand]’s attacks, or moving through a space that your [Stand] moved through during its current manifestation, is [Revealed] for two [Rounds] and loses all [Miss chance].

6th Circle – November RainEX: Your [Stand] may make its melee attacks as a [Volley] against all opponents in its and your [Melee] ranges.

7th Circle – The WorldSLA: As a standard action, your [Stand] may attempt to slow down time. Roll a d12 and take additional actions based on the result:

  • 10-12: It may make an additional move and swift action.
  • 7-9: It may make a standard action, which may not be The World.
  • 5-6: It may make a standard, and move action. It cannot use The World again during this manifestation.
  • 2-4: It may make a standard, move, swift, and a move or a swift action. It cannot use The World again during this manifestation.
  • 1: It may take two standard, two move, and two swift actions. It cannot use The World again during this [Encounter].

5.45 Summoning

Specialists in the Calling subschool of Conjuration are more well known as Summoners. They can reach through the Astral Plane to call beings from the Outer Planes, the Inner Planes, and even things from elsewhere on the Material with enough power investment. All Summoners specialise in a certain type of Calling, their specialism is known as their Eidolon, and they preferentially call creatures of that type, and can even merge their Eidolon with their own essence to grant themselves that power.

When you acquire the Summoner track, choose another one of your Tracks, this is your Eidolon track. At the start of each [Scene], you may choose to merge your Eidolon powers into yourself, allowing you to use and benefit from that Track’s abilities for the [Scene], or to use it for Summoning, in which case you cannot use or benefit from abilities in that track, but it instead gives benefits to your Summoning.

1st Circle – Welcome to Summoner’s RiftSLA: As a full round action, you may call a Summon onto an unoccupied space within [Close] range. The Summon takes the form of a Mook of level equal to yours with the Scout, Grunt, Striker or Turret Archetype; however, it has HP equal to the total of your KDM and the number of circles you have in Summoner multiplied by your level+1, rather than the normal HP for that type of Mook. All damage done by your Summons is halved, after adding other bonuses but before taking off [Damage reduction] or [Resistance]. All healing given by your Summons is likely halved after any modifiers. It has a creature type and appearance of your choice (within reason) and is your choice of [Large], [Average] or [Small]. The Summon acts on initiative count 0 (at the end of the [Round]), and you can direct its actions. You can have a number of Summons active at a time equal to the number of circles you have in Summoner. Whenever one of your Summons dies, you take psychic backlash in the form of [HP reduction] equal to twice your level. All active Summons disappear at the end of the [Encounter].

2nd Circle – Special SummonSLA: You build up a Repertoire of abilities and powers which you can call Summons with. A number of times per [Quest] equal to your KDM, you may attempt to learn any ability (passive or active) of a circle equal to or lower than your highest circle in the Summoner track, this requires an hour of effort and a successful Arcana check of DC 20 + your level + the twice circle of the ability being learned. You can decrease this DC by 1 for each creature you have seen using this ability (or having it if it is passive), up to a maximum of 10. If you fail to learn an ability, you cannot try again for that ability until the next [Quest]. Abilities in your Eidolon track, if you are using it to benefit your Summoning, are always part of your Repertoire.

When you call a Summon, you may give it one ability from your Repertoire. When you gain your 4th circle in Summoner, you may instead grant it three abilities, and five at 6th circle. Any abilities with limited uses per [Encounter] or per [Scene] have those uses shared between all of your Summons. If you are using your Eidolon track to benefit your Summoning, you may grant a Summon an additional ability from that track for each ability you can add normally.

3rd Circle – Ritual SummonSLA: When you call a Summon, you may sacrifice any number of your active Summons (this does not cause you [HP reduction], unlike a normal death). When you do, the new Summon gains additional HP equal to your KDM plus the number of circles you have in Summoning, and +3 to attack and damage rolls for each sacrificed Summon.

4th Circle – Summon of their PartsSLA: Your Summons can now have the Minion Archetype.

5th Circle – Got Friends on the Other SideSLA: Three times per [Scene] you may call a Swarm. The Swarm counts as two of your possible active Summons. The Swarm acts as a Myriad of level equal to yours, with you choosing whether it uses Scout or Grunt statistics, but it has half the normal HP.

6th Circle – Pendulum SummonSLA: At the start of every [Round], roll a d4. If your result is the same as the result you had on the last [Round], you may summon that many additional Summons when you call a Summon this [Round].

7th Circle – Synchro SummonSLA: Your Summons now combine the benefits of Scout, Grunt, Turret and Striker Archetypes, have the higher speed of the Archetypes, and can use any attacks granted by the Archetypes.

5.46 Swarmkeeper

Special: Druids, Fey and creatures with the Cyberspace Mastermind track can multiclass freely into Swarmkeeper.

You have a swarm of creatures which is at your command. Maybe an army of spiders or beetles crawls over your skin, or an array of pixies flies around you, or you have an array of nanobot drones ready to engage. In any case, your swarm can enhance your own capabilities, and can act independently in some ways to help you out.

1st Circle – Gather the SwarmEX: Once per [Encounter], as a move action, you can agitate your swarm for a number of [Rounds] equal to your Wis modifier. While agitated, the swarm enhances your attacks, causing them to deal an additional 1d6 + your KOM damage. When you reach 10th level, this increases to an additional 2d6 + your KOM.

When you hit a creature with an attack while your swarm is agitated, you may push it 5 ft towards or away from you (this movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity).

2nd Circle – Scuttling EyesEX: You can enhance one of your swarm and send it out as a scout. You may cast prying eyes at will, but you only create one instead of 1d4. You can have a number of instances active of the spell at a time equal to the number of circles you have in Swarmkeeper.

3rd Circle – Writhing RideEX: When you agitate your swarm, you gain a +10 bonus to movement speed and the Fly movement mode as you are carried along by the Swarm.

4th Circle – Zerg RushEX: Once per [Scene], you can empower your Swarm with a ten minute ritual. This causes the Swarm to become a Myriad of level equal to yours for up to one hour. In combat, the Myriad acts on your initiative order, and is under your control. Enough of the swarm stays behind on your body that you can still use your other Swarmkeeper abilities.

When you reach your 6th circle in Swarmkeeper you can use this ability twice per [Scene], and thrice per [Scene] at 7th circle.

5th Circle – Heart of the SwarmEX: While moving, you discorporate into and become one with the swarm, so you do not provoke attacks of opportunity. With a standard action once per [Encounter] you can empower one of your swarm to grow to [Small] size and become a Mook of one of the four basic types of your choice that acts under your control on your initiative for a number of [Rounds] equal to your Wis modifier.

6th Circle – Storm of MinionsEX: As a standard action you can send your swarm out to attack an area of radius 30 ft centred within your [Medium] range. All creatures in the area take damage equal to 1d10 per half your character level + your Wis modifier. You heal equal to the result of this roll (not the total damage done).

7th Circle – Ten PlaguesEX: When you use your 4th circle ability, creatures damaged by your swarm also gain one stack of the Swarm’s Poison, which lasts for one [Round], but the timing is reset if they gain another stack, this has effects as follows:

  • 1 Stack: Take 1d4 damage at the start of your turn for each stack of the Swarm’s Poison you have
  • 2 Stacks: [Sickened]
  • 4 Stacks: [Battered]
  • 6 Stacks: The damage you take from the poison becomes [HP reduction]
  • 8 Stacks: [Helpless]
  • 10 Stacks: Causes instant death

5.47 Tinker

Gnomes are, as a race, wholly unsuited for combat. They’re small enough to be pushed around by most other species, too weak to make an effective offence, and lack any of the Halfling nimbleness or Dwarf stoutness to make up for their size. What Gnomes can do, though, is tinker and invent, making them perfect as backline support in battle, deploying a variety of mechanical and magical contraptions to help themselves and their allies in battle, and even building new ones outside of combat. Tinkers aren’t unique to Gnomes, Artificers of many races also use similar contraptions, but only Gnomes are so well represented in the Tinker community.

Special: Gnomes may switch one of their tracks for Tinker without using their multiclass.

1st Circle – Nuts and BoltsEX: You can use materials you find to build a variety of useful Contraptions. These materials are represented by Scrap Points. You gain 4 Scrap Points per [Scene], though you may gain or lose some at the GM’s discretion at times you have more or less materials than usual.

You may choose three Lesser Contraptions to be able to build. You may spend 1 Scrap Point and ten minutes to build any Lesser Contraption you know how to build.

Any Contraption, once built, can be used as a free action by any creature holding it on their turn. Once used, a Contraption disintegrates, breaks down, or is otherwise rendered utterly unusable and irreparable.

2nd Circle – Eureka!EX: You now gain 6 Scrap Points per [Scene] and you may choose three further Lesser Contraptions to learn.

Once per [Quest], you may develop a new Contraption. This may be any Contraption from the list of level you can build, or one of your own design (pending approval by the GM) of level you can build. This is added to your list of known Contraptions.

3rd Circle – Science Marches OnEX: You now gain 10 Scrap Points per [Scene] and you may choose three Greater Contraptions to learn. Greater Contraptions cost 3 Scrap Points to build.

4th Circle – Experimental PurposesEX: You now gain 13 Scrap Points per [Scene] and you may choose three Greater or Lesser Contraptions to learn.

Once per [Quest], you may create a new Lesser magic item, this can be either an existing Lesser magic item or one of your own design (pending approval by the GM). Each character may wield and use the effect of one Lesser item created by a Tinker (though only one, no matter how many Tinker allies they have) without using an attunement slot, though they may attune to more normally.

5th Circle – Latest DevelopmentsEX: You now gain 18 Scrap Points per [Scene] and you may choose two Relic Contraptions to learn. Relic Contraptions cost 5 Scrap Points to build.

6th Circle – HE BUILT IT, IN A CAVEEX: You now gain 21 Scrap Points per [Scene] and you may choose two Relic, Greater or Lesser Contraptions to learn.

Once per [Quest], you may create a new Greater magic item, this can be either an existing Greater magic item or one of your own design (pending approval by the GM). Each character may wield and use the effect of one Greater item created by a Tinker (though only one, no matter how many Tinker allies they have) without using an attunement slot, though they may attune to more normally.

7th Circle – WITH A BOX OF SCRAPS!EX: You now gain 24 Scrap Points per [Scene]. You may spend 7 Scrap Points to create the Perfect Defibrillator Contraption.

  • Perfect Defibrillator: Return target [Dead] creature in [Melee] range to life at half HP. This only works on creatures that died since your last turn.

5.47.1 Contraptions

5.47.1.1 Lesser

  • Acid Belcher: You deal energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor equal to twice the total of your level + KOM to all creatures in a radius equal to your [Close] range with centre within [Medium] range.
  • Ballista: You create a Ballista which takes up a 5 ft space. A creature in [Melee] range of the Ballista may destroy it as a standard action unless creature in [Melee] range of the Ballista uses their immediate action to prevent this. As a move action while adjacent to the Ballista, any creature can move themselves and the Ballista up to 20 ft. While adjacent to the Ballista a creature can make ranged attacks with it as if it is a [Long] range weapon with [Brutal], [Brutal] and [Magnum]. This deals triple damage to inanimate objects. This lasts until the end of the [Scene] before it falls apart from wear and tear.
  • Discharge Generator: You deal energy damage with the [Electric] descriptor equal to twice the total of your level + KOM to all non-you creatures in your [Close] range.
  • Flamethrower: You deal energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to twice the total of your level + KOM to all creatures in a wedge out to [Close] range.
  • Foam Generator: You may create a 10 ft radius spread orig¬inating from target square within [Close] range, which lasts for four [Rounds]. An opponent that begins its turn in or enters a square in the spread becomes [Checked] in all directions. Such an op¬ponent may spend a move action to remove the [Checked] condition and ignore the effects of this Contraption for one [Round].
  • Forcefield Generator: You gain temporary HP equal to twice the total of your level and KDM.
  • Focusing Crystal: You may use this Contraption as part of casting a spell, spell-like or supernatural ability to increase the DCs of all saves involved in it by 3.
  • Healing Salve: You heal an ally within [Melee] range for an amount of HP equal to 7 + 7 times their level.
  • Icicle Shooter: You deal energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to twice the total of your level + KOM to all creatures in a 5 ft wide line out to [Medium] range.
  • Neon Sign: Choose an ally within [Close] range. For the duration of the [Encounter], enemies in that ally’s [Melee] range must target them if able with Melee attacks (unless affected by other similar abilities such as Valiant Challenge).
  • Ornithopter: You may send the small copter to a target square within [Medium] range, gaining line of sight from it in addition to your own for the remainder of the [Encounter].
  • Personal Warper: All your movement gains the [Teleport] until the end of the [Encounter], choosing a target square within range of your movement whenever you would move
  • Relocator: You may cause target opponent within your [Medium] range to lose the [Flying], [Burrowing], [Swimming], or [Soaring] condition if it possesses any of those conditions and [Teleport] 45 ft away from their current space to target square. Target square must be solid ground.
  • Repulsors: Until the end of the [Encounter], as a move action you may cause one creature in [Close] range to be [Blown Away] in a direction away from you.
  • Rotarothopter: You create a small copter in a square adjacent to yours. You may move it once on your turn as a free action, and it moves with a speed of 15 ft with the Fly movement mode. You may establish line of sight form the copter’s square. Any creature in [Melee] range of the copter can destroy it as a standard action, otherwise it is destroyed at the end of the [Scene].
  • Universal Translator: You may speak and understand all languages until the end of the [Scene].

5.47.1.2 Greater

  • Ally Monitor: You create a tracking code of each ally in [Close] range. Until the end of the [Scene], you know the distance and direction of each tracked ally, what conditions they are suffering, and whether they are at maximum HP.
  • Artificial Gills: You gain the Swim movement mode for the duration of the [Scene]
  • Detector Suite: You gain [Tremorsense] and [Ghostwise Sight] out to your [Close] range for the duration of the [Encounter].
  • Drill Attachment: You gain the Burrow movement mode for the duration of the [Scene].
  • Excavator: Create a 5 ft radius spread within [Close] range. All creatures gain [Burrowing] while in that spread, and can move the spread and all inside it 5 ft in any direction as a move action. This lasts until the end of the [Scene] before it falls apart from wear and tear.
  • Gravity Generator: You may create a 10 ft radius spread centred within your [Medium] range until the end of the [Encounter]. All [Flying] creatures in the spread or who enter the spread lose [Flying] and the Fly movement mode for the rest of the [Encounter], though the fall is slow so no fall damage is taken, and they may move up to half their speed on to solid ground.
  • Greater Forcefield Generator: You may create a wall of force within [Medium] range. This wall consists of a number of 5 ft spaces equal to your character level, with each sec¬tion adjacent to another section. Each section of the wall is an obstacle and has 50 HP. Each sec¬tion may be treated as a creature for the purpos¬es of targeting with attacks and effects that deal damage and for the purposes of area effects that deal damage. Each section cannot make saving throws and is hit by any attacks targeting it. If an effect would damage a section on the section’s turn, it is damaged on your turn. Once a wall sec¬tion reaches 0 or fewer hit points, it is destroyed. The wall may not be placed in such a way that it occupies the same space as a creature, mount, or another object. The wall dissipates at the end of the [Encounter].
  • Hardlight Armour: You gain [Damage reduction] equal to your KDM for the duration of the [Scene]
  • Healbot: You may place a Healbot in an unoccupied space within [Close] range. At the end of each of your turns, the Healbot heals one ally within your [Close] range of it for 5 HP per level and removes up to two of the following conditions [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Nauseated], [Paralyzed], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], or [Stunned] and may then move up to 10 ft. A creature in [Melee] range of the Healbot may destroy it as a standard action, and the Healbot is otherwise destroyed at the end of the [Encounter].
  • Keypad Lock: Create a Keypad on any wall which is linked to a door within [Long] range of it. The door is locked (against up to a DC 30 Larceny check), but can be opened if the correct code is entered in the Keypad. You can set the code freely, and it requires a DC 25 Perception or Larceny check to decipher the code one examination of the Keypad. This lasts up to one [Quest] before it stops working.
  • Snowchugger: You may create a Snowchugger in any space in your [Melee] range, which then moves up to 60 ft on any path, and may move through occupied spaces. It is then destroyed and a spread is created covering each space it moved over, and any space adjacent to one of those. Any non-you creature in the spread is [Slowed] until the end of the [Encounter].
  • Warp Generator: You may place a Warp Gate in any space adjacent to you, and until the end of the [Scene] you may place a second Warp Gate. Creatures standing in a Warp gate’s space may immediately [Warp] to the other one placed by this Contraption use. A Warp Gate has 30 HP, cannot make saving throws and is hit by any attacks targeting it, and is destroyed if it reaches 0 or fewer HP.

5.47.1.3 Relic

  • Analysis Suite: You gain complete knowledge of the statistics and abilities of all enemies in a wedge out to [Close] range.
  • Cloaking Device: You gain [Invisibility] until the end of the [Scene], you may suppress or reactivate this as a free action.
  • Double Team: All allies in [Close] range gain 50% [Miss chance] for two [Rounds].
  • Greater Detector Suite: You gain the effects of the true seeing spell for the duration of the [Encounter]
  • Magic Disruptor: You may create a 20 ft radius spread within [Medium] range which lasts for two [Rounds], all effects created by spells or spell-like abilities in the radius are immediately ended and all spells and spell-like abilities in the radius are cancelled and spaces within the spread are exempted from the area of effect of any spell or spell like ability. A creature may use a standard action to destroy the disruptor if they are in the spread, but then all creatures in the spread take energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to four times your level.
  • Mortar: You create a Mortar which takes up a 5 ft space. A creature in [Melee] range of the Mortar may destroy it as a standard action unless creature in [Melee] range of the Mortar uses their immediate action to prevent this. A creature adjacent to the Mortar can, as a standard action, designate a 30 ft radius spread within [Extreme] range. Two [Rounds] later, all creatures in that spread take damage equal to seven times your level plus your TAM. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your TAM) halves this damage.
  • Personnel Warper: You may use teleport, as the spell.

5.48 Unstable

Sometimes, a creature or construct’s power source is greater than the bounds of its own body, and energy visibly leaks out through the cracks and seams. This could be because they are a Warforged using an experimental new power source, a Fire Elemental who has become infused with chaotic magic, or even a common thug whose strength has been enhanced by a hex more powerful than they can contain. In any case, with this great power comes great risk - but much of that risk is also borne by their enemies.

1st Circle – Breaching ContainmentEX: You start each [Encounter] with 2 points of Fuel. You gain a fury bonus to damage rolls equal to twice the number of odd numbered circles you have in Unstable per point of Fuel you have, and 1 [Damage reduction] per odd numbered circle you have in Unstable per point of Fuel you have.

At the start of your turn, make a Fortitude save with DC equal to 12 + 1/2 your level + 3 per instance of damage you have taken since the end of your last turn. If you fail the save, you lose one Fuel point, and then you and one opponent in [Close] range take energy damage with a descriptor of your choice (you choose it when you gain the Track and cannot change it) equal to 2d4 times your level plus your Con modifier. The opponent can make a Fortitude save, with the same DC as the one you made, to half the damage. You may not voluntarily fail this save.

2nd Circle – Exothermic ReactionEX: You now start each [Encounter] with 3 points of Fuel. You gain +5 speed for each point of Fuel you have, with an additional +5 if you have the same amount of Fuel that you started the [Encounter] with.

3rd Circle – RefuelEX: As a standard and partial move action, you may regain Fuel points until you have the same amount with which you started the [Encounter], and do not need to make a Fortitude save at the start of your next turn.

Once per [Round], as an immediate action, you may spend 1 point of Fuel to allow an ally in [Close] range to reroll a d20. If they do, they take energy damage (with the same descriptor as the damage from Breaching Containment) equal to twice your Con modifier.

4th Circle – Full TankEX: You now start each [Encounter] with 4 points of Fuel. Any opponent who fails the save against damage from Breaching Containment is [Slowed] for one [Round].

5th Circle – Burning RubberEX: You may take an additional swift or immediate action per [Round] for each 2 points of Fuel you have.

6th Circle – War Never ChangesEX: Whenever you trigger the damage from Breaching Containment, note what the Fortitude save DC was and leave a 10 ft radius Fallout spread centred on your current position which lasts until the end of the [Scene]. The first time each [Round] a creature which isn’t you starts its turn inside or moves into a Fallout spread, they take damage equal to that inflicted by Breaching Containment, making a Fortitude save to half damage as normal against the current DC. Fallout spread do not inflict [Slowed].

7th Circle – Maximum OverdriveEX: As a move action, if you have the same amount of Fuel that you start an [Encounter] with, but this is at least your third turn in the [Encounter], spend all of your Fuel. You may immediately move up to 200 ft without provoking attacks of opportunity and make a single attack against any creature you move within your [Melee] range of during this movement. Those attacks deal 50 additional fury damage.

5.49 Warcry

It’s not really Bardic magic. Well, it actually is, but there’s no technique behind it. It’s just that shouting really loud and with a lot of willpower behind it just does improve morale and empower one’s allies - especially if you’re already very cool and strong.

1st Circle – Cry Havoc!EX: As a swift action on a turn where you have already made an offensive action, you may let out a warcry. This affects all allies except you within 10 ft of you per circle you have in Warcry. This does not require line of sight, but does require line of effect and for the affected allies to not be [Deafened]. You cannot use the same warcry multiple times in a [Round].

When you warcry, choose one of the following effects:

  • Empowering Cry: Roll a d4. Affected allies count as that many levels higher for all level-dependent variables of abilities they use on their next turn (including save DCs).
  • Willful Cry: The next time each ally affected by the cry is targeted for an attack, they may replace their AC against that attack with the result of a Will save. If that attack misses, they can do so again for the next attack, but only within the same attack action.
  • Invigorating Cry: Affected allies gain temporary hit points equal to your level, up to a maximum of your KOM.

2nd Circle – Victory CryEX: You can warcry with the following two different effects:

  • Mighty Cry: The first affected ally to hit with an attack in the next [Round] deals additional damage on all attacks that [Round] equal to 1d4 per circle you have in Warcry.
  • Cowing Cry: Instead of allies, this affects all opponents in the area of effect. They are [Shaken] for one [Round]. A Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) negates this effect.

When you let out a warcry on a turn you have killed a creature, its effects are increased:

  • Empowering Cry: Instead roll 1d6+1.
  • Willful Cry: Allies can choose to make a Will or Reflex save for this ability.
  • Invigorating Cry: Allies gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your KOM, which stacks with previous instances of Empowering Cry.
  • Mighty Cry: The damage bonus is instead 1d8 per circle.
  • Cowing Cry: Affected opponents are also [Fatigued] and can’t make attacks of opportunity.

3rd Circle – Let Slip the DogsEX: Allies affected by your warcries may make two 5 ft steps towards any opponent. Opponents affected by Cowing Cry must immediately make two 5 ft steps away from you.

4th Circle – Quelling CryEX: All opponents in the area of effect of your warcries take a penalty to damage rolls equal to the number of circles you have in Warcry for one [Round]. This is doubled on a turn when you have killed a creature.

5th Circle – Roar of the VictorEX: On a turn where you have killed a creature, as a warcry you may deal damage equal to four times your level and inflict [Frightened] for one [Round] to all opponents in a 45 ft wedge originating from you. Affected creatures may make a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) to half the damage and negate Frightened.

6th Circle – Strike Them in AweEX: All opponents in the area of effect of your warcries are [Flat-footed].

7th Circle – Anthem of WarEX: You may let out two warcries with a single swift action.

5.50 Warden

Warden is the title given to Killoren who have proficiency in wielding the power of the Aspects which flow through the lifeforce of nature. They can use the Aspect of the Ancient to use their allies’ knowledge to augment their own, the Aspect of the Hunter to enhance their senses, and some skilled Wardens can even channel the Aspect of the Avenger to castigate their foes. Most importantly, they can channel the pure Life energy of the Summer Fey to heal their allies.

Special: A Killoren can switch one of their tracks for Warden without using their multiclass.

1st Circle – The High LifeSU: As a move action, you may heal an ally in your [Melee] range an amount of HP equal to 1d6 per your character level plus your Wis modifier.

2nd Circle – Ancient StirringsEX: You may use your Wis modifier instead of Int as a bonus to Knowledge skill checks, and gain a further +1 for each ally in [Medium] range who has that skill trained, these bonuses stack up to the number of circles you have in Warden.

3rd Circle – Hunter’s InstinctsEX: You gain [Tremorsense] out to [Close] range, [Blindsight] out to [Melee] range and [Immunity] to [Figment] effects.

4th Circle – The Wyld HuntSU: Your [Blindsight] extends out to [Close] range. When you heal an ally with your ability from 1st circle you can remove up to two of the following conditions: [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Nauseated], [Paralyzed], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], or [Stunned].

5th Circle – Nature RisesSU: As a move action, you may cause a target opponent in your [Medium] range to become [Entangled] and lose access to the Fly and Burrow movement modes until the end of the [Encounter], a successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Wis modifier) reduces this duration to one [Round].

6th Circle – Protect the WildEX: If an ally has done damage to an enemy in [Medium] range that the enemy has [Vulnerability] to on their last turn, as a move action you may cause that enemy to gain [Vulnerability] to all damage for one [Round]. A successful Will save (DC=10 + 1/2 your level + your Wis modifier) negates this effect.

7th Circle – Life as We Know ItSU: You can use your move action to heal yourself even when you are otherwise unable to act. Also, when you heal with your 1st circle ability you can now remove up to three of the following conditions: [Battered], [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Dazed], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Energy drained], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Frightened ], [Nauseated], [Paralyzed], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], or [Stunned].

5.51 Witch

The magic of Hags is focused on curses, but also on esoteric spells like potion making and enchanting household objects. While this hex magic comes naturally to Hags, it is actually quite easy for humanoids to emulate with the right apparatus and some amount of malicious willpower.

1st Circle – Toil and TroubleSLA: As a standard action, target creature in [Medium] range takes damage equal to your KOM and is [Energy drained] once. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the damage and reduces the [Energy drained] duration to one [Round].

2nd Circle – Cauldron BubbleEX: Once per [Scene], you may create a number of potions equal to twice the number of circles you have in this track, with 30 minutes of effort per potion. To make a potion, spend a spell slot and choose a spell of that circle with a target of one character, or a use of an ability with limited uses per [Scene] or [Quest] with a target of one character. The potion, when consumed, has the effect of the chosen ability. A potion can be consumed as a swift action, and transferred to another character in [Melee] range as part of a move action.

You also gain the Witch’s Hex ability:

  • Witch’s HexSLA: As a standard action, make a melee attack roll which ignores item bonuses to AC against an opponent in [Melee] range. If it hits the target must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or become [Cursed] for 1d4-1 [Rounds]. A [Cursed] creature has a 50% chance to be [Dazed] each turn.

3rd Circle – Flying BroomstickSU: You gain the Fly movement mode, or your movement speed increases by 10 ft if you already have the Fly movement mode.

4th Circle – She Turned Me Into a Newt!SLA: Toil and Trouble now deals damage equal to twice your KOM and inflicts [Energy Drained] twice. Once per [Encounter], you may cause a creature that fails its save against Toil and Trouble to be affected as by the baleful polymorph spell (the save DC at end of turn is the same as for Toil and Trouble).

5th Circle – The Charm is Firm and GoodSLA: Three times per [Scene], grant a single ally one of the following wards until the end of the [Scene], each ward can only be chosen once in a [Scene]:

  • [Resistance] to physical damage
  • [Resistance] to magic and energy damage
  • +4 to all saves
  • Repelling ward, as the spell

6th Circle – Charm of Powerful TroubleSLA: Toil and Trouble inflicts [Energy Drained] three times. Once per [Encounter], you may cause a creature that fails its save against Toil and Trouble to be [Stunned] for one [Round], [Battered] for the [Encounter] and start [Bleeding] and [Burning].

7th Circle – Something Wicked This Way ComesSLA: Once per [Encounter], as a move action, you may cause all opponents in [Close] range to become [Cowering] for two [Rounds].

6 Feats

6.0.1 Absolute Chaos [Iconic]

The best part about Anarchomancy is that even you don’t really know what it’ll do. This just widens the possibilities even more
Prerequisite: Chaos Mage track
Benefit: At the start of each [Scene], you may swap out the spell you gain from any circle of Chaos Mage with any of the spells below of the appropriate circle, they are all Spell-Like Abilities:
2nd Circle – Chaos Necromancy, target an opponent in [Close] range and roll a d4

  • 1: You drain life from the creature, they are [Energy drained] twice and you gain a +2 bonus to all d20 rolls for two [Rounds].
  • 2: You infuse your target with negative energy and drain some into yourself. The target takes 1d8 energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor per your level and you gain hit points equal to half the damage dealt.
  • 3: You necroticise the target’s wounds, they are [Battered] and [Exhausted] for one [Round].
  • 4: You mix up your energy types, and the target gains 3d4 hit points.

2nd Circle – Chaos Dreamsong, target an ally in [Close] range and roll a d4

  • 1: The ally is protected and healed by a spirit of the chaotic Metalsong, they gain hit points equal to ten times your Cha modifier and opponents take a penalty to damage rolls against them equal to your Cha modifier
  • 2: Binding dream energy appears around the foes pursuing your ally. Each creature that has targeted that ally with an offensive action or damaged them in any way in the last two [Rounds] is [Entangled] for two [Rounds], and the ally gains hit points equal to your Cha modifier multiplied by twice the number of [Entangled] enemies
  • 3: You transfer your life force to the ally. Take [HP reduction] equal to four times your Cha modifier, the ally gains hit points equal to three times the reduction you took
  • 4: An ordered dream twangs discordantly in the ally’s mind, they are [Deafened] for one [Round] and take damage equal to four times for Cha modifier. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage and negates the [Deafened] condition

2nd Circle – Chaos Divination, the DM rolls a d4 in secret, you may not know the result.

  • 1: You replicate the effects of a holy divination spell
  • 2: Nothing happens, and you take 10 points of [HP reduction], which last until the end of the [Scene]
  • 3: You replicate the effects of an augury spell, with a 100% success rate
  • 4: You replicate the effects of a holy divination spell, except the advice is definitely incorrect

3rd Circle – Chaos Sanguimancy, target an opponent in [Close] range that took physical damage in the last [Round] and roll a d6

  • 1: You roil up the target’s blood into a tempest, and they gain +1 to AC, +10 to speed and a [Bonus attack] for one [Round].
  • 2: You prevent their blood from clotting, causing the target to start [Bleeding]
  • 3: Your target’s blood weakens and they become slow and anemic, the target cannot take swift actions, [Bonus attacks] or attacks of opportunity for two [Rounds]
  • 4: You take some blood and forge it into a sanguine weapon, the target takes damage equal to your Cha modifier and you can make your next attack roll as if you were the creature who last did them physical damage, using the weapon that attacker was wielding
  • 5: You warp the target’s blood to force their body to attack itself, they take damage equal to if they had hit themself with a single attack with one of their wielded weapons of your choice
  • 6: You drain a huge amount of the target’s blood, they lose hit points equal to the difference between their current hit points and maximum hit points. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect, and in any case it can’t reduce a creature below 1 HP.

3rd Circle – Chaos Evocation, roll a d6

  • 1: A fireball explodes around you, all creatures within a 30 ft radius, centred on yourself, take 12d6 energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor. All creatures except you may make a Reflex save to half the damage done.
  • 2: An almighty shout erupts from your throat. You deal damage equal to thrice your level plus your Cha modifier to all creatures in a wedge originating from you going out to your [Close] range, but you are [Deafened] and [Shaken] for the duration of the [Encounter]
  • 3: Negative energy lances from you and arcs through the battlefield. Target opponent within 30 ft, then another target opponent within 30 ft of them that has not already been damaged by this ability, and so on, take energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to twice your level and are [Energy drained] once
  • 4: A huge sphere of acid appears in your hands, and you haphazardly toss it. All creatures in a 30 ft radius spread centred within your [Close] range take 1d10 energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor equal to your level and have their AC reduced by 3 for the [Encounter]. A successful Fortitude save halves this damage and negates the AC reduction.
  • 5: Cold winds swirl around you. All opponents in your [Close] range take 1d6 energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor per your character level, and are [Slowed] for two [Rounds]. A successful Fortitude save negates the [Slowed] condition.
  • 6: You summon lightning down from the sky. All opponents in your [Medium] range take 2d6 energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor per your character level. A successful Reflex save halves the damage done

4th Circle – Chaos Meteomancy, roll a d8

  • 1: The sun rises, and all creatures in the [Encounter] return to their maximum hit points, and all conditions currently affecting them end.
  • 2: An arcane breeze sweeps across the battle, and all magical effects of 5th circle or lower in the [Encounter] end.
  • 3: The rains are unpleasant for your foes, and they are all [Fatigued] for the rest of the [Encounter].
  • 4: A flash frost suddenly runs up your opponents’ skin, dealing energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to four times your Cha modifier to all opponents in the [Encounter]
  • 5: A thick snowfall obscures your foes’ vision, and all your allies gain [Concealed] for the [Encounter].
  • 6: Welcome rains fall down on the battle, all your allies gain [Fast healing] 10 for the rest of the [Encounter]
  • 7: A tornado whips up out of nowehere, and all creatures in the [Encounter] are [Blown away] in a random direction, in an order of your choice
  • 8: The sun’s heat blares down on the battlefield, and all of your opponents in the [Encounter] are [Battered] for one [Round], and all conditions affecting them have their durations increased by one [Round].

6.0.2 Aces High [Iconic]

You’re feeling lucky, always
Prerequisite: Larceny trained
Benefit: As a swift action, make a Larceny check with DC equal to 12 + your character level + your KOM. On a success, you may treat any results of a 1 on a die you roll until the start of your next turn as the maximum result on that die.

6.0.3 A Convenient Excuse [Combat]

For more violence!
Prerequisite: BAB +6
Benefit: Whenever an ally within your [Medium] range that has not already triggered this feat in the [Enconter] falls below half their maximum hit points, you gain a +1 feat bonus to attack rolls and a +5 bonus to speed. This stacks a number of times equal to half your KOM.

6.0.4 An Elegant Weapon [Combat]

Your attacks are accurate and beautiful, reminiscent of a more civilized age
Prerequisite: 6th Level
Benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to attack rolls. As part of a move action, you may sacrifice two weapon properties from the weapon you wield for one [Round] to increase this bonus to +3 with attacks using that weapon for the [Round], or sacrifice four to increase the bonus to +4.

6.0.5 A Fine Addition

Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, and you love to flatter your defeated foes
Benefit: You may attune to an additional Lesser item, but it must be a weapon which belonged to an enemy you killed. At 6th, 9th and 15th levels, you gain the ability to attune to an additional Lesser item with the same restrictions.

6.0.6 Antediluvian [Iconic]

Your ancient aura is so repulsive it becomes difficult to even look at you directly
Prerequisite: 9th Level
Benefit: Each [Round] the beginning of its turn, each opponent within your [Close] range may choose to take -2 penalty to d20 rolls and AC against attacks, abilities, and effects originating from you for one [Round]. If an opponent does not choose to take this penalty they become [Nauseated] for 1 [Round]. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Nauseated] condition and grants the opponent [Immunity] to this ability for the rest of the [Encounter].

6.0.7 Kneel Before Zod

Your tremendous power can force your enemies to prostrate before you
Prerequisite: Antediluvian
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may force an opponent within [Close] range to become [Cowering] for the rest of the [Encounter]. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level+ your KOM) negates the condition but causes the opponent to become [Prone]. An opponent rendered [Cowering] by this ability may make a Will save each [Round] at the beginning of its turn to negate it. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.8 Artful Dodger [Combat]

As long as you can stay focused on one person to avoid, you’re exceptional at getting out of the way
Prerequisite: Dex KDM or Athletics trained
Benefit: Each [Encounter], choose one opponent. You gain a +2 feat bonus to AC and Reflex saves against attacks and abilities used by that opponent. Whenever you dodge an attack from that opponent, you may make an immediate 5 ft step, up to twice per [Round].

6.0.9 A Slow Succumbing

You can bind your foes ever more with the aether
Prerequisite: Baptised in Rage
