Benefit: Twice per [Encounter], as a move action, you may create a wedge originating from you with a length equal to your [Close] range. All creatures inside the wedge when you create it must make a Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or become [Slowed]. Creatures [Slowed] by this ability may remove the condition with a move action, though doing so provokes an attack of opportunity. After three [Rounds] of being [Slowed] by this ability, creatures lose the condition and instead become [Paralyzed] for the [Encounter]. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.10 To the Bone

You strangle your foes’ nerves and encase them in stone
Prerequisite: A Slow Succumbing
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may force an opponent within [Close] range to become [Petrified] for the rest of the [Encounter]. A successful Fortitude save (DC 10 + ½ your level+ your KOM) negates the condition. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.11 Aura Aura Aura [Iconic]

Your vitality extends beyond your body as a shielding aura of positive energy
Prerequisite: 9th Level
Benefit: When you have temporary hit points, you become the centre of a 15 ft radius spread. When an ally in the spread takes damage, they may use any [Resistance]s or [Damage reduction] you have, and deduct the damage from your temporary hit points (any reamining damage it dealt to the ally as normal).

6.0.12 A Worthy Opponent [Iconic]

Your battle will be LEGENDARY!
Prerequisite: 9th level
Benefit: As long as the only creatures in your [Close] range are you and one opponent, neither you nor that opponent can benefit from any bonuses or conditions originating from another creature, ignore all penalties and conditions originating from another creature, and may not regain hit points by any method not originating from themselves.

6.0.13 Bayonet [Combat]

Ready! Aim! Steady! … Stab!
Benefit: As a swift or part move action you may modify or change the way you wield any ranged weapon you are wielding to be able to make melee attacks with it for the remainder of the [Round].

When a creature uses the Charge manoeuvre targeting you, or moving through your [Melee] range, you may make an attack of opportunity against it which does not count as your attack of opportunity for the [Round].

6.0.14 Blasting Off Again

You have mastered the art of surviving lethal situations by instead being blasted hundreds of feet into the air and disappearing into a twinkle
Prerequisite: Henchman Track, 12th Level
Benefit: Once per [Scene], when you are reduced to below 0 HP, you may instead survive on 1 HP. If you do, you disappear into the sky (essentially being [Soaring]), and reappear 1d20 miles away in a random direction.

6.0.15 Blind-Fight [Combat]

You are adept at fighting in the dark, which extends to proficiency against those pesky ethereal and illusions which are also hard to hit
Benefit: Once per [Round], when you roll [Miss chance] you may reroll, but you must keep the second result. Also, you gain a +5 bonus to Awareness against [Invisible] creatures.

6.0.16 Blood Mage [Iconic]

You have learned to fuel your magic with your own body
Benefit: When you use a spell, spell-like ability, or supernatural ability, you may take [HP reduction] equal to twice your level. If you do so, any DCs for saving throws made against that ability or any other spells, spell-likes or supernatural abilities you use that [Round] are increased by 1. You may do this any number of times per spell, but cannot exceed the limit of half your maximum HP in [HP reduction].

6.0.17 Call for Parley [Skill]

You gotta fight/for your right/to par-ley
Prerequisite: Diplomacy trained, do not have Dread Pirate or Liar’s Dice
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], you may make a Diplomacy check that targets all creatures in [Medium] range, as long as all combatants are within [Medium] range. If your Diplomacy check beats the Diplomacy defence of all opponents in the [Encounter] plus the highest Cha modifier of opponents in the [Encounter], and your opponents do not specifically despise you, you immediately end combat and start a social encounter (or, where appropriate, a Negotiation skill game). No-one can initiate combat during the first five rounds of this encounter, and if combat is initiated, your opponents get a Surprise Round.

6.0.18 Child of Shadow [Combat]

The ability to blink through space is basic Sombramancy, but more advanced Shadow Mages can use their movement to draw the shadows around them in a concealing veil
Prerequisite: Shadow Blink
Benefit: When you move at least 20 ft, you gain [Concealment] until the start of your next turn.

6.0.19 Shadow Garrotte [Combat]

Experienced Sombramancers can bring the shadows into a corporeal weapon to silence their foes
Prerequisite: Child of Shadow
Benefit: In a turn where you use Shadow Blink and move at least 20 ft, as a standard action you may fling a noose of physical shadows at a target. Make a ranged attack roll out to [Medium] range, if it hits it deals 1d6 damage per your character level and inflicts [Flat-footed]. A successful Reflex save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates Flat-Footed. Also, you only take a -2 penalty to your cumulative Stealth modifier when using this action. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.20 Shadow Blade Technique [Combat]

More martially inclined Sombramancers can use their powers to create a shadowy duplicate of their weapon, which provides both cover on an attack, and can inflict a deadly chill on enemies
Prerequisite: Child of Shadow
Benefit: In a turn where you use Shadow Blink and move at least 20 ft, as a standard action you may make a single melee attack with both your equipped weapon and a shadowy copy. Make two d20 rolls for the attack, if only the highest hits you do damage as normal, but if the lower one hits, it deals additional energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to 1d6 per circle you have in your Fast track, and leaves the target [Exhausted] until the end of the [Encounter].

6.0.21 Ghost Blade [Combat]

You Shadow Blade is invisible, and you even make your actual weapon invisible when you use the technique.
Prerequisite: Shadow Blade Technique
Benefit: When you use Shadow Blade Technique, your target is [Flat-footed] against the attack roll.

6.0.22 Choke Out [Combat]

Once you have a grapple on someone, you can take them out of the fight.
Benefit: When you use the Choke manoeuvre, the target creature must make a Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Str modifier) or be [Paralyzed]. Each subsequent time you use the Choke manoeuvre, they take a -2 penalty to Fortitude saves against [Paralyzed], stacking up to five times.

6.0.23 Collect

“Thank you!” she said, in the cutest voice ever as she stole all the bandit’s money
Benefit: As a standard action, you may take money from an opponent in [Melee] range. The maximum amount of money you can take is equal to the standard currency unit of the nation you are in, multiplied by the product of your level and the result of a Larceny check you make as part of this action. Most level appropriate humanoids should have that amount of money on them, and even monsters should have some (somehow), but the DM may adjudicate when a target simply does not have anything to steal.

6.0.24 Cluster Bomb

For whatever reason, your abilities are a lot more chaotic than most
Prerequisite: 6th Level
Benefit: Once per [Round], whenever you create a spread that deals damage, you may create up to two other spreads that have a 5 ft. radius. These spreads have the same effect and duration as the original spread, and must be placed within [Melee] range of the edge of the original spread. None of the spreads created by this feat may overlap with each other or the original spread. If the original spread moves then these spreads move in the same direction and at the same speed as the original spread. At 12th level, you may place up to four spreads.

6.0.25 Combined Arms [Combat]

You are a master of synergy between bow and blade, and your instruction has reached your allies
Prerequisite: 6th Level
Benefit: Your allies within [Close] range gain a +2 feat bonus to ranged attack rolls against creatures in your [Melee] range. You gain a +4 feat bonus to saving throws against effects which also affect an opponent in your [Melee] range.

6.0.26 Constructed Formats [Skill]

You love to tinker with mundane objects and practice what you call ‘basic coding skills’
Prerequisite: Arcana and Engineering trained
Benefit: With one hour of work, you can animate any normally inanimate object with moving parts. You set a simple ‘program’ where the object will move in a specific way in response to a specific stimulus. An object can respond to any stimulus in its ‘line of sight’ and ‘line of effect’ which you personally could perceive. You can set a number of programs on an object equal to the number of circles you have in your Fast tack. You can have a number of objects programmed this way equal to twice your Int modifier.

6.0.27 Countermagic

You can channel your own magic to thwart the efforts of rival mages
Prerequisite: 6th level, Arcana as a trained skill
Benefit: Twice per [Encounter], as an immediate action when an opponent in [Close] range casts a spell or uses a spell-like or supernatural ability, you may make an Arcana check of DC 10 + that opponent’s level + that opponent’s highest mental ability modifier. If you succeed, you counter that ability, causing it to have no effect and expending the action used and any spell slots, points or per [Encounter] or [Scene] uses that were spent to use it. In addition to the Arcana check, if you are countering a spell you must expend a spell slot of equal circle or greater to the countered spell. If it is an ability which is not at-will, you must expend one use of an ability of equal or greater class. The classes are:
Class 1: Multiple uses per [Encounter]
Class 2: Once per [Encounter]
Class 3: Multiple uses per [Scene]
Class 4: Once per [Scene]

When you reach 10th level, you can use this Feat an additional time per [Encounter].

This is a spell-like ability.

6.0.28 Covering Fire [Combat]

You lay down fire to keep your allies safe as they advance on to the front.
Prerequisite: Base Attack Bonus +3
Benefit: As a standard action, or by replacing an attack in an attack action, create a cone centred on you out to 60 ft for one [Round]. The first time an opponent uses an attack of opportunity in this cone, the attack of opportunity is cancelled. Allies in the cone gain [Covered] when they are targeted by ranged attacks. You may sacrifice additional attacks in an attack action when using this ability. For each additional attack sacrificed, you may cancel an additional attack of opportunity, and allies in the cone gain a further +2 to AC against ranged attacks.

6.0.29 Cunning Disguise

You and your partner are actually way better at crafting disguises than any other aspect of villainy, you might actually be better served in that profession
Prerequisite: Henchman Track, Larceny Trained
Benefit: When you gain this Feat, choose another creature with the Henchman track. If you both make a Larceny check to make a disguise which is linked to each other’s, you both gain a +8 feat bonus to the Larceny check.

6.0.30 Curiosity [Guild]

It might have killed the cat, but in many other situations it can be quite helpful…
Benefit: You gain a +3 feat bonus to Awareness. You can hear all telepathic communication any creature in your [Close] range is involved in.

6.0.31 Devil Eyes Come [Iconic]

You open your eyes… and you see through the cursed and invisible mask you have left on your victim’s face
Benefit: When you hit a creature with an attack roll, you may leave a Devil’s Eye mark on that creature. As long as you are not currently in combat with that creature, you can establish line of sight and effect from that creature, and for all spells, spell-like and supernatural abilities that do not require an attack roll, you can treat your range as originating from that creature. You may have a number of Devil’s Eye marks equal to the number of circles you have in your fast track. While looking through a creature’s eyes using this feat, they see the world in monochrome. You can do this only once per [Scene] for each creature, for a number of [Rounds] up to your Int modifier.

When you reach 9th level, you may make a Larceny check while using this feat. If you beat a DC of 14 + the level of the creature who you are seeing through + the creature you are seeing through’s KDM, and use an ability which could feasibly have been used by that creature, you can have it appear as though that creature used the ability.

6.0.32 Die Hard

You have a very particular set of skills allowing you to carry on even when close to death. Yippee-kai-yay!
Prerequisite: 6th Level
Benefit: When you are reduced below 0 HP, you do not fall [Unconscious] and immediately become [Stable]. You are still [Disabled] though.

6.0.33 Dive for Cover

Before the fireball has even exploded, you’re already on the floor. It’s a bit overdramatic, but it does help
Prerequisite: Base Reflex save bonus of +6
Benefit: When you are not [Prone] and have to make a Reflex save, you may fall [Prone] and roll twice for the Reflex save, taking the higher value. This provokes an attack of opportunity.

6.0.34 Dormant Personality Overlay [Iconic]

There is another you that lies dormant in your consciousness, ready to reassert themself when they think they are needed, no matter how inconvenient it might be
Benefit: When you take this feat, choose three skills you have trained and three skills you do not. Choose one of your tracks and one track from the same Class which you do not have.

Once per [Scene], as a full [Round] action, swap your skills and track that you chose for the ones you don’t have that you chose for three minutes.

6.0.35 Dragonbreath

I mean, it’d be pretty sad to be a Dragon without the whole ‘breathing elemental destruction’ thing
Prerequisite: Dragon or Dragonborn race
Benefit: Choose an energy type ([Fire], [Cold], [Electricity], [Acid], or [Force]) and either a Wedge or Line. As a standard action, you may create a Wedge out to 5 ft per your level if you chose Wedge, or a 5 ft wide line out to 10 ft per level if you chose Line. All creatures in the area take energy damage with the descriptor you chose equal to 1d4 times your level. This increases to 1d6 when you reach 9th level, and 1d8 at 15th level. You may not use this ability again for 1d4 [Rounds]. A successful Fortitude save if you chose [Cold], [Acid] or [Force], or Reflex save if your chose [Fire] or [Electricity] of DC 10 +1/2 your level + your Con modifier halves the damage.

6.0.36 Dread Pirate [Skill]

Your reputation preceeds you. And your reputation is very, very nasty
Prerequisite: Intimidate trained, do not have Call for Parley or Liar’s Dice
Benefit: All opponents whose Intimidate defence is 5 or less points above your Intimidate bonus start [Encounters] with you [Shaken] for two [Rounds].

6.0.37 Emoter

You have mastered a unique subdiscipline of telepathy where you can overlay your emotions onto a creature you are in telepathic communion with
Prerequisite: Any amount of Power Points through any source, or Cerebromancy track
Benefit: Once per [Scene], as a standard action, make a Will save and force a creature within 10 ft to make a Will save. If your result is higher, you may change your target’s emotional state to any that you describe (this may change their attitude, but does not change their allegiance or knowledge). If your result was higher by 8 or more, you can use this ability once more during the [Scene].

You may augment this ability with 4 PP to specify a single sentence of no more than 10 words. As long as it does not obviously contradict contemporary knowledge they have, the target will believe that sentence is true.

6.0.38 Est [Iconic]

You really are worth it if your player trains you up… whatever that means
Prerequisite: Can only be taken at 1st level by a character starting at 1st level
Benefit: Your ability scores start at 15, 14, 13, 11, 8, 6. Every time you level up, you may increase one of your ability scores by 1.

6.0.39 Expert Sniper [Combat]

You are so skilled with your weapon of choice that you can shoot a sword out of someone’s hands
Prerequisite: Sniper feat
Benefit: The first time each [Round] that you make a ranged attack against a [Flat-footed] target, you may treat it as a Disarm attack. Once per [Encounter], when you Disarm this way you may instead target a non-armour magical item the target is attuned to. If it is Disarmed, they count as unattuned to it until they use a move action to pick it up (which provokes an attack of opportunity).

6.0.40 Exponential Elementalism [Iconic]

Your chaotic energies were trained by your mentor in the League. Now you can harness your unpredictable elemental might just enough to blow up your enemies without also blowing up yourself.
Prerequisite: Elemental Burst
Benefit: When you roll damage for Elemental Burst, for every 6 you roll you may roll an additional two d6s.

6.0.41 Fancy You [Iconic]

Nuga meonjeo johahamyeon eottae
Prerequisite: Attractiveness score of 75 or more, Larceny, Diplomacy and Bluff trained
Benefit: All creatures who are attracted to you (determine this by rolling a percentile for each creature of appropriate sexual preference, they are attracted if their result is lower than your attractiveness score) are always [Flat-footed] against you. In addition, they lose the first token they have against you in each social encounter, and cannot counter your use of a token to request a minor favour or gift from them. This effect wears off after the creature faces you in two encounters – social or combat.

6.0.42 Fast Talk [Iconic]

Some are born with a silver tongue. Yours is forked
Benefit: Whenever you make a check for the in-combat use of an interaction skill, make another roll and compare the result using the modifier for a different interaction skill instead. If that roll is higher than the DC of the interaction skill check you were making, you may apply the effects of the in-combat use of the interaction skill whose modifier you used.

In addition, you may substitute your Charisma modifier for your Wisdom modifier when making a Perception check.

6.0.43 Fastball Special

There are faster ways to get your comrades into the freay
Prerequisite: [Large] size or larger
Benefit: As a move action, you may move an adjacent smaller ally up to half of your movement speed in one direction. Your ally counts as [Flying] for this entire movement, but can provoke attacks of opportunity from non-[Flying] creatures on the first and last turn of the movement. If they move further than their own movement speed this way, they take 1d4 physical damage for each 5 ft above their normal speed.

6.0.44 Favoured Form [Iconic]

There is a form you are comfortable with
Prerequisite: Shapeshifter Track
Benefit: You may choose one Feature you have access to. Its point cost is reduced by 1 on the first instance of that Feature on a given Form. You must have this Feature on every Form you prepare.

6.0.45 Favoured Vestige

You feel a particular affinity for one of the Void’s denizens.
Prerequisite: Binder Track
Benefit: Choose a Vestige when you get this Feat. You do not need to make an interaction check when making a Pact with that Vestige, you simply always display their Sign and Influence, but their Influence’s clause which compels you to do something does not happen.

Your level counts as two higher and you count as having one more circle of Binder when calculating the effects of that Vestige’s abilities.

6.0.46 Fistbeard Empowerment [Iconic]

You are an acolyte of the Fistbeard school, channelling your ki through the purest of mediums – the Beard and the Fist
Prerequisite: Discipline of the Kirin Track, Fist of White Lotus
Benefit: You can charge your Unarmed Strike with just the pure power of Beard, when you discharge your Unarmed Strike, you deal energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to your character level to the target opponent. In addition, whenever you deal damage with Hadoken or Badoken the target starts [Burning]. At 10th level, once per [Round] you can also cause an opponent hit by Hadoken or Badoken to be pushed up to 1d4X10 ft away from you.

6.0.47 Flame Mastery

By fire be purged!
Prerequisite: 6th level
Benefit: When you inflict the [Burning] condition, choose one of the following three additional effects:

  • Blue FlameEX: The affected creature rolls d8s instead of d4s for the [Burning] damage.
  • Red MetalEX: Choose one weapon wielded by the affected creature. At the start of every turn they continue to wield it for the [Encounter], they take 1d4 points of energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor for every [Round] they have been wielding the weapon since the effect started.
  • White FlameEX: The affected creature must make a Reflex save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your Con modifier) or be [Blinded] for one [Round].

6.0.48 Fly High

Kokoro o mu ni shite mukaikaze ni nori josou o tsukete
Prerequisite: Fly movement mode, 12th Level
Benefit: You gain the Soar movement mode. It takes five minutes of effort to ascend or descend.

6.0.49 Frantic Brawler [Combat]

You really get into the thick of things in combat, to the point your opponents can barely see you
Prerequisite: BAB +3
Benefit: As long as you have two or more opponents in your [Melee] range, you gain 50% [Miss chance] against ranged attacks.

6.0.50 Get Over Here! [Combat]

Yanking opponents towards oneself from across the battlefield, be it with chains, hooks, or an extendable fist, is a time-honoured tradition.
Prerequisite: Base Attack Bonus +6.
Benefit: As a standard action, you may make a ranged attack roll out to your [Close] range (or out to [Medium] with a -4 penalty). On a hit, you deal damage equal to your KOM and the target must make a Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or be pulled in a straight line until they are adjacent to you. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

6.0.51 Had a Gun for a While [Combat]

You always have one last weapon up your sleeve, just in case
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], you can give a weapon you are not currently wielding [Quick-draw] and make a [Bonus attack] with it, your target is [Flat-footed] against this attack and loses their KDM bonus to AC. At 10th level, you can do this an additional time per [Encounter], but it must be a different weapon.

6.0.52 Harrier [Combat]

You have mastered a strange technique known as ‘kiting’
Prerequisite: BAB +3
Benefit: At the end of your turn, select an opponent you have line of sight to. At the start of your next turn, if that enemy did not deal any damage or inflict any conditions on you since you selected them, you may make three 5 ft steps towards them.

6.0.53 Heartful Cry [Iconic]

Whenever you fight a powerful foe, the same song always comes into your head, it’s a bit tedious but at least the song is pretty hype.
Prerequisite: Minstrel Track
Benefit: While you are fighting an enemy at least three levels higher than your highest level ally, for the purposes of calculating the effects of your Minstrel abilities, you treat yourself as having two more circles in the track, with a +4 bonus to your TAM and an additional +2 bonus to save DCs.

6.0.54 He Protecc [Combat]

He protecc
Prerequisite: 3rd level
Benefit: You gain a +1 feat bonus to AC. If an opponent in [Melee] range makes an attack roll against one of your allies, you may take all damage that is done to that ally instead - if you do so [Resistance] and [Damage reduction] does not apply to this damage (from you or the targeted ally)

6.0.55 He Attacc [Combat]

He attacc
Prerequisite: 6th level
Benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to attack rolls. When you make an attack of opportunity, you may move to any unoccupied space in your [Melee] range while you make the attack.

6.0.56 But Most Importantly

But most importantly…
Prerequisite: He Protecc and He Attacc
Benefit: Twice per [Scene], when you roll a natural 1 on a d20, you may reroll the d20. You must take the new result.

6.0.57 He Change Tracc

lmaoooo gottem
Prerequisite: But Most Importantly
Benefit: Once per [Encounter] or once between [Encounters], you may change one of your Tracks for any other Track.

6.0.58 Hidden Mind

Your mental actions are so subtle that many are not even aware it is you manipulating reality with your psyche
Prerequisite: Larceny trained, access to at least one Power
Benefit: When manifesting a power, you can make a Larceny check as a free action to conceal your work. Opponents whose Awareness defences are equal to or less than your check result are unaware that you are the caster of the power. In addition, you may make a Larceny check in place of a Perception check for the in-combat use of the Perception skill. You gain a +2 feat bonus to Larceny checks.

6.0.59 Hollow Voice

Your voice imbues your magic and your weapons with an empty arcane power
Benefit: Select a track with at least one spell, spell-like, or supernatural ability that forces a saving throw. You gain a +2 feat bonus to the DCs of all abilities from that track. In addition, whenever you use an ability, you may choose to grant one weapon you are wielding [Arcane] for the purpose of determining effects of that ability.

6.0.60 Horny on Main

I’m not sorry
Prerequisite: 1st level
Benefit: You gain a [Brutal], [Devastating], [Traumatising] melee natural weapon. You gain a further +2 bonus to attack rolls when you Charge with this weapon, but take a further -2 penalty to AC. Whenever you hit with an attack as part of the Charge manoeuvre, you may immediately make a Bull Rush attempt against your target.

6.0.61 Hors d’oeuvres

You’re a really good chef
Prerequisite: Chef Track
Benefit: As a full round action in combat, you may choose one Ingredient. Grant both of its effects to all creatures in [Long] range until the end of the [Encounter]. If you use this for a second time in an [Encounter], it overwrites the effects of any previous uses.

6.0.62 I Am Speed [Skill]

Live and learn! Riding on the edge of tomorrow! Live and learn! From the works of yesterday!
Prerequisite: Athletics trained
Benefit: Every time you end your turn a distance from where you started it at equal to your greater than your speed, your [Miss chance] increases by 5%. This stacks up to a number of times equal to three plus the number of circles you have in your Fast track, but resets back to 5% if you go a turn without activating it.

6.0.63 I Got Voodoo [Iconic]

You’ve got things you haven’t even tried!
Prerequisite: 9th Level
Benefit: If you have an item of clothing or a body part of a creature, you may use it to target that creature, wherever it is, with any attack or ability with a range of [Melee] or [Close]. The item used to focus on them is destroyed in the process, and you can target each creature only once per [Scene].

6.0.64 Improved Sunder [Style]

You make cracks in your adversaries’ weapons to the point where they become almost unusable.
Benefit: The penalties you inflict with [Sundering] weapons now stack up to -2. When you reach 6th level they now stack up to -3, and any time you inflict a -3 penalty, you may destroy a mundane weapon the target is wielding. At 12th level, you can now destroy a Lesser enchanted weapon. At 17th level, you can now destroy a Greater enchanted weapon.

6.0.65 Intimidating Strike

When you gear up for a powerful attack you can instead scare your foe into submission
Prerequisite: Sinister Sinews
Benefit: Bonuses to damage you gain as part of a Power Attack manoeuvre also apply to all Intimidate checks you make that [Round].

6.0.66 Iocane Powder [Guild]

Never go in against a [Insert nationality here] when [Insert consequence here] is on the line!
Benefit: Choose one of the following sets of conditions to gain [Immunity] to:

  • [Dazzled] and [Blinded]
  • [Sickened] and [Nauseated]
  • [Fatigued], [Slowed], and [Exhausted]
  • [Burning], [Bleeding] and [Poison] effects
  • [Flat-footed] and [Grappled]

6.0.67 It’s a Trap! [Skill]

You were lying in wait all along!
Prerequisite: Stealth trained
Benefit: Your bonus to Stealth checks for each [Round] you have remained stationary increases to +3. If you are not in combat, your cumulative Stealth bonus can increase up to +10. Your first attack after coming out of Stealth with a cumulative +10 bonus ignores all [Damage reduction] and [Resistance], and the target loses their KDM bonus to AC.

6.0.68 Know a Guy [Guild]

Due to a long history in the underworld, you have a very wide web of contacts
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
Benefit: At the start of a [Scene], you can choose one general form of service, and one skill check. By the end of the [Scene], you will have access to a friendly person who can provide that service (at any appropriate fee, including extra charges for special circumstances), and a person (maybe the same one) who can make a skill check of that kind for you with a bonus equal to the highest bonus in that skill in your party plus 4 (again, for any reasonable fee). You can do this a number of times per [Quest] equal to the number of circles you have in your Fast track.

6.0.69 Long Game

The risk you’re taking is calculated. It remains to be seen whether you are bad at math
Prerequisite: You obviously can’t take this feat during character creation unless you are creating a character at a level where they gain a feat and you take it as the feat for that level
Benefit: Take a -2 penalty to either the ability score you use for your KOM or the ability score you use for your KDM.

The next time you gain a Feat by levelling up, remove the penalty from this feat and instead gain a +2 feat bonus to two ability scores of your choice.

6.0.70 Liar’s Dice [Skill]

This is a very literal interpretation, not gonna lie
Prerequisite: Bluff tained, don’t have Call for Parley or Dread Pirate
Benefit: When you make a skill check targeted at another creature, you may make a Bluff check against them and roll a d4. If your Bluff check succeeds, add the result of that d4 to your skill check result. If it fails, take the result of the d4 away from your skill check result.

6.0.71 Martial Disciple [Iconic]

You have studied a single weapon to near mastery, and now you are ready to bring your style out into the world
Prerequisite: 6th Level, Martial Magister
Benefit: Choose a set of three weapon properties. When you make attacks with weapons with those three weapon properties, you gain a +3 feat bonus to attack rolls. You learn all Weapon Master manoeuvres at Apprentice or Journeyman level that are keyed to those three weapon properties.

6.0.72 Menacing [Iconic]

ゴゴゴゴ
Benefit: For each [Round] of a given [Encounter] you have not used any offensive action, any creature which has not hit you with an attack roll takes a -1 penalty to all d20 rolls, stacking up to a number of times equal to your Cha or Str mofidier, whichever is higher.

6.0.73 Meowth, That’s Right! [Iconic]

Your strangely intelligent companion is just as much an asset to the Boss as you are
Prerequisite: Henchman Track, Nature’s Ally Track
Benefit: When you gain access to the abilities, your Companion can freely use the Prepare for Trouble, Protect the World from Devastation and Denounce the Evils of Truth and Love abilities.

6.0.74 Messenger Magus [Skill]

With just a feather and a whisper, you can send a message without any fancy Sendings
Prerequisite: Nature trained
Benefit: You have one Feather Token per six character levels (minimum one). As a standard action, you may transform one of your Feather Tokens into a dove and give it a message of up to 50 words and a target person and place which you can describe in detail. The dove will then fly at a speed of 50 mph to the location and find the person and pass on the message in your voice. The target can then give a reply of 50 words which will return to you. If the dove is killed, or cannot find its target, it will be lost, but another can be created with ten minutes of effort.

6.0.75 Moment of Clarity [Combat]

At the start of a battle, you enter a zen-like state where you know exactly how to react
Benefit: Three times per [Scene] you may reroll your Initiative check, but must take the second result. You may always act during surprise rounds.

6.0.76 Montage [Iconic]

The hour’s approaching to give it your best and you’ve got to reach your prime. That’s when you need to put yourself to the test, and show us the passage of time.
Prerequisite: Minstrel Track, Diplomacy trained
Benefit: With one [Scene] of effort, you may make a Diplomacy check against any number of allies, with the DC being the highest Diplomacy defence amongst them. In the next [Encounter], all allies targeted gain a +1 bonus to d20 rolls per 4 you passed the check by (minimum 1 if you passed the check).

6.0.77 Mind Without Body

You don’t need to put your fingers to your head anymore. In fact, you now realise you never really did
Prerequisite: 9th Level
Benefit: You may spend 2 power points to manifest a power or Psi-like ability with an action you cannot use normally due to a condition. These power points do not count against the cost limit for augmenting powers at your circle.

6.0.78 Mister World-Mind [Guild]

Look, it’s just a really useful ability
Benefit: You may cast the spell world-mind at will.

6.0.79 Nature’s Grace

You weren’t born as one of the best, but through the blessing of nature’s spirits, you have overcome your limitations
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
Benefit: Choose one of your ability scores. Its base amount becomes 15. When you take this Feat, you may take 2 points away from one of your other ability scores to increase it to 16.

6.0.80 Once Again Asking

People skills sometimes just means persistence and a down-to-earth manner
Benefit: When you make an interaction check against a creature you have already made an interaction check against this [Quest], you gain a +1 feat bonus for each previous interaction check you have made against them, up to your Cha modifier.

6.0.81 Open-Minded [Guild]

You can access a wider array of skills… it doesn’t mean you’re good at them
Benefit: You gain an additional trained skill, but you only gain a bonus from training the skill equal to half your level (but rounded up).

6.0.82 Ora ora ora ora [Iconic]

The flurry of fists you can manage in combat is faster than the human eye can see, but your battlecry is definitely audible
Benefit: You may use up to three [Bonus attacks] per turn, ignoring the limit of one (they must be from different sources though). However, your [Bonus attacks] must be unarmed strikes, and you cannot use an ability to make them into manoeuvre attacks (such as Ceaseless Flow).

6.0.83 Overburn [Iconic]

You burn people with a blue flame, which doesn’t seem to harm them… until the flame detects they are weak enough to die in a single horrific conflagration
Prerequisite: Elementalist Track using [Fire], Fire Elemental Track, Magma Elemental Track, or Discipline of the Kirin Track
Benefit: When you deal damage with the [Fire] descriptor, the target’s HP does not decrease. Instead, they gain that much [Overburn].

[Overburn] has no effect, until the total of the creature’s current hit points and Constitution ability score is equal to or lower than their amount of [Overburn]. When that is the case, the creature is immediately killed and all creatures within 15 ft of them take energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to one quarter (rounded down) of the amount of [Overburn] the dead creature had.

6.0.84 Overcautious [Iconic]

You are significantly more concerned with safety than you are with actually hurting people
Prerequisite: Good BAB
Benefit: Your BAB becomes poor (i.e. use the Tactician/Shaman/etc. BAB progression). The Poor save from your class now has a base bonus equivalent to your other two saves.

6.0.85 Overchannel

You can exert your mind even further to make your Powers harder to resist, but your body pays the price
Prerequisite: Any powers or psi-like abilities
Benefit: Whenever you manifest a power or PLA, you may take [HP reduction] equal to your level to gain a +3 feat bonus to the DCs of saves against that ability.

6.0.86 Talented

You are so good at overchanneling that you are able to put off the worst of the side effects, but your body will still suffer in a drawn-out fight
Prerequisite: Overchannel
Benefit: Whenever you use Overchannel, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

6.0.87 Outdraw [Combat]

You’re used to pistols at dawn, the chaos of normalcombat is almost quaint to you
Prerequisite: 3rd level
Benefit: When intiative is rolled, you may swap your place on the initiative order with the opponent highest on the order. If you do, on your first turn you can only use your standard action to make ranged attacks and use your move and swift actions to draw weapons to make a ranged attack with.

6.0.88 Pick a God and Pray! [Guild]

You have given your devotion to a deity, and can call on them in times of need
Benefit: Once per [Quest], as a free action, you can call on your God for Divine Intervention. For Divine Intervention, roll percentile, and the following result happens:

  • 01-05: Your Deity makes a powerful Intervention, but in doing so breaks the Domain Agreement, prompting a response from any other Deities invested in the current conflict (a quest may be undertaken to smooth over this problem)
  • 06-84: No effect
  • 85-89: If you or the DM can think of a thing particularly thematic to your deity which can alter the tide of the current battle, it occurs
  • 90-95: Your deity intervenes in a way which alters the tide of your current predicament
  • 96-100: Your deity makes a powerful Intervention, strongly advantaging you.

At 10th, 15th and 20th level, you gain an additional use of this ability per [Quest]. For every two times in a [Quest] you get ‘No effect’ you may use this ability an additional time.

6.0.89 Blessed by Archinus

Archinus, the Great Vanguard, teaches his followers to never back down from a fight, and always stand firm against evil, even when they’re… underwater?
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: Every time you fail a saving throw, you gain a +1 feat bonus to attack rolls for the rest of the [Encounter], which stacks up to +3. As long as your bonus from this feat is +2 or higher, you cannot lose access to movement modes or the [Flying], [Burrowing] or [Swimming] conditions due to any effect originating from an opponent.

6.0.90 Blessed by Arthrus

The Once and Future King delights in honourable combat, and encourages his followers to inform their enemies of their weaknesses, and not to exploit them
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: Once per [Encounter] as a standard action, you may truthfully tell an enemy any [Resistance], [Vulnerability] or [Immunity] you have, and what your lowest save is. You will then find out this information for that enemy. Also, that enemy must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) or be unable to target you with damage you have [Vulnerability] to, or an ability which makes you roll your lowest save, until you or one of your allies does one of those things to them, or the [Encounter] ends.

6.0.91 Blessed by Asmodeus

The Archduke of Nessus blesses only those with the highest ambitions with his silver tongue, and encourages them with his power to act in absolute disdain of those beneath them
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: When you successfully make a Diplomacy skill check in combat you also inflict a -4 penalty to your target’s damage rolls. The penalty you inflict to attack rolls is increased to -3 and that to damage rolls is increased to -5 when you succeed on an in-combat Diplomacy check against an opponent of a lower level than you.

6.0.92 Blessed by Astiablor

The Hoardmistress grants her followers additional magical circuits to make better use of their treasures
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: You can equip an additional Lesser item, and can start each [Quest] with an additional Lesser or Greater consumable

6.0.93 Blessed by Baalzebul

The Lord of the Flies teaches his followers to simply not bother resisting the techniques of their enemies - with his power, they can overcome their foes regardless
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: Whenever you make a saving throw, you may voluntarily fail it. If you do, the creature which caused you to make the save takes [HP reduction] equal to your KDM.

6.0.94 Blessed by Bahamut

Bahamut, God of Dragons and Honesty, asks his followers to give the weak the skills they need to prosper, rather than dishonestly helping them prosper directly
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: As a move action, you target your weakest ally in [Medium] range, defined as the ally with the lowest combined ability scores, with ties broken by HP, then current HP. Choose one of your abilities, your ally can use that ability, or gains it if it is passive, until the start of your next turn, though if it has limited uses their uses count towards your limit. An ally using your ability can choose to either use your modifiers for the ability to substitute in theirs. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.95 Blessed by Baphomet

Baphomet, Demon Prince of Wrath, is a being of primal rage who gives his followers the ability to incite this deep anger
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: As a standard action, you may cause an opponent within [Close] range to immediately make a single melee attack with either a melee weapon they are wielding or their unarmed strike against any creature in their [Melee] range. A successful Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Con modifier) negates this effect.

6.0.96 Blessed by Boccob

Boccob the Uncaring gives his followers additional knowledge of their foes, but only if they have enough learning to work the basics out for themselves
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: When you make a successful knowledge check to identify a creature, you can ask two additional specific questions about their abilities and defences. Whenever you identify an ability, you can ask another specific question about its user.

6.0.97 Blessed by the Eight Wings

The Sezai Tribe of the Apothis Desert are watched over by four avian demigods, Akoris, Meni, Sitre, and Nebet, who together can wield the power of a deity.
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: With a two hour ritual, you can transform a mundane bird (a [Tiny] creature with AC 12 and 6 HP) into a messenger of the Eight Wings. You may communicate telepathically with this bird and it will follow your commands, and while it is alive, you gain a result on Pick a God and Pray! rolls equal to the 90-95 result on a roll of 78-84. When you reach 5th level, you gain a +2 feat bonus to Perception rolls while the bird is alive. When you reach 10th level, you may establish line of sight and effect from that bird as long as it is within your [Medium] range.

6.0.98 Blessed by Falazure

The Goddess of Black Dragons infects her own followers with a toxin so virulent it seeps into the air around them, and it only becomes more virulent with continued exertion.
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: At the end of each of your turns, all creatures within 5 ft of you, including youself, take 1d4 [HP reduction]. At the start of each of your turns after the first, increase the size of this die by 1 (if you increase the size of a d12, instead make it 1d12+1d4 and start to increase the size of the d4) and the size of the area of effect by 5 ft.

6.0.99 Blessed by Geryon

Geryon, Archdevil of Betrayal, is a renegade force who rewards traitors with bestial strength and power over acid
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: The first time each [Round] you attack an opponent against which you have already made a successful Diplomacy check against in the [Round], you deal bonus energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor equal to your level. If the attack hits, you gain diabolic horns and features for a few seconds and all creatures in your [Melee] range must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) or become [Shaken] for one [Round]. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.100 Blessed by Gruumsh [Racial]

Orcs who find glory in battle in gouge out an eye in devotion to Gruumsh lose some sight but receive new visions of glory and truth – the Orcs exist to raze the world, and the Eyes of Gruumsh shall lead them
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!, Orc Race
Benefit: You take a -2 penalty to Perception and Awareness, and gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to half your level. Once per [Scene], you may cast augury as a spell-like ability. When you gain your 5th circle in your fast track, you may instead cast holy divination.

6.0.101 Blessed by Heironeous

Heironeous, the God of Valour, teaches his followers to never back down from a fight, and always stand firm against evil, even in adverse conditions
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: Every time you fail a saving throw, you gain a +1 feat bonus to attack rolls for the rest of the [Encounter], which stacks up to +3. As long as your bonus from this feat is +2 or higher, you cannot be moved by effects originating from opponents.

6.0.102 Blessed by Hlal

Hlal, Dragon Goddess of Stories and Tricks, delights in her followers pulling jokes on their friends, giving them the blessing of the Copper Dragoness
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: As part of a move action, you may make a Larceny check to play a trick on an ally in [Close] range (with a DC of their Awareness). If it succeeds that ally takes a -1 to either AC, attack rolls or one save of your choice for a [Round], and you gain the Fly and Swim movement modes for two [Rounds] and your attacks for the next two [Rounds] deal bonus energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor equal to your KOM. This is a spell-like ability.

6.0.103 Blessed by Io

Io the mighty God of Balance, decrees that his followers shall ensure a constant balance in the world and gives them the tools to fight any extremes
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: As a standard action you may affect an enemy in [Medium] range which fulfils one of the following criteria, and inflict the associated penalty. You can only use each of these penalties twice per [Scene], and they are all spell-like abilities.

  • Highest HP of all creatures in [Long] range: Deals 9 damage per circle they possess in their Fast track. A Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Wis modifier) negates this damage.
  • Highest Base Attack Bonus of all creatures in [Long] range: -2 penalty to all attacks made after the first each [Round] for the rest of the [Encounter]. A Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Wis modifier) reduces this to the next [Round].
  • Highest AC of all creatures in [Long] range: [Vulnerability] to all damage from attacks that hit in the next [Round]. A Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Wis modifier) reduces this to the next one attack

6.0.104 Blessed by Jiyah

The one who preserves the world grants her followers the ability to mystify their abilities against identification, and even outright hide themselves and the world
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: Knowledge checks made to identify abilities you use have their DCs increased by 3. Also, as a standard action you may make yourself [Invisible] until the end of the [Encounter] or you make an offensive action, or make any environmental feature within [Medium] range, of no larger size than a [Large] creature, [Invisible] until the end of the [Encounter].

6.0.105 Blessed by Jubilex

The Demon Prince of Gluttony grants only one boon: the power to act on one’s desire to eat. No matter the material, Jubilex’s followers can consume and metabolise it
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: Can can eat anything - as long as you consume enough mass to match a normal meal, you are unaffected by Starvation as long as you consume something. As a swift action, you my bite a creature which is [Grappled] by you, dealing damage equal to your Con modifier which ignores [Damage reduction] and [Resistance], and healing hit points equal to the amount of damage done. You gain a +2 bonus to Fortitude saves for the [Encounter] for each different opponent you have bitten this way.

6.0.106 Blessed by Kord

Kord, the God of Self-Improvement, inspires his followers to better themselves and personally fight against forces of oppression
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: Choose five weapon properties other than [Arcane], [Thrown] and [Barbed]. Your unarmed strike gains those weapon properties. You gain a +3 bonus to Athletics checks.

6.0.107 Blessed by Lolth [Racial]

Lolth, the Goddess of Deceit and Assassins, encourages her followers to make war on anyone who lives above the earth, and grants them a keen eye for the weak points of foes caught unawares.
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!, Elf Race (Drow)
Benefit: You gain a further +3 bonus to attack rolls against [Flat-footed] creatures, and a further +2 bonus to attack rolls against [Entangled] creatures.

6.0.108 Blessed by Malcanthet

Malcanthet, the Demon Prince of Lust, grants her followers power to exploit those that they seduce, but also forces them to indulge their baser impulses.
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: You gain a bonus to Attractiveness equal to your Charisma score. Any creature which is attracted to you counts as having social skill check defences 4 points lower. You take a -2 penalty to saving throws against the abilities of creatures you are attracted to, but gain a +4 bonus to damage rolls against them.

6.0.109 Blessed by Mammon

Mammon, the Archdevil of greed and wealth, tempts the avaricious with a great boon - forever binding them to his service, but granting them mastery of magical trinkets in return
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: When you take this feat, you may immediately swap one of your tracks for Item Master. If you do, you may create a Lesser item of your own design - this is subject to DM approval but can be more powerful than a normal Lesser item (e.g. a weapon with 2 points of enhancements, or generally about 1.5 times as good as a standard Lesser Item). Only you may attune to this item.

6.0.110 Blessed by Obad-Hai

The Shalm allows his followers to cultivate nature wherever they are, and punishes those who flagrantly disrespect it
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: As a swift or a move action you may place two trees on unoccupied spaces on the ground within [Close] range. They take up a 5 ft space and block movement and line of sight ([Flying] creatures have their movement blocked but retain line of sight, though anyone they target past a tree benefits from [Concealment] ([Soaring] and [Burrowing] creatures ignore trees). These can be destroyed by using an attack, or as a move action, but any creature who destroys a tree is [Entangled] until the end of their next turn. This is a spell-like ability.

6.0.111 Blessed by Olidammara

The God of Larceny grants his followers… exactly what you’d expect him to grant
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: You gain a +3 bonus to Larceny and Stealth checks.

6.0.112 Blessed by Orcus

Orcus, Demon Prince of Sloth, allows his followers to spread his corrupting influence, preventing others from acting while his necromantic power takes hold
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: As a move action on a turn you didn’t make an offensive action, you may create an aura of magical darkness, out to [Melee] range which moves with you. This aura lasts until you make an offensive action, or the end of the [Encounter], and you can use a swift action to grow it to [Close] range, and another move or swift action afterwards to grow it to [Medium] range. The first time each [Round] a creature in the darkness makes an offensive action against you, they must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KDM), if it fails the action is not taken and they cannot target you with an offensive action for the rest of the [Round]. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.113 Blessed by Pelor

Pelor, God of Light and Glory, teaches his followers the virtues of self-sacrifice and perseverance, to bring the his light to all who wallow in evil
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: At will as a free action, you may take [HP reduction] equal to your level to create a spread out to your [Close] range which clearly illuminates everything within the radius and lasts for 10 minutes. If you have this spread active in combat, as a standard action you may attempt to cause one opponent in the radius to become [Blinded] for one [Round], a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) negates this effect. This is a Spell-like Ability.

6.0.114 Blessed by Pholtus

The God of the Moon’s followers can bring about the light of Law, castigating any who break their divine proclamations
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: At will as a free action, you may create a spread out to your [Close] range which clearly illuminates everything within the radius and lasts for 10 minutes. As a move action, you may choose an active ability, when any creature in the spread uses that ability, they take a -1 penalty to all d20 rolls until the end of the [Encounter]. Choosing a new ability overwrites the previous one. All creatures in the light know which ability is forbidden.

6.0.115 Blessed by Primus

Primus, God of Law, behoves his followers to impose order upon a chaotic world, and allows them great bursts of axiomatic power to combat lawbreakers
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: Whenever you make a damage roll, take the average result (rounded up). Once per [Scene] per six levels you may instead choose to take the maximum result on a damage roll.

6.0.116 Blessed by Theodore Tolvaire

Newly ascended to Celestia with the aid of a convalescing Bahamut, Theodore Tolvaire brings his idiosyncratic, esoteric form of madness to the world
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: As a swift action, roll two d6s and an ally in [Medium] range. They choose one result to be a bonus to an ability score of their choice. The other determines which of their ability scores (1 = Strength, 2 = Dexterity, 3 = Constitution, 4 = Intelligence, 5 = Wisdom, 6 = Charisma) takes a penalty of the same amount. This bonus and penalty lasts until the end of the [Encounter]. You can use this ability again in the [Encounter], but if you do the creature who did have a bonus and penalty from the ability loses both.

6.0.117 Blessed by Tiamat

Tiamat, Goddess of Destruction and Dragons, gives her followers a fivefold blessing with which to rid the world of her enemies
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: You gain a +5 feat bonus you may assign between attack rolls, damage rolls and save DCs for your abilities. The individual bonus for each of these cannot go above +2. As a move action, you may reassign your 5 points.

6.0.118 Blessed by Vecna

The God of Secrets grants his followers boons for deciphering secrets, and gives them the power to keep their own.
Prerequisite: Pick a God And Pray!
Benefit: For every two times you successfully identify an ability used by an opponent with a Knowledge skill, the DCs of saves against your abilities used against that opponent increase by 1.

Also, once per [Encounter], plus an additional time for every +1 bonus you have from the above ability, you may make one of your own abilities completely unidentifiable on use. You can also make a Larceny check when using this ability. All creatures whose Awareness is lower than your result do not know you are the ability’s user.

6.0.119 Blessed by Voladeron

Voladeron teaches his followers to grind evil into dust, never relenting, and never letting anything get in their way, even seemingly inpenetrable things like armour
Prerequisite: Pick a God and Pray!
Benefit: All weapons you wield gain the [Magnum] weapon property. All allies that attack a creature you have attacked in the last [Round] also gain the [Magnum] property on the weapons they use to attack.

6.0.120 Disciple of Archinus

The most devoted followers of Archinus are unrelenting in their attacks, and even when their enemies block their advance they do not give in
Prerequisite: Blessed by Archinus, 6th Level
Benefit: You gain a bonus to speed equal to five times your bonus to attack rolls from Blessed by Archinus, and that bonus now stacks up to +5. Your bonus from this feat increases by +1 every time you miss two attack rolls. As long as your bonus from this feat is +5 or higher, you have [Immunity] to [Binding] effects.

6.0.121 Disciple of Arthrus

The Knights who are Arthrus’ main disciples gain the ability to further enchant their favoured weapons and armour, getting ever closer to the King’s legendary regalia
Prerequisite: Blessed by Arthrus, 6th Level
Benefit: You gain 2 points worth of weapon and armour enchantments to can add to any magical weapon or armour you are attuned to. You can change what these points are used for, and what items they are applied to, between [Scenes].

6.0.122 Disciple of Asmodeus

The Lord of the Ninth Hell will give the slightest taste of his power to his greatest devotees, but only if they can live up to his expectations
Prerequisite: Blessed by Asmodeus, 6th Level
Benefit: You gain a +3 feat bonus to attack rolls, a +2 feat bonus to Charisma, a feat bonus to maximum hit points equal to twice your character level, and a +2 feat bonus to Will saves. The first time each [Round] that you fail a saving throw, or are hit with an attack by a creature with level lower than yours, you lose one of these bonuses for the duration of the [Encounter].

6.0.123 Disciple of Astiablor

Devoted followers of Astiablor get even more power to equip and attune the trinkets which make up their vast hoard
Prerequisite: Blessed by Astiablor, 6th Level
Benefit: You can equip an additional Greater item.

6.0.124 Disciple of Baalzebul

The Lord of Maladomini is a liar and a trickster, but he can back up his claims, and with his power, his disciples and also truly lay low their foes without lifting a finger.
Prerequisite: Blessed by Baalzebul, 6th Level
Benefit: When you inflict [HP reduction] with Blessed by Baalzebul, you inflict magical damage equal to twice that amount to that opponent, and gain temporary hit points equal to your KDM. The temporary hit points you gain from this ability stack up to four times your KDM.

6.0.125 Disciple of Bahamut

Bahamut gives his devotees power over the winds and ice which they employ to empower the weak
Prerequisite: Blessed by Bahamut, 6th Level
Benefit: When you use your ability from Blessed by Bahamut, you may choose one of the following powers to use. They are both supernatural abilities.

  • Flash Freeze: One enemy within [Close] range of the ally you target takes energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to your level plus KOM
  • Divine Wind: All enemies within [Close] range of the ally you target are [Blown Away] towards you. A successful Reflex save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Str modifier) negates Blown Away

6.0.126 Disciple of Baphomet

Baphomet gives his devotees the power of his wrath, creating a vortex of pure rage which encompasses them and an adversary, unleashing their might but also inviting a counter-attack
Prerequisite: Blessed by Baphomet, 6th Level
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action you may unleash this power on an opponent in [Melee] range. You may then use a swift, standard and move action immediately, but you may only use them to use a single offensive ability or attack action and any abilities which will either decrease the target opponent’s defences (and theirs alone) or make the ability or attack more powerful. Any ability uses during this action do not count towards your limit per [Encounter] or [Scene]. You gain a +5 fury bonus to any attack rolls made as part of the ability, and a fury bonus equal to the total of your level and KOM to any damage dealt. After you have done that, your target may do the same with the same bonuses.

6.0.127 Disciple of Boccob

When the Uncaring truly shows his favour to a follower, they gain additional knowledge and spells that were previously unknown to them
Prerequisite: Blessed by Boccob, 6th Level
Benefit: You may choose a Knowledge skill to gain as an additional trained skill (if you have every Knowledge skill, choose any skill). Also, choose two 3rd circle spells (from any spell list), three times per [Scene] you may cast either of those spells.

6.0.128 Disciple of the Eight Wings

Sezai priests see themselves as the talons of Sitre and the shielding feathers of Meni, using their magic to protect their allies
Prerequisite: Blessed by the Eight Wings, 6th Level
Benefit: When you hit with a melee attack, you may create a 10 ft radius spread centred on yourself. This spread does not move with you, and if you make a second spread, remove the original spread. When an ally other than you takes damage while inside this spread, they may remove the spread and instead have you take the damage. Neither of your [Damage reduction] or [Resistances] apply to this damage, but you may reduce it by your Con modifier, plus your Con modifier again for each time you have taken damage this way during the [Encounter].

6.0.129 Disciple of Falazure

Favoured ones of the Queen of Diseases are just as subject to Falazure’s experiments as any other followers, but do gain the ability to cull the weak and advance their Goddess’s studies
Prerequisite: Blessed by Falazure, 6th Level
Benefit: As a standard action, target creature in [Close] range makes a Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KDM). On a failed save, they take damage equal to their current [HP reduction]. If they currently have the lowest maximum hit points of all creatures in the [Encounter], increase this damage by half of your current [HP reduction].

6.0.130 Disciple of Geryon

Devoted cultists of Geryon are blessed with his unique acidic gaze, boiling the blood of all who behold them
Prerequisite: Blessed by Geryon, 6th Level
Benefit: At the start of your turn, all opponents in your [Close] range take energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor equal to your level + KOM. A creature may avert their gaze to avoid this damage, but if they do they treat you as [Invisible] until they look at you, at which point they immediately take the [Acid] damage. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.131 Disciple of Gruumsh

Eyes of Gruumsh who survive their battles learn a terrible truth. The Orcs are not the strongest beings on the Material Plane, and they need to work on their own individual power… by killing those even stronger beings
Prerequisite: Blessed by Gruumsh, 6th Level
Benefit: Every time you land the killing blow on a creature with a higher score than you in at least two of Strength, Dexterity and Constitution, you gain a point for this Feat. You gain a feat bonus to Strength for every 10 points you have, up to a maximum of the number of circles you have in your fast track minus 1.

6.0.132 Disciple of Heironeous

The most devoted followers of the Invincible are unrelenting in their attacks, and even when their enemies block their advance they do not give in
Prerequisite: Blessed by Heironeous, 6th Level
Benefit: Your bonus to attack rolls from Blessed by Heironeous also applies to damage rolls, and stacks up to +5. Your bonus from this feat increases by +1 every time you miss two attack rolls. As long as your bonus from this feat is +5 or higher, you have [Immunity] to [Binding] effects.

6.0.133 Disciple of Hlal

Devotees of Hlal are dedicated to the art of storytelling, and their own exploits are not exempt from this
Prerequisite: Blessed by Hlal, 6th Level
Benefit: Whenever you kill an enemy or score a critical hit, you gain a Story. Stories last indefinitely. As a standard action, you may spend a Story to tell your allies that Story, and all allies in your earshot gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls, saves and AC for one [Round]. You may spend a standard action next turn to elaborate on the story, giving allies a +5 bonus to either attack rolls or AC and saves for that [Round]. This is an extraordinary ability.

6.0.134 Disciple of Io

Io’s followers can manipulate their power to Balance to level the playing field in battle
Prerequisite: Blessed by Io, 6th level
Benefit: As a standard action once per [Encounter], you may use this ability if your allies in [Long] range have more of the following conditions than your enemies in [Long] range: [Battered], [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Dazed], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Energy drained], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Nauseated], [Paralyzed], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], [Stunned]. Remove conditions from your allies until they have as many as the enemies. This is a spell-like ability.

6.0.135 Disciple of Jiyah

The Raptoran druidic goddess’ devoted followers gain the ability to call down her divine mist of concealment, even defending themselves against deleterious spellcraft
Prerequisite: Blessed by Jiyah, 6th Level
Benefit: Three times per [Scene], as a move action you may create a spread of mist centred in [Medium] range with a radius of 5 ft per two character levels you have. All creatures in the mist gain [Concealment], and a +3 bonus to saves against any conditions caused by spells, spell-like abilities and supernatural abilities.

6.0.136 Disciple of Jubilex

The Lord of Oozes and Hunger grants his disciples the ability to endlessly regenerate, whether they be composed of slime or of flesh
Prerequisite: Blessed by Jubilex, 6th Level
Benefit: Whenever you bite a creature with your Blessed by Jubilex ability, you gain [Fast healing] 2 for the [Scene], stacking up to a maximum of 2 times your Con modifier. As a free action on your turn, you may lose all [Fast healing] gained this way to roll a number of d10s equal to half the [Fast Healing] lost and heal that many hit points.

6.0.137 Disciple of Kord

Kord’s devotees can use themselves as a shining example to inspire others to greatness
Prerequisite: Blessed by Kord, 6th Level
Benefit: As a move action, you may gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the [Encounter]. This stacks up to one quarter of your level (rounding down). Allies in your [Melee] range gain half of this bonus. This is an extraordinary ability.

6.0.138 Disciple of Lolth

Those chosen by the Demon Prince of Spiders will gain access to her power over poisons
Prerequisite: Blessed by Lolth, 6th Level
Benefit: When you attack a [Flat-footed] or [Entangled] creature and deal physical damage, you may inflict -1d4 to one of that creature’s ability scores, of your choice, for the [Encounter]. You may instead choose an ability score randomly to inflict -1d6+1. The creature may make a Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) to negate this effect. If they do, you may not affect that creature with this ability again for the duration of the [Scene], and that creature may choose one of their ability scores already reduced by this ability at the start of each of their turns, and remove the penalty.

6.0.139 Disciple of Malcanthet

Advanced cultists of the Queen of Succubi can emulate the Demons of Lust and take limited control over the minds of those whose mental faculties are weakened by attraction - but they themselves must be similarly afflicted for the spell to take hold
Prerequisite: Blessed by Malcanthet, 6th Level
Benefit: As a standard action, you may Charm a creature in [Melee] range that you are attracted to and is also attracted to you. The Charmed creature cannot use an offensive action against you or an ally. When it would use an offensive action, it must make a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your Cha modifier). A successful Will save allows it to use that offensive action as normal and renders the creature no longer charmed; a failed save means it cannot use an offensive action against you or your allies for one [Round]. The creature remains charmed until you or an ally use an offensive action against it. The creature also takes a -10 penalty to Will saves against the Charm while they remain in your [Melee] range, and may not move out of your [Melee] range willingly while Charmed. If a creature succeeds in a Will save against this Charm, they cannot be targeted by it again for the duration of the [Quest].

6.0.140 Disciple of Mammon

The Miser of Minaros understands the pure desire for wealth and accoutrement held by his followers, and he will grant them the ability to sate that desire, even in the midst of combat
Prerequisite: Blessed by Mammon, 6th Level
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, make a Bluff check against an opponent within 15 ft. If this succeeds, you may then make an Intimidate check, with the DC increased by twice the difference between your levels if the target is higher level than you. If this succeeds, you learn a simple description of every magic item that creature is attuned, and immediately take and become attuned to yourself one item of your choice that they are attuned to and you have a free attunement slot for.

6.0.141 Disciple of Obad-Hai

Obad-Hai allows his devoted druids to persevere against unnatural afflictions, and even preserve them temporarily on their enemies
Prerequisite: Blessed by Obad-Hai, 6th Level
Benefit: All conditions and [Binding] effects affecting you have their durations reduced by one [Round], to a minimum of 1 [Round]. If a condition would normally persist for an [Encounter], it instead lasts eight [Rounds] or until the [Encounter] ends, whichever occurs first. If a condition would normally persist for a [Scene], it instead lasts for the [Encounter]. If a condition would normally persist for a [Quest], it instead lasts for the [Scene]. Permanent conditions are unaltered.

Also, once per [Scene] as a standard action, you may cause an effect that lasts until the end of the [Encounter] on target creature in [Medium] to instead last until the end of the [Scene]. A successful Will save (DC 10 + ½ your level + your Wis modifier) negates this effect. This is a spell-like ability.

6.0.142 Disciple of Olidammara

The Laughing Rogue does have a domain beyond thievery - he is also the God of Revelry, and his followers can initiate a spiritual ceremony to lure all nearby into a false sense of security
Prerequisite: Blessed by Olidammara, 6th Level
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may heal all creatures in [Medium] range for a number of hit points equal to the total of your Larceny and Stealth modifiers. For the duration of the [Ecounter], you gain a bonus to Stealth and Larceny against all affected creatures equal to half the number of creatures healed.

6.0.143 Disciple of Orcus

Devotees of the Prince of Undeath gain a necrotic touch, which drains their enemies and claims their heart when they die
Prerequisite: Blessed by Orcus, 6th Level
Benefit: You may attack with your unarmed strike as if it was a [Brutal, Sundering, Magnum] weapon, which deals energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor. The first time each [Round] you hit a creature with an unarmed strike using this ability they are [Exhausted] and gain the [Undead] type for one [Round], though you can still damage them with [Negative] effect (they are otherwise healed by Negative and hurt by Positive), a Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM) negates the [Exhausted] condition. If you kill a creature with this ability, you rip out their heart and dissolve it in necrotic energy, and that creature can’t be raised from the dead (but can be turned Undead).

6.0.144 Disciple of Pelor

Devotees of Pelor can channel his light to bring convalescence to those who suffer
Prerequisite: Blessed by Pelor, 6th Level
Benefit: Three times per [Scene], as a move action, you may end the spread of light you create with Blessed by Pelor to heal one ally in the radius for an amount equal to five times your level. This is a [Positive] effect and a Supernatural ability.

6.0.145 Disciple of Pholtus

Pholtus’ devotees can bind their enemies in strings of moonlight, but only along strict geometric patterns
Prerequisite: Blessed by Pholtus, 6th Level
Benefit: Three times per [Scene], as a standard action you may target three enemies in a line originating from you out to your [Medium] range (there must be three in the line). These enemies are [Paralyzed] on a failed Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Wis modifier).

6.0.146 Disciple of Primus

Primus’ devotees are granted an almost robotic devotion to justice, which translates into powerful resistance
Prerequisite: Blessed by Primus, 6th Level
Benefit: Your deflection bonus to AC increases by 1 as you gain a small forcefield around you. At the start of each [Scene], you can choose something for your forcefield to grant to resistance to, you can choose from the following:

  • Choose two energy types. You gain [Resistance] to those energy types
  • You gain [Immunity] to [Fear] effects and the in-combat use of the Intimidate skill
  • You gain a +4 bonus to saves against [Binding] effects
  • You gain [Immunity] to [Prone], [Blown Away], [Knocked Down] and any other forced movement

6.0.147 Disciple of Theodore Tolvaire

The God of Madness grants his few devoted followers the ability to truly impose madness on the living.
Prerequisite: Blessed by Theodore Tolvaire, 6th Level
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you may cause all creatures except you in [Long] range to become [Confused] until the start of your next turn. Creatures [Confused] this way ignore the rule about ‘jerks’, instead acting purely on the basis of the percentile table.

6.0.148 Disciple of Tiamat

Tiamat’s devotees can create a wave of pure destructive energy
Prerequisite: Blessed by Tiamat, 6th Level
Benefit: Five times per [Encounter], as a move action or as part of a move action you may create a wedge out to 15 ft. You destroy all mundane obstacles in that wedge and all enemies in the wedge take damage equal to your KOM which ignores [Resistance] and [Damage reduction]. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.149 Disciple of Vecna

Vecna’s devout have access to deeper and darker secrets than simple acolytes, and can wield the power of shadow to further conceal their own powers.
Prerequisite: 6th Level, Blessed by Vecna
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action you may target a creature you have a bonus of at least +3 to DCs against from Blessed by Vecna. You speak a dark secret about that creature, and they must make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Int modifier) or be [Dazed] for one [Round].

When you use the second ability of Blessed by Vecna, if your Larceny check is successful against every opponent in [Medium] range, you gain 10% [Miss chance]. This stacks with itself up to 50% and expires at the end of the [Encounter].

6.0.150 Disciple of Voladeron

The Tidal Force bestows his mightiest outriders with the ability to create waves of pure force, matching the tsunami that began his legend
Prerequisite: Blessed by Voladeron, 6th Level
Benefit: Once per [Round] you may give a melee attack you make the [Volley] descriptor, applying the attack to all creatures in a 30 ft cone originating from you. This attack does magical damage, which ignores all [Resistance] to magic. Any creature killed by this attack has its body completely destroyed, and cannot be resurrected except by the miracle spell.

6.0.151 Prophet of Archinus [Iconic]

The High Paladin of Archinus can push their limits even further than most of His disciples, and can channel their divine fervour into a near-unblockable mighty charge, which comes with Kraken tentacles… for some reason
Prerequisite: Disciple of Archinus, 12th Level
Benefit: Your bonus to attack rolls from Blessed by Archinus now stacks up to +8. As a standard action make a Charge action, with the bonus to attack rolls from Blessed by Archinus doubled. If the attack hits, you conjure eight tentacles from the ether, each of which targets a different creature within 50 ft of you which was not the target of your Charge and deals energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor equal to four times your Cha modifier.

6.0.152 Prophet of Arthrus [Iconic]

Only the Rightborn King of all Albion may be the Prophet of the Once and Future King, and for his devotion he is awarded the ability to enhance Excalibur and grant eight chosen Knights an additional blessing on their armaments
Prerequisite: Disciple of Arthrus, 12th Level
Benefit: Choose any weapon enchantment (up to 3 points), one weapon you are attuned to of your choice always has this enchantment. Also, you may choose up to eight allies (you may change this between [Scenes]), each gains a 2 point enchantment on one magical weapon they wield of their choice.

6.0.153 Prophet of Asmodeus [Iconic]

In every polity, there will be one cultist of Asmodeus more powerful than all others, and Asmodeus will ensure that they remain as one of the highest powers around.
Prerequisite: Disciple of Asmodeus, 12th Level
Benefit: You treat your level as two higher for all level-dependent variables and calculations.

6.0.154 Prophet of Astiablor [Iconic]

Astiablor’s criteria for choosing her Prophet are simple. The wealthiest Blue Dragon in existence is given the designation, and its power
Prerequisite: Disciple of Astiablor, 12th Level
Benefit: You can equip an additional Relic. When you reach 17th level, you may instead equip an additional Artefact.

6.0.155 Prophet of Baalzebul [Iconic]

Baalzebul’s Prophet loses the integrity of their own physical form, to match the punishment inflicted upon their Infernal master. But, having a body made of diabolic vermin has its benefits
Prerequisite: Disciple of Baalzebul, 12th Level
Benefit: When you die, you become a [Small] Grunt Myriad of level equal to your own and the Fly movement move, at maximum hit points, with 2d6 bodies. Whenever damage you inflict in this form kills an opponent, you gain 3d6 bodies. If you ever have 20 bodies, you return to life as yourself at maximum hit points.

6.0.156 Prophet of Bahamut [Iconic]

Bahamut’s mightiest follower becomes his platinum-skinned Prophet, tasked with ensuring all have the power they need to survive
Prerequisite: Disciple of Bahamut, 12th Level
Benefit: You gain an item bonus to your AC equal to the number of circles you possess in your Fast track from your platinum scales.

As a standard action once per [Encounter], you may bless all your allies in [Medium] range who have lower combined ability scores than you. Blessed allies can take an additional action of any type on their next turn, and with that action may use any of your abilities. An ally using your ability can choose to either use your modifiers for the ability to substitute in theirs. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.157 Prophet of Baphomet [Iconic]

Baphomet grants the follower that best pleases him the power to roar with his own voice, inciting a berserk rage in all mortals who hear it
Prerequisite: Disciple of Bahamut, 12th Level
Benefit: Twice per [Scene], as a standard action, you may enrage all creatures in [Medium] range for the next two [Rounds]. Enraged creatures, on their turn, must use every action to either make an offensive action, reduce a creature’s defences, or increase the power of an offensive action they will take. The target for any offensive action is chosen at random from all creatures within the range of that ability or attack.
