A successful Will save (DC=10 + ½ your character level + your Con modifier) negates the berserked state.

6.0.158 Prophet of Boccob [Iconic]

Boccob’s most devoted seeker of knowledge is granted a magical secret of one of the most powerful spells
Prerequisite: Disciple of Boccob, 12th Level
Benefit: Choose a 7th circle spell. You may cast that spell once per [Quest]. Once per day, you may attempt a DC 35 Knowledge check (of any kind) to unearth a great secret to share with Boccob, granting an additional use of the spell for the [Quest]. You may have no more than three uses per [Quest] though.

6.0.159 Prophet of the Eight Wings [Iconic]

Akoris grants the High Priest of the Sezai with the power to castigate foes in sand, while Nebet grants them her most powerful wings.
Prerequisite: Disciple of the Eight Winds, 12th level
Benefit: You gain the Fly and Soar movement modes. Whenever you hit an opponent with a melee attack while you are both inside the spread you created with Disciple of the Eight Wings, you may cause them to be unable to move for one [Round]. This can only affect one opponent at once, and they may make a Reflex save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your Con modifier) to negate the effect and gain [Immunity] to this effect for the [Encounter].

6.0.160 Prophet of Falazure [Iconic]

Falazure’s prophet is the only one that she spares from her bespoke poisons and viruses, as long as they are always there to monitor the disease’s progess.
Prerequisite: Disciple of Falazure, 12th level
Benefit: When you kill a a creature, you lose an amount of [HP reduction] equal to that creature’s [HP reduction]. You may then inflict a total amount of [HP reduction] equal to the amount that creature had evenly spread on all creatures (including you) in [Close] range.

6.0.161 Prophet of Gruumsh [Iconic]

The most powerful Eyes of Gruumsh are not just his tools, but his avatars on the Material Plane, indomitable and fearsome
Prerequisite: Disciple of Gruumsh, 12th level
Benefit: All creatures in your [Melee] range with lower Strength scores than you are [Shaken]. If their Strength is more than 10 points less than yours, they are [Frightened], and if it is more than 20 points less than yours, they are [Panicked]. The effect ends as soon as they are no longer in your [Melee] range. When you make a melee attack against a creature with a higher Strength score than you, you gain a bonus to Strength equal to twice the difference between your two Strength scores for that attack.

6.0.162 Prophet of Heironeous [Iconic]

The High Paladin of Heironeous can push their limits even further than most of His disciples, and can channel their divine fervour into a near-unblockable mighty smite
Prerequisite: Disciple of Heironeous, 12th Level
Benefit: Your bonus to attack rolls from Blessed by Heironeous now stacks up to +8. As a standard action make a single melee attack roll, with the bonus to attack rolls from Blessed by Heironeous doubled. If the attack hits, it deals additional damage equal to your bonus to attack rolls from Blessed by Heironeous multiplied by your Cha modifier.

6.0.163 Prophet of Io [Iconic]

Io selects a most dedicated follower to become his Prophet, a being dedicated solely to ensuring Balance, and with the power to bring it
Prerequisite: Disciple of Io, 12th level
Benefit: As a standard action three times per [Scene], you may total the current HP of all creatures in [Long] range and divide it by the number of creatures in [Long] range. Each of those creatures’ HP becomes that result. Any HP over their maximum HP becomes temporary hit points. This is a spell-like ability.

6.0.164 Prophet of Jubilex [Iconic]

Jubilex does not select its Prophet. Rather, the disciple of the Demon Prince who most strongly desires the position will be rewarded for their primal hunger
Prerequisite: Disciple of Jubilex, 12th level
Benefit: Any creature [Grappled] by you loses all benefits of all items they are attuned to. You may gain the benefit of up to one item of each rank currently attuned to a creature which is [Grappled] by you.

6.0.165 Prophet of Kord [Iconic]

Kords’ mightiest, most inspiring follower is designated as his Prophet, becoming a paragon of the God’s ideals of physical perfection.
Prerequisite: Disciple of Kord, 12th Level
Benefit: Your Unarmed Strike gains a further three weapon properties of your choice, your speed increases by 20 ft, you gain a +3 bonus to all saving throws, 2 additional HP per level, and [Damage reduction] equal to your highest physical ability modifier.

6.0.166 Prophet of Lolth [Iconic]

Queens of the Drow are inherently Prophets of Lolth, able to bring a fraction of the Demonweb Pits into the material plane.
Prerequisite: Disciple of Lolth, 12th Level
Benefit: Whenever you hit with an attack against a [Flat-footed], [Entangled], [Confused], [Dazed], [Stunned], [Shaken], [Frightened], [Panicked] or [Cowering] creature, you may conjure webs centred on them. These webs are a 30 ft radius of difficult terrain. For any opponent in the radius when it is created, or when a creature who was not there when it was created enters the radius, they must make a Reflex save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) or become [Entangled] for two [Rounds] and take a -1d8+1 penalty to a random ability score for the [Encounter] (which can be removed with your other penalties caused by Disciple of Lolth).

6.0.167 Prophet of Malcanthet [Iconic]

The most powerful cultists of Malcanthet can expand their control over their Charmed victims
Prerequisite: Disciple of Malcanthet, 12th Level
Benefit: You may completely control the actions of a creature you have Charmed with Prophet of Malcanthet. If you do, they may make a Will save at the end of their turn to end the effect - with the same penalty to Will saves if they remain in your [Melee] range.

6.0.168 Prophet of Mammon [Iconic]

The desire of Mammon’s prophet breaks the laws of reality itself, being able to steal away experience from their foes and implant it into a serpentine facsimile
Prerequisite: Disciple of Mammon, 12th Level
Benefit: When you succeed on your stealing ability from Disciple of Mammon, you may instead steal one of the target’s Tracks. They lose all benefits from one of their Tracks of your choice, and cannot use any ability of that Track. When you do this, create a Small Expert Mook of level equal to yours, adjacent to you and with the stolen Track. This Mook acts on your turn under your control, and must remain within your [Medium] range (if you are forcibly moved out of [Medium] range of it, it will move to the edge of your [Medium] range immediately). If it is killed, the target of this ability gets their Track back.

6.0.169 Prophet of Olidammara [Iconic]

The legendary Prince of Thieves, the Prophet of Olidammara, is actually a network of devoted disciples of the Laughing Rogue, all of whom can slip seamlessly in and out of shadow
Prerequisite: Disciple of Olidammara, 12th Level
Benefit: As a free action on your turn, you may become or cease being [Invisible].

6.0.170 Prophet of Orcus [Iconic]

Orcus’ mightiest follower is blessed with the power to wrest life from their enemies in the heat of battle, bending them to their will
Prerequisite: Disciple of Orcus, 12th Level
Benefit: Twice per [Scene], on a successful attack with your unarmed strike using the Disciple of Orcus ability, you may force your target to make Fortitude save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your KOM). If it fails, you rip out their heart immediately. That creature gains the [Undead] type permanently; though you can still damage them with [Negative] effects (they are otherwise healed by Negative and hurt by Positive). As long as you hold their heart, you may use an action to instead force the creature to use that action to use any ability you choose that they can with that action. If the heart is destroyed at any time (you can as a free action while you hold it), they take energy damage with the [Negative] descriptor equal to six times your level, this is a [Death] effect. Any creature that hits you with an attack may instead hit the heart while you hold it or have it on your person in any way, which immediately destroys it. This is a supernatural ability.

6.0.171 Prophet of Pelor [Iconic]

Every few decades, Pelor designates one of his most loyal followers as his Prophet, one to bring his light to all the world
Prerequisite: Disciple of Pelor, 12th Level
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action, you create a burst of holy light with radius out to your [Medium] range. All opponents in the radius take damage equal to half the difference between your maximum and current HP and all allies heal equal to that amount. Creatures may make a Will save (DC=10 + ½ your level + your Cha modifier) to negate the damage taken. This is a Supernatural ability.

6.0.172 Prophet of Primus [Iconic]

The greatest enforcer of cosmic law among Primus’ followers is given the ultimate ability to bring the order of Mechanus into the Material Plane
Prerequisite: Disciple of Primus, 12th Level
Benefit: As a swift action three times per [Scene] you may gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and AC for one [Round] and create a spread out to your [Long] range that lasts for one [Round]. All rolls made in the spread are treated as their average result, rounded up (so all d20 rolls are 11 for example).

6.0.173 Prophet of Theodore Tolvaire [Iconic]

Scholars of esoterica tell tales of a frozen corpse in fine garments who teleports throughout the Material Plane with a host of frogs, spreading the near-incomprehensible word of his divine patron
Prerequisite: Disciple of Theodore Tolvaire, 12th Level
Benefit: All movement you make is a [Warp], and as a move action you may swap places (as a [Warp]) with any creature you know of in [Long] range (even if you do not have line of effect). When you do so, you may swap appearances with that creature until the end of the [Scene], a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM) negates the appearance swap but not the forced movement.

6.0.174 Prophet of Tiamat [Iconic]

Tiamat chooses one Dragonkin to be her Prophet, gaining destructive power beyond compare if they destroy Tiamat’s foes – old and new
Prerequisite: Disciple of Tiamat, 12th Level
Benefit: You gain a pool of Destruction Points per [Scene] equal to five times your KOM. Whenever you make an attack or use an offensive ability, you may spend Destruction Points up to your KOM to increase the attack roll or save DC by an amount equal to the number of points spent.

6.0.175 Pierce the Veil [Combat]

As well as being a fan of loud music, you’ve developed a skill for getting around illusory defences and other magical obfuscation
Prerequisite: 6th Level
Benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to attack rolls, and every time you make an attack – hit or miss – against a creature with [Miss chance], you reduce their [Miss chance] by 5% until the end of the [Encounter]

6.0.176 Plus Ultra [Skill]

Your great feats inspire yourself to even greater heights!
Prerequisite: Three physical skills trained
Benefit: Whenever you succeed on a physical skill check of DC equal to at least 20 + your level, without taking 20, you gain a Plus Ultra Charge. At any time, you may spend three Plus Ultra Charges to reroll a physical skill check, before you know if it was a success or failure.

6.0.177 Pommel Smash [Combat]

You have learned a risky manoeuvre for when the chips are down: Leave yourself open, and if the bait is taken transfer your useless momentum into a blunt stunning strike
Prerequisite: BAB +6
Benefit: When you make an attack action in which you use all of your iterative attacks, all attacks were made as melee attacks against the same target, and all of the attacks missed, you may provoke an attack of opportunity from the target of those attacks. If the target makes an attack of opportunity and they miss, they become [Dazed] for one [Round] unless they succeed on a Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your level + your KOM).

6.0.178 Predator [Combat]

You thirst for the kill, pursuing your attacks with unbridled ferocity and lashing out when you strike a foe down
Prerequsite: 6th Level
Benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to attack rolls. When you reduce an enemy below 0 HP, you may use your attack of opportunity for the [Round] to make an immediate single melee attack against an enemy in [Melee] range, at a +4 bonus.

6.0.179 Primal [Iconic]

You are a creature who has been reverted to a previous evolutionary stage by Heartsinger magic
Benefit: Whenever you hit with an attack which would have any additional effect besides damage, you may forgo any number of those effects to instead deal bonus damage equal to the total circle number that effects forgone came from (Feats count as 2nd circle, Lesser items as 1st circle, Greater items as 3rd, Relics as 4th and Artefacts as 6th). You may not gain a bonus of more than twice your KOM on a single attack.

6.0.180 Provocateur [Skill]

Your annoying presence means your enemies actively stumble over each other to fight you
Prerequisite: Larceny or Bluff trained
Benefit: As a move action, you may make a Bluff or Larceny check targeting two opponents you have line of sight to. If the check beats both targets’ Bluff Defence or Awareness respectively, switch the initiative placement of the two opponents.

6.0.181 Psychic Magister

You are trained in the psychic arts, being able to bring overwhelming focus to bare
Benefit: Choose one track you have which has at least one power or psi-like ability which forces a save. You gain a +2 feat bonus to the DC of saves against abilities from that track. Also, whenever you roll on a 50% or greater [Miss chance], you may reroll once.

6.0.182 Razing Strike

You can combine your magical charge and your assassin’s skill to inflict a terrible arcane blow on a foe
Prerequisite: Assassin Tack, Spellcasting Track, 9th level
Benefit: As a swift action, you may spend a spell slot of any circle you know. If you do, the next time you make an attack against an opponent subject to your Sneak Attack ability, you gain a bonus to attack rolls on that attack equal to the circle of spell slot you used, and deal an additional 1d6 damage per circle used up. That attack also does magical damage instead of the type it would normally do, and treats any [Resistance] to this damage as one lower per circle spent.

6.0.183 Reactive Heal

Sometimes pessimism is realism
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
Benefit: As a swift action, choose an ally in [Medium] range. If they take damage before your next turn, you immediately heal them for 1d4 hit points per two character levels (minimum 2d4).

6.0.184 Ready to Go

You are uniquely sensitive to the feeling of invincibility that comes with full healing
Prerequisite: BAB +3
Benefit: When you are healed for at least 20 hit points at once and reach maximum hit points, you gain a +15 ft bonus to movement speed, +1 to all saving throws, and a +4 bonus to damage rolls for one [Round].

6.0.185 Recall Point [Skill]

Soujourners in the school of Chronomancy can use a limited version of the famous Rewind spell to get out of tricky situations
Prerequisite: 9th Level
Benefit: Once per [Encounter], while moving you can designate a space you move through as your Recall Point until the end of the [Encounter]. As a standard action while your Recall Point is unoccupied, you may [Warp] to it.

6.0.186 Regroup and Refresh

You can direct your allies on the battlefield to disengage and rest for a breath
Prerequisite: 14 Int or War Master track or White Raven track
Benefit: When you move with a move action and haven’t used any partial move actions, you may move only 15 ft. If you do, one ally who you moved close to with line of sight to you may make three 5 ft steps towards you, and if you are now in [Close] range of each other you both gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

6.0.187 Revived [Iconic]

For some reason, you know that you were once dead. Your body is a resurrected one, or perhaps reincarnated. In any case, this gives you a closeness to death which few can match.
Benefit: You gain [Immunity] to [Negative], and any [Negative] damage you would take heals you for that amount instead. When you are killed by going below your Con score in negative hit points, you may make a Foritude save (DC = damage done by the attack which reduced you below the threshold). If you succeed, you survive (another attack that reduces you below the threshold will still kill you). Whenever you do, you gain a random piece of knowledge from either your past life, or the past life of any of the dead (you do not know which).

With a minute of effort, you may talk to a [Dead] creature, asking it a number of simple yes or no questions equal to the number of circles you have in your Fast track. The creature answers to the best of its knowledge in life. You can only talk to each [Dead] creature once.

6.0.188 Ronin [Iconic]

With no master or house and your honour in tatters, you are a Samurai with nothing left to live for, and throw yourself into battle as only a man with nothing to lose can
Prerequisite: Bushido track.
Benefit: As a move action (where part of the move action is to use Bushido), you may cause any pen¬alty to attack rolls from Bushido you are suffering to become a penalty to your Armor Class instead. (This penalty still may not exceed any limit applied by the Track.) If an attack roll of an attack targeting you would be compared to a value other than your Armor Class, you suffer a penalty to that value equal to half of the penalty from Bushido against that attack.

6.0.189 Saviour [Skill]

You are always ready to come riding in on your mighty steed to rescue allies in distress
Prerequisite: Ride trained
Benefit: When an ally starts riding your Personal Mount, for the next two [Rounds] they can use the higher of the two of your AC, saves and [Damage reduction]. A given creature can only benefit from this effect for a total of two [Rounds] in each [Encounter].

6.0.190 Show Me Ya Moves!

Hyah! Yes! Falcon Kick! Hraagh!
Prerequisite: Discipline of the Kirin, Vigilante, 6th Level
Benefit: Can gain access to the following abilities:

  • Falcon Kick: When you make your Falcon Punch attack, you may make is as a Brutal Kick, with the same +3 bonus to attack and tripled damage
  • Knee of Justice: When you make an attack action against a [Flying] enemy, you may instead make a single unarmed attack. On a hit it deals bonus energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to twice your level and inflicts [Blown away].
  • Yes!: When you use Brutal Kick that isn’t a Falcon Kick against a [Flying] opponent, you may make that attack a Grapple attempt. If the target is successfully [Grappled], they immediately stop being [Grappled] and take energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to twice your level, and you both move 10 ft away from each other.

6.0.191 Song Name? [Iconic]

Dun dun dun dun dun dun dun dun do do do do do do do do do da da da da da do do dun dun
Prerequisite: Minstrel Track, Meteomancy Track
Benefit: Whenever you use a Minstrel ability, the Weather becomes Sandstorm. Instead of all allies, the Sandstorm weather affects all enemies in the [Encounter], at the start of your turn it deals damage to them equal to your TAM. This increases to equal to your level (or your TAM if still higher) when you reach your 4th circle in Meteomancy, and to the total of your level and TAM when you reach your 6th circle. Any other effect based on the Weather treats it as Sun, but Cloud Nine does physical damage instead of energy damage in the Sandstorm Weather.

6.0.192 Step of the Wind

You wander lightly as a cloud, and strike precisely against those who have trouble with the terrain
Benefit: Moving out of a square of difficult terrain does not cost you any movement, and you gain a +2 feat bonus to attacks against creatures currently in difficult terrain for whom moving out of it does cost extra movement.

6.0.193 Step of the Dancing Moth

You now move on the air just above the ground, your footfalls not even making a sound
Prerequisite: Step of the Wind
Benefit: You now walk about 5 ft above the ground, so you cannot be attacked in [Melee] by [Small] creatures unless their reach is more than 5 ft, and you do not take any penalty to Stealth checks for moving more than half speed.

6.0.194 Strider [Skill]

You are really good at tracking. It somehow involves a lot of eating dirt and weird stuff like that. Your allies aren’t sure if you’re messing with them or not
Prerequisite: Nature trained
Benefit: When you succeed on a Nature check to track a creature, you may learn things about it as though you got that result on a Knowledge check about the creature. On a success, you also know exactly how old the tracks you are following are and, if the creature is in your [Extreme] range, its exact location within a 50 ft radius of error.

6.0.195 Subtle Knife [Guild]

Either through an enchanted weapon or pure magical energy, you can open up portals between Planes
Prerequisite: 12th Level
Benefit: With thirty minutes of effort, you may either open up a portal in [Melee] range to target Plane which takes up a 5 ft space and lasts for ten [Rounds], or instantly teleport (after the incantation) up to six target creatures in [Melee] range to target Plane. This has a 5% chance per level you are under 18 to accidentally transport you to a random Plane within two steps of the target Plane.

6.0.196 Superhuman Strength

Your natural statistics go beyond normal scales!
Prerequisite: 28 or higher in a base ability score.
Benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to an ability score of your choice.

6.0.197 Swift Pact

Under duress, you have been known to draw Seals quickly and speak just as fast
Prerequisite: Binder Track
Benefit: Once per [Scene], you may draw a seal and bind with a Vestige with a single standard action. You are counted as voluntarily failing the interaction check to make the Pact.

6.0.198 Take the Grenade

Your heroism is so magnetic that you can absord even huge explosions in such a way that only you are affected
Benefit: When you are in a spread or other area of effect, you may voluntarily take the effect twice, failing any relevant saves voluntarily, to negate the effects of the spread or area of effect for all other allies that would otherwise be affected that [Round].

6.0.199 The Chad [Iconic]

> Relies on buffs to succeed, needs to be careful of positioning, gets cucked by the guy with Smiting

> Needs no assistance to carry the team, walks up to enemies, refuses to elaborate
Benefit: As a swift action, you may immediately remove all beneficial spells and other effects that are currently affecting you, and target an opponent within [Close] range. That opponents takes a penalty to AC and d20 rolls equal to the number of effects you removed (up to a maximum of the number of circles you have in your Fast track) for two [Rounds].

6.0.200 The Metal [Iconic]

Within the Dreamsong is a mass of chaotic feeling. Almost lost, it persists, always ready to rebel against power, and be called upon to strike down The Man.
Prerequisite: Chirurgic Poet 3rd Circle.
Benefit: Whenever The Dream Endures activates, you may inflict a -2 penalty to AC for the [Encounter] on a creature within [Close] range. When The World Bends activates, if you use it on an ally and it is the third time in the [Round] you have targeted that ally, they may make an immediate single melee attack. Whenever The Heart Beckons activates, it also deals damage equal to twice your KOM to all creatures that are [Entangled].

6.0.201 The True Motto [Iconic]

It’s to INFECT the world with devastation!
Prerequisite: Henchman Track, 6th level
Benefit: Your 3rd and 4th circle abilities from the Henchman track become the following:

3rd Circle – Infect the World With DevastationEX: As a standard action, choose any number of opponents in [Medium] range suffering from any of the following conditions: [Battered], [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Cowering], [Dazed], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Entangled], [Exhausted], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Nauseated], [Panicked], [Paralyzed], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], or [Stunned]. Any of those conditions with a duration of two [Rounds] or more have their duration increased by one [Round], and cannot be removed by any means other than a save being made successfully against them. A successful Will save (DC = 10 + ½ your character level + your KOM) negates this effect.

4th Circle – Blight All Peoples in Every NationEX: Once per [Encounter], as a standard action choose an opponent within [Medium] range. All penalties to attack rolls, skill checks, AC, or saving throws affecting that opponent now affect all opponents within [Medium] range for the next two [Rounds].

6.0.202 Thicket of Blades [Combat]

Your weapon seems to always be exactly where it needs to be to get in the way of your opponent’s movement and spells.
Prerequisite: Base Attack Bonus +6.
Benefit: You may make an additional attack of opportunity every [Round].

6.0.203 Iron Guard’s Glare

Your presence on the battlefield is so strong your opponents are unable to find purchase with attacks on anyone else.
Prerequisite: Thicket of Blades.
Benefit: Creatures moving through your [Melee] range always provoke an attack of opportunity, even if it is a 5 ft step. Creatures in your [Melee] range take a -4 penalty to attack rolls against any target except you.

6.0.204 Trance of Battle [Combat]

You enter a meditative state of complete focus when blood is shed
Prerequisite: BAB +6
Benefit: You gain 1 focus point at the start of each [Round] of combat. From the fifth [Round] onwards, you gain 2 focus points, and from the tenth [Round] 3 points, and so on. During an attack action you may spend any number of focus points to gain a feat bonus to attack rolls equal to the number of points you spent.

6.0.205 Travel Across the Land [Iconic]

You are on a quest to find every ’mon you can across the world, and with the help of your best friends, you’re gonna find ’em all!
Prerequisite: Nature and Geography trained.
Benefit: Whenever you see (in the flesh) a species of creature you have not encountered before, gain an Encylopedia point. For every 15 Encyclopedia points you have, at the start of each [Quest] you may gain an additional Lesser Consumable. Each time you reach a milestone of a multiple of 50 Encyclopedia points, you may choose the 1st circle of any track. You gain that circle, though you always count as 1st circle for its purposes. When you reach 151, 251, 386, 493, 649, 721, 809 or 890 Encyclopedia Points, you can choose a 3rd or 2nd circle of any track, and immediately gain an Artifact Consumable of your choice.

6.0.206 Searching Far and Wide

You understand the power that’s inside
Prerequisite: Travel Across the Land
Benefit: If you observe a habitat for an hour, you can determine what each species of creature that lives here (but not temporary visitors) is. You can remember and access at any time the exact statistics of every creature you have defeated in combat.

6.0.207 Tyrant [Iconic]

The masses cower beneath your feet, oppressed by your grip of terror
Benefit: [Fear] effects originating from you can now cause opponents with [Immunity] to [Fear] to be [Shaken], although they retain [Immunity] to all other [Fear] effects. Additionally, whenever an opponent within [Long] range of you fails a saving throw against a [Fear] effect, they take magic damage equal to your KOM that surpasses all forms of [Resistance].

6.0.208 Ventus Saltare [Iconic]

Some Merchants can summon huge triple bursts of wind to rend their enemies. Naysayers will say it’s not ‘optimal’, but that’s because they don’t respect cute Merchant girls and their cool unique spears enough
Prerequisite: Merchant Track, Arcane Magister, 6th level
Benefit: As a standard action while this ability is not already active, you may create a 10 ft wide line going from one edge of your [Medium] range to the other. This line lasts for three [Rounds], and at the end of each [Round], a huge burst of magical wind will affect all creatures in the line, dealing 1d8 damage per your character level and causing all damaged creatures to be [Blown away] out of the line. A successful Reflex save (DC 12 + 1/2 your level + your Cha modifier) halves the damage and negates [Blown away]. This is a spell-like ability.

6.0.209 Veteran Soldier

Experience brings many benefits, but one which is often overlooked is the stamina that a real veteran has. Where others start to flag, you find your second wind.
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
Benefit: At the start of the 5th [Round] of an [Encounter], roll a d4. If the result is a 4 or higher, you heal hit points equal to twice your level and may either regain the use of a once per [Encounter] ability or heal hit points equal to twice your level again. At the start of every subsequent [Round], roll the d4 again for the same benefit but with a +1 bonus for each previous [Round] in a row where you did not gain the benefit.

6.0.210 When I’m Angry [Combat]

There is one specific circumstance in which people will dislike you
Prerequisite: 6th Level
Benefit: You gain a +2 feat bonus to attack rolls. This increases to +5 for one [Round] the first time in an [Encounter] you go below one quarter of your maximum HP.

6.0.211 Yaksha [Iconic]

Donning the mask of a demon, your contained rage blossoms forth with divine power that eats away at you just as it does your enemies
Prerequisite: Rage Track, 6th level
Benefit: When you enter a Rage, you no longer gain temporary hit points, and instead take that much [HP reduction], and at the start of every turn in the Rage you take damage equal to twice your level. In return, while in a Rage you gain a [Bonus attack], a +5 ft bonus to movement speed per circle you have in Rage, your bonus to damage rolls from Rage doubles, and your bonus to attack rolls increases by the number of even circles you have in Rage.

6.0.212 You’re Approaching Me? [Combat]

They can’t beat the shit out of you without getting any closer, and that’s exactly what you’re counting on
Benefit: When you prepare an action to make a melee attack when a creature enters your [Melee] range, you gain a +4 fury bonus to that attack roll, and a +8 fury bonus to any damage rolls from that attack. This applies only to the first melee attack roll made as part of the prepared action.

7 Spells

7.1 Spell Lists

7.1.1 Cleric

1st Circle

  • Cure Light Wounds - Restore 2d4 HP, +2 per level, and remove one condition from an ally
    • Reversal: Inflict Light Wounds - Deal 2d6 damage, +2 per level to an opponent
  • Sanctuary - Opponents must make a Will save to make an offensive action against touched creature until it takes an offensive action
  • Shield of Faith - Touched creature gains a +2 deflection bonus to AC, +1 per 6 levels
  • Deathwatch - Know whether each nearby creature is alive, dying, undead, below half, below a quarter and below 10 HP
  • Remove Fear - Remove [Fear] effects from a target and give them a bonus to saves against [Fear] effects
  • Ressistance - Target gains a +1 bonus on all saves, +1 per 8 levels
  • Bless - Allies gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and will saves
    • Reversal: Bane - Enemies take a -1 penalty to attack rolls and will saves

2nd Circle

  • Cure Moderate Wounds - Restore 2d4 HP, +3 per level, and remove one condition from an ally
    • Reversal: Inflict Moderate Wounds - Deal 2d6 damage, +3 per level to an opponent
  • Augury - Learn whether an action taken in the next half an hour would have immediately good or bad results (or both), with a small chance of failure
  • Calm Emotions - Creatures who fail a Will save cannot take offensive actions until a nearby creature does, also staves off [Fear], [Confused], and Fury bonuses
  • [Summon Monste]r - Summon a Mook with limited abilities
  • Silence - Target creature can’t cast for one [Round]
  • Locate Object - Know the location of a specific item you have seen, or a general class of item, within [Long] range.
  • Lesser Restoration - Remove two conditions from an ally

3rd Circle

  • Cure Serious Wounds - Restore 3d4 HP, +4 per level, and remove two conditions from an ally
    • Reversal: Inflict Serious Wounds - Deal 3d6 damage, +4 per level to an opponent
  • Animate Dead - Raise a corpse as a Skeleton or Zombie Mook with no abilities
  • Magic Circle - Allies nearby gain +2 to AC and saves, immunity to [Mind-affecting] and cannot be affected by summoned creatures of a certain category, and those summoned creatures can’t cross the circle.
  • Death Ward - Creatures gain [Immunity] to [Death] effects and [Energy drained]
  • Wind Wall - Create a 10ft/level wall which causes creatures passing through to be [Blown away] and gives attacks going through it a 50% [Miss chance]
  • Sending - Send a short instant message to anyone
  • Prayer - Allies get +1 on all d20 rolls, opponents get -1 on all d20 rolls

4th Circle

  • Cure Critical Wounds - Restore 4d4 HP, +5 per level, and remove two conditions from an ally
    • Reversal: Inflict Critical Wounds - Deal 4d6 damage, +4 per level to an opponent
  • Restoration - Remove four conditions from an ally
  • Holy Divination - Gain useful advice about an action within the next week, with a small chance of failure
  • Symbol of Sleep - Symbol is triggered under specific circumstances and makes nearby creatures [Helpless] until aroused magically or by taking damage
  • Plane Shift - Shifts up to 8 willing creatures to another Plane, but not to a particular point on that Plane
  • Scrying - Spy on a creature or area from a great distance
  • Hold Monster - Creature is rendered [Paralyzed]

5th Circle

  • Heal - Restore 5d4 HP, +6 per level, and remove three conditions from an ally
    • Reversal: Harm - Deal 7 damage per level to an opponent
  • Holy Aura - Nearby allies gain [Damage reduction], a bonus to saves, and cause attacking opponents to be [Blinded]
  • Symbol of Pain - Symbol is triggered under specific circumstances and gives nearby creatures a -4 penalty to d20 rolls.
  • Raise Dead - Return a dead creature to life
  • Animate Objects - Cause nearby objects to become a Myriad under your control
  • True Seeing - See through darkness, [Glamers] and [Figments]
  • Planar Binding - Summon a creature with a Racial track, but you still need to convince it to help you

6th Circle

  • Hallow - Create a magical field over an area that boosts allies’ spells and hinders opponents’ spells
  • Create Undead - Raise a corpse as an Elite with the Undead track.
  • Blasphemy - Nearby creatures are [Paralyzed] and take a penalty to their KOM based on their level.
  • Brain Spider - Spy on the thoughts of up to 8 creatures, and can give them suggestions
  • Commune - Ask a deity a number of yes/no questions equal to level, getting true answers (to the best of a deity’s knowledge)
  • Greater Restoration - Remove 6 conditions from an ally
  • Symbol of Death - Symbol is triggered under specific circumstances and kills 150 HP worth of creatures

7th Circle

  • Mass Heal - Restore 5d4 HP, +6 per level, and remove three conditions from allies in range
    • Reversal: Mass Harm - Deal 7 damage per level to an opponents in range
  • Miracle - Perform a miracle
  • Storm of Vengeance - Allies are [Concealed], enemies are [Deafened], damaged by [Acid], or struck by [Electricity] at random
  • Astral Projection - You enter suspended animation and create a projection that can cast spells, but you can be killed if an incorporeal cord between you and it is broken
  • Antimagic Field - All non-extraordinary abilities in the area fail
  • Gate - Either summon a creature from another Plane or create a permanent thoroughfare for travel between two Planes.

7.1.2 Shaman

1st Circle

  • Jump - Creature gets a +10 to Acrobatics checks for Jumping
  • Shillelagh - Create a magical staff with notable reach

2nd Circle

  • Flaming Sphere - Summon a sphere you can move with deals 1d6/level damage
  • Quench - Remove magic on one item you can see for the [Encounter]

3rd Circle

  • Spike Stones - Create an area of difficult terrain which deals damage when crossed
  • Nature’s Might - Target gains a +4 bonus to a statistic of your choice

4th Circle

  • Cone of Cold - Creatures in a wedge take 1d10 cold damage per level
  • Meld into Stone - Gain the Burrow movement mode

5th Circle

  • Chain Lightning - Lightning bolt deals 1d6/level damage to a target, and one secondary bolt per level strikes another nearby target
  • Fire Seeds - Create berries which can be used as grenades or bombs to explode on command

6th Circle

  • Geas - Give a creature a quest to carry out, even if it is not [Oathsworn] it takes damage each [Scene] it does not work towards fulfilling it

7th Circle

  • Storm of Vengeance - Allies are [Concealed], enemies are [Deafened], damaged by [Acid], or struck by [Electricity] at random

7.1.3 Sorcerer

1st Circle

  • Endure Elements - Creature gains resilience against environmental hazards
  • Shocking Grasp - Make a melee attack roll that ignores armour and deflection and deals 1d6+3 per level energy damage
  • Grease - Create an area of slippery terrain
  • Hypnotism - Entrance 1d4/level levels worth of creatures, gaining a bonus to Diplomacy and making them unable to act until distracted
  • Cause Fear - Target creature is [Shaken], or [Frightened] if low level
  • Enlarge - Double a creature’s size and increase its strength
    • Reversal: Reduce - Half a creature’s size and weaken it
  • Jump - Creature gets a +10 to Acrobatics checks for Jumping

2nd Circle

  • Resist Elements - Creature gains [Lesser resistance] to a specified energy type
    • Reversal: Elemental Vulnerability - Creature gains [Vulnerability] to a specified energy type
  • Darkness - Create a globe of magical darkness
  • Acid Arrow - Fire acid which deals 4d6 damage, and persists for one [Round]/circle
  • Blindness/Deafness - Cause a creature to be [Blinded] and [Deafened]
  • Status - Monitor the location and condition of allies
  • Summon Monster - Summon a Mook with limited abilities
  • Flaming Sphere - Summon a sphere you can move with deals 1d6/level damage

3rd Circle

  • Dispel Magic - End one or two magical effects, dependent on circle
  • Hideous Laughter - Touched opponent falls [Prone] and can’t act while they are laughing
  • Haste - Allies in an area gain a [Bonus attack] and have their movement speed increased
  • Shout - Deal 1d6/level damage to all in [Close] range which bypasses [Lesser resistance] and [Resistance] and inflicts [Deafened]
  • Alter Self - Take the form of another being of the same creature type
  • Fly - Creature gains the ability to fly
  • Knock - Creatures in a cone are damaged and [Blown Away], doors are opened

4th Circle

  • Baleful Polymorph - Creature is transformed into a harmless small animal
  • Wall of Thorns - Create a wall of nearly impassable, deadly thorns
  • Charm Monster - Make a creature friendly to you and your allies if not attacked
  • Dimension Door - [Teleport] yourself and several allies a short distance
  • Mass Enlarge - Double multiple creatures’ size and increase their strength
    • Reversal: Mass Reduce - Half many creatures’ size and weaken them
  • Cloudkill - Creates a cloud which deals constant [HP reduction] and kills very weak creatures
  • Cone of Cold - Creatures in a wedge take 1d10 cold damage per level

5th Circle

  • Acid Fog - Create a cloud of fog which renders creatures within [Concealed], hinders their movement, and corrodes them
  • Planar Binding - Summon a creature with a Racial track, but you still need to convince it to help you
  • Malocchio - At the start of each turn, cause an enemy to be [Sickened] and [Shaken]
  • Mass Suggestion - Compel multiple creatures to follow a simple course of action
  • Sunburst - Burst of light deals 2d6 damage per level and leaves creatures [Blinded]
  • Transformation - Creature gains abilities from Utter Brute, Wildborn, Arthropod, Divine Beast, Sentient Construct or Ooze
  • Chain Lightning - Lightning bolt deals 1d6/level damage to a target, and one secondary bolt per level strikes another nearby target

6th Circle

  • Disintegrate - Single creature takes 7 damage/level and if killed is completely destroyed
  • Polymorph Any Object - Can baleful polymorph, transformation, petrify, change objects into creatures, or transmute a material
  • Bloodwind - Howling wind inflicts [HP reduction] and can also deal damage and inflict [Energy drained]
  • Insanity - Creature is permanently and badly [Confused]
  • Vortex - Create whirlwind that damages and draws creatures within
  • Greater Dispel Magic - As dispel magic but ends higher circle effects
  • Symbol of Death - Symbol is triggered under specific circumstances and kills 150 HP worth of creatures

7th Circle

  • Gate - Either summon a creature from another Plane or create a permanent thoroughfare for travel between two Planes.
  • Shapechange - Gain the abilities of any Track and change your physical form, can change again every [Round].
  • Spell Turning - Creature is warded to reflect several spells back at their caster
  • Meteor Swarm - Fire four orbs which deal 2d6 fire damage per level
  • Dominate Monster - Gain control of target creature
  • Energy Drain - Inflict [Energy drained] 2d4 times

7.1.4 Tactician

1st Circle

  • Deathwatch - Know whether each nearby creature is alive, dying, undead, below half, below a quarter and below 10 HP
  • Hypnotism - Entrance 1d4/level levels worth of creatures, gaining a bonus to Diplomacy and making them unable to act until distracted

2nd Circle

  • Silence - Target creature can’t cast for one [Round]
  • Bigby’s Slapping Palm - Magical hand deals minor damage and knocks a foe [Flat-footed]

3rd Circle

  • Wind Wall - Create a 10ft/level wall which causes creatures passing through to be [Blown away] and gives attacks going through it a 50% [Miss chance]

4th Circle

  • Baleful Polymorph - Creature is transformed into a harmless small animal
  • Symbol of Sleep - Symbol is triggered under specific circumstances and makes nearby creatures [Helpless] until aroused magically or by taking damage
  • Bigby’s Interposing Hand - Hand of force blocks attacks and parries an incoming attack with an Arcana check

5th Circle

  • Animate Objects - Cause nearby objects to become a Myriad under your control
  • Mass Suggestion - Compel multiple creatures to follow a simple course of action
  • Bigby’s Crushing Fist - Magical hand deals constant damage and keeps a foe [Grappled]

6th Circle

  • Brain Spider - Spy on the thoughts of up to 8 creatures, and can give them suggestions

7th Circle

  • Antimagic Field - All non-extraordinary abilities in the area fail

7.2 Spell Descriptions

7.2.1 Acid Arrow

Circle: Sorcerer 2
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Target: Creature within [Medium] range
Duration: 1 [Round] per circle; see text
Saving Throw: Reflex partial; see text

You fire an arrow of long-lasting acid at a foe. This deals 4d6 energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor. For each circle you have in Sorcerer Spellcasting, this acid sticks to the target, and at the start of each of your turns while it persists the target takes another 4d6 energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor. A reflex save prevents this lasting damage, but the target still takes the initial 4d6.

Special: When you learn this spell, you may replace [Acid] above with [Fire], [Electricity] or [Cold]. You may learn this spell multiple times.

7.2.2 Alter Self

Circle: Sorcerer 3
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: Self
Effect: Own altered form
Duration: [Scene]

You alter your own physiology, assuming any form you know of the same creature type as yourself. You can change your size to [Small], [Average] or [Large], choose the general characteristics of your new form within the normal bounds of the species (hair colour, eye colour, horn length, etc.), and can increase your Strength, Dexterity and Constitution by a total of 6 (the 6 points are shared between the stats) for the duration of the form change.

Also, you may gain a natural weapon, the Swim or Fly movement mode, or any other characteristic of the new species which is purely biological and not based on any ability.

7.2.3 Animate Dead

Circle: Cleric 3
Casting time: 1 [Round]
Range: [Melee]
Target: Touched body
Duration: [Encounter]

You infuse a corpse with negative energy and raise it as a Zombie or Skeleton to fight for you. This creature has the [Undead] type and is a Mook of level equal to yours or the creature when alive, whichever is lower. It is under your control, but acts on its own initiative, and can only take one action per [Round].

With a use of a Black Onyx Lesser Consumable, you can cause the creature to exist for one more [Encounter]. At the end of its last [Encounter], the body dissolved into dust.

7.2.4 Animate Objects

Circle: Cleric 5, Tactician 5
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: 4 objects in [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]

You grant a semblance of life to the mundane objects in your surroundings. Choose 4 objects in [Close] range, they become the only bodies of a Myriad of level equal to your own minus 5. This Myriad acts under your control on your turn. At the start of your turn, you may choose another object in [Close] range to become a new body for the Myriad. The objects lose their animation at the end of the [Encounter].

7.2.5 Antimagic Field

Circle: Cleric 7
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Effect: 30 ft radius spread centred within your [Close] range
Duration: [Scene]

You create a monochromatic field with radius 30 ft within your [Close] range. All effects of spells, spell-like abilities and supernatural abilities within the radius end. Spells, spell-like abilities and supernatural abilities cannot be used in the area.

7.2.6 Astral Projection

Circle: Cleric 7, Tactician 7
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Effect: An astral copy of yourself
Duration: [Quest]

You create an astral copy of your spirit which travels independently of you. Your body enters suspended animation, becoming [Helpless], but not needing to eat, drink, sleep or breathe. Then, a copy of you appears in your [Melee] range. The copy has the same statistics as you with the following exceptions: It has no HP (and cannot be damaged), it has the Fly movement mode, and has a 50% [Miss chance].

The copy is completely under your control, but the only actions it can take are to move, change their movement mode, or cast spells. Any attempts to target it hit or seem to have an effect, but it takes no damage, and suffers no conditions. However, there is an [Invisible], [Fully concealed] silver cord coming off it, and also connected to you. This cord occupies its space and yours, and has AC equal to yours and HP equal to yours. It only takes damage if specifically targeted (if someone targets the area it is in but does not know it is there, it is unaffected). If the cord is reduced to 0 HP, you are reduced to -30 HP and become [Dead], and your projection disappears.

The projection can last until the end of a [Quest], or can be dispelled as a free action. At which point you return to your normal state. You also return to your normal state if your projection is ever dispelled.

7.2.7 Augury

Circle: Cleric 2
Casting time: 10 [Rounds]
Effect: Information about one event in the next 30 minutes
Duration: Instantaneous

You make a minor divination that tells you about how one action will result in the immediate future. Say an action, you are then given one of the following responses:

  • Weal: Will have a generally good outcome
  • Woe: Will have a generally bad outcome
  • Weal and Woe: Will have both good and bad outcomes
  • No Response: Will have neutral or no meaningful outcome

This only refers to the effects of the action within the next 30 minutes. Also, there is some chance that there will be no response. The chances of getting an appropriate response are 70% + 1% per your level.

7.2.8 Baleful Polymorph

Circle: Sorcerer 4, Tactician 4
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: Creature within [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Fort negates; see text

You transform a creature into a harmless animal, smaller than a human, of your choice, such as a dog, a toad or a sheep. The target becomes [Helpless], but with the exception that they do not fall [Prone], and can use a move action to move (but can take no other actions). A successful Fortitude save negates this effect, and at the end of their turn, the effected creature may make another Fortitude save to end the effect. If still under the effect at the end of the [Encounter], they must make another Fortitude save, and if failed it lasts until the end of the [Scene]. At the end of the [Scene], they must make another Fortitude save, or it is permanent.

7.2.9 Bigby’s Crushing Fist

Circle: Tactician 5
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Effect: Hand of Force energy
Duration: See text
Save: See text

You summon a great fist which slams into a target then attempts to crush them. Make a ranged attack against a target enemy, which deals 1d12 damage per level plus your KOM, the target must then make a Reflex save against becoming [Grappled]. If the target is [Grappled] at the start of your next turn, they must make a Reflex save against becoming [Pinned] and if they are [Pinned] you may cause damage to them equal to your level without an action once per [Round], as the Choke combat manoeuvre. If at any point the target is not [Grappled] by the spell, the Hand disappears and the spell’s effect ends.

7.2.10 Bigby’s Interposing Hand

Circle: Tactician 4
Casting Time: 1 immediate action
Range: [Medium]
Effect: Hand of Force energy
Duration: [Encounter]

You summon a huge hand on a line between squares/hexes, this hand blocks line of sight and line of effect. If the hand is summoned at a time where it blocks the line of effect of an attack or ability already activated, you may replace the target’s AC or Save against that ability with the result of an Arcana check, as the hand attempts to blocks the attack before it passes through where it would be.

7.2.11 Bigby’s Slapping Palm

Circle: Tactician 2
Casting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Effect: Hand of Force energy
Saving Throw: None

You summon a huge palm of force to knock an enemy off balance, make a ranged attack out to [Close] range which is treated as with a [Brutal 2], [Magnum] weapon which does damage with the [Force] descriptor. If the attack hits, the target is knocked [Flat-footed] for one round.

7.2.12 Blasphemy

Circle: Cleric 6
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: All opponents in [Close] range
Duration: Instantaneous
Saving Throw: Fortitude, see description

You speak a single word of profane or holy power which wracks all your nearby enemies. All opponents in [Close] range are [Paralyzed] until the end of the [Encounter], a successful Fortitude save negates this effect, and they can make a save at the end of each turn as normal. Additionally, they all take a 1d6 penalty to their KOM until the end of the [Encounter]. This increases to 2d6 if they are 2 or more levels below you, to 3d6 if they are 5 or more levels below, and to 5d6 if 10 or more levels below you.

7.2.13 Blindness/Deafness

Circle: Sorcerer 2
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target/Effect: Creature within [Close] range
Duration: Three [Rounds].
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

You use necromantic energy to rob your opponent of their senses. Target creature in [Close] range must make a Fortitude save or be [Blinded] and [Deafened] for three [Rounds].

7.2.14 Brain Spider

Circle: Cleric 6, Tactician 6
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Long]
Target: Up to 8 creatures within [Long] range
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: Will negates

You weave a cerebromantic parasite which allows you to eavesdrop as a standard action on the thoughts of up to eight other creatures at once, hearing as desired:

  • Individual trains of thought in whatever order you desire.
  • Information from all minds about one particular topic, thing, or being, one nugget of information per your level.
  • A study of the thoughts and memories of one creature of the group in detail.

Once per round, if you do not perform a detailed study of one creature’s mind, you can attempt (as a standard action) to implant a suggestion in the mind of any one of the affected creatures. The creature can make another Will save to resist the suggestion, but otherwise attempts to follow the instructions of it unless they are obviously self-destructive.

7.2.15 Calm Emotions

Circle: Cleric 2
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Target: All creatures in [Medium] range
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Will negates

You dampen the emotions of all nearby beings, making them less eager to battle, and even assuaging emotional magic affecting them – but this call comes crashing down if someone breaks the peace. All creatures affected must make a Will save, or be unable to take actions. They also lose all [Fear] effects currently affecting them, cease being [Confused], and all fury bonuses they have are halved. If an opponent of that creature within its [Close] range makes an offensive action, this effect ends. The time the other effects were cancelled (such as the [Fear] effects) still counts towards their duration.

7.2.16 Cause Fear

Circle: Sorcerer 1
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: Creature within [Close] range
Duration: 1d4 [Rounds]
Saving Throw: Will negates

You use necromantic energy to invoke fear in an opponent. If they fail a Will save, they are [Shaken] for 1d4 [Rounds]. If they failed the Will save by 5 or more, they are [Frightened] for the first [Round] of the duration.

7.2.17 Chain Lightning

Circle: Shaman 5, Sorcerer 5
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Target: Creature in [Medium] range, then subsequent creatures within your [Close] range of them
Saving Throw: Reflex halves

You fire a bolt of lightning at a creature within [Medium] range. The bolt deals 1d6 energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor per your character level. Then, you may target another creature within your [Close] range of that creature and deal 1d6 energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor per your character level to them. You may do this a number of times equal to your circles in the track which gave you this spell, with each target being determined from the previous, and with no creature targeted twice. A creature damaged by this spell may make a Reflex save to half the damage.

Special: When you learn this spell, you may replace [Electricity] above with [Fire], [Cold] or [Acid]. You may learn this spell multiple times.

7.2.18 Charm Monster

Circle: Sorcerer 4
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: Creature within [Close] range
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: Will negates

You cause your target to see you as a friend and ally. They will perceive any request you make while charmed favourably, but must still be convinced any obviously dangerous order is a good idea. Whenever a charmed creature would use an offensive action against an ally, the charmed creature must make a Will save. A successful Will save allows the charmed creature to use that offensive action as normal and renders the creature no longer charmed; a failed save means the charmed creature cannot use an offensive action against you or your allies for one [Round]. A charmed creature remains charmed until the end of the [Scene] or until you or an ally use an offensive action against it (this spell and its effects are not considered offensive actions for this purpose).

7.2.19 Cloudkill

Circle: Sorcerer 4
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Effect: A 20 ft radius cloud of toxic vapours
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Fortitude partial; see text

You create a 20 ft radius cloud of toxic gas within [Medium] range. Any creature of level 1 or 2 who enters the cloud or starts their turn in the cloud immediately dies. Any creature of level 3 or 4 must make a Fortitude save or immediately die. Any other creature (or a level 3 or 4 creature that survived) takes [HP reduction] equal to twice your level, a Fortitude save halves this [HP reduction]. At the end of your turn, the centre of the cloud (and hence the rest of it) moves 10 ft in a direction of your choice.

7.2.20 Commune

Circle: Cleric 6
Casting time: 10 Minutes
Range: Self
Effect: Answers to a number of yes-or-no questions equal to your level
Duration: Instantaneous

You contact your deity or another powerful divine entity. You may ask them a number of simple yes-or-no questions equal to your level. They are answered to the entity’s best knowledge, so ‘Unclear’ is a valid answer.

7.2.21 Cone of Cold

Circle: Shaman 4, Sorcerer 4
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Effect: Wedge out to [Close] range
Saving Throw: Fortitude halves

You create a cone of cold in a wedge with length equal to your [Close] range. All creatures in the wedge take 1d10 per your level energy damage with the [Cold] descriptor. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage.

Special: When you learn this spell, you may replace [Cold] above with [Fire], [Electricity] or [Acid]. You may learn this spell multiple times.

7.2.22 Create Undead

Circle: Cleric 6
Casting time: 1 [Round]
Range: [Melee]
Target: Touched corpse
Duration: [Encounter]

You animate a corpse as an intelligent form of Undead under your control. The target dead creature becomes an Elite Mook with the [Undead] type and the Undead track (with the specific type of your choice) with the level it was in life or yours, whichever is lower and half its maximum HP. The creature is under your control but acts on its own initiative.

Using a Midnight Onyx relic consumable creates the Undead at full HP and with a duration of [Scene], further uses extend its existence multiple [Scenes]. At the end of its duration, the Undead dissolves into dust.

7.2.23 Deathwatch

Circle: Cleric 1, Tactician 1
Casting time: 1 swift action
Range: [Close]
Target: Self
Duration: [Encounter]

You gain an intuitive and instant knowledge of the health of every being nearby. For each creature in your [Close] range, you always know if they are any of the following: Alive, [Undead], [Dying], below half their maximum HP, below one quarter of their maximum HP, below 10 HP.

7.2.24 Disintegrate

Circle: Sorcerer 6
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Long]
Target: Creature in [Long] range
Saving Throw: Fortitude halves

You fire a beam of pure destructive energy at your target. They take damage equal to 7 times your level. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage and prevents it from reducing them below 1 HP. This is a [Death] effect. If this damage kills the target, their body is completely destroyed, and they cannot be resurrected.

7.2.25 Dominate Monster

Circle: Sorcerer 7
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: Creature in [Close] range
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: Will negates

You completely brainwash your target, and can command it to your will. Target creature becomes [Bound] under your control until the end of the [Scene]. A successful Will save negates this effect. The [Bound] creature cannot act normally, you may command it to use its move action as a free action, and to use its standard action as a swift action. If a creature provokes an attack of opportunity from your controlled creature, you may use an immediate action to force it to make the attack of opportunity, which uses your attack of opportunity for the [Round]. In combat, on its initiative count, the creature may make a Will save. If it succeeds, it is no longer [Bound].

7.2.26 Energy Drain

Circle: Sorcerer 7
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: Creature in [Close] range
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

You lash a creature with pure necromantic energy, draining their life force. Target creature in [Close] range is [Energy drained] 2d4 times. These [Energy drained] stacks stack up to your level. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.

7.2.27 Enlarge

Circle: Sorcerer 1
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: Creature touched
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

You double your target’s size. If the targeted creature is [Tiny], it becomes [Small]; if [Small] it becomes [Average] and if [Average] it becomes [Large], gaining the normal bonuses and penalties. In addition, it receives a +4 bonus to its Strength and its [Melee] range is doubled. This lasts until the end of the [Encounter], and an unwilling target may make a Fortitude save to negate the effect.

Reversal: Reduce

You instead make the creature smaller. If it is [Large] it becomes [Average], if [Average] it becomes [Small] and if [Small] it becomes [Tiny]. In addition, it receives a -4 penalty to its Strength and its [Melee] range is halved. A creature made [Tiny] by this effect may make an additional Fortitude save at the start of its turn to negate. In all other ways this works as Enlarge.

7.2.28 Mass Enlarge

Circle: Sorcerer 4
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: Any chosen creatures in [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

Any number of creatures in your [Close] range are affected as if you cast enlarge on them, except their Strength instead gets a +6 bonus.

Reversal: Mass Reduce

Any number of creatures in your [Close] range are affected as if you cast reduce on them, except their Strength instead gets a -6 penalty

7.2.29 Fire Seeds

Circle: Shaman 5
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: Self
Target: 4 seeds you are holding
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Reflex, see text

You enchant four seeds or nuts you are carrying to become powerful explosives. For each of the four, choose one of these options: * In place of an attack in an attack action, you may make a ranged attack out to [Close] range. On a hit it deals 1d4 energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to your level. On a hit, all opponents within 15 ft of the target also take that damage, but may make a Reflex save to half the damage. * As a free action, you may drop it in a space adjacent to you. As an immediate action, you may detonate it (and any others you have placed). On detonation, all creatures within 15 ft of the seed take 1d4 energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor per your level. A successful Reflex save halves this damage. If a creature is in range of multiple seeds detonated at the same time, they only take the damage once.

As you cast the spell, you may give any number of the seeds to any of your allies in [Melee] range.

7.2.30 Flaming Sphere

Circle: Shaman 2, Sorcerer 2
Casting time: 1 move action
Range: [Melee]
Effect: An elemental sphere in a 5 ft space
Duration: [Encounter]

You conjure a sphere of fire in an unoccupied space within your reach that you can direct at will. Any creature moving through the space with the sphere in takes 1d6 per your level energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor. As a standard action, you may move the sphere in a straight line up to edge of your [Medium] range, if it passes through the space of any creature (or ends in a space with a creature), you must make a ranged attack roll (with a -2 penalty for each opponent it passes through), for each opponent the result exceeds the AC of, they take 1d6 per your level energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor. The sphere lasts until the end of the [Encounter].

Special: When you learn this spell, you may replace [Fire] above with [Acid], [Electricity] or [Cold]. You may learn this spell multiple times.

7.2.31 Gate

Circle: Cleric 7, Sorcerer 7
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Effect: Planar portal in [Close] range
Duration: Instantaneous or [Quest]; see text
Saving Throw: Will negates; see text

You generate a true portal to another Plane. When you cast this spell, you may choose to create a stable portal, or pull a creature through the portal. If you create a stable portal, the Gate remains as a thoroughfare between your plane and the target plane for the rest of the [Quest]. If you choose to pull a creature, you may call upon any creature, of any level and with any tracks. It may make a Will save to reject the pull and not be summoned, any unique creature (such as a Deity) may freely reject the pull (and if a Deity, probably should). If it is summoned, it retains its free will and is not necessarily your ally, and must be convinced to fight with you.

7.2.32 Geas

Circle: Shaman 6
Casting time: 1 minute
Range: [Melee]
Target: Creature touched
Duration: Permanent
Saving Throw: Will partial, see text

You cast a powerful Fey enchantment on a creature which compels them to fulfil one request of you. That request can be whatever you want, and with any level of difficulty, as long as it is not obviously self-destructive. The creature becomes [Oathsworn] to you. While [Oathsworn], whenever it targets you or your allies with an attack or offensive ability it must make a Will save. If it succeeds the ability works but if it fails the ability does not happen, they lose that action and cease to be [Oathsworn]. While [Oathsworn], the creature is compelled to attempt to complete the quest. However, even if it is no longer [Oathsworn], every [Scene] in which is does not attempt to fulfil its Geas, it takes [HP reduction] equal to 3d4 plus 4 times your level. [HP Reduction] from Geas can stack until the creature’s maximum HP is 1.

7.2.33 Hideous Laughter

Circle: Sorcerer 3
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range [Melee]
Target: Creature touched
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Will negates; see text

You touch someone and instil in them a horrendous fit of laughter. The target falls [Prone] and starts laughing. While their defences are not otherwise impaired, they may not take any action while laughing. The target may make a Will save to negate falling [Prone] and starting to laugh, and at the start of their turn while laughing they may make another Will save to stop, with a +3 bonus for each turn they have been laughing, as the joke in their head gets less funny.

7.2.34 Holy Aura

Circle: Cleric 5
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: All allies within [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Fortitude partial, see description

You surround your allies nearby with a blinding aura of divine energy. All allies in [Close] range gain [Damage reduction] equal to your Wis modifier, a +2 bonus to all saving throws, and the first time each turn each opponent targets them with a melee attack, that opponent is [Blinded] until the end of the [Encounter], a successful Fortitude save reduces this to one [Round].

7.2.35 Holy Divination

Circle: Cleric 4
Casting time: 10 Minutes
Range: Self
Effect: Information about one event in the next week
Duration: Instantaneous

You use divine powers to gain a useful piece of advice from beyond about one proposed goal, event or activity to occur within one week. The advice can be as simple as a short phrase, or it might take the form of a cryptic rhyme or omen. If your party doesn’t act on the information, the conditions may change so that the information is no longer useful. The base chance for a correct divination is 70% + 1% per your level.

7.2.36 Hypnotism

Circle: Sorcerer 1, Tactician 1
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Effect: A hypnotic pattern on your own space
Duration: 1 [Round]; see text
Saving Throw: Will negates

You create a hypnotic pattern which entrances anyone nearby. When you cast this spell, roll 1d4 per your level and note the result. This spell effects creatures in [Close] range with levels totalling up to the result, with the lowest level creatures affected first (you choose in a tie) until there are no levels left to be affected.

An affected creature may make a Will save to negate the effect. Creatures who fail their Will save are entranced and unable to take actions until distracted. You also get a +4 bonus to Diplomacy checks against entranced creatures. If they are targeted by any negative effect, they are instantly snapped out of the trance. If they are targeted by any other effects, or an enemy moves within their [Close] range, they may make another Will save against the effect. Also, if a creature leaves your [Close] range, it breaks the spell.

This spell lasts for one [Round], but while it is in effect you cannot take offensive actions. At the start of your turn (when the spell would wear off), you may use a standard action (which does not provoke attacks of opportunity) to keep the spell going, but again you cannot take offensive actions for the turn.

7.2.37 Insanity

Circle: Sorcerer 6
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Target: Creature in [Medium] range
Duration: Permanent
Saving Throw: Will negates

You permanently addle the brain of your target. Target creature is [Confused] until the effect is removed somehow. In addition, while [Confused], if they ever roll to Act Normally, they must reroll and take the new result (even if it is Act Normally). A successful Will save negates the [Confused] condition.

7.2.38 Jump

Circle: Shaman 1, Sorcerer 1
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: Creature touched
Duration: [Scene]

You give the target creature enhanced jumping ability. They gain a +10 bonus to Acrobatics checks made as part of the Jumping action.

7.2.39 Knock

Circle: Sorcerer 3
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: 45 ft wedge
Effect: Wave of force in the wedge
Saving Throw: Reflex halves

You create a sudden shock of force which knocks away force and is specifically designed to knock down doors. You create a wedge of length 45 ft. All creatures in the wedge take damage equal to three times your level and are [Blown away] away from you, and all doors in the wedge with a Larceny DC to unlock them of 30 or less, or locked by a magical effect of 5th circle or less, are immediately unlocked and blown open. A successful Reflex save halves the damage taken and negates the [Blown away].

7.2.40 Locate Object

Circle: Cleric 2
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Long]
Target: 1 object
Duration: 10 minutes

Choose one non-living object you are familiar with or can clearly visualise. For the next 10 minutes, if it is in your [Long] range, you know exactly where it is. If you think of a general class of objects, you only know the location of the closest.

7.2.41 Magic Circle

Circle: Cleric 3
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: All allies in [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]

You create a warding circle which protects allies against a certain sort of threat. Choose a track. All allies in the circle gain a +2 bonus to AC against attacks by creatures with that track, +2 to saves against their abilities and [Immunity] to any [Mind-affecting] abilities of creatures with that track, and to all damage and abilities of summoned creatures with that track. In addition, no summoned creatures with that track can cross the border of this spell’s area. All effects last until the end of the [Encounter].

7.2.42 Malocchio

Circle: Sorcerer 5
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: Self
Effect: Curse from own eyes
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Will partial; see text

You cast a dark Evil Eye curse, allowing you to inflict a wracking fever on your enemies. When you cast this spell, and at the start of your turn while it remains active, you may choose an opponent within [Medium] range. That opponent is [Shaken] and [Sickened] until the end of the [Encounter]. If you target the same opponent again in an [Encounter], they get a Will save to resist subsequent applications of [Shaken]. The curse remains active until the end of the [Encounter].

7.2.43 Mass Suggestion

Circle: Sorcerer 5, Tactician 5
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Target: A number of creatures equal to your level in [Medium] range
Duration: [Scene], or until completed
Saving Throw: Will negates

You influence the actions of the target creature(s) by suggesting a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two). The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the activity sound reasonable. Asking the creature to do some obviously harmful act automatically negates the effect of the spell. The same suggestion applies to all these creatures.

The suggested course of activity can continue for the entire duration. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do. You can instead specify conditions that will trigger a special activity during the duration. If the condition is not met before the spell duration expires, the activity is not performed.

7.2.44 Meld into Stone

Circle: Shaman 4
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: Self
Target: Self
Duration: [Scene]

You sink into the earth gaining the Burrow movement mode until the end of the [Scene]. Also, when you cast this spell, if you are touching a piece of rock or stone larger than yourself, you instantly become [Burrowing] within that.

7.2.45 Meteor Swarm

Circle: Sorcerer 7
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Effect: Four 20 ft radii in [Medium] range
Saving Throw: Reflex half

You throw four balls of pure elemental energy which explode ferociously. Create four 20 ft radius spreads within your [Medium] range. Each creature within a spread takes energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to 2d6 times your level. If a creature is in multiple spreads, it takes damage from each. A successful Reflex save halves the total damage done.

Special: When you learn this spell, you may replace [Fire] above with [Acid], [Electricity] or [Cold]. You may learn this spell multiple times.

7.2.46 Nature’s Might

Circle: Shaman 3
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: Ally touched
Duration: [Scene]

You grant an ally a boon, increasing their power, speed, fortitude, cunning, wisdom or grace. Target ally in [Melee] range gains a +4 bonus to a statistic of your choice (Str, Dex, etc.) until the end of the [Scene]. Any increased bonuses from this spell do not stack with those from Nature’s Power.

7.2.47 Planar Binding

Circle: Cleric 5, Sorcerer 5
Casting time: 1 hour
Range: [Close]
Effect: Summoned creature in [Close] range
Duration: [Scene]; see text
Saving Throw: Will negates; see text

With a lengthy ritual, you summon a being from another Plane. This is an Expert Mook of level equal to yours, with its track being any Racial track of your choice, it remains summoned until the end of the [Scene]. The being has free will, and acts independently, so must be convinced to help you. However, when casting the spell you may choose to attempt to bind the creature to your will, if so it makes a Will save, on success it will immediately attack you, on a failure it will become your ally, but will be unsummoned at the end of the next [Encounter].

7.2.48 Plane Shift

Circle: Cleric 4
Casting time: 10 [Rounds]
Range: [Melee]
Target: Self and up to 8 willing creatures within [Melee] range
Duration: Instantaneous

You transport yourself and up to 8 willing creatures linking hands to another Plane of existence. You may specify the Plane down to Demiplane or Layer, but you can end up from 5 to 500 miles out from your intended destination (5d100).

7.2.49 Polymorph Any Object

Circle: Sorcerer 6
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: Creature or object touched
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Fort negates; see text

This is the most versatile form of transmutation. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following effects:

  • Cast Baleful Polymorph, as the spell
  • Cast Transformation, as the spell
  • Cause target creature to be [Petrified] until the end of the [Encounter], a successful Fortitude save negates this effect
  • Transform a touched object into a creature. The creature takes the form of a Mook of an Archetype of Scout, Turret, Grunt or Striker, of your choice and level of your choice (up to your level). The creature is not your ally and will act independently.
  • Transmute a space of up to your [Close] range in radius from one material to another, of your choice.

7.2.50 Prayer

Circle: Cleric 3
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Target: All creatures within [Medium] range
Duration: [Encounter]

You call upon divine forces to bless your friends and bane your enemies. All allies in [Medium] range gain a +1 bonus on all d20 rolls for the remainder of the [Encounter]. All opponents in [Medium] range take a -1 penalty on all d20 rolls for the remainder of the [Encounter].

7.2.51 Quench

Circle: Shaman 2
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: Item within [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]
Save: Will partial, see text

You dampen the magic of a certain item for a short time. Target any magic item you can see within [Close] range. It loses all enchantments and other magical effects that are part of the item until the end of the [Encounter]. If it is on their person, the item’s owner may make a Will save to reduce this to one [Round].

7.2.52 Raise Dead

Circle: Cleric 5
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: Touched corpse
Duration: Instantaneous

You raise a creature back to live. Target [Dead] body stops being [Dead] and [Unconscious] and gains 4d4 HP plus 4 per your level.

7.2.53 Remove Fear

Circle: Cleric 1
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: Creature within [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]

You instil an ally with courage, remove all [Fear] effects currently affecting them. For the duration of the [Encounter], they also gain a +3 bonus to saves against [Fear] effects.

7.2.54 Ressistance

Circle: Cleric 1
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: Creature within [Close] range
Duration: [Scene]

You grant an ally divine grace to protect them against harmful effects. They gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws. This bonus increases by 1 for every 8 levels you have.

7.2.55 Sending

Circle: Cleric 3
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: Any
Target: Creature you know
Effect: 25 word message

You send a message of up to 25 words to a creature you are familiar with. They instantaneously hear it in your voice, and may immediately respond with a 25 word message of their own.

7.2.56 Shapechange

Circle: Sorcerer 7
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: Self
Target: Self
Duration: [Encounter]

You use a powerful transmutation on yourself to allow you to assume any useful form, from one instant to the next. For the rest of the [Encounter], you cannot cast spells and you must choose one other Track you possess, and cannot use any abilities from it or benefit from any abilities from it. When you cast the spell and at the start of each turn, choose a Track. You gain abilities and benefits as if you had seven circles in that Track (though any abilities at a circle which have a per [Encounter] or per [Scene] limit share their uses, so for example, you can only use one seventh circle ability which is used once per [Scene]) for one [Round]. You can also choose your creature type, size, and any number of natural weapons whenever you choose your Track.

7.2.57 Shield of Faith

Circle: Cleric 1
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: Touched creature
Duration: [Scene]

You create a field of divine energy that protects your target. They gain a +2 Deflection bonus to AC. This bonus increases by 1 for every 6 levels you have.

7.2.58 Shillelagh

Circle: Shaman 1
