Casting time: 1 move action
Range: [Self]
Effect: Staff appearing in your hand
Duration: [Encounter]

You cause a piece of wood on your person to grow to become a long, magically enchanted staff for combat. You immediately unequip any non-natural weapon you are wielding, and start wielding a [Brutal 2, Reach] melee weapon with a +1 bonus to attack rolls. While you are wielding this weapon, your [Melee] range increases by 5 ft. The staff returns to its original state at the end of the [Encounter].

7.2.59 Shocking Grasp

Circle: Sorcerer 1
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: Creature within [Melee] range
Duration: Instantaneous

You charge your hand with electricity and grasp an enemy or their armour, electrocuting them. Make a melee attack roll (this spell does not provoke an attack of opportunity), which ignores all the target’s item and deflection bonuses to AC. If it hits, you deal energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to 1d6 + 3 times your level.

Special: When you learn this spell, you may replace [Electricity] above with [Fire], [Acid] or [Cold]. You may learn this spell multiple times.

7.2.60 Shout

Circle: Sorcerer 3
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Effect: Sonic burst out to your [Close] range
Saving Throw: Reflex halves

You unleash a burst of sonic energy which deals 1d6 damage per your level and inflicts [Deafened] for two [Rounds] to all creatures within your [Close] range. The damage ignores all [Resistance]. A successful Reflex save halves the damage and negates the [Deafened] condition.

7.2.61 Silence

Circle: Cleric 2, Tactician 2
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Target: Creature in [Medium] range
Duration: 1 [Round]
Saving Throw: Will negates

You strip a creature’s voice and with it their ability to incant spells. Target creature must make a Will save or be unable to cast spells or use Spell-like abilities for one [Round].

7.2.62 Spike Stones

Circle: Shaman 3
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Effect: 30 ft radius of rough terrain
Duration: [Encounter]

You cause a small area to be filled with pointed rocks and other hazards which makes it hard to cross. You create a 30 ft radius spread centred within your [Medium] range. Until the end of the [Encounter], it is difficult terrain. For every 5 ft a non-[Flying], [Swimming], [Soaring] or [Burrowing] creature moves in this spread, they take 3d4 points of damage.

7.2.63 Storm of Vengeance

Circle: Cleric 7, Shaman 7
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Effect: A divine storm out to your [Medium] range
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: See description

You create a storm of divine vengeance, which is a spread of radius equal to your [Medium] range centred on you. All allies in the spread are [Concealed] and [Covered]. When you cast the spell, and at the start of each turn, roll a d6 and take the result:

  • 1-2: A crack of thunder leaves all opponents in the area [Deafened] until the end of the [Encounter]. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.
  • 3-4: Acid rains from the sky. Each opponent in the area take energy damage with the [Acid] descriptor equal to twice your level.
  • 5-6: Lightning strikes each opponent in the area. They take 1d6 points of energy damage with the [Electricity] descriptor equal to your level. A successful Reflex save halves this damage.

The storm dissipates at the end of the [Encounter].

7.2.64 Summon Monster

Circle: Cleric 2, Sorcerer 2
Casting time: 1 full-round action
Range: [Close]
Effect: Creature summoned within [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]

You reach through the planes and summon a creature to aid you. The creature is a Mook of level equal to yours minus 3 with the Scout, Grunt, Striker or Turret Archetype with a size and creature type of your choice. The summoned creature acts on your initiative, and will only move and attack the nearest enemy, and requires you to use a move action to command it to do anything else.

You can summon creatures appropriate to the situation, but only vaguely. When you summon a creature it may benefit from one Lesser Item, Feat which it qualifies for, or a 1st or 2nd circle ability from any Racial track.

7.2.65 Symbol of Death

Circle: Cleric 6, Sorcerer 6
Casting time: 10 minutes
Range: [Close]
Effect: Inert symbol, radius out to your [Close] range when activated
Duration: Permanent
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

You create a rune on any surface in [Close] range. As a default, it is triggered whenever a creature does one or more of the following, as you select: looks at the rune; reads the rune; touches the rune; passes over the rune; or passes through a portal bearing the rune. Regardless of the trigger method or methods chosen, a creature more than the length of your [Close] range from a symbol of death can’t trigger it (even if it meets one or more of the triggering conditions, such as reading the rune). Once the spell is cast, a symbol of death’s triggering conditions cannot be changed. You can also set special triggering limitations of your own. These can be as simple or elaborate as you desire. Special conditions for triggering a symbol of death can be based on a creature’s name, identity, or alignment, but otherwise must be based on observable actions or qualities. Intangibles such as level, class, and hit points don’t qualify.

When scribing a symbol of death, you can specify a password or phrase that prevents a creature using it from triggering the effect. Anyone using the password remains immune to that particular rune’s effects so long as the creature remains within the length of your [Close] range of the rune. If the creature leaves the radius and returns later, it must use the password again. You also can attune any number of creatures to the symbol of death, but doing this can extend the casting time. Attuning one or two creatures takes negligible time, and attuning a small group (as many as ten creatures) extends the casting time to 1 hour. Attuning a large group (as many as twenty-five creatures) takes 24 hours. Attuning larger groups takes proportionately longer. Any creature attuned to a symbol of death cannot trigger it and is immune to its effects, even if within its radius when triggered. You are automatically considered attuned to your own symbols of death, and thus always ignore the effects and cannot inadvertently trigger them.

Once triggered, the symbol creates a spread with radius equal to your [Close] range centred on it. When a creature with less than 150 HP enters the spread, or starts its turn in the spread, it must make a Fortitude save or die. The DM notes down the HP it had when it died. Once the total noted down exceeds 150, the Symbol of Death is discharged, and can only be recharged by casting the spell again.

7.2.66 Symbol of Pain

Circle: Cleric 5
Casting time: 10 minutes
Range: [Close]
Effect: Inert symbol, radius out to your [Close] range when activated
Duration: Permanent
Saving throw: Fortitude partial, see description

You create a rune on any surface in [Close] range. As a default, it is triggered whenever a creature does one or more of the following, as you select: looks at the rune; reads the rune; touches the rune; passes over the rune; or passes through a portal bearing the rune. Regardless of the trigger method or methods chosen, a creature more than the length of your [Close] range from a symbol of pain can’t trigger it (even if it meets one or more of the triggering conditions, such as reading the rune). Once the spell is cast, a symbol of pain’s triggering conditions cannot be changed. You can also set special triggering limitations of your own. These can be as simple or elaborate as you desire. Special conditions for triggering a symbol of death can be based on a creature’s name, identity, or alignment, but otherwise must be based on observable actions or qualities. Intangibles such as level, class, and hit points don’t qualify.

When scribing a symbol of pain, you can specify a password or phrase that prevents a creature using it from triggering the effect. Anyone using the password remains immune to that particular rune’s effects so long as the creature remains within the length of your [Close] range of the rune. If the creature leaves the radius and returns later, it must use the password again. You also can attune any number of creatures to the symbol of pain, but doing this can extend the casting time. Attuning one or two creatures takes negligible time, and attuning a small group (as many as ten creatures) extends the casting time to 1 hour. Attuning a large group (as many as twenty-five creatures) takes 24 hours. Attuning larger groups takes proportionately longer. Any creature attuned to a symbol of pain cannot trigger it and is immune to its effects, even if within its radius when triggered. You are automatically considered attuned to your own symbols of pain, and thus always ignore the effects and cannot inadvertently trigger them.

Once triggered, the symbol creates a spread with radius equal to your [Close] range centred on it. All creatures in the spread take a -4 penalty to all d20 rolls for the rest of the [Encounter]. Each turn, as a free action, they may make a Fortitude save which, if successful, reduces the penalty to -1 for a [Round].

7.2.67 Symbol of Sleep

Circle: Cleric 4, Tactician 4
Casting time: 10 minutes
Range: [Close]
Effect: Inert symbol, radius out to your [Close] range when activated
Duration: Permanent
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

You create a rune on any surface in [Close] range. As a default, it is triggered whenever a creature does one or more of the following, as you select: looks at the rune; reads the rune; touches the rune; passes over the rune; or passes through a portal bearing the rune. Regardless of the trigger method or methods chosen, a creature more than the length of your [Close] range from a symbol of sleep can’t trigger it (even if it meets one or more of the triggering conditions, such as reading the rune). Once the spell is cast, a symbol of sleep’s triggering conditions cannot be changed. You can also set special triggering limitations of your own. These can be as simple or elaborate as you desire. Special conditions for triggering a symbol of death can be based on a creature’s name, identity, or alignment, but otherwise must be based on observable actions or qualities. Intangibles such as level, class, and hit points don’t qualify.

When scribing a symbol of sleep, you can specify a password or phrase that prevents a creature using it from triggering the effect. Anyone using the password remains immune to that particular rune’s effects so long as the creature remains within the length of your [Close] range of the rune. If the creature leaves the radius and returns later, it must use the password again. You also can attune any number of creatures to the symbol of sleep, but doing this can extend the casting time. Attuning one or two creatures takes negligible time, and attuning a small group (as many as ten creatures) extends the casting time to 1 hour. Attuning a large group (as many as twenty-five creatures) takes 24 hours. Attuning larger groups takes proportionately longer. Any creature attuned to a symbol of sleep cannot trigger it and is immune to its effects, even if within its radius when triggered. You are automatically considered attuned to your own symbols of sleep, and thus always ignore the effects and cannot inadvertently trigger them.

Once triggered, the symbol creates a spread with radius equal to your [Close] range centred on it. When a creature enters the spread, they must make a Fortitude save or fall asleep. Unless the effect is dispelled, they remain [Helpless] for eight hours. They wake up if they ever take damage, but must make another save against the spell. If a creature succeeds the save, they do not need to make a save against that symbol for the rest of the [Scene].

7.2.68 Transformation

Circle: Sorcerer 5
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: Willing creature touched
Duration: [Encounter]

You change your target’s form into one that is more battle-worthy, at the cost of some of their existing potential. The affected creature chooses a track they have, and while they are transformed they lose all benefits from that track and cannot activate any abilities from it. In return, they may choose Utter Brute, Wildborn, Arthropod, Ooze, Divine Beast or Sentient Construct, and they gain abilities and benefits as if they had four circles in that track (they choose all options for each circle). This transformation lasts until the end of the [Encounter].

7.2.69 Wind Wall

Circle: Cleric 3, Tactician 3
Casting time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Effect: 5 ft wide transparent wall of wind.
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Reflex, see description

You create a wall of swirling wind with a 5 ft width and length equal to 10 ft per your level, with all of it within your [Medium] range. Any opponent entering a space within the wall or starting their turn in it must make a Reflex save or be [Blown away] in a direction, away from the wall, of your choice and ending their movement. Any ranged attacks which go through the wall have a 50% [Miss chance].

8 Extras

8.1 Cults

While worshippers of established deities can gain blessings through feats (or otherwise by intercession of a deity), and this includes the cults of Archdevils and Demon Princes, many worship less powerful forces. These groups are cults, groups where servitude gives some amount of magical power, but not tied to a specific godly force.

Cults work on Cult Points. Only characters who have been initiated into the cult may spend Cult Points, and initiations vary by cult and by the individual. Cult leaders, or the being the Cult reveres, can award Cult Points to followers at their own discretion, but each cult does have its own specific ways to gain Cult Points through actions of devotion. These points can then be spent as a free action to do certain things, specific to the Cult, or provide passive benefits.

8.1.1 Cult of the Magmaw

The purpose of existence is simple – everything is fuel for the Magmaw

The Magmaw is a rare form of magma elemental – a creature from the border between the Planes of Fire and Earth – which feeds on magical gems in its native environment. When a Magmaw surfaced on the material plane, a small group of Azer started to feed it magical items, greatly increasing its power, and also its hunger for fuel.

How to gain points:
1 Point: Feed the Magmaw a Lesser item
Feed the Magmaw 3 Consumables
2 Points: Feed the Magmaw a Greater item
3 Points: Feed the Magmaw a Relic item
4 Points: Feed the Magmaw an Artefact

Buffs from points:
1+: You gain a brand of the Magmaw somewhere on your body. You may cause this to heat up at any point, becoming incredibly hot to the touch (touching it deals energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to your level) and increasing the surrounding air temperature by 2 degrees.
3+: You gain [Resistance] to [Fire] damage
5+: You may swim through lava without taking damage as if it was water and you had the Swim movement mode, and you gain [Immunity] to [Fire] damage

Spend points:
1: Your brand fires small orbs of magma at surrounding enemies. All enemies in [Medium] range take energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to twice your level plus your KOM.
1: Your next melee attack that hits is augmented by the claw of the Magmaw, it deals additional energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to the damage it dealt.
2: You gain the [Burrow] movement mode for the rest of the [Encounter]
4: You call forth the Magmaw for but a moment. All creatures in a 20 ft radius within [Medium] range take energy damage with the [Fire] descriptor equal to eight times your level. A reflex save (DC=13 + ½ your level + your KOM) halves the damage done. If this kills a creature, the Magmaw immediately consumes any magic items on the creature.

8.1.2 Cult of Black Earth

The Cult of Black Earth worship Ogremoch, the Prince of Evil Elemental Earth. They revere the destructive power of the earth and seek the eventual but complete destruction of civilization, especially those who exploit the power of the earth through mining and agriculture. Black Earth cultists value patience and stoicism, often not acting in face of slights against the cult and going many days without a word, but once moved to action they are utterly implacable.

How to gain points:
1 Point: Spend a day without talking
2 Points: Destroy a small farm’s crops
Spend 24 hours in meditation about the earth’s power
3 Points: Destroy a large farm or mine

Buffs from points:
1+: You can communicate telepathically with creatures that live within the earth
3+: You gain a +3 item bonus to AC, or your existing item bonus to AC increases by 1
5+: You gain [Immunity] to [Prone] and any effect which moves you against your will

Spend points:
1 Points: You gain Resistance to all damage for one [Round]
1 Points: For the rest of the [Encounter], once per [Round] whene you move, any creature within [Close] range of any one space you move through takes damage equal to the total of your level and KOM. This is a [Ground] effect
2 Points: All opponents in [Close] range are [Slowed] for the [Encounter].
3 Points: You gain [Immunity] to all damage for one [Round]

8.2 Psionics Rules

Powers and Psi-Like Abilities

A psionic power is a one-time effect. Like spell casting, psionic powers do not need to be prepared ahead of time. A psionic creature either has enough power points and the available action to spend in order to manifest a power or they do not.

A psi-like ability functions like a spell like ability, except it follows the rules for psionic powers if there is a specific difference between the two.

Powers and psi-like abilities do Magic damage by default.

The main differences between psionics and spells is the use of points instead of spell slots, and that if you are hit by an attack of opportunity while using a psionic ability you must make a Will save (DC 10 + ½ attacker’s level + attacker’s KOM) or lose the effect of the ability.

Transparency Between Other Systems

Powers and psi-like abilities interact with spells in the same way that spells interact with other spells or spell like abilities. If a [Dispelling] effect would normally dispel a spell, it may dispel a power and vice versa. If any vision mode allows a creature to detect or see magic or magic auras, it can also detect or see psionics and psionic auras and vice versa.

However, if an ability requires spells or spell like abilities to function, like the spell storing property, the track Bastion: The Seven Circles of Protection, or Just Blades’ Mystic Focus circle, powers and psi-like abilities may not be used in their place. Similarly, spells and spell like abilities may not be used in place of an ability that requires powers or a psi-like ability.

As usual, bonuses of the same type do not stack. Follow the normal stacking rules to determine what applies.

Acquiring Powers and Psi-Like Abilities

Psionic creatures in Legend usually gain the use of powers via a specific track devoted to manifesting powers. A track is tied to a list of powers and may be acquired via multiclassing. Possessing a manifesting track gives a creature two benefits. First, the track opens access to its power list. The creature can learn (and therefore manifest) powers from that list. Second, the track grants a number of “powers points per [Scene]” – essentially, a pool of points which the creature can “spend” on any power it is able to manifest.

Psi-like abilities are more varied, and can come from tracks, feats, or even items. Once a creature possesses a psi-like ability, it may be used as often as stated in its description.

Power and Psi-Like Ability Cost

Powers have a base cost of 1 point per circle of the power to manifest, up to a maximum of 7 points for a 7th circle power. Augmenting a power increases its cost, up to a maximum of 8.

Psi-like abilities have no base cost. Augmenting a psi-like ability increases its cost, up to a maximum of 8.

Manifesting a Power or Psi-Like Ability

To manifest a power, you must spend the action required by the power and pay power points equal to the power’s cost. These count against your total points for the [Scene]. You may manifest the same power multiple times per [Scene]. You may select any power you possess to manifest, as long as you have a high enough circle in your manifesting track to manifest that power.

A psi-like ability may be manifested as often as stated in its description. The action required for a psi-like ability to be manifested is also stated in its description.

Power or Psi-Like Ability Augmentation

Most powers and some psi-like abilities may be augmented to give a greater effect than normal. You may spend more power points than a power or psi-like ability normally costs to manifest in order to augment it. Augmentation usually costs 1 or 2 points, and unless otherwise specified may be used once every time a power is manifested. You may augment a power to a maximum cost of 1 + the highest circle in any manifesting track you possess. If you have multiple manifesting tracks, only the highest one counts towards augmentation.

Psi-like abilities may be augmented if a creature possesses power points and the psi-like ability allows for augmentation. Augmenting a psi-like ability costs nothing to manifest the power, but a psi-like ability can be augmented up to one point for every odd circle you possess in your highest manifesting track. The normal cost of the augmentation is subtracted from your power points.

Sometimes augmenting a power or psi-like ability requires an additional action cost. This must be paid at the time the power or psi-like ability is manifested. Most powers or psi-like abilities don’t normally have an additional action cost to augment the power.

Power Points

With the normal Psion Powers track, which only gives you access to powers, you will have the number of power points per [Scene] shown on this table:

Table 8.1: Power Points
Level PP
1 2
2 4
3 7
4 10
5 14
6 18
7 23
8 28
9 34
10 40
11 47
12 54
13 62
14 70
15 79
16 88
17 98
18 108
19 119
20 130

As with spells, you gain bonus power points per [Scene] based on your MAM (manifesting ability modifier).

Table 8.2: Bonus Power Points
MAM PP
-1 and lower You cannot manifest powers with a negative modifier
0 0
1 1
2 1
3 2
4 3
5 5
6 8
7 13
8 21
9 34
10 55
11 89
12 144

Finally, if you have a track which grants psi-like abilities (PLA), you gain 2 power points per [Scene] per circle of that track you possess.

Using Powers or Psi-Like Abilities

Using a power or psi-like ability in Legend is a straightforward process. On your turn (unless activating a power or psi-like ability as an immediate action), you manifest the power or psi-like ability, make any roll necessary to determine the power’s success, and make any roll necessary to determine the power’s or psi-like ability’s damage or other variable effects. The GM then makes any saving throws required by the power or psi-like ability.

Saving Throws

Many powers or psi-like abilities require their targets to make saves, either to reduce or avoid their effects. The save DCs of all powers and psi-like abilities are determined by the particular manifesting track used to manifest them. Attacks of Opportunity

All powers and psi-like abilities with a manifesting action other than “swift action” or “immediate action” provoke an attack of opportunity from any enemy creature within [Melee] range. If you are damaged by such an attack of opportunity, you must make a successful Will saving throw (DC 10 + ½ your attacker’s level + your attacker’s KOM) or your power or psi-like ability fails and the action spent to cast it is wasted without effect. If manifesting the power or psi-like ability involves taking an action that would normally provoke an attack of opportunity, such as making a ranged attack, you still only provoke one attack of opportunity.

Recovering Power Points

Power points are recovered by rest and meditation. Power points are recovered at the end of every [Scene].

Long Lasting Effects

If you manifest a power that has a duration longer than how often you recharge power points, you must spend ½ of the cost of the power to maintain it if it is one step away, or ¼ of the cost of the power if it is two steps away. For example, if you recharge powers at the end of every [Encounter] and have one power up that lasts until the end of the [Scene] and another that lasts until the end of the [Quest], you must spend ½ of the power points you paid for the [Scene] length power to be maintained and ¼ of the power points for the [Quest] length power to be maintained.

8.3 Psionic Power List

1st Circle

  • Correspond - Communicate telepathically with your allies
  • Deceleration - Half the speed of target creature
  • Energy Ray - Send out a ray of energy which deals 1d6/level+KOM damage, augment to increase damage dice
  • Expand - Increase a creature to [Huge] size, increasing the amount of space it occupies
  • Inertial Armour - Gain a +3 item bonus to AC for the [Scene]
  • Mind Thrust - Deal 1d6/level untyped damage
  • Sensory Link - Perceive a single sense’s input from one creature

2nd Circle

  • Aura of Misfortune - Enemies in 20 ft of touched ally take -2 to attacks, AC and saves
  • Body Adjustment - Heal a creature for 1d6 HP/level
  • Energy Push - Deal 1d6/level+KOM energy damage in a 25 ft radius and push targets out of the radius
  • Metafaculty - You learn what tracks a creature possesses and with augmentation can increase the DCs of your psionic abilities against them
  • Prescience - Your attacks deal an additional 3 [Precision] damage
  • Share Pain - Transfer up to 10/circle points of damage to a nearby ally

3rd Circle

  • Apport - Rain objects down in a 10 ft radius, dealing 1d6/level + KOM damage and leaving the area as difficult terrain
  • Psionic Dispel - End one or two magical or psionic effects, depending on circle
  • Energy Flash - Deal 2d4/level energy damage in a 20 ft radius and leave targets [Revealed]
  • Prowess - Target creature can make an additional attack of opportunity
  • Psionic Movement - Target creature can Fly for the [Scene], can be augmented for additional movement modes
  • Touchsight - Target creature gains Tremorsense 40 ft for the [Scene], can be augmented for additional vision modes

4th Circle

  • Death Urge - Target creature repeats its previous [Round]’s actions against itself
  • Dispelling Buffer - The next [Dispelling] effect against your Powers fails
  • Phase Door - [Warp] self and one creature/3 levels up to [Long] range
  • Psionic Scrying - Spy on a creature or area from a great distance
  • Time Hop - Up to three creatures disappear completely for one [Round]
  • Vampiric Blade - Target creature deals bonus damage and [HP reduction] equal to your level and heals half damage done (up to your level)

5th Circle

  • Cloud Mind - Target creature gets a 50% [Miss chance] on attacks and their next ability with a save has the save automatically succeed
  • Force Field - Create a 5 ft thick force field within your [Melee] range that causes enemies attempting to move through to be [Checked]
  • Hustle - Allies gain an additional partial swift, partial move and partial standard action for the [Encounter]
  • Wrench - Creature loses ability to [Warp] and [Teleport] and also loses 20% [Miss chance].
  • Psychofeedback - Allies in [Close] range gain +1 to DCs and attack rolls and +1/2 your level bonus damage, opponents take the opposite in penalties.
  • Time Shift - Add or remove objects within a 50 ft radius in [Medium] range

6th Circle

  • Divert Teleport - Move the destination of any [Teleport] or [Warp] within range, and force a Will save or forced to [Teleport] or [Warp]
  • Energy Conversion - Target gains a shield of [Resistance] to an energy type which also allows the target to fire beams of the absorbed energy out to [Medium] range
  • Energy Wave - Deal 1d10/level energy damage in a wedge and cause [Knocked down]
  • Mindwipe - Deal 1d4 damage/level and remove access to the target’s highest circle abilities
  • Recall Life - Return a creature to life at half their maximum HP
  • Tower of Iron Will - Target gains [Greater resistance] to all damage, [Damage reduction] equal to twice your level, and [Fast healing] equal to your level for one [Round].

7th Circle

  • Affinity Field - First time each [Round] target is dealt damage, opponents in reach take damage equal to twice your level
  • Bend Reality - Resurrect a [Dead] character, copy a different power, dispel a lot of effects, or [Warp] your allies somewhere safe
  • Sublimate - Deal 2d6/level damage, [Battered] and [Knocked down] in a 60 ft radius and cause the area to become difficult terrain
  • Energy Stun - Creatures in a 50 ft radius take 2d6 energy damage and are [Battered] and [Stunned]
  • Null Field - Creatures in a 50 ft radius can’t use their highest circle abilities, can be augmented to prevent all non-offensive actions
  • Psychic Chirurgery - Freely switch out powers once per [Encounter] for the [Quest]

8.3.1 Affinity Field

Metacreation
Circle: 7
Manifesting Time: 1 move action
Range: [Close]
Target: One creature
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: Fortitude

The first time each [Round] the target is dealt damage, opponents within your [Melee] range of the target take damage equal to twice your level. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage.

Augment
This power can be augmented in the following way.

  1. For 1 additional power point, every time a creature is dealt damage by this power, any [Resistance] or [Damage reduction] they possess is lowered by 5 damage until the end of the [Encounter].

8.3.2 Apport

Psychoportation
Circle: 3
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Long]
Effect: Rain of teleported objects over target
Saving Throw: Reflex half

You teleport a large number of objects to a location directly above your enemies. This power allows you to rain large heavy objects over a 10-foot-radius. Creatures within this area suffer 1d6 physical damage per level (Reflex save for half) and for the rest of the [Encounter] this area becomes difficult terrain.

Augment
You can augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. For every 2 additional power points you spend, this power’s damage increases by one damage die (1d8 per level, 1d10 per level).
  2. For every 1 additional power points you spend, the radius of this power increases by 10 ft.

8.3.3 Aura of Misfortune

Telepathy
Circle: 2
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]; see text
Effect: Spread that causes enemies to suffer from ill luck.
Duration: [Encounter]

You warp the probabilities in an area around a touched ally to create unfortunate circumstances for their enemies. All enemies in a 20 ft. radius spread around the touched creature suffer a -2 penalty to attack rolls, AC and saving throws.

Augment
You can augment this power in the following way.

  1. For every 3 additional power points you spend, you may increase the radius by 20 ft., and the penalty to attack rolls, AC, and saving throws by 1.

8.3.4 Bend Reality

Discipline: Metacreation
Circle: 7
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: See text
Target/Effect: See text
Duration: See text
Saving Throw: See text

Choose one of these effects when you manifest this power:

  • Resurrection: You revive a [Dead] or [Unconscious] creature within [Close] range, healing it to its maximum HP and negating the [Dead] and [Unconscious] conditions.
  • Anypower: You can duplicate any power on the Psion manifesting list of the 6th circle or lower, or any power or spell on any other manifesting or spell list of the 5th circle or lower. The power or spell is adjudicated exactly as if you had manifested that power or cast that spell, and if it has a manifesting or casting time greater than 1 standard action you must use the greater manifesting or casting time.
  • Power Disjunction: You immediately end up to three target effects created by powers or power-like abilities whose durations are not instantaneous and which are centred on a creature or square within range or which targeted a creature within range. This is a [Dispelling] effect.
  • Word of Recall: You and all other willing allies within [Long] range are immediately transferred to an area you consider safe, which can be at any range. This is a [Teleport] [Warp] effect.

Augment
This power can be augmented in the following way.

  1. For 1 additional power point, if you choose anypower and select something with a manifesting or casting time less than 1 standard action, you may use that manifesting or casting time instead.

8.3.5 Body Adjustment

Metacreation [Healing]
Circle: 2
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Saving Throw: None (harmless)

You take control of a creature’s healing process, healing 1d6 points of damage per level you possess.

Augment
You can augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. If you spend 2 additional power points, this power’s healing increases by one die size (1d8 per level, 1d10 per level, 1d12 per level). You may use this augmentation more than once, and its effects stack.
  2. If you spend 2 additional power points, this power removes one condition from the following list: [Bleeding], [Blinded], [Burning], [Confused], [Dazzled], [Deafened], [Energy drained], [Fatigued], [Frightened], [Nauseated], [Paralyzed], [Shaken], [Sickened], [Slowed], [Stunned]. You may use this augmentation more than once, and its effects stack.

8.3.6 Cloud Mind

Telepathy [Mind-affecting]
Circle: 5
Manifesting Time: 1 move action
Range: [Close]
Target: One creature
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Will Partial

The target of this power suffers from a 50% [Miss chance] whenever they try to attack. In addition, the next spell, spell-like ability, supernatural ability power, or psi-like ability that offers a save is treated as if the creatures affected by it have successfully saved. A successful save reduces this to a 20% [Miss chance] whenever they try to attack and allows the next spell, spell-like ability, supernatural ability power, or psi-like ability to function normally.

Augment
This power can be augmented in the following way.

  1. For every 1 additional power point you spend, you may target one more creature.

8.3.7 Correspond

Telepathy
Circle: 1
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: All allies within [Close] range
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: None (harmless)

You and your targets can communicate with each other telepathically across any distance for the duration of the [Scene].

8.3.8 Death Urge

Telepathy
Circle: 4
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: One creature
Duration: One [Round]
Saving Throw: Will

The target of this power repeats all actions it took on its previous [Round], except the target of those actions is changed to the target of this power. If the target of this power used an ability that was centred on a space, that ability is centred on the target of this power. If an ability the target of this power used listed allies as the creatures affected, treat it as opponents, and if it listed opponents as the creatures affected, treat it as allies.

8.3.9 Deceleration

Psychoportation
Circle: 1
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: One creature
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Reflex, see text

You warp space around an opponent, hindering the target’s ability to move. The target’s speed (in any movement mode it possesses) is halved, to a minimum of 5 ft, a successful Reflex save negates this and it does not stack with itself.

Augment
You can augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. If you spend 1 additional power point, creatures who succeed the Reflex save have their movement modes reduced by 10 ft.
  2. If you spend 3 additional power points, creatures who fail the Reflex save are [Slowed] for the duration of the power, in addition to the halved movement speed.

8.3.10 Dispelling Buffer

Psychokinesis
Circle: 4
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: One creature
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: None

The next [Dispelling] effect made against a power you manifest this [Scene] fails.

Augment
You may augment this power in the following way.

  1. For every 2 additional power points you spend, you may ignore another [Dispelling] effect.

8.3.11 Divert Teleport

Discipline: Psychoportation [Teleport], [Warp]
Circle: 6
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 0 ft.
Effect: Spread centred on you with a radius out to [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Reflex and Will

Whenever an opponent uses a [Teleport] or [Warp] effect, you may choose where that opponent moves to as long as the location you choose is inside of the spread and it is not occupied by an object or obstacle. A successful Reflex save negates this effect. In addition, at the start of its turn, an opponent in the radius that has an at-will [Teleport] or [Warp] effect must make a Will save once per [Round] or be forced to use one [Teleport] or [Warp] effect.

Augment
This power can be augmented in the following way.

  1. For 2 additional power points, you may delay the first [Teleport] or [Warp] effect used in the radius for up to one [Round].

8.3.12 Energy Conversion

Discipline: Psychokinesis
Circle: 6
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: One creature
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: None

The target gains [Resistance] against a type of elemental energy ([Acid], [Cold], [Electricity], or [Fire]). Whenever the target’s [Resistance] or [Greater resistance] reduces the damage that creature takes, the amount of damage reduced, to a maximum of two times your level, is added to the mitigation pool. In addition, for every time the mitigation pool absorbs damage equal to your character level, the target creature may fire a ray of energy as part of an attack during an attack action of the type selected at any creature within [Medium] range. Treat this ray as a ranged attack that deals 1d4 damage per level you possess + your KOM. Once this power has blocked 10 times your level in damage, the [Resistance] from this power is removed.

Augment
You may augment this power in the following way.

  1. For every 1 additional power point you spend, you may add 3 times your level to the shields mitigation pool.

8.3.13 Energy Flash

Psychokinesis
Circle: 3
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Medium]
Effect: 20 ft. radius spread of energy
Saving Throw: Fort or Reflex partial

The first time you manifest this power each [Scene] you must choose either [Acid], [Cold], [Electricity] or [Fire]. This power inflicts 2d4 damage per level of the chosen type, and all creatures damaged by this power is [Revealed] until the end of the [Encounter]. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage if you choose [Acid] or [Cold], or a Reflex save halves the damage if you choose [Electricity] or [Fire].

Augment
You can augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. If you spend 1 additional power point, creatures that fail the save begin [Burning].
  2. If you spend 2 additional power points, you may inflict [Blinded] on any creature that fails the save.

8.3.14 Energy Push

Psychokinesis
Circle: 2
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Effect: 25 ft. radius spread
Saving Throw: Fort or Reflex half

Upon manifesting this power, you choose [Cold], [Electricity], [Fire], or [Acid]. This choice lasts until the end of the [Scene]. You create a sphere of energy of the chosen type that shoots forth from your fingertip and explodes in a spread centred at a square of your choice within range. This spread deals 1d6 per level + KOM points of damage and creatures on the inside of this spread are moved to the edges of it. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage and prevents the movement if you choose [Acid] or [Cold], or a Reflex save halves the damage and prevents the movement if you choose [Electricity] or [Fire].

Augment
You can augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. If you spend 2 additional power points, after a creature is moved to the edge of the spread, they are [Knocked down]. If a creature saves against this power, this effect is negated.
  2. If you spend 3 additional power points, after a creature is moved to the edge of the spread, they are [Blown away]. If a creature saves against this power, this effect is negated.

8.3.15 Energy Ray

Psychokinesis
Circle: 1
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: One creature
Save: Fort or Reflex half

The first time you manifest this power each [Scene] you must choose an either [Acid], [Cold], [Electricity] or [Fire]. You create a ray of energy of the chosen type that shoots forth from your fingertip and strikes a target within range, dealing 1d6 points of damage per level + your KOM. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage if you choose [Acid] or [Cold], or a Reflex save halves the damage if you choose [Electricity] or [Fire].

Augment
You can augment this power in the following way.

  1. For every 2 additional power points you spend, this power’s damage increases by one damage dice size (1d8 per level, 1d10 per level, 2d6 per level).

8.3.16 Energy Stun

Discipline: Psychokinesis
Circle: 7
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Long]
Effect: 50 ft. radius spread
Saving Throw: Reflex half

The first time you manifest this power in a [Scene], choose either [Acid], [Cold], [Electricity], or [Fire]. This power gains that descriptor and inflicts energy damage of that type until the end of the [Scene]. Any creature inside of the spread takes 2d6 damage and is [Battered] and [Stunned]. A successful Reflex save halves the damage and negates [Stunned].

Augment
This power can be augmented in the following way.

  1. Creatures affected by this power become [Vulnerable] to the energy type you chose until the end of the [Encounter]. Inflict this condition before damage is dealt by this power.

8.3.17 Energy Wave

Discipline: Psychokinesis
Circle: 6
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Effect: Wedge originating from you out to [Close] range
Saving Throw: Reflex half

The first time you manifest this power in a [Scene], choose either [Acid], [Cold], [Electricity], or [Fire]. This power gains that descriptor and inflicts energy damage of that type until the end of the [Scene]. Creatures must make a Reflex save or take 1d10 damage per level and be [Knocked down]. A successful Reflex save halves the damage.

Augment
You may augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. For 1 additional power point, you may inflict [Blown away] to all creatures affected by this power. If creatures succeed on the Reflex save to half damage, this effect is negated.
  2. For 1 additional power point, you may have the wedge persist until the end of the [Encounter]. The wedge originates from the square you were standing in when this power was manifested instead of originating from you.

8.3.18 Expand

Metacreation
Circle: 1
Manifesting Time: 1 swift action
Range: [Close]
Target: One ally within [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: None

The target of this power increases until it is [Huge] size and takes up a 10 ft space. It gains all the benefits of being [Large] and [Huge], but suffers none of the penalties.

Augment
You can augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. For an additional 1 power point, the duration for this power changes to [Scene] instead of [Encounter]. The target may choose to end the effect of this power earlier by spending a standard action to return to its normal size.
  2. For an additional 2 power points, increase the radius of the target by a further 5 ft. You may use this augmentation more than once and its effects stack.

8.3.19 Force Field

Psychokinesis
Circle: 5
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: One square
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Fortitude negates

You create a spread with a radius of your [Melee] range centred on a target square within range that lasts until the end of the [Encounter], then remove all squares from the power’s area of effect within another spread with a radius your [Melee] range minus 5 ft originating from the same square that lasts until the end of the [Encounter]. Any opponent trying to pass through this force field must make a Fortitude save or be [Checked] for two [Rounds].

Augment
This power can be augmented in one or both of the following ways.

  1. For 1 additional power point, you may deal damage equal to two times your character level to any creature that attempts to pass through the force field.
  2. For 1 additional power point, you may manifest this power on a creature instead of a square.

8.3.20 Hustle

Psychoportation
Circle: 5
Manifesting Time: 1 free action
Range: [Close]
Target: All allies within [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: None

Each ally may take an additional partial standard, partial move and partial swift action until the end of the [Encounter].

Augment
This power can be augmented in one or both of the following ways.

  1. For 2 additional power points, all allies may take an additional partial move action.
  2. For 1 additional power point, taking a partial move action does not reduce move speed.

8.3.21 Inertial Armour

Psychokinesis [Force]
Circle: 1
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: 0 ft.
Target: You
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: None (harmless)

Your mind generates a tangible field of force that provides a +3 item bonus to AC. Your inertial armour can be invisible or can appear as a coloured glow.

Augment
You can augment this power in the following way.

  1. For every 2 additional power points you spend, the item bonus to AC increases by 1.

8.3.22 Metafaculty

Telepathy
Circle: 2
Manifesting Time: 1 move action
Range: [Close]
Target: One creature
Saving Throw: None

You learn all tracks target creature in [Close] range possesses.

Augment
You can augment this power in the following way.

  1. If you spend 1 additional power point, all powers and psi-like abilities you use against that creature get a +2 bonus to their DC for the duration of the [Encounter].

8.3.23 Mind Thrust

Telepathy
Circle: 1
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: One creature
Saving Throw: Will half

You attack your target’s very psyche dealing 1d6 points of damage per level. A successful Will save halves the damage. This damage ignores any [Resistance] or [Greater resistance] to magic damage.

Augment
You can augment this power in the following way.

  1. For an additional 3 power points, creatures you hit are [Bleeding] for three [Rounds] and [Blinded] for one [Round].

8.3.24 Mindwipe

Discipline: Telepathy [Mind-affecting]
Circle: 6
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: One creature
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Will partial

The target of this power takes 1d4 damage per level and until the end of the [Encounter] may not use abilities from the highest circle of each of their tracks. A successful Will save prevents the loss of abilities.

Augment
This power can be augmented in the following way.

  1. For 2 additional power points, the damage dealt by this power increases to 1d6 damage per level and [HP reduction] equal to the damage dealt is inflicted on the target of this power after damage has been dealt.

8.3.25 Null Field

Discipline: Psychokinesis
Circle: 7
Manifesting Time: 1 move action
Range: [Medium]
Effect: 50 ft. radius spread
Duration: One [Round]
Saving Throw: None

All creatures within the spread lose access to the highest circle from all tracks they possess. In addition, you may dispel up to 2 effects of any circle on every creature.

Augment
This power can be augmented in the following way.

  1. For 1 additional power point, you may prevent all creatures from using any ability that is not an offensive action for one [Round].

8.3.26 Phase Door

Psychoportation [Teleport], [Warp]
Circle: 4
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Long]
Target: You, plus 1 willing creature per 3 levels within [Melee] range
Saving Throw: None (harmless)

You instantly transfer yourself and up to one willing creature within [Melee] range for every 3 levels you possess from your current locations to a group of separate destination squares within range that are all within your [Melee] range of one another. You always arrive at exactly the spot desired—whether by simply visualizing the area or by stating direction and distance. If those squares are already occupied by a solid body, you and each creature traveling with you appear in the closest unoccupied squares within your [Melee] range of each other instead.

Augment
You may augment this power in the following way.

  1. For 3 additional power points, you may remove the [Teleport] and [Warp] descriptors from this power.

8.3.27 Prescience

Telepathy
Circle: 2
Manifesting Time: 1 swift action
Range: 0 ft.
Target: You
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: None (harmless)

Your awareness extends a fraction of a second into the future, allowing you to better aim blows against your opponent. All of your attacks deal 3 bonus [Precision] damage.

Augment
You can augment this power in the following way.

  1. For every additional power point you spend, the bonus [Precision] damage increases by 1.

8.3.28 Prowess

Telekinesis
Circle: 3
Manifesting Time: 1 swift action
Range: [Close]
Target: One creature
Duration: One [Round]
Saving Throw: None

The target of this power may make an additional attack of opportunity during this [Round].

Augment
You can augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. If you spend 1 additional power point, you may target up to two creatures.
  2. If you spend 2 additional power points, the target of this power may make attacks of opportunities using ranged weapons (they may make one against any opponent that provokes one within range of the weapon). Doing so does not provoke an attack of opportunity.

8.3.29 Psionic Dispel

Metacreation
Circle: 3
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Long]
Target: Magical effect or effects within range
Saving Throw: None

Choose one of the following: this power ends two target effects created by powers or power-like abilities of second circle or lower that have durations and that originate from a creature or square within range or targeted a creature within range; or this power ends a single target effect created by a power or power-like ability of fifth circle or lower that has a duration and that originates from a creature or square within range or targeted a creature within range.

Augment
You can augment this power in the following way.

  1. If you spend 3 additional power points, you may instead choose one of the following: this power ends two target effects created by powers or power-like abilities of fifth circle or lower that have durations and that originate from a creature or square within range or targeted a creature within range; or this power ends one target effect created by a power or power-like ability of seventh circle or lower that has a duration and that originates from a creature or square within range or targeted a creature within range.

8.3.30 Psionic Movement

Metacreation
Circle: 3
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: One creature
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: None

The target gains the Fly movement mode, if it does not already possess it.

Augment
You can augment this power in one of the following ways.

  1. If you spend 1 additional power point, the target gains your choice of the Burrow movement mode or the Swim movement mode instead of the Fly movement mod.
  2. If you spend 2 additional power points, the target gains your choice of two of the following movement mods: Burrow, Fly, or Swim instead of the Fly movement mode.
  3. If you spend 4 additional power points, the target gains the Burrow, Fly, and Swim movement modes.

8.3.31 Psionic Scrying

Telepathy
Circle: 4
Manifesting time: 1 minute
Range: See text
Effect: Magical sensor
Duration: 10 minutes
Saving Throw: Will negates

This power functions exactly like the spell scrying.

Augment
You may augment this power in the following way.

  1. For 3 additional power points, this power functions like the spell greater scrying instead.

8.3.32 Psychic Chirurgery

Telepathy
Circle: 7
Manifesting Time: 1 immediate action
Range: 0 ft.
Target: You
Duration: [Quest]
Saving Throw: None

As a free action once per [Encounter], you may change one power known for another power of the same circle. You may also swap a power known when you manifest this power, and this does not count against the limit to the number of times you may swap powers per [Encounter]. You may not change out this power for another one.

Augment
This power can be augmented in the following way.

  1. You may swap powers twice per [Encounter] as a free action, instead of once per [Encounter].

8.3.33 Psychofeedback

Metacreation
Circle: 5
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: All creatures within [Close] range
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: None

Allies affected by this power gain a +1 to the DCs of any ability they use, a +1 to attack rolls, and deal additional damage equal to ½ your character level. Opponents affected by this power have the DCs of any abilities they use reduced by 1, take a -1 penalty to attack rolls, and have all damage they deal reduced by ½ your character level. Both effects only affect those within your [Close] range at any time during the [Encounter].

Augment
You may augment this power in one of the following ways

  1. For 2 additional power points, you may double the bonuses allies receive from this power.
  2. For 2 additional power points, You may double the penalties opponents receive from this power.

8.3.34 Recall Life

Metacreation [Healing]
Circle: 6
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: One [Dead] or [Unconscious] creature
Saving Throw: None

You revive a [Dead] or [Unconscious] creature within [Close] range, healing it to half its maximum HP and negating the [Dead] and [Unconscious] conditions.

Augment
This power can be augmented in the following way.

  1. For 2 additional power points, you may target up to two [Dead] creatures with this power, but each one comes back to life with ¼ of their maximum hit points.

8.3.35 Sensory Link

Telepathy [Mind-affecting]
Circle: 1
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Long]
Target: One ally
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: Will (harmless)

You perceive what the subject creature perceives using its sight, hearing, taste, or smell. Only one sense is linked, and you cannot switch between senses with the same manifestation.

Once the sense link is manifested, the link persists even if the subject moves out of the range of the original manifestation (but the link does not work across planes). You do not control the subject, nor can you communicate with it by means of this power.

Augment
You can augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. If you spend 1 additional power point, you can have the subject perceive one of your senses instead of the other way around.
  2. If you spend 2 additional power points, you can link to a second sense of the same subject.

8.3.36 Share Pain

Metacreation
Circle: 2
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: One ally
Saving Throw: None

You may transfer up to 10 times the number of circles you possess in this track points of damage to the target.

Augment
You can augment this power in the following way.

  1. If you spend 2 additional power points you may increase the amount of damage you transfer to up to 20 times the number of circles you possess in this track.

8.3.37 Sublimate

Psychokinesis [Force]
Circle: 7
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Long]
Effect: 60 ft. radius spread
Saving Throw: Fortitude half

You create a 60 ft. radius spread centred on any square within [Long] range. All creatures inside of the spread take 2d6 damage per level and are [Battered] and [Knocked down], any part of an obstacle or object inside of the spread is destroyed and every square within the spread becomes difficult terrain. A successful Fortitude save halves the damage.

Augment
This power can be augmented in the following way.

  1. For 1 additional power point, any creature in the spread is [Pinned] by the ground. The DC to escape being [Pinned] is 10 + ½ your level + your KOM.

8.3.38 Time Hop

Psychoportation
Circle: 4
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium
Target: up to three creatures or objects Duration: One [Round] Saving Throw: See Text

The targets of this power hop forward one [Round] in time. In effect, the targets seem to disappear in a shimmer of silver energy, then reappear after the duration of this power expires. The targets reappear in exactly the same orientation and condition as before. From the targets’ point of view, no time has passed at all. A successful Will save negates this effect.

If the space from which a target departed is occupied upon its return to the time stream, it appears in the closest unoccupied space, still in its original orientation.

Augment
You may augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. For 1 additional power point, if you use this power on an object, you may choose to have it last until the end of the [Encounter] or until the end of the [Scene].
  2. For 2 additional power points, the targets are [Slowed] until the end of the [Encounter], regardless of the Will save.

8.3.39 Time Shift

Psychoportation
Circle: 5
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: Medium
Effect: 50 ft. radius spread that distorts time
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: Fortitude; see text

You are able to manipulate the present state of objects and obstacles, and even pull them from the past or future. You may add or remove obstacles of any shape inside of this spread, as long as they do not overlap with creatures. Creatures must make a Fortitude save every time they attempt to move through an obstacle created by this power. Failure to do so means that a creature is unable to move through the obstacles created.

Augment
You may augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. For 1 additional power point, every time a creature fails to move through an object or obstacle created by this power, they take additional damage equal to your character level. You may use this augmentation more than once and its effects stack.
  2. For 1 additional power point, the duration for this power changes to [Quest] instead of [Scene].

8.3.40 Touchsight

Metacreation
Circle: 3
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Melee]
Target: One ally
Duration: [Scene]
Saving Throw: None (harmless)

You subtly enhance the vision of the target, granting them [Tremorsense] out to 40 ft.

Augment
You may augment this power in one or both of the following ways.

  1. For 1 additional power point, the target gains [Darkvision].
  2. For 2 additional power points, the target gains [Blindsight] out to 40 ft.

8.3.41 Tower of Iron Will

Metacreation
Circle: 6
Manifesting Time: 1 standard action
Range: [Close]
Target: One creature
Duration: One [Round]
Saving Throw: None

The target of this power gains [Damage reduction] equal to twice your character level, [Greater resistance] to all damage, and [Fast healing] equal to your character level.

Augment
This power can be augmented in one or both of the following ways.

  1. For 1 additional power point, you may extend the duration of this power by one [Round].
  2. For 1 additional power point, you may force up to two opponents in [Close] range to use their offensive actions on the target of this power for one [Round]. A successful Will save negates this effect.

8.3.42 Vampiric Blade

Metacreation [Arming]
Circle: 4
Manifesting Time: 1 swift action
Range: [Melee]
Target: One creature
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: None

Whenever a creature deals damage with an attack, it deals additional damage equal to your level and inflicts [HP reduction] equal to your character level after damage has been dealt. In addition, the target of this power is healed for half the damage dealt on that attack, up to your level in HP.

Augment
You may augment this power in the following way.

  1. For 2 additional power points, attacks treat any form of [Resistance] as being one step lower.

8.3.43 Wrench

Psychokinesis
Circle: 5
Manifesting Time: 1 move action
Range: [Close]
Target: One creature
Duration: [Encounter]
Saving Throw: Reflex negates

Target creature is anchored into their current position, and cannot use [Teleport] or [Warp] effects for the rest of the [Encounter], and also lose 20% of their highest [Miss chance]. A Reflex save negates this effect.

Augment
You may augment this power in the following way.

  1. For 2 additional power points, the target also has their movement speed halved for the [Encounter], the Reflex save also negates this effect.

8.4 Skill Games

8.4.1 Rock Off

Type of Skill Game: Option
Number of Skills Chosen per Action Round: 3
Maximum Number of Actions per Round: 1
Skill List: Athletics, Acrobatics, Vigour, Diplomacy, Bluff, Intimidate. Some Knowledge skills may be applicable depending on genre (e.g. History for a classical music battle).

When the battlefield is the field of musical expertise, it’s time for a Rock-Off. While most of the time Rock-Offs will be in an aggressive genre, this can also be used for other genres, such as a rap battle, an orchestral competition, or even a dance-off with some refluffing.

A Rock-Off is between two parties, and on each Action Round each party chooses one thing to do with their performance for the Round, and a number of Tokens to spend on that action, in an attempt to gain Rock Points (they start with 0). Importantly, the effects of some actions change depending on the actions that the other party took as well as the number of tokens spent, so timing is everything.

Once a total of 3 Choruses have been chosen by one party, or there have been 6 Solos used in total, the Rock-Off ends, and whichever party has the most Rock Points wins.

It is also worth noting that due to a clause in the Demon Code, rigorously enforced by Demogorgon and Baphomet, any creature with the Demon track may not refuse a challenge to a Rock-Off, as long as the terms are fair (each side would lose something of approximately equal value for a loss), but they also gain a +3 bonus to all checks in a Rock-Off, due to their decidedly Metal nature.

Action Set

Riff: You simply gain a number of Rock Points equal to the number of Tokens spent, and are unaffected by any other abilities. If you used this in the last Action Round, you gain another 2 Rock Points for ending on a sweet finish.

Diss: You use your efforts to put down the other side, or possibly get the fuckers to taste lightning. If the other party used a Chorus or Solo, their Rock Points they gain this round are reduced by the number of Tokens spent (and can even become negative). Also, if you spent more Tokens this Action Round, the other party cannot use the Action they used this Round for a number of Action Rounds equal to the difference in your Tokens spent.

Brag: You talk yourself up, avoiding any problems you’d get from a Diss, but it’s not quite so impressive as focusing on your music. As long as your spent at least 2 Tokens, you gain a Rock Point. If your opponents used a Diss this Round, they lose 3 Rock Points and cannot use Diss for two Action Rounds. For every two Brags you use, you gain a use of Power Chord.

Bridge: You start to prepare for a killer next move. If you gain Rock Points next Action Round, you gain additional Rock Points equal to the number of Tokens you spend on Bridge plus 2. This increases to plus 4 if you use it before a Chorus. However, this bonus is cancelled if the opponents used a Diss this Round, ruining your momentum.

Chorus: You unleash the beast in a catchy set of lines. The first time you use Chorus, you gain Rock Points equal to the Tokens spent -2. The second time, you gain Rock Points equal to the Tokens spent +1. The third time, you gain Rock Points equal to double the Tokens spent. If you gain a bonus to these Rock Points from a Bridge, they are halved if your opponents use a Diss this Round.

Solo: You start a blistering solo, but it’s so blistering you can’t stop. You gain Rock Points equal to the number of Tokens spent, but next Action Round you must use Solo again, gaining additional Rock Points equal to the difference in Tokens Spent between you and your opponents in the last two Rounds (even if you spent less, since the solo keeps your momentum going). This second Solo does not force you to use Solo the next Round, and the bonus Rock Points are halved for each additional Round you Solo for.

Power Chord: You start with no uses of Power Chord, and gain an additional use only after every two Brags used. When you use Power Chord your blistering rock drowns out the other side’s music, cancelling their action completely and granting you Rock Points equal to half the number of Tokens spent (but rounding up this time). However, if both parties use a Power Chord in a Round, instead whichever party spend the most Tokens gains Rock Points equal to the total Tokens spent by both parties, as they channel the music created by both sides into one flourish.

8.4.2 Boxing Match

Type of Skill Game: Option
Number of Skills Chosen per Action Round: 2
Maximum Number of Actions per Round: 2
Skill List: Athletics, Acrobatics, Bluff, Vigour, Attack Rolls

A boxing match is a special case in skill games – it still involves attacking and HP. Each fighter attacks the other (this damage is often agreed to be nonlethal) with unarmed strikes, aiming to reduce the opponent’s HP (their attacks do damage as a normal unarmed strike attack from that character would). A boxing match consists of a given number of Rounds (not [Rounds]!) – decided by the fighters or the referee, each of five turns. A match ends when a fighter hits the mat three times in one Round (TKO), or is reduced to 0 HP (KO). If this hasn’t happened by the end of the match, whoever gained the most Advantage Points during the match wins on decision.

Both fighters roll Initiative at the start of each Round, this is used to decide who attacks first each turn.

For each turn, each fighter makes four attack rolls. These represent probing jabs and feints during the fight. Compare the highest result from each fighter and the lowest result for each fighter. Whoever has the highest on each of these comparisons gains an Advantage Point. Each fighter may also make a single Athletics, Acrobatics or Bluff check, whoever has the highest on that gains an Advantage Point. Finally, each turn each fighter may make a single Vigour check.

Each fighter may then make two actions on their turn. They can either make two attacks (Body blow, hook, straight), one attack and one block (Block, duck, dodge) or one uppercut. When choosing an action for the turn, any number of Advantage points can be spent to augment that action.

Actions are then resolved, with all dodges happening first, then the attacks of the fighter who won Initiative for the Round, and then the attacks of the other fighter.

A fighter hits the mat when they are hit by a critical hit, or when a single attack deals more than 20 damage, or 20% of the fighter’s HP (whichever is higher) after removing any temporary HP.

Each time a fighter hits the mat, and for every 3 attacks that either hit them or miss them after they used the Block action, they get a stack of [Concussion], each stack reduces their AC by 1 and inflicts a -1 penalty to Athletics, Acrobatics, Bluff, Vigour and attack rolls. [Concussion] wears off at the end of the [Scene].

At the end of each Round, each fighter may, before the next Round, make four Vigour checks, which restore HP instead of granting temporary HP.

Action Set

Body Blow: You make an attack roll which bypasses Blocks and Ducks. However, the damage done by this attack is halved, and it cannot cause the target to hit the mat and does not benefit from any effects of a critical hit. For every 3 Advantage Points you spend, you may make an additional attack roll.

Hook: Make two attack rolls and take the lowest to determine if the attack hits. When you choose to Hook, choose either Left or Right (this determines what Dodge side works better). If you have already chosen to throw a Left Hook this turn, you must choose Right, and vice versa. For every 2 Advantage Points you spend, the attack deals an additional 3 points of damage.

Straight: Make an attack roll. If the opponent used Block, the damage done by this attack is halved, otherwise it does normal damage. For every 2 Advantage Points you spend, this attack roll has a +1 bonus.

Uppercut: You make an attack roll which bypasses all blocks. This attack does normal damage. For every Advantage Point you spend, this attack gains a +1 bonus and deals an additional point of damage.

Block: You gain a +6 bonus to AC against Straights and Hooks.

Dodge: Choose either Left or Right, you gain a +10 bonus to AC against Hooks from the chosen side, -5 against Hooks from the other side and +4 to AC against Straights, Body Blows, and Uppercuts.

Duck: You gain +8 to AC against Straights and Hooks, but -3 to AC against Uppercuts.

8.4.3 Heist

Type of Skill Game: Option
Number of Skills Chosen per Action Round: 4 (special)
Maximum Number of Actions per Round: 4
Skill List: Stealth, Perception, Larceny, Acrobatics (special)

A Heist is played when the party is infiltrating a location looking for loot and want to avoid combat, either because the inhabitants of the place are too strong to fight, or because raising the alarm would have disastrous consequences (e.g. the inhabitants can converge on their location especially quickly). The goal of the Heist is either to get as much Loot as possible, or perhaps find a specific place or piece of loot. In either case, the Heist is lost when the Alarm level reaches 7, at which point the alarm has been raised and the infiltrators located - the party will have to immediately escape by whatever means possible. The Alarm level starts each Heist at 1.

A Heist plays out on a map. Unlike a typical map, the map should explicitly consist of ‘Nodes’ and ‘Connections’. These are roughly equivalent to rooms and corridors, but each node should correspond to a discrete part of the location which could reasonably be hidden in (e.g. a corner of a wide open space) or contain loot (e.g. a tent in an enemy camp), rather than strictly being a room, and the connections should be any way between these nodes that could reasonably be traversed stealthily by the party. The party will start in whichever Node they entered the map at, and any Node may be designated as a point where the party can freely exit the area and hence end the Heist. Ending the Heist assumes the party will not return to the area for at least a [Scene], and if they do return

In each Action Round, each party member participating in the Heist will roll all four of the relevant skills. Stealth and Perception are of obvious utility in a Heist. Larceny represents using one’s larcenous instincts to avoid places where one would be detected but is less efficient than Perception, so is rolled at a -2 penalty. Acrobatics is a backup plan when Stealth fails, covering the need to climb along the ceiling or quickly tumble out of the way of a guard, it is obviously less efficient than Stealth and so is rolled at a -5 penalty. If other skills are relevant to the particular situation (for example, Bluff when blending in to a semi-public area), they can be used in place of any of those four, and bonuses and penalties to those rolls (or indeed rolls on the main four skills) should be applied by the DM based on the specific actions the party is taking and their situation.

Before the rolls are made, each party member can assign those rolls freely to the action set. If they assign on skill to an action each, they take four actions that Action Round, if they assign multiple rolls to the same skill they will take the highest result of those rolls for that action, but take less actions overall. A party member can assign one of their rolls to an ally’s action if they are in the same Node. Any party member not participating in the Heist but in communication with those that are (e.g. via World-Mind) may add their Intelligence or Wisdom modifier to a single skill check made each Action Round, representing their aid as a ‘guy in the chair’ of sorts.

Once the actions have been chosen and rolls made, resolve the results of those rolls per the description in the Action Set below.

When an Action Round is finished, roll a d10 for each party member participating in the Heist. For each time that roll is equal to or lower than the current Alarm level, increase the Alarm level by 1.

The Heist assumes that guards are patrolling the area but the party are using their skills to avoid patrol routes and hide from the guards. If an area is not being actively patrolled, bonuses to skill rolls should be applied appropriately. If guards are stationed at a specific Node without patrolling, that should be treated as a trap, with the effects of ‘triggering’ the trap determined by the DM (but likely involving an increasing Alarm level!).

Action Set

  • Sneak: You stealthily move around the area, being careful to avoid the detection - but if you’re careless you’ll still leave behind some signs that raise suspicion.
    • Move between Nodes by crossing up to 4 Connectors. For each Connector above the first that you cross, decrease the result of your roll by 6. Then roll to increase the Alarm level (as you would at the end of the Round) once for every 4 below the skill DC your result is.
  • Case the Joint: You thoroughly check your current node, identifying any loot to be found, and with a chance to find things like secret passageways or especially well-hidden loot.
    • If you fail the check by 10 or more: Nothing happens and you roll to increase the Alarm level.
    • If you fail the check: You find any Loot in the Node and roll to increase the Alarm level.
    • If you succeed on the check: You find any Loot in the Node.
    • If you succeed by 5 or more: You find any Loot in the Node, as well as any secret Connectors, hidden mechanisms, especially well hidden Loot, etc.
  • Scout: By peering through doorways, very carefully scouting a passageway, or finding a good vantage point, you scout out the nearby area.
    • If you fail the check: You get a basic description of all Nodes you could reasonably see from your current Node.
    • If you succeed on the check: You get a basic description of all Nodes you could reasonably see from your current Node. Then, choose a Connector you could reasonably see from your current Node, plus an additional one for every 4 points you beat the DC by. Detect any traps or special features on those Connectors.
  • Loot: You collect an item of Loot. Your roll does not matter to do this, since it’s fairly trivial to collect things. Instead, for each skill that you assigned to Loot, you collect a single item of Loot. If you collect more items of Loot than you have detected, roll a d12 for each additional collection. On a 4 or lower, Collect a piece of Loot that you had not identified with Case the Joint.
  • Disarm/Distract: You disarm a trap or distract someone who would see you, so that you can traverse a Connector without triggering its effects. This targets any Trap that you have identified in a Connector linked to your current Node.
    • If you fail the check by 8 or more: Trigger the trap you were trying to disarm.
    • If you fail the check by 4 or more: Roll to increase the Alarm level.
    • If you fail the check by 3 or less, or succeed by 3 or less: You disarm the trap, but only for the current action Round
    • If you succeed the check by 4 or more: You disarm the trap permanently
  • Hide: You attempt to hide or otherwise reduce the heat on you for a moment. If you use this action, you cannot use Sneak or Sabotage for the remainder of the Action Round.
    • If you fail the check by 10 or more: Increase the Alarm level by 1.
    • If you fail the check by 5 or more: Roll to increase the Alarm level.
    • If you fail the check by 4 or less: Do not roll for Alarm at the end of this Action Round.
    • If you succeed the check: Roll a d10. If the result is equal to or less than the current Alarm level, reduce the Alarm level by 1.
    • If you succeed the check by 10 or more: Reduce the Alarm level by 1.
  • Sabotage: Either by setting a trap, knocking out a guard, or otherwise making yourself difficult to follow or detect, you may decrease the Alarm level, but doing so leaves the risk of your sabotage being found later.
    • If you fail the check by 10 or more: Increase the Alarm level by 1 (you completely mess up the sabotage)
    • If you fail the check: Decrease the Alarm level by 1, but increase it by 2 in four Action Rounds.
    • If you succeed on the check: Decrease the Alarm level by 1, but after two Action Rounds have passed, you count as two party members for the Alarm roll at the end of each Round for the rest of the Heist (i.e. you roll twice)
    • If you succeed on the check by 10 or more: Either decrease the Alarm level by 2, but after two Action Rounds have passed, you count as two party members for the Alarm roll at the end of each Round for the rest of the Heist (i.e. you roll twice), or decrease the Alarm level by 1.

8.4.4 The Rumour Mill

Type of Skill Game: Option
Number of Skills Chosen per Action Round: 5 (special)
Maximum Number of Actions per Round: NA
Skill List: Diplomacy, Bluff, Intimidate, Perception, Larceny, History

The Rumour Mill is played when a party is doing generic social things within a given community, this can be a town, a city, a smaller settlement or even a subculture within a settlement depending on where the DM decides there is a different information flow. It is played against a grid of hidden information unique to a community. The grid is usually 5x5, but may be larger in a larger community like a large city, or a more detailed community information-wise like a Thieves’ Guild network.

Each space on the grid represents a piece of information yet to be revealed. The information for a community generally consists of 15 Basic Rumours (background information, fun facts, and community concerns), 6 True Rumours (actionable information for the party – either plot relevant, leading to a sidequest, or generally actually helpful) and 4 Fake Rumours (appear to be either Basic or True Rumours, but are wrong through exaggeration, misappropriation or just plain trickery – either on the part of the spreader or the originator). One True Rumour space also hides a Golden Rumour, an especially useful piece of information which the party will definitely want to know. The Rumour Grid usually refreshes between [Quests], but no sooner. Adjacent Rumours will tend to be related or gained from the same part of the community, but this isn’t a hard and fast rule.

The game also deals with Reputation with a community, representing how generally well liked the party is in the community. Reputation ranges from -10 to +10, and starts at whatever score the DM deems appropriate (though usually between -4 and +4). Reputation is permanent. If a party plays The Rumour Mill in a community for a second [Scene] in a [Quest], they lose 1 reputation, then 1 for the third, 2 for the fourth, 3 for the fifth, 5 for the sixth (and continuing in the Fibonacci Sequence), this represents the community being annoyed by a party’s constant badgering – it does not apply if the last [Action round] was spent entirely increasing Reputation, and the Reputation loss is reduced by 1 for each [Scene] where the party did not play The Rumour Mill since the last time they did.

[Action rounds] in The Rumour Mill last for a [Scene] of socialising (though the first [Action round] can take less than a [Scene], subsequent [Action rounds] always do as it takes longer to gather more detailed information). During an [Action round], a party may choose the same skill multiple times, in which case they use the top and the second highest result for one skill if they chose it twice, the top three if they chose it three times, etc.

Parties take a -1 penalty to skill checks for this Skill Game for every previous Action Round they have played in this community, as it becomes harder to squeeze information out.

A party gains a number of tokens equal to the number of skill checks that passed the DC for the skill game, plus an additional token for every 3 Reputation points above 0 they have, or minus a token for every 3 Reputation points below 0 they have.

Action Set

The party can then spend those tokens until they are all used up on any of the following actions:

  • Inquire: Choose a square on the Rumour Grid and reveal the information there. If it is (or appears to be) a Basic Rumour, whether any of the adjacent squares are a True Rumour or a Fake Rumour (but not which one of those it is) is also revealed.
  • Investigate: Chose two squares on the Rumour Grid and learn how many Fake Rumours are orthogonally adjacent to those squares
  • Inform: Chose a 2x2 set of squares on the Rumour Grid, and learn if the Golden Rumour is among them.
  • Impress: Gain 1 Reputation with the community. This costs an additional token for every time you have used it already in the Action Round.

You may also spend 2 tokens to choose a space. If it has the Golden Rumour hidden beneath it, then you learn the Golden Rumour.

8.5 Weapon Properties

The following weapon properties can be added to a weapon, just as with any of the usual ones.

[Ambush]] weapons deal 1d4 extra damage, plus 1d4 damage per seven levels of the wielder, in [Melee]] range on any turn where they switch between movement modes.

[Flanking]] weapons gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls when another ally is in [Melee]] range of the target.

[Impeding]] weapons inflict a penalty to move speed equal to 5 ft + 5 ft per six levels of the wielder (rounded down) for one [Round]] on a hit. This does not stack with itself or the penalty inflicted by any other [Impeding]] weapons, and can be removed with a move action which does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

For each attack in which the wielder hits a creature with a different [Rending]] weapon in a round, to a maximum of 3, their critical range on subsequent attacks is increased by one.

[Sundering]] weapons inflict a -1 penalty to attack rolls for one [Round]] on the target on a hit. This does not stack with itself or the penalty inflicted by any other [Sundering]] weapons.

[Swarm]] weapons deal damage equal to half the wielder’s level on a miss.

[Trapping]] weapons grant their wielders a +1 bonus to the DC of any Grapple or Pin combat manoeuvre they activate and to the DCs for opponents’ attempts to escape or act in a [Grappled]] or [Pinned]] condition.

On a hit, [Weakening]] weapons inflict a -2 penalty to all physical skill checks for one [Round]], this does not stack with itself or the penalty inflicted by any other [Weakening]] weapons.
